comment.text:
The food and service was surprisingly good for a place right in the heart of the theater district. Our actual server was a little slow so the manager jumped in and we dealt with him the rest of the night, he was amazing.

The food was great, got a chicken club and chicken Marsala. Would definitely return.

So I don't typically brunch in Times Square or honestly go there at all besides for work. This past weekend, I happened to find myself in the area and stopped into O'Casey's for brunch. OMG is all I can say. I was absolutely shocked at how unexpectedly great the food was! It was *NOT* your typical underwhelming Irish Pub in a tourist trap food.. not at all. The food was AMAZING!

Everything made from scratch - even the bun on the hamburger! Hand cut fries, super fresh meat and toppings. My bf said it was one of the best burgers he's had! I went with the meatloaf and was very happy with my choice. Very fresh and tasty. Awesome mashed potatoes, gravy and fresh broccoli. Portion sizes were great too. I honestly still can't believe I found such a great meal at an Irish Pub in Times Square - it just doesn't make sense!

We went with the bottomless mimosas along with our brunch which also did not disappoint. They used good OJ and not too much of it, which is key! Prosecco is on tap which is rare but awesome.

Seriously though. I know, I know.. If you're a NY'er, Times Square is the worst! BUT.. If you find yourself in this neck of the woods or if you're up for a challenge do check this place out. If you're a tourist who thrives in this area of the city, by all means have a meal or 2 here. Great options to choose from and I have a feeling you can't go wrong with whatever you choose.

Food was good. Service was okay. Prices are moderate. Drinks were light and refreshing. Pretty close to certain Broadway shows. Server was friendly.
Lobster ravioli was delicious, the sauce was amazing.

A quick stop in O'Caseys before seeing Sweeney Todd. A very typical Irish pub with all the fixings . We sat at the bar and enjoyed the company of the lovely young bartender who googled how to make an Aperol Spritz. I will say she did an excellent job ! She was friendly and accommodating . The buffalo cauliflower was good to munch on with drinks . It was quiet when we were there but i'm sure it's fun when it's busy and loud as well
Fun time, great bartenders and staff. Food was ok but could have been hotter (especially the stew.) Still, a fun time - great people.

Okay not gonna lie we were skeptical, went in around 1:30pm and had to catch a show at 2pm. We sat ourselves and there seemed to be only one guy working both the bar and restaurant. The guy was nice and friendly, but the beer on tap was not working (bummer) so order two cokes and one chicken club and one burger. The food was really good everything fresh and homemade- bun, burger, chicken and the fries!! The coke tasted like RC cola it was not good. But the service was fast and the food was good!!

My friend and I came in for lunch and the place was pretty empty. The waitress and the owner were the only people here. They did get a few construction people from next door in and a food delivery. Those people did hang around for a bit, but most people came for a pint and then left. They didn't really stick around for the time my friend and I were there.

I ordered a soda ($4) and my friend ordered a vodka and a club ($11). The soda was flat and had an artificial sweetness to it. It tasted like RC cola. The waitress mentioned that everything on the menu is made fresh. I sort of believed her until I saw a food delivery for chicken tenders. However, I think she must have meant the entrees.

I couldn't decide between the chicken sandwich ($17) or the pot pie ($22), so I got both. My friend got the bangers and mash ($21). They mentioned that the bangers tasted exactly like what her Irish grandmother used to make and that they tasted like real Irish sausages. The chicken sandwich was delicious and the meat was chicken breast that was roasted. The bread was a bit stale and fell apart easily, but the sandwich was good overall. I was surprised at how thick the french fries were though. These seemed more like wedges than fries to me. The pot pie was delicious and stuffed with bits of chicken. The gravy had a nice buttery taste. I ate most of the pot pie and took home the rest. Sadly, it didn't taste as great the next day. The food was delicious and hearty here.

They didn't have any desserts ready other than ice cream. The ice cream tasted rich and creamy but it wasn't homemade. The only thing I didn't like was that it was filled with ice chips.

In the beginning, I mentioned that the construction workers and other people stopped by often. Well, they are the reasons why I rated this place so low. One worker came with his cooler and was chatting with the waitress. Then he went behind the bar and poured his own drink. Another worker walked in with his full construction clothes and was picking his nose the entire way. He went right into the kitchen area/bus area and made himself some tea or coffee and then took out the trash. The entire time, this man didn't wash his hands but was touching everything. He came in several times and went back and forth. The chef even came out to help with the food delivery and the same thing as the owner and right back they went into the kitchen to peel and prep. The kitchen is partially viewable but, they were going back and forth so often it  didn't seem like they washed their hands. Also, I do not like that they were letting people off the streets to go back of the bar, into the kitchen/prep area without cleaning their hands. The bathroom is another sore point of mine. The bathroom is clean but only one side of the faucet has a handle. The other was broken and unusable. Several people have used the bathroom before me, including the chef and the waitress (multiple times). We were sitting right in front of the bathroom. The sink was bone dry when I went to use it. No one stray droplet of water anywhere, not even on the sink. I tend to be careful but, I always get droplets. You might think, but maybe they used a towel to clean it up. Here  is the other thing, they had a hand dryer and it was broken. So, how would the sink be bone dry if they used it and how did everyone dry their hands? Everyone came out with dry hands and went back to work. My hands were soaking wet and my friend asked me why I didn't dry my hands. So, I am lead to believe that they knew the dryer was broken, so, they just didn't wash their hands. After realizing that and seeing people come in and out of the kitchen, I felt a bit queasy. Thankfully, I felt alright, but it still didn't make me feel better.

I will say the service and the food were great. I would visit again just for the home-cooked food, but the cleanliness is what's preventing me from coming back.

As a New Yorker as much as it is expensive to live here , we all try to get a bargain some time. I bought a Groupon brunch , was there earlier. Made a reservation as recommended. Got here at 12:30 only to be told by Frankie that the kitchen is close for brunch due to our Groupon deal. That we have to chose from the lunch menu. I said it not even 1 pm after few back and forth exchange , he said he will speak to the chef and make an exception, we had our food and it was distasteful, really insipid, the only good this is the mimosas, which at after the 3 drinks started to tasted differently. It's nice to try new places but this is not one of them. The new server Jennifer is good . That is the best thing at this venue . Avoid it
Good food great service awesome place to go to before a show every body knows your name
Had a great time here with a bunch of visitors from Hawaii on St. Patrick's Day.  Food was good too!  Server Claire was excellent!

Great food, great service. Def worth the visit.
Relaxed environment good selection of food.

The sliced steak sandwich was delicious! The steak was cooked perfectly - tender and juicy. The bread had a nice crunch on the outside and was soft on the inside. The onions and mushrooms were sautéed so well that they just melted in your mouth.

The waitstaff was very friendly and attentive.

We went right before seeing a musical, so there were a few people at the tables and more people at the bar. Overall, it had a relaxed vibe.

The only downside is my friend's burger was more rare than the medium well she asked for.

Very few places are this chill at just over an hour to curtain on Saturday night. Food is great, too. Service got us in & out in plenty of time for our show. Also: all of the show posters on the walls are from a 5-year period in the 90's. Don't know why. Highly appreciated. Would recommend.
What a nice surprise!!!! Food was very very good!I had the chicken pot pie and Shepard pie. Staff was extremley friendly and the owner Paul was alot of fun!!

This place has amazing food! Burger is legit, spring rolls awesome so are the fish and chips. Drinks never stop flowing and very good. The bartenders are the best, loved  Danny & Chris.  Breakfast lunch and dinner, we have been here 3x this week!

Great oasis in the middle of the theatre district.

Great service great bar!  Really happy we stumbled onto it
Super fun place. Whether it is to eat a hearty breakfast or catch a game and some ales. O'Casey's does not disappoint. You need to try this place!

After watching Chicago On Broadway the hubby wanted to see the second half of the NFC Championship. O'Caseys had the game on ALL the TV's. Our waitress was attentive, the atmosphere was fun. You can tell alot of the customers are regulars. It was cool that the two bartenders had Irish accents. We ordered Chicken tenders just to put something in our stomach. Food came out fresh and hot. With so many overwhelming options in NY city we are glad we walked into the right place. Giving this place two thumbs up!

After a show, our group went to O'caseys.
Our server Clare was a joy. She was gregarious, attentive to our needs and took care of us without being too intrusive. The space is warm and inviting. Overall a really excellent experience.

We found ourselves in Manhattan on Christmas Day. Any of the usually popular places that were open were totally booked for the day. We walked into O'Casey's for lunch at the bar. Service was initially slow, but improved. We had a great time talking to folks around us. Oddly, no beer on tap...had a can of Guinness and a glass of wine. Never asked if the tap situation was temporary, but there were no handles to be seen. Minus a star. There was a special holiday menu, but we decided on burgers and they were excellent. Angus beef, cooked perfectly with fresh hand cut fries...plus one star. Nice atmosphere...quiet, but gathering steam as we left. We would definitely return.
Fun Place to Be! Very good atmosphere and great food too! Myself, along with my friends love coming here. Their staff always treated us very well. I highly recommend O'Casey's - Time Square.
Service was great and attentive. Great spot grab a few beers. I had their dessert which was delicious. Nice spot to check out in New York.

This place is great, very happy with the service. Came in two nights in a row and the staff was constantly pleasant. Most places are nice the first time but the bartenders remembered us. Small place but well worth coming in for drinks, beers and food. Great spot for delish food and good drinks

Nice spot. Easy to find.  Classic Irish pub.  Excellent service.
Great bartenders. Atmosphere is surprisingly romantic for an Irish pub.

We stayed at the Paramount Hotel across the street from O'Caseys for 3 nights. We stumbled in the first day and fell in love with the owner and all of the staff! True authentic Irish Pub, mostly all of the staff is from Ireland! Paul was there to greet us every day and we just had to keep going back! Great food, great drink and some fantastic people! Definitely recommend!
A new place in an old restaurant. Delicious food, nice atmosphere, Claire is just lovely. Definitely on our radar now!

Starting on a positive note, the food was delicious! We really enjoyed/recommend the shepards pie and chicken marsala!

The service tonight on the other hand was not the best. I'm a server myself and often give servers the benefit of the doubt, but our experience was heavily lacking from quality service. Our waitress, though i'm sure her intentions were well, was very forgetful and did not listen to us very well. I won't go into detail on her many mistakes, but she seemed very inexperienced and multiple tables had issues with her service. I would recommend retraining her.

As for the other "servers", which I'm not sure that title should be given to them as they took turns eating in the corner of the restaurant most of the time while we were there. Multiple customers came in and we're not at all greeted or given menus until they asked themselves. E

Overall, the food is good but the service was so questionable we were waiting for cameras to come out with John Quinones from "What would you do".

Recommend this authentic Irish pub in Times Square. Nice dark paneled wood and tables with red checked table cloths. We came for dinner before seeing Six on Broadway, then had breakfast next morning here as it was across from our hotel The Paramount. We highly recommend the Shepherds Pie & Chicken Pot Pie for dinner. Prices a tad high ($22) but then again this is Times Square. Custard for dessert was great! We loved the oatmeal in the morning - check out the photo - for only $7.50. And you could get 2 eggs, home fries & toast or an egg & cheese breakfast Sammie both for around $10 - so prices seem fair. Nice staff. Only thing I would change is to turn the music down just a tad.
The beef stew is quite amazing. Megan makes this place!! Great service and truly an Irish pub with excellent food.
Food is excellent staff are wonderful atmosphere is as Irish as it's comes definitely a recommendation before after snd during Broadway!!

Great food, great drinks, even better service! If you are lucky enough to have Danny as a bartender then you should be thankful and grateful. He's quick with a line, he is good with a joke, and the man knows how to make a good drink. He is welcome to join our friends and family anytime in Arizona!

Great little bar with friendly atmosphere and staff   we spent a week in NYC and ended up going to OCaseys every day   Danny and the girls were so friendly and welcoming. The food was great. A real gem of a place that we highly recommend anyone to visit.  Thanks a million guys for adding to our NYC experience
Trev and mel
Wow, this place is great for breakfast. So close to our hotel, Marriott Marquis.  Oatmeal is perfect and my son enjoyed his bacon egg and cheese sandwich.  Will come back for dinner.

My son and I ate here a few weeks back while visiting NYC. The owner was walking around chatting with everyone. The owner made our night as he treated us like family. By the end of the night I was hugging staff and patrons alike. We both had the traditional bangers and mash which was spot on and my 10 year old was all over it. I highly recommend and will be back next I'm in the city!
What a gem!   Stopped in recently and everything was exceptional.   Great food, very friendly staff,  and  great ambience.

What's not to like about excellent service and excellent food? We felt welcome the second we walked in -- though I will admit it took me a split second to translate the authentic Irish accents of the staff. That's how you know you're getting the real thing.

Thanks for the great service, Claire! We'll be back someday.

Diana and Mr. Easy

Best Irish pub in Time Square!  We sat at the bar and Danny took EXCELLENT care of us. Paul, the owner, made us feel so welcome. Food was great and so convenient to walk from our hotel after watching a show. Thank you guys for a great evening!  We'll be back next time we're in town!

Was on the list for Santa con. We were patiently waiting for their bathroom as a big group (quietly not disturbing anybody) and a worker was clearly upset that we had to pee EVEN THOUGH they had a Santa con sign on their door that said they were welcoming santa con participants. Very rude and not a good vibe there, do not recommend this place to anybody. Don't waste your $ here, there's a reason it's empty when you go in

This place is great !! . For starters I don't speak when I'm outside since the new year has begun . I speak fluent ASL, English and Spanish but for medical and personal reasons I just don't talk I rather sign or write something down. I'm partial deaf in one ear but I can hear in my other perfectly. The waiter was an absolute darling and helped me the entire night . Again I typical don't speak . I may come off as deaf because I don't  speak and I squint when people speak but trust me I can hear. This Caucasian man and his friend said something about me playing " deaf " and I spoke because I can but I typically do not and we got into a back and forth . The bartender/ waiter Jake McCarthy was an absolute sweetheart and I explained in my voice why I don't speak . My natural voice is scratchy raspy and have to exert every-time i speak . I rather not speak at all . I explained to him he was very understanding because I bought up race . " White people " choose to be racist, and not speak to black people so if I don't want to speak race not withstanding to people I honestly don't have too. Jake was such a sweetheart honestly I hope this bar has other waiters/waitresses like him honestly the greatest. I had a nice time here. I'm definitely coming here again

We stumbled upon this gem right off of Time Square!  Great atmosphere in an intimate setting.  The owner and bartender treated us like family and made it feel like we stepped into a small bar in Dublin.  Our burgers and fries were fantastic!  One of the best I've ever had.
This was a last minute find and it was amazing.  The service was excellent.  The beef stew was one of the best I've ever tasted.
Stopped in after Hamilton for a quick drink and was pleasantly surprised at both the atmosphere and the owner. This was such a friendly, welcoming pub. Cannot recommend enough.

We and 3 friends shared 3 plates and everything  was AWESOME! The food was the highlight of our trip to New York.  Topped only by Paul, the owner, who was so hospitable and entertaining!  Definitely recommend. Perfect Irish pub!!
The service was phenomenal! Everyone was so kind and accommodating. We didn't eat any food but it looked amazing based off of what we saw from other's tables

Absolute gem of a place right off Times Square. We came here for a few drinks after dinner and sat at the bar. Great selection of drinks and a really fun, lively atmosphere. Danny is the best, such a funny and witty guy who we got chatting to all night. Clare was great fun too. Their homemade fries are unbelievably good. We will definitely be back!
Super fun place for drinks before or after a show. The service was too notch!  I'll be back for sure next time I'm in NYC!

We had the most wonderful time at O'Casey's with the incredible bartender Danny. Our group was on a trip to New York and found this hidden gem and we are so glad we did. Danny is kind, absolutely hilarious, and the bar atmosphere was unmatched. I highly recommend stopping in for drinks and having memorable nights at O'Caseys!!!
Great atmosphere and amazing food. Best shepherd's pie I've ever had. Waitress was friendly and made us feel very welcome as did the owner. Will have to come back next time we are in the city.
In a rush and grabbed a quick burger with fries to go--really, really good--can't wait to  get back there and try some of their specials.

Stopped in for lunch today , was very impressed with their burger and fresh cut steak fries,  asked for it medium rare and was cooked perfect, price is right, this is a worthwhile pit stop in a sea of tourist traps, they have a special prix fixe that has prime rib on it.

One of about 10 different variations of Korean cuisine in the hippest little asian food court ever. Seating is on the second and third floor.

Taste of the meat was a little underwhelming but the serving is sufficient and cute.

The Beef Teriyaki Bento Box from O-de-ppang is a Korean version of the Japanese Bento Box without the box and much more simple. It comes with rice, house salad, and seaweed soup. The house salad is probably the most boring salad, just 2 ingredients, lots of lettuce and the ginger dressing, what happen to the tomato, cucumber, and all the others? You also get some kimchi and that's pretty much the box. The thinly sliced beef was really good, which makes up for its simpleness.

Oh man. I waited 30 minutes for my dish at this place but it was really good so I'm kinda torn. I gotta go back and see if it was a fluke. They only had two young Mexicans in the back that looked like they didn't know what they were doing.

They completely ripped me off in the takeout. They had bento boxes on the counter and I specifically asked for one, complete with everything included in it. The woman at the register even commented on the included items describing the seaweed salad and egg roll. When I picked up the bag to take out, I was too polite to open it in front of her to check if it was the same. BIG MISTAKE! I bring it back only to find... iceberg lettuce salad. This seems to happen every time I order takeout here, I end up eating something completely different, as if I won't ever come back. I going back tomorrow, lady, you'd better be ready.

Also, the food I ordered is not great. Even the iceberg lettuce salad is wilting. How do you mess up iceberg lettuce salad? And hello? No kimchi even? At this place they give you kim chi with everything, i'm sure it's even slapped on frozen yoghurt. Cash register lady, I hope you're reading this because you'll be seeing me again soon!

Definitely, that Irish pub you're looking for from the indoor ambience, to the beer selection to the food! My only gripe is no pitchers of beer!

This pub has everything you're looking for trust me! Right at 44th St. and eighth Avenue Near Times Square, New York City! If you're looking for that spot to grab some beers in an incredibly lively atmosphere with a full gigantic Irish bar, and Irish food look no further! You will not be disappointed here.   My son and I came here after a convention at the Javits center and we were looking to have multiple beers and lots of different tastes, we got it!

They got all your classic, Irish beers like harp, Smithwick, and others, but they also have a selection of IPAs and every kind of beer!!   Very good selection! Beers are served in a 16 ounce glass. I have to get this out-of-the-way I really wish they served beer in pictures. I know they make more money by making you buy it by the glass but it's a nice touch to be able to order a pitcher of beer in an Irish pub. It's part of the experience. So my search for that pub continues but this is definitely a must stop place if you're looking for an Irish pub near  Times Square.  

But hey, the food was great! We got a Cuban sandwich, crabcakes, good old, gigantic nachos for an appetizer. The other thing is the seating here is very comfortable. I'm not gonna name the other pub we stopped at first, but the seating was not comfortable, and I knew this pub was nearby so we decided to leave and come here. Best decision I've made in a long time

Highly recommended for an authentic Irish pub, near Times Square, look no further!

Small place, just one floor and dark. Real candles were indicate. Great service, server was outstanding.

The 12oz steak was sizzling and delicious. They allowed to sub the potatoes for salad and all was great tasting. The wings were tasty and the meat just gave off the bone very easily.  Buffalo sauce had the right amount of spice!
Close to the theater. Great place to grab a bite and a beer. Food was great. It was crazy busy but service was good. Full blown Irish Pub experience.

It's right off of Times Square, so quite touristy. Service is good, although it took a while for us to be seated, as it seemed that no one noticed we were waiting for a table (nor did the waiters really acknowledge for the first 5 minutes). However, they have good, decent bar food, and good beer/cocktails option. The vibe is cool, chill, and a nice spot to rest up for the rest of your day in NYC.

Went here with my wife on Saturday evening to get some liquid refreshment before seeing a show at the Belasco.  We found a table near the door and got a greyhound and a Smithwicks.  I usually opt for a Guinness, but I felt a bit rebellious.  I'm very disheartened by the fact that a pint is no longer a pint.  I thought it was just a St. Patrick's Day thing, but it appears to be permanent.  Anyway, we had a nice conversation with Helen and discovered that she is friends with one of our favorite butcher shop's owner in our local town.  If your want a nice bar for a drink pre or post show, stop by here.

I had a great visit to this pub prior to a Broadway show at The Belasco Theatre. Good service, good food, good patrons and good booze. I love a great dive bar and this one I recommend and look forward to seeing again. Cheers!

We only stopped for a beer, but enjoyed our time here.  The atmosphere is very much a NYC Irish pub.    There were many beers on tap, as well as a big wine selection.  

I settled on a Stella Artois and it was served in a nice size glass.  The server was friendly, but not intrusive.

The place has an overall great feel and had many customers so I am guessing it's a good place to stop for food as well.

Came in looking for some Guinness stew.  Got a seat at the bar and grabbed a beer and stew.  Came out hot and tasty with big chunks of meat topped off with a scoop of mashed potatoes.  Wish they were playing Irish music instead of the Bruno Mars collection.

Good food and atmosphere right off the heart of Broadway!  The corned beef in the Rueben was perfectly tender, and the sandwich was overly stuffed like other places you find in NYC (cmon, do you REALLY need a pound of meat in your sandwich?  The ratio of ingredients is important!).  I did find the rye breaded toasted, but slightly soft/soggy. I don't know if it was the corned beef or kraut doing it, or just waiting on the back to be delivered. Still was delicious to eat, and a great experience which we will come back for!

Atmosphere - OK. Located just off of Times Square, the place has a neighborhood pub feel to it. It is very narrow, with a long bar (seating a dozen or so patrons, on the right when you enter and a bunch of small tables on the left side. The place is very dark.

Service - Very Good. We had a couple of beers and the bartender was very attentive.

Drinks - Very Good. There is a decent selection of beer on tap and bottles.

Overall Value - Very Good. I like Irish pubs, and though this place is nothing special, the location and prices make the place a good value
Service was excellent waitress was a sweetheart we had a great visit I would recommend  this place they treated us great good drinks

Good pub food with some Irish and British classics. Fish and chips, bangers and mash were really good. Good wings and burgers too. Everything was reasonably priced.

The bar is busy and the drinks were reasonable and spot on. No micro drinks in this place. Most important the staff was professional and attentive.

The music was loud but really good and set a good vibe with college hoops, soccer and hockey on the screens.

Times Square is like my least favorite place in Manhattan unless it's for the theater. So if you're in for a play or the sights you'll never go wrong here.

Let me start with the basics and then get into the issue we had

I got a French onion soup.  The broth was nice and the cheese good, the bread was mushy.  But over I'd say 3.5

We are outside in one of the huts built on the street.  Very nice

Timing of service.  Slow.  It did not appear busy and it took a while to get the food

Given just the food I would probably rate a 3.  

One in our party is vegetarian.  They had a 44th burger in the menu which has beef+onion+bleu cheese+chorizo.  She asked if she could get a veggie burger dressed like a 44th burger less the chorizo.  The waiter said he understood the order.   What came was a 44th st burger (beef) with a side of veggies (carrots and broccoli) instead of fries.   It was clear someone down the chain didn't understand the order.    We asked the waiter to fix it and he sent over the manager.  She proceeded to lecture us and said 'if you wanted the veggie burger you should have ordered it, not the 44th st burger'.   She should have asked us the problem and then responded.  We tried to explain but she wasn't listening, but she did say she would remake.  What we got was a regular veggie burger.  

As a manager you should ask the customer what is wrong, not just assume we didn't place the order correctly, which we did

We will not be returning

It's no secret, I'm a fan of true Irish pubs.  I love the ambience, the Irish lilt, the food and of course, the libations.  I'm a native New Yorker and look forward to the rare times i can get back "home" as it were.  I first found this place back in 2017, when my wife and I started making regular trips up north.  Whenever we can make the trip, we inevitably find our way here...there isn't anything ultra-special about it (though the weekend live music is worthwhile if you like Irish); but the service is always top-notch, and that's saying something with the number of quality restaurants and bars in the Times Square area.
I typically get a Jamie's neat (Jameson's Irish Whiskey for you neophytes) and a cool pour of Guinness (it isn't supposed to be served ice-cold), my wife will usually adopt the same if she's not fancying wine at the moment.  We've only ever had a few things off the bar menu and have never had a complaint.  I'll usually order potato leek soup w/a side of bacon or a shepherd's pie in such establishments, but I haven't had either here, yet.
It is a typical shotgun bar arrangement- when you enter the front door, the restaurant and bar are set up like a long throw- you have a relatively narrow entry way with 2-top bar seating which leads to the bar, which is sited on the right- all the way to the staircase at the back of the restaurant, where there is additional seating.  There's also more seating upstairs which is usually packed on live music nights.  The bar takes up the right side, and there's more booths to the left, after which it opens out to booths and tables.  It is a tight little setup that can get packed on weekend nights, mostly due to the live music and the close proximity to Times Square.
It isn't the only Irish pub in the area, it just happens to be my favorite.  I'm already looking forward to going back.

The wife and I stopped by for a few drinks and where we met the best employees and bartenders we have come across in sometime. We are from Memphis and they treated us like fellow New Yorkers. The wife tried a few different drinks some fruity stuff I have no idea but she loved them all. We ordered the sampler platter because we didn't want to eat a lot in the heat. All the food was great.!!  The drinks are a tad pricey but that's expected in the heart of Time Square so that wasn't an issue at all. Just something to keep in mind. I wish I could remember our bartenders name but they both rocked it. To the owner of the establishment I will say this. Keep those two guys forever and keep up the stellar work. Thanks for the great time.
We will return soon !!

Over a decade on, every word, each syllable still has a sonorous ring of absolute truth.

To Sue, Eddie, Orla, Helen, Joe and all the other members of the band past and present, and in no particular order of magnificence...

It was a cold, brisk, astringent mid-winter evening in New York City. As the unforgiving wind took hold and the frigid temperature crept ever lower, a British gentleman in need of solace, sustenance and stay strolled down 44th St.

Though he had frequented and patronised many bars in Manhattan over the years, warming many a bar stool along the way, a new light caught his eye this particular evening. 'O'Donoghue's Pub' is where we lay our scene.

Having escaped the chill of the night,  the warmth of this establishment was most welcoming.

Pulling up a bar stool, it soon became evident that the true warmth, however, lay in the welcome afforded by the staff.

After a convivial, cordial greeting, a swiftly presented beer and some endearing banter, this Brit knew , without hesitation or cause for amendment, that this was to be his home for the duration of his stay and indeed, a regular haunt on each subsequent visit.

(As it turns out, dear reader, I later met my future wife at this very establishment, spent several years living in the city, and was able to make this the most venerated and prized place  I have ever had the fortune to call my local)

From the charming mahogany bar to the plethora of beers on offer; from the genial bar conversations to the piquant nourishment of the menu; from the unquestionably authentic welcome to the courtesy afforded by all who worked there...this was hospitality of the highest order.

For the next six evenings, and oft a quick sojourn for luncheon, O' Donoghue's was his unrivaled establishment of choice.

I urge those who may be trawling the unrelenting, invigorating, inspiring yet oft exhausting streets and avenues of this fair city, take pause.

When that time comes, traverse to O'Donoghue's. May their earnest welcome sooth your weary soul, their appetizing food refuel your body and the intelligent, charming conversation of the staff be your company.  

Enjoy and remember, many will imitate but none will replicate.

See you next time...

12/08/2021

Having to decide where to eat let alone what cuisine to eat in New York City is quite the feat for the faint of heart. I pretty much scrolled though a bevy of lists on Yelp along with what I have booked marked for this trip alone. Well, the ideal was to visit Carmine's to have Italian for dinner, and we were told to visit their sister restaurant (I don't remember its name). But anyways, O'Donoghues Pub was in my friends list as a lunch option and we happen to walk by it and thought; okay, we're having dinner here instead.

When I think of Ireland, or Irish cuisine in general (well there's the pot of gold and dancing leprechaun that I'll think about), but no, I thought of food this time; and I really wanted bangers and mash!

The Experience: true to the its Irish and pub roots; that is basically what I saw. It was dimly lit on the inside, and a tad loud with all the patrons. All of the seating are high stools and bar seating. The service and hostesses were so friendly in true Irish manner, with a touch of humor as well. It really brings me back to my time in Dublin.

The Food: We started with fried calamari as an appetizer; and it was light and crisp. My bangers and mash was so delicious, and filling. My friend devoured her Atlantic salmon dish with asparagus and mashed potatoes in almost an instant. We each had a cocktail before ordering a round of Irish beer (Smithwicks - I think I have a new favorite beer).

This was perhaps the easiest of meals during my visit to the Big Apple and I enjoyed it.

Lively atmosphere and traditional Irish menu options. Beef stew was excellent. Lots of beef and flavor was authentic. Fish and chips were just okay. Fish was good but chips were soggy and lacked flavor. Bartender could use a lesson on how to properly pour a pint of Guinness. I would go back but Rosie Dunn's is far better.

Nice hang with buddies spot in Midtown Manhattan.  Kinda rolled up in here cause the place we wanted to go to was closed.

Tables were nicely spread out, dim bar lighting and groovy music through the airwaves.  Atmosphere very welcoming to any Joe Schmoe.

Although most of the cocktails feature vodka, the bartender was willing to change the vodka to whisky. I had a delish cocktail, but the most I can remember and most def recommend... it's the first one on the list.

My dinner was awesome. Pretty much the only non seafood item on the menu.. my go-to... steak, mash and veggies. Presentation gets 2 thumbs-up, but if I had another hand, the perfectly done medium well steak gets 3 thumbs-up!

Nice evening. Not loud, not rambunctious... but nice.

Went for lunch & the next day went back for dinner. The waitstaff is INCREDIBLE & the food is even better! Instantly a favorite & honestly one of the things I can't wait to get back to on my next trip!

My party decided to meet up at O'Donoghues Pub because we were looking for a convenient restaurant in the Times Square area with a large menu that would not totally empty out our wallets. O'Donoghues checked off every one of those boxes. Their menu is average but has something for everyone. The turkey club was hearty, but their French fries were tasteless (we recommend the sweet potato fries instead). The space was clean and the service was good. We were able to spend our entire Sunday afternoon there without feeling rushed. Pleasant atmosphere.
Dion is the GOAT bartender. Why? I put heavy metal on the jukebox and he does not skip it. And great service.  Plus the bar had air conditioning on, unlike some of its competitors on the block.

Good pub food.    Our reservation was canceled at another restaurant so I decided on pub food.  Had a steak with fries and an IPA.   Was very good. Many quality beers on tap.   The waitress was Irish and did a good job.
A little loud, but delicious penne vodka. Very reasonable prices for being in time square
Great place to grab a drink and some food before a Broadway show. We ended up there for Happy Hour and they had good drink and food specials.

Enjoyed a great meal before catching a show. Happy hour pricing was excellent and the wine pour was generous. Our server was outstanding.  I had the Reuben sandwich, which had thick corned beef slices- delicious. The ambiance was very nice.
Always good cocktails and food. The Guinness stew was delicious!!! We had great service!
Great food and excellent service! Nice little pub and great spot to grab some good drinks and yummy grub!

This was my first visit to O'Donoghues. It was a Friday at 3pm. It was fairly packed even at that off-peek time. I ordered the Sandwich Special of Grilled chicken with prosciutto, provolone cheese and pesto mayo on ciabatta bread served with fries even though the menu board outside said it was an angus burger for today. I enjoyed my meal while watching World Cup soccer games on the televisions. The sandwich turned out to be quite tasty however the fries were of the lowest quality. Despite that, I had a pleasant experience.

Great Irish style fare in a pub setting. They have other options too. I had the Shepard's Pie, my wife had the Beef Stew. We were both full after our meals. Very tasty and not too much salt either. Drinks were also decent. Recommend if you're in Times Square and want a break from the flash.
The drinks sucked... asked for a Hot Toddy and it was Hot terrible!!! But, this Shepard's Pie was so damn good!
Service is amazing- Roger was so kind! Recommend a new whiskey - I will forever be a fan!
Ok so great atmosphere food just ok, loved the onion rings and awesome sauce, beer was good, barley soup excellent, corned beef was a little to skimpy for me

Cool place in Midtown Manhattan for a few drinks. Kind of busy, but service was decent. If you are not from New York City you might get a bit of sticker shock from the price of the drinks, but it is New York City.
Absolutely phenomenal place! Their staff is nice, helpful and prompt. My boyfriend and I love their espresso martinis. 10/10 recommend
Nice little pub that opens late in time Square.   Kinda small, few medium size TV for sports.  Bathroom it's not very clean.

Watch your bill. Got over charged for a $13 alcoholic drink I didn't order and they also charge a credit card fee. I didn't catch the overcharge until later so that was my fault for not paying better attention. But should have never happened.

It's around time Square. Went for a drink and it's cute and very touristy. Margarita is very good and the beer says the other person not me lol
It's a great place to watch the game.

The food was terrible. All four steaks were over cooked to what we had asked for. The vegetables were undercooked and the mash stoggy. The waitress was rude. It was over priced and expensive for what we ate (or didn't eat).
Absolutely the worst Drinks I've ever had.... watered down and old tasting...food was blah...very disappointed

If i could give this place zero stars ...I would.

I was in a party of 5 with reservations and we still had to wait for a table that was for 4 people, thanks.
Then we order drinks, it all was okay. we ordered food and waited 40 minutes for this food!! And during those 40 minutes they brought us someone else's appetizer and then also brought us a whole other tables order So we complained about our food and that's when our food came out and it wasn't even hot. Two of the steaks were fully cooked rather than medium which is how they were ordered (why ask if you're going to make them however). The meat in the beef stew was super dry and seemed old, it's also a super small portion for almost 20 too! Our waiter didn't really care about our table if i'm being honest. He would take our beer cups and leave quick and wouldn't even bother to ask us if we wanted more beer so we really just tried to hurry up and leave.

I'm pretty sure the bar area is way better to be but don't even bother to sit and eat, it's trash, not worth it.

O'Donogues is another Irish bar. It has better drinks than food. You can't go wrong with a drink here. It's real close to Broadway. The prices aren't too bad for Midtown.

I had a Jameson, which was poured nicely. It was about $8, which isn't horrible. The drink came pretty fast, even though it was crowded in there. As for the food, it's typical for an Irish bar. It's very revolved around meat. A lot of things like lamb chops. There's shepherd's pie and other classics if you like to eat Irish food. Inside the bar was pretty clean. They get crowded, but it's spacious enough you aren't squished.

If you like Irish bars, you probably will like it. Lots of good Irish drinks. The food looks better than just your average fried things.

A nice Irish pub just a bit off Times Square.  It seems every block has at least one Irish pub and this one was cozy with plenty of TVs for watching the World Cup.

We stopped in on a Friday for a late lunch and enjoyed a massive burger with fried onions and a pulled pork sandwich.  Both came with hot, crispy fries.  The burger was almost too big to eat.  Service was good and it wasn't too busy since we were dining at 2 pm.

We enjoyed the meal in this cozy environment.
No respect for the elders! Manager came out and made the seniors  move when they had no customers waiting! Table was empty for our entire dining experience at Virgil's! Beware if you are over 65!!!

Our favorite Irish pub in the city! Their mango martinis (mango fusion) are to die for! We used to come here every time we visit the city, however when the pandemic hit, it took a while for us to come back again. When I saw they reopened, we immediately planned a trip to go back! Boneless buffalo wings are also amazing! Staff is always attentive and friendly. Hope they stay strong through these tough times!

Came across this place completely accidentally when I just didn't have the patience to deal with the crowd over at Jimmy's corner.
Decent finger food and beer.
I like that this place sets a laid back atmosphere where the lights are dim but you can still see someone clearly and the music is throw backs mixed in with some new hits, loud enough to hear and low enough to hold a conversation.
Good spot for some grubs and beer after work.
Very clean, service is good and server is friendly. Nice atmosphere for some drinks and appetizers
Nachos were bomb. Waitress nice. Ipa was yummy. French Open was on tv. Close to the theater.
Loved the place and the staff! Food is great loved everything that we ordered! The place have a nice ambiance.

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place looking for any open bar. We ended up coming here EVERY night on our 4 day vacation. We will be back next month and have already decided this is where we will go for our drinks! Food was great, crowd was diverse, music on point, sports playing on all TVs, couldn't ask for anything more. The best part about our time there was the staff and manager. Fast Eddie and Fergie made our time there so memorable!  So friendly and welcoming. Can't wait to see them again next month! - Isaiah & Christy

I love this place.
We were checking the menus outside then a elderly women told us that this bar is good for drinking and eating, so we decided to try.
She was right. All foods are good and reasonable price, the atmosphere is mellow and chill. Also staff are all friendly. I definitely come back here soon.
Awesome bar with a jukebox, tvs, beer pong and flip cup.  Kevin and Cathy held it down all night and treated us well all night. Recommended!

Pros: Nice atmosphere, bartender was friendly
Cons: I asked the bartender for a recommendation and she couldn't give me one so I asked for a simple margarita and it was the most watered down drink I've ever had. Glad I tried it but won't be going back.

- free blankets for the win
- the oflanagan beer was really good
- outdoor tvs in which I could watch the game
- burger looked tasty
- friendly clientele
- free blankets
- the outdoor heaters didnt help my feet at all
- beers were relatively ineno with xpensive

If you're looking for a place to watch the game on the UES in an outdoor and covid-safe way, here's your place.  It has 3 giant TV's facing the street with ample curbside seating.  The burger was on point and the beer list was above-average for a sports bar.  The service was pleasant and timely as well.  Prices weren't too bad either.

live right behind your bar. Your AC/Exhaust system is very loud and is constantly going off and on all night long. Can it be fixed or somehow muffled. This has been going on for a very long time and nothing ever changes. How about trying to be a responsible owner and neighbor and allow people to sleep without your constant noise coming from the rear of your bar.

First off, I like this pub. The owner and staff are friendly and accommodating. But since Covid they've blocked the widows and almost all natural light. To anyone walking by, the bar appears to be closed for business, and looks much like the foreboding gay bar that it once was--it's downright depressing and creepy.

Never go during the week around lunchtime / my wife and I were seated outside and menus provided but never saw a waiter for 15 plus minutes although nearby table of 4 gentleman were continuously served beer refills- I guess senior citizens are not welcome there.
Wonderful neighborhood bar with great food and a friendly staff.  The weekend brunch is a good deal. Also a fabulous place for parties.

We were recommended to come here for a drink after going to the 9/11 Museum. Great choice. The inside is fully decorated with badges of different first responders.

We sat at the bar. Good beer choices, fast service, and decent prices.

We didn't stay long, but we we had a great time here while we drank our beer.

Can't vouch for the good, but it's a good stop for a drink in the area.

This place is iconic. The servers are very friendly.   they deal with a lot of tourists yet still maintain a very patient positive attitude.  Came here for lunch with a group of friends. We ordered lunch and got drinks from this place being very iconic the food and drink we're not very special. It was typical bar food and regular canned drinks, drafts wine and cocktails.
I particularly did not enjoy my meal and my friends also, we're not delighted with their meal as well.  

Visiting and you wanted to check this place out. Just grab a drink and roll.

Fantastic bar, amazing ambiance supporting first responders who bring an item from where they work to apply to the walls.

This location makes it a little more special as it is very close to the World Trade Center Memorial given the ambiance.

We had some mozzarella sticks and a burger along with some beer. All of it was what you would expect from bar food.

The service was adequate we were the only two customers for about 30 min as we were there at the opening but as more patrons came in our service did not take a hit they staff was still attentive.

The only restaurant to patronize near the World Trade Center ! These guys took care of all of the first responders during clean up.
Besides that - the food is excellent and priced very fair!! You won't pay insane prices for drinks either. The burgers are the way to go - delicious, perfectly cooked and the fries are great too.
Due to dietary reasons I had to order a salad - there was a special for a Grilled chicken and spinach salad. I couldn't believe how much chicken came with it! Very filling and good
You are greeted with a smile and then you enter to wall to wall first responder patches from around the world!

Great pub with lots of history! Definitely recommend stopping by here if you're in NYC. Tons of police patches and ties to the World Trade Center. Our bartender was the kindest and friendliest. Ordered a Philly cheesesteak, wasn't authentic but still a great steak sandwich. Can't beat a frosty Cooney Island brew either!

Fun bar near the 9/11 Museum and Freedom Tower.  Good selection on the menu, and tasty food.  Every wall is covered with fire/police/emt patches to honor those lost.  Pictures around the pub will show the devastation that happened.  Service was on point, with several servers helping one another out!

Very nice Irish pub less than a block away from our hotel. Bar pays tribute to all first responders, and there are thousands of patches covering the walls from first responders all over the world. We came in late for a nightcap and the bar wasn't crowded at all. Service was quick and friendly. We all had a beer and walked back to our hotel after a really fun evening.

Iconic old school Irish pub located in the shadows of 911 memorial- near the firehouse.
This place has lots of history!!  
The owner is super friendly.
Food was great!!  
Be sure to ask to see the scrapbook!!  It's filled with 911 photos and articles from that day, and the aftermath.  
The restaurant survived that horrific day, and this book is a tribute to those who did not.  
Love everything about this place!
Recently stopped by this place since it's right next to our hotel, and it was a great experience! Solid burgers and great service. Would come back

Came here while doing a NY vacation. We came in because it looked like just our kind of neighborhood bar but it was so much more. This bar was a hangout for police and firefighters before the 2 World Trade center towers fell. It is adorned with the patches of police and firemen from all over the country who are paying respect to their fallen brothers. This bar was a focal point for search and rescue and was covered in the debris from the fallen towers.

We ordered burgers which were delicious and had a couple of drinks while chatting with the friendly bartender. We saw that another patron was looking at a scrapbook and asked about it. It was a book with articles and pictures of the days & weeks following the attack. We leafed through the book and were in tears by the end. I've watched all the video, read a lot of stories, heard the stories, but to be right there and see the pictures of the people that lost their lives that used to frequent that bar - well that made it even realer.

So the food was great, our bartender was great, the prices were good, but the history of the bar and the interior with the decorations - that was something I will never forget about my visit to NY.

Walked in to a pretty packed bar on a Sunday night, the bartender at the front told us there was a second bar around the corner. To our surprised we walked into a second room with a wrap around bar. Super neat bar and the meaning behind the patches on the wall make it that much more meaningful.

Quick and friendly service, bar food was delicious, overall great atmosphere.

Went here for food and drinks after the NYC marathon. Initially barmen and servers were lovely, food was average but edible. We asked for the bill and noticed a service charge of $13:50 even though there was only 2 people. We questioned this with the waitress and she said it was the service charge yet there was only 2 of us in group, from then on she became extremely rude and started muttering rude things in our direction as she passed our table and became extremely hostile towards us because we had questioned why she had added on an extra 18% to our bill. An awful experience and disrespectful way to treat customers, would advice people to avoid this pub and stay clear of the extremely rude waitress. This isn't an Irish pub nor will it ever be when it treats tourists as if they haven't a clue to service charges. Grow a set and apologize when you get caught out ripping off your customers, would they treat the locals like this?

Perfect place to stop in for a cold beer and a meal! If your just visiting, things to know, it's kid friendly! The ac is cold and so is the beer! Support this local business who took care of all the service men and woman at ground zero.

Burger and fries were a 4-star, but the location, vibe, drinks and ownership made the difference. This place is steps from One World Trade Center, and is sort of a shrine to the firefighters who died in 9/11. Firefighters from around the world have brought patches to put on the walls. Very moving. And the owner (who served us) has worked here since 1987 and has been through a fire, 9/11 and Covid and keeps on coming back to serve this community. He's a great guy and runs a great bar.
This is my favorite place to go when I travel to NY! Great owner! Great service! Great food! Ask to see the 9/11 scrapbook if the owner is behind the bar!

You go to this place for staff as well as the history and decor.  This place is an amazing bar and eatery with a first responder patch in just about every square inch of this establishment.  Staff here is very friendly and even did a shot of makers mark with our table.  What an experience!!

After spending the day morning walking around the WTC vicinity, we wanted to have a local-ish meal. A quick Yelp browse led us to O'Hara's. Really glad we stopped in. The menu is comprised mostly of bar food and burger/wrap type dishes which is exactly what we were looking for. The food came out super fast, very hot and fresh. We loved the atmosphere and looking at all the first responder patches from around the country and world hanging on the walls and ceilings. Just a very classic pub to stop in and soak up the NYC ambiance inside.

One word: Classic.  
Things, life, people - the neighborhood - change; not this great pub.  Good drinks, great staff, good food.  (Ask to see the photo album.)
Highly recommended

Every time I visit NYC, this is my Must do. So much history packed into this one little building that I would never be able to explain in this one post. I submit that this place should be a Historical Landmark for New York City.

A first responder focal point adjacent to 9/11 Ground Zero, you could spend a solid week inside this place and not see every single patch, coin, business card, or tribute amongst its walls.

The food is fantastic and the staff is even better. Please ask to see the Owner's photo album; it will change your life.

I'll see ya there next time I'm in Manhattan.

Great spot to hang and watch some games, or just hang with the friendly people!  
The drinks are great.. food is tasty, and the bartenders are fantastic!
Best burger in town! We had the BRONX burger and it was AMAZING Love the atmosphere too!!! Great story about 9/11, look it up!
Cop bar and the lights are so bright inside. Pretty basic stuff, food is alright, the staff is friendly. Nothing special about the place

They have the best location right downtown next to the Morial very easy to fine we were seated at just as soon as we got in and grab the menu to find something delicious. I had a whiskey sour which was OK I should've just grab beer and stay on whiskey Street. The burgers that we agra delicious and also the nachos as well it was one of the best time so far in New York. I definitely recommend this place for someone looking for something to eat

Amazing Irish pub near the World Trade Center. I love Irish pubs and frequent them quite a lot due to my bf's heritage and this was a great experience. The food was good for pub level, the drinks were generous and the staff was very friendly.  The ambiance is also very special, considering the history of it, and the special respect it pays to our heroes. Will be back for sure when in the city!

Just a bunch of starved Californian's coming off the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island tours. It was now 2PM and we needed some sustenance...and pronto! Brother in law did a quick search and we landed on this place. They provided indoor and outdoor seating. There was a little bit of a wait but we found a quaint park with seating across the way.

When we were finally seated inside the ambiance just encapsulates you. The walls are adorned with various first responder patches. You kind of get caught up looking for a patch from your neck of the woods. Waiters were quick. They were out of a few items but there are so many yummy things on their menu that we weren't heart broken. Waiter took our drink order first and when he brought the alcohol to the table first he looked at me and said "I had to bring the real drinks first"...lol! Just hand my my arnold palmer okay..hahahhaa! Then he came back with my drink and took our orders.

Our order went something like this...I ordered the Bronx burger medium well, husband ordered the Ohara's Classic medium well, brother in law ordered BBQ pulled pork on a roll and sister in law ordered the Queens burger. All our burgers were perfect. Brother in law's pulled pork was not oversauced and the meat was melt in your mouth. All our orders came with fries and those were done perfectly.

Place was busy from the moment we put our name in to the time we left. Customer service is one of those places that you like to frequent if you are a local just because you know they treat you like family and remember your name if not your order. If you're in the neighborhood you should stop in. Delicious food, great customer service and a feel good ambiance that just screams "we've been here for a long time, we aren't going anywhere and we are damn proud of our City"!

Love this place! It's a Wall Street staple. After a quick jaunt in Battery Park to gaze at the Statue of Liberty, this is a great place to cool off with a few cold ones. The clientele is old school and provides some very entertaining conversation. The energy is contagious!

This place is pretty cool. There are police badges from everywhere on all walls and even the ceiling. Service was good. I only gave it 3 stars because I ordered shepherds pie and it was very dry and honestly not that great. My husbands sandwich was really good according to him

After the 9/11 Memorial and Museum my Mom and I looked up where we should go eat and we landed on O'Haras due to the reviews and the history that was mentioned.

When we walked in we were very impressed. The atmosphere with all the badges everywhere was something else. We also read about the bar and the impacts they made when 9/11 happened.

The bartenders and waiters were good and the drinks were as well. I had the burger which was a good size and my Mom had the Rueben.

My girlfriend and I came here and wanted to like it, but the service was the worst I've ever had. First, the A/C didn't work and there were bugs everywhere. Second, the bartender paid no attention to me and took forever to even get me a menu, spending all his time trying to sell a customer on some gin. But this is where it got really bad.

My girlfriend asked if they could make a certain mixed drink and he looked at her like she wasn't supposed to be there and then looked at her ID for a solid minute or two because I guess he thought it was fake (a customer blurted out that it was too. It was not). At this point I could tell he was drunk. He never asked for my order so I went ahead and told him what I wanted. He never told my girlfriend if they could make the drink and then started telling the people at the bar a story. We had a dinner reservation somewhere else and tried to get his attention multiple times. Finally, when we asked him about the drink again he was completely confused. He acted like we never even asked and then the two customers next to us (both also drunk) said we never asked for it. The bartender told me, "Both the people around you are saying you didn't order it. I'm a bartender. I'd have known if you ordered it". I slid my beer back and said I wasn't going to be drinking it and he said, "Fine, I don't need your money" and proceeded to watch me the whole time I was getting my things to leave. I told him he didn't have to stare at me because I wasn't being kicked out, I was leaving.

I'm a fair and honest guy so I won't lie on a review. This was legitimately the WORST experience I've had at a business. The bartender was an Irish guy with a mole just above his lip. I don't know his name but he was absolutely disrespectful and treated us like he couldn't stand us from the moment we tried to interact with him. I recommend that you go literally ANYWHERE but here. Even if you have better service than I did, the place was extremely hot and had bugs everywhere and the bar was sticky, so I can't imagine they clean this place well.

SAVE YOUR MONEY. According to that terrible bartender, they're doing so well that they don't need it anyway. 0/10

Walking around the area, a few restaurants we tried were closed around 9pm on a Sunday night. O'Hara's was open! The walls were covered with fire and police dept. badges and the bartender looked like he used to be a police officer. This business obviously supporters and is loved by law enforcement.

We ordered nachos for start and each ordered a bacon cheeseburger. I got onion rings and my date for the fries. They brought out our nachos when we were already eating our burgers. We refused the nachos. They may have messed up by not bringing out the nachos in time, but it worked out in our favor because it would have been way too much food.

The service and prices were both very good. We got 2 burgers and 2 sodas for 41$. I'm not sure if this was the best burger I've ever had, or if I enjoyed it so much because I haven't had beef in close to a year. They did have a vegetable burger but what the hell. My onion rings were a little greasy, but I ate a good amount of my dates fries.  

If you're in the area if the World Trade Center, this is the spot to get a burger and some drinks. I wish I tried their Ruben sandwich.
Sweet spot in Jersey City. Sit outside if you can. The top shelf marg was excellent as well as the wings. Great spot.

I was recommended to check this place out by coworkers. It lived up to my expectations.

This place is unlike any place I've gone to before. I told the bartender that I was recommended to come here. He goes lets celebrate and poured me a shot on the house. Every 3 beers you buy the next one is on them. Who does this? No bar I've ever been to.

The bartender is the best I've met. Knew his stuff and even had a beer with me.

Check this place out. I hear the food is excellent as well

Love this place new menu items are a hit

The bartender is well rounded great service makes a mean margarita!!

Chicken wings and calamari app were excellent and so was the burger

We walked here after visiting the 911 memorial. It's just a block away and they have lots of memorials themselves of the patches of many first responders who lost their lives on that fateful day.

We sat outside and had great service. Of all the many restaurants we visited while in NY, this one had the most reasonable prices. I enjoyed a few adult beverages and a Caesar salad.  My daughter gave 2 thumbs up for her grilled cheese and bacon.  

Lots of law enforcement, firemen and women as well as construction workers working on the towers hang out often. Totally respect the horrific history that many of the regulars experienced.

I started going to Ohara's probably 15 years ago.  It was once a great place to hang out and have a few drinks.  Owner Mike is a really nice guy who works hard to make his bar as great as it is.  However, these days it is just not the same.  There is a bartender there that seems to be skimming off of the customers.      Sometimes he charges the normal price of $8 per drink.  Sometimes he charges $10 per drink.  When I asked about this, he said, and I quote verbatim:  Yeah, well, I gave you a big drink, so I charged you 10.  

He's skimming the register.

Mike, I hope you ferrit out this miscreant because you and your business are a treasure.  Don't let these upstate hicks ruin what you've built over the years.  

One word of advice:  GoPro!

Keep an eye on this guy.  It's the Freddy Mercury looking guy with the pencil mustache.

I love this place. We came here because of its backstory and we love a local place with character. The food was actually really good. My husband had the cheese steak which wasn't a standard cheesesteak, but still really good. I had the chipotle chicken wrap as a recommendation, and it was also  really good. But the onion rings. They are the star of the show; you have to get them. I don't care if you don't like onion rings. You need to get them. Step out of your non-onion loving box, and experience the crunchy goodness. You will not regret it. The bartenders were super nice so if you like to chat while you eat, sit at the bar. Take a minute and walk around the place. Soak it in. You're welcome.

A few coworkers and I stopped by after work to grab a few drinks before dinner. The interior of this place was so neat and packed full of history. Sadly, they don't have any happy hour specials but the price of the beer was reasonable. I got the Hawaii wave and it was pretty light and just what I needed after a long day of work. However, towards the end my colleagues and I were rushed out of the bar because someone needed our table which is why I'm docking a star. The waiter at the beginning told us to take our time and then we were rudely asked to leave only after a half hour or so. If you're in the area for a quick drink, I would still recommend stopping by for the ambiance of the space.

Great atmosphere, good food, friendly owner and staff. We were there a half hour before they opened and they welcomed our group in, as our plans were changed due to air quality and the wildfires
In Canada. We got first hand accounts of 9/11 events, saw the scrapbook and loved looking at all the first responder patches on the wall. Highly recommend stopping there

We stopped in after our visit to the 9/11 Memorial and had a great meal. The stew and the shepherd's pie were outstanding. Friendly staff and good service. The walls are covered with police patches from all over the world and it feels like a cozy pub.

Of all the places we went in New York during my trip this was one of my favorites. Not only was the service spot on, the food was really good. The entire pub is decorated with photos from 9/11 showing the damage this establishment received from the towers falling down, and thousands upon thousands of patches from police and firemen. The whole vibe of the pub is inviting yet and a reminder of what happened. We had a great time including a round of shots that was delivered and photographed by the waitress. Definitely would return the next time I'm in New York.
One of my favorites with a closed sign and bars on the doors. Now sure what happened here but sad.

Sweet place!  Saw this place from the hotel window (visiting from the Metro Detroit area) and it piqued my interest so my friend and I went to check it out. We hit this place 3x's in 3 days if that tells you anything! We found a new watering hole in NYC in the Financial District.
They are taking Covid seriously and asking for ID along with vax proof, which was pretty typical during our visit to NYC almost two weeks ago.
Our first night there we had dinner and drinks, and they have pretty decent bar food. I had a burger and fries and my friend had a rueben and fries and we had a tasty hazy ipa from Brooklyn. The server was pleasant and attentive. The music that was being played was good and the crowd was really getting into it!  
Our next two visits we just had drinks and had a nice talk with the bartender on our last visit there.
Very friendly staff and a cool vibe means I'd like to come back here at some point!
This place is like a block away from the WTC,  and they pay tribute to that with police badges etc.
Restaurant is currently closed by Health Dept as of 7/21.  Writing enough to get a review posted.  It shows open, but it's not.

Phenomenal story of a comeback from 9/11. The book of history with pictures is amazing and seeing the devastation and destruction turned into a positive phenomenon where people can gather and share their stories is unbelievable and not to be missed. The food and drink are great and pricing is also very reasonable. Service is spot on. I highly recommend.
Great service and unique atmosphere!  Love the shepherds pie and the patches all over the place from police and fire departments around the country/world!

Staff are friendly, fast, and made sure we enjoyed our dining experience. Price is reasonable. The place is lively, just what we need when everything is just started opening up after the Covid pandemic. I recommend this place.

Very close to 9/11 museum and precious site of the twin towers- this place was damaged in the attack and they have built back into a really great bar. The decor is great and it is bustling. Def can be hard to find a table during peak hours so expect to stand esp if ur just getting drinks. The wings and zucchini fries were actually really good for bar food.
Food was not good. Burger had no flavor and the bun was falling apart like it was old and stale. Bar has a cool atmosphere and friendly staff.

I would give this establishment 5 stars just for being a friendly neighborhood pub. The fact that it played a significant role in catering to the men and women charged with dealing with the physical and human aftermath of the horrific events of September 11 makes me wish I could give it 10 stars. The staff was super friendly and the bar itself has a great vibe. We didn't order any food so I can't say what that's like. There are literally thousands of fire, police and military patches from around the world stapled to just about every square inch of every flat, vertical surface in the entire bar. There are also some framed pictures of the damage the bar suffered on 9/11 and a scrapbook you can thumb through. In a way, the bar itself has become somewhat of a memorial of the tragic days of that event. It's definitely worth checking out.

The bottom line: If you love America and neighborhood dive bars then this is the place for you.

This place is important. There's no other way to say it. What it means to the city, especially given it's location, is immeasurable. As an out-of-tower who's been multiple times, I've always felt welcome. Staff is amazing, the food is good, they have the single best beer on the planet (River Horse Tripel Horse), and ownership is amazing. The patches on the wall invoke a feeling only ground zero can give, and I tell everybody I know who lives in or visits NYC to make this place a must-stop.
Good food The food is very fresh and the service is very good. It is a good restaurant

Was looking to see what was in the area that wasn't closed by 10-11 on a Sunday night and came across here. Small, little family-owned shop. Lots of different menu options to choose from.

Roast Pork Ramen:
Nice and big portion. The pork itself was a little bit on the tougher side. But the overall dish was pretty bland. The broth didn't have much flavor as well as the other ingredients that were part of it. Not sure if this was because it was at a later time, but definitely wished there was more flavor.

Spider Maki & Salmon Avocado Roll:
The sushi was solid and good, no complaints here.

Service was good, not much interaction but still friendly. Respect the fact that this place opens up late when many places have already closed for the night.

Really adorable family-run sushi spot. I've gone here to get a dragon roll for dinner and it was tasty and not wildly expensive for sushi. Service was very quick, I'll have to come back to try the rest of the rolls!

LOVED the two (2) bugs in my soup! Saw the first one and didn't think about complaining, it happens - but then there was another. My friends and I continued looking, there was another one. Could not believe my eyes, I've never had an experience like this at a restaurant, even one of far lesser quality.

I got the party tray which was $36 for 6 rolls ($40 after tax). I got the salmon avocado, eel avocado, spicy mango shrimp, shrimp tempura, spicy salmon crunch, and sweet potato tempura. They were all pretty good and fresh. Eel avocado and salmon crunch were my favorite. Their rolls are tiny but I like that they didn't skimp on the filling. Not sure if it was worth $40 but I'll def be back for their lunch special !

Had a great delivery via Seamless experience with O Sushi Asian Fusion. Food came quickly, warm, accurate order, and I had requests that they followed! Food was delicious, as expected. Fresh. Was my first time ordering a large amount of food to last a couple days. Will be ordering again for sure!
I can't review the food, because it never showed up. But they made me wait for almost 2 hours before just cancelling my delivery order.
Ordered from here through Seamless and received solid sushi right on time! The basic salmon avocado roll was good, and the spicy crunchy tuna was huge and delicious. Would get again!
Great drinks and outdoor seating. This was our resting spot after walking the High Line. Could have spent longer if we didn't have more exploring to do.

Located right under the #Highline and in the Hudson Yards area O'Toole's Way is a local Irish pub but elevated. They've opened up a rooftop lounge area recently and it's perfect t for hanging with co-workers, grabbing a bite with friends, or grabbing drinks with bae.
.
The waiters and bartenders were super knowledgeable and accommodating. I can definitely see myself coming here after work for drinks (my fave: BOOTLEGGER
ghost tequila / cazadores silver / hibiscus / rockey's botanical / lime / rose salt ) and the short rib fries. They now offer #Brunch (started in May) and I suggest the HANGOVER SHORT RIB COTTAGE PIE or any one of the Irish breads.

I had a really nice Sunday brunch with a few friends. Great service--our server was so sweet and helpful. I recommend the soda bread with marmite - it was delicious, and a very generous portion. The coffee was very good as well. I also tried the black pudding and although I don't think this is something that I'd get every time, it was tasty and worth trying.
Solid burger with a side salad. Also liked the fish and chips. Will probably skip the dirty fries next time - a bit too heavy. A little pricey but otherwise pretty decent!
Delicious food and friendly service. A great place to grab lunch while exploring the city.

I feel like it's a 3.5. The waitress was nice but she was busy so the service wasn't that great. Our Irish soda bread was sitting in the window for about 10-15 mins before we flagged the manager down to get it. It was good. The pizza wasn't the best at all. I wasn't a fan of the tomato sauce so I took it all off. The key lime pie was surprisingly good. The manager was a great guy and really sweet. The taps weren't working when we went so nothing on draft.

Dang! We were trying to find a place before we went to the ledge observatory. My husband found O'Toole's and we were far from disappointed.

Happy that we are able to review so early in their game.
The drinks were delicious and the service was incredible. Nicole was our waitress and she was super sweet. I noted on the reservation that we had a birthday and there were birthday notes waiting on the table for us.

We ordered the dirty fries to start and let me tell you...order two of them. They are by far the best dish on the menu. The short rib was like butter and the flavor was to die for. My god.

Got a burger and it was also delicious. We got a couple of pizzas and they were great. Overall, very very good food, friendly staff, good drinks and a good looking restaurant. Only thing is that their whiskey collection isn't as much as my husband likes, but he is a whiskey lover!
Be careful when you split the check because the tip that they put on the split check is for the full amount. Quite deceptive.

My new local spot. It is like Cheers. The bartenders Sergio and another guy were fabulous. What a great bar. Love the TVs to watch sports. But what was really surprising was the quality of the food. The espresso rubbed chicken wings buffalo) were fabulous as was the kale Caesar salad. Large portion, so 2 people can share. I had my slightly dirty grey goose martini with a twist and olives to the side that was perfectly made. This will be my go to place as I just moved to One Hudson Yards. Need to try the burgers and the dirty fries not to mention the Shepard pie as well as the fish and chips. We also had the Lobster BLT Sandwich. OMG!!! Phenomenal. My only criticism was that I had to share it with my friend whom I was there with!!! What a great place to have next door. I used to live in London. this place brings me back!
Visited during friends and family and offering a distinct casual dining experience with a  great bar next to the high line in Hudson Yards
Food was delicious, service was good and their outdoor seating with live jazz was awesome.  My table was the right amount of sunlight, fresh air, and light breeze right under the high line.
Great food and amazing friendly service. Went with friends and we had a great time. Watched sports, great drinks, and food was beyond our expectations. Will definitely be coming back

This place was recommended by a friend and I'm glad I was able to try it out. We had the burger and chicken sandwich along with the short rib fries. The fries was most impressive to me because it had delicious chunks of short rib on the fries. The burger and chicken sandwich were tasty. I had 2 cocktails (can't recall the names!) but they very much were top quality flavors (gave me Dead Rabbit cocktail quality). And the staff was absolutely friendly. Check this place out and you will not be disappointed!

Brand new pub adjacent to the high line and across from Hudson Yards. I had a reward on the Hudson Yards app for a koozie or a cup so I went on the hunt for this spot. After searching the mall, I caved and asked. It's not in the mall, but across the street from Little Spain. It's brand new, so clean and beautifully designed with painted tiles and wooden beams.
