Brick accents and a tin roof. There's an open kitchen and tvs if you're into watching while eating. I didn't venture upstairs, but I'm assuming there's more seating. Tabitha the bartender was lovely. Happy to make recommendations. I ordered a blue point toasted draft and the caramelized onion flatbread. I didn't read carefully when ordering so I was a little surprised by the dominant saltiness of the anchovies and olives, but it was good once i switched gears from sweet to savory. I'd get the prosciutto, goat cheese, arugula and hot honey version next time. It was quiet in the restaurant, and just right for my mood today. I'd definitely come back during a game or happy hour when it's more lively. Two thumbs up!

I had the fish & chips, fish was quite greasy and portions were small compared to the cost of $30. Also had the chicken pot pie, very tasty, would order again. Also had hamburger, came with small salad, looked good.
Service was good, came by several times.

Went for happy hour with some friends after work and since we're new to the neighborhood it was our first time. The staff was very nice, the manager came over proactively to introduce herself and check in on our experience. They had a dj on a Wednesday night which added to a fun ambiance without it turning into a club. We'll definitely be back
Had a very average round of drinks and some fries. Fries were pretty bad... frozen and not cooked well. Lame ambience. Wouldn't go back.

Full review and photos on the blog!
eraenvogue.com/nyc-eats-…
Overall great location and nice spot for drinks! Dessert was a huge standout but everything else was also very good.

Left my apartment in search of comfort food and came across O'Toole's Way, tucked out of sight under the High Line. It's so new it doesn't have a liquor license yet. Even so, it hit the mark on every level. We had the hearty short rib cottage pie and the dirty fries -- true comfort food. And we had enough to take home for lunch the next day. Our Purple Rain mocktail was tart, pretty and delicious. The music was spot on -- the Stones, some Motown. And it's a really inviting space, candlelit and attractive. Best of all are the staff -- my servers Sarah and Patrick were so attentive and good humored.

I know the crowds are going to find this place. Go have a nice dinner soon before it's discovered.

The food was terrific. The service was good - friendly, professional, and attentive. The drinks were outstanding- best Irish Coffee I've had since Buena Vista in San Francisco!
Great area to stroll around outside, and nice pub atmosphere inside.
Gotta Check It Out!
What a great find! The food and service was amazing. My friend mentioned it was my birthday and the staff was amazing! Great birthday lunch  highly recommend!

Second time coming to at O'Toole's Way.
Amazing food, drinks, service, and atmosphere!
Such aesthetically pleasing vibes!
The bartender Grace was so professional, accommodating, and overall made my experience perfect! Can't wait to come back!

Had lunch at O'toole's way. There signature salad and dressing were a perfect blend.  I also had their Irish coffee and for the first time loved Irish coffee. It was smooth and favorable. Going back soon

Don't bother. This restaurant is consistently empty because they haven't gotten their liquor license. I live in the neighborhood so decided to order in but their online ordering system was broken. So I called and by time I got to a human she just passed me back to automated message saying to order online. So I called back and explained their system was broken and I got put on hold again so they could "check something". After 10 minutes on hold I gave up. They won't last. Shame.
Loved the food and service. All 3 people in our party have a great meal. The restaurant was lit dim for dinner and very nice feel to it. Very relaxing!

Burger was very good and cooked to the right temperature. The onion rings were a little bland, crust has no flavor but they were actually onions so that was good. Drinks and atmosphere were great. Would definitely go again.

Had the pleasure of joining during the friends and family opening they were having and it was a great time. Awesome ambiance and food was great! Their mock tails are a hit! Can't wait to join again when they fully open and we are able to have the full experience!

Stumbled across this place after walking on the High Line. We had an amazing experience there. I'm not a big drinker but they were able to make me a delicious mocktail. We split the fried chicken sandwich and the branzino, both were phenomenal. Definitely coming back for more!!
Went the first week this place opened. -LOVED- the Devils on Horseback.  Fantastic drinks as well. Hoping the 'New York State of Mind' catches on and ends up at every bar. My new standard.

Food: 10/10
Service: 10/10
Ambiance: 10/10

Amazing place! The food is pretty good for an ayce spot. They had a vast menu of proteins to choose from and theyre also vegetarian friendly. Theres two separate pricing one for meat eaters and the other for the vegetarians (which is rare at most places).

Service was amazing! All the workers were super attentive always stopping by every now and then to make sure we were okay and to help cook our meats. The grills are very big allowing you to cook more meats faster and not have to wait long. was surprised to see they also offered gopchang as a ayce item!

we were very pleased with our first visit here and will be looking forward to our next visit! shout out to the owner! thank you for the little gift!

My experience at 02, the Korean barbecue restaurant, left me with mixed feelings, primarily due to the impression that the workers might have been trying to take advantage of customers. While the concept of a Korean barbecue is inherently interactive and enjoyable, my time at 02 was marred by an underlying suspicion that I was being subtly pushed towards pricier options.

From the moment I sat down, the server recommended an upgraded meat selection, which, while tempting, felt more like a sales pitch than genuine assistance. Throughout the meal, there was a persistent effort to upsell, with subtle nudges towards premium cuts and additional side dishes. While upselling is a common practice, the frequency and insistence at 02 bordered on discomfort, leaving me questioning the authenticity of their recommendations.

Adding to my unease was the pricing structure. The menu, while offering a variety of options, came with a hefty price tag. The cost of each dish and the per-person charge for the barbecue experience seemed disproportionately high, especially considering that similar establishments in the area offered comparable quality at a more reasonable cost.

What compounded the sense of being possibly scammed was the lack of transparency in pricing. Hidden charges and unexpected fees appeared on the final bill, leaving me with a feeling of being taken advantage of. It's disheartening when a dining experience that should be centered on enjoyment and communal dining turns into a transactional encounter.

While the food at 02 was undeniably delicious and the barbecue experience enjoyable, the persistent upselling and seemingly inflated prices left a sour taste. The restaurant has the potential to offer a fantastic dining experience, but an honest and transparent approach to pricing would go a long way in enhancing customer satisfaction and dispelling any concerns about being taken for a ride.

One of my favorite KBBQ places so far in Jersey! We did a day trip down from northern NJ because Hubby works in the area and said this was a highly recommended spot and we wanted to try it. We've lived in SoCal and frequented the KBBQ joints so I was excited to see how this one fared.

Definitely did not disappoint! The meats were well seasoned/marinated and the sides were fresh and tasted delicious. I'm a sucker for potato salad whenever we sit down for KBBQ and left a happy gal + mama. My four boys love their meats and our waiter kept their favorites coming!

Everyone was nice and friendly, helped when we had questions so it was great. I hesitate going out sometimes because my two young toddlers are active but the food kept them seated and quiet from start til finish.

The place is clean and well maintained. We can't wait to be back!

We were just refused service at 11:48 PM told the kitchen closes at 11:50 PM and the man looked me and my young children in the face argued with me for 2 minutes when I said I don't understand. Your business closes at 1 AM it's over an hour and 10 minutes ahead of that and you're refusing to serve me. He says now it's 11:50 PM good bye. Evil rude and nasty people. Will never patronize this place ever again or tell anyone else to come here. Made a huge trip for lying business hours and refusal of service with children.

First time trying Korean bbq and it was a fun experience. Came with a large group and ordered different cutlets of beef and chicken (no pork), rice cakes, and a Makosa Tower. My favorite of the meats was the marinated chicken and the salad had a sweet marinade that had me eating all night. I love the way they do birthdays...techno bday song, flickering lights, and the whole restaurant joins in the celebration. The staff were all attentive and helpful the whole time. As far as parking goes, they have a garage next door for which they validate your ticket or try your luck with street parking.

This is by far was the best AYCE Korean BBQ we had in New Jersey. I would go back to eat here again but it's about an hour and a half away from where I live. My daughter who also loves this place rates this as one of her top choices.  The staff was attentive and readily available for orders and cooking.

The place is in a residential neighborhood so parking is a little difficult so you would need to enter the parking lot at the side of the building and navigate the labyrinth of level parking. Then you have to work your way up to the street level via stairs or elevators and one may be lost in the numerous turns.

Overall, if you manage to get yourself to the place, you won't be disappointed.  I have spoken highly about this place at work that a group of us are already scheduling a food road trip down to Jersey.  Enjoy the food.

Came in with some family for a small celebration. We had a reservation ahead of time. Because this restaurant is in a high-volume area of Edgewater, we were happy to see that they validate garage parking for customers.

We arrived at the designated garage listed on our reservation. As someone who has had plenty of experience garage parking in different cities, this was one of the worst garages I have ever seen. The floors were extremely confusing and did not go in numerical order. The flow of traffic in the garage was different on each floor. There was also a ridiculous amount of construction within the garage, making it even more confusing to get from floor to floor.

Once we had finally parked and made it out of that insane garage, we were excited to eat. We arrived in time for our reservation, but we waited a few minutes while our table was set. I had to use the restroom as we were waiting; it was pretty gross and unkempt. I expected better for a place like this.

As soon as we were seated, we took a few minutes to look at the menu. They charge a flat fee for KBBQ, but you still get to choose your selection of meats, appetizers, and sides. We went for a few Veggie Dumpling and Tteokkbokki orders. We chose a selection of about 3 different cuts of beef, 1 type of chicken, and some veggie orders.

Although we were initially being taken care of by one server, it seemed like a team effort. Different servers would bring items to our table. On each table they have a selection of sauces and small Banchan appetizers to eat with your meal. They also bring over bowls of steamed rice to eat with the meat.

Once our meats were brought over, they got the grill started. This KBBQ place is somewhere between others in terms of cooking meat. They seem to be pretty set on getting your meats started and checking in them as they cook. However, you're still allowed to move items on and off the grill to your liking. I found the experience fun; I would have also been OK being a little more independent with the cooking.

In terms of food flavor and quality, it was solid. I wasn't a huge fan of the appetizers. I'm someone who has had a lot of Korean food, and I didn't find any of them taste very good. The Veggie Dumplings were bland, and the Tteokkbokki had a strange texture compared to others I've had. The meats were decent, but almost all of the dipping sauces had a very strange aftertaste. The service throughout was OK. The employees were diligent about checking on the meat and cooking process. However, I didn't find that any of them were particularly friendly or paid attention to customer service.

Overall, this place was OK. KBBQ is always a pretty fun experience. I didn't find that anything stood out as special to me. I found the bathroom, garage, and service to all be weak points for this place. Pricing was pretty standard for this kind of food. It was about $40 per person before tax and tip. I liked the company and the meats, but I don't think I'd pay a visit to this location again.

Want to come and eat in a Korean BBQ with a lot of friends? This place is not it.

They charge 37$ per person for all you can eat. But there is a time limit of 100 minutes from the moment you sit there and there's a 3 item per table limit so you cant order more food while you're cooking what you have. It takes some time to heat up the grill and cook the food so in the end its a lot less than 100 min to eat as much as you want, specially if there's 4-6 people

The other problem is, they randomly come and change your grill which is fine but that adds onto the 100 minutes and it wastes even more time. They also add tips from the 37 dollars, so in the end its 52$ per person for food with time limit that you won't be filled with.

I think you can find better korean BBQS in Queens for cheaper and without all of these restrictions. I only gave 2 stars because the food was good but the price wasn't.

Location is deceiving as you park in a shopping mall and don't expect much ambiance.  But as soon as you leave the parking garage the elevated view down the Hudson gives a spectacular angle of everything from the Bronx to downtown and across the river to Jersey city and beyond to the Verrazano bridge. Wow.

Inside it's modern and well appointed with great table top grills and ventilation. Everywhere you look you see high def screens pumping K-pop videos which I happen to love for their energy and happy vibe.

The staff is highly attentive, friendly and prompt to bring all the meats and things you care to order.  

The food is no doubt the best Korean bbq I've had, even saying this after many a visit to K-town in Manhattan.  This is better.  Perfect really. My favorite is the pork belly.  The condiment sauces include their own secret recipe bean sauce which is a beautiful thing unto itself.

Highly recommend this place.

1.5 hour wait - not worth the wait. Turn around now if you are debating waiting. This is more of a 2.5 but, I will round up.

AMBIANCE

This place is a lot larger than it looks which is great because they are pretty popular. The place was packed but this is definitely not the best kBBQ spot out there. The tables are pretty spaced out, the decor is cool, and the booths are hard. The back support is wooden opposed to upholstery.

SERVICE

They don't really explain anything so if you have never been here, it's all you can eat. You can have up to 4 meats at a time but, the cooker fits only so much. I don't know if they are supposed to cook it, we requested it but cooked it ourselves.

FOOD

UM...in one word...disappointing. Unless you order a marinade meat (like the Kolbi steak- which is responsible for 2/2.5 of this review) don't expect the meat itself to have much flavor. It was a lot paler than we were all used to. Some teriyaki sauce would have been nice; when asked we were told meats were seasoned.

The marinade was  pretty thin. So thin, that the juices spilled into the sauces they provide while the waiter put the meats on the grill. Also, the meat comes really large. One first round our waiter cut it, the other round he did not. We could not even eat all you can eat, was not our jam.

Don't recommend. Especially if you drive. The parking lot is like a maze located in the underground (very steep ramp under apartments in the "mall").
Not a bad spot, good service , food was fresh and the marinated stuff was good. The food came quick , pricing not bad. Place was clean. The condiments weren't bad . But I have had better spots .

Came here for a weekday lunch.
Arrived when they just opened at 12.
Great service coz only have 3 tables occupied.
Meat quality is great!
It's better than cast iron pot. Also more banchan.
Would def come here instead of.

If you are a fan of K-pop and K barbecue, this place is perfect for you. This establishment is adorned with TVs, playing K-pop, music videos, and upon being seated, we were delighted to receive an array of delicious sides, along with one of the stand outs being the sauce tray. The sauces pair well with the meat! The service was excellent, with staff frequently, checking in on us to ensure that we were cooking the meat who are liking. If you are unsure how to cook the meat, they are more than happy to assist you as well.
Very delicious! 100% recommend. Perfect place for dates, group hangouts, special occasions. Loud and fun atmosphere, great service and delicious unlimited food!

Good not great -- when you go to a KBBQ spot, you're already paying a premium for standard cuts of meat in standard marinated sauces. What rubbed me the wrong way were a few things at O2 BBQ -- first, we had a party of 3, we came hungry & ready to eat. We were told that we can only order 2 meats at a time -- now I would understand perhaps after the first 3-4 servings to mitigate the propensity of wasting food/money/meat to enforce some type of limit-rule, however from the start we were told two meats at a time. This seemed odd because I could easily cook 4 meats at a time, I personally could consume the entire portion & most others could as well. So frankly, I didn't appreciate this rule at all.  Second, the parking location/situation was awful -- we had to navigate through a sketchy mall to get to the restaurant -- probably a better way but couldn't easily figure that out. Lastly, they didn't have that extensive of a menu as it pertains to non-veg sides for BBQ -- I am an avid KBBQ fan & the sauces, sides & veggies that come alongside the actual meat are equally as great to enjoy while cooking/eating the BBQ. All in all, I would not recommend O2 BBQ for multiple reasons, if it's your first KBBQ experience, this will set the bar VERY slow & if you're a KBBQ fan, this will honestly just disapoint you. Huge fan of V-YAN Hot Pot & BBQ in Parsippany -- they are probably one of the best in NJ!

Went here last night to celebrate my moms birthday and I want to say we had such an amazing night. We had the all you can eat dinner menu. Jennifer was such an amazing waiter, so friendly and personable. We shared a lot of laughs. Gyozaa dumplings were great, pork ones. We had marinated chicken, beef bulgolgi, beef thin brisket, top blade steak, kalbi marinated steak and so much more: which were all good. We had veggies, salad, miso soup, & spice friend riced cake. Overall they deserve a 5. Go here have a great time, experience different foods and have a drink. Oh we didn't really like the squid - but it was of the texture.  Overall, go ! We brought a cake and everyone sang HBD. TY - Jenn for the experience.

We didn't realize o2 bbq existed and so close to where we live! So we wound up heading there for an early dinner. It was pretty slow when we sat down but within a hour the place got really busy and this was around 4pm on a Saturday, so plan accordingly.

The service was very good. They don't cook the food for you currently because of Covid but we prefer to do it ourselves anyways. They definitely use higher quality meats than most other all you can eat kbbq spots in the area. This is without the doubt the best kbbq around. Pricing is very fair and reasonable as well.

The brisket was very good with great marbling. The spicy chicken was delicious and so were the steak choices. They had a great steamed egg as well, extremely fluffy. I was a big fan of their kimchi too and I usually steer clear of it.

All and all their quality, service, and overall food were all great. They also pay for your first hour in the parking garage which is great. We went slightly over 2 hours and it was 30 bucks so keep that in mind. I'll be looking for street parking next go around.

Terrible service and terrible food. Last time I came here on a Friday night and it was pretty good. Not sure what was up this time... Maybe they're far worse on weekdays? Or they've gone downhill. Every meat we ordered was either dry or extremely salty, and all were barely edible.

The servers were extremely cold and didn't do basic things like come ask us what we wanted to order or tell us which meat was which. We had to flag them down, which was hard since they avoided looking at us. They overcooked everything, which made the food even worse.

For ambiance, we got to see and hear one of the workers smacking flies with a zapper racket throughout our meal. So appetizing

I'm really disappointed since I recommended this restaurant and brought my family just to show them this awful experience. Bad food and worse service for premium prices. There's plenty of far better KBBQs not too far away, in nearby Bergen County.

Seriously, don't go to O2.
I recommend this restaurant in New Jersey. Korea BBQ All you can eat . The restaurant is very nice and clean stuff was great service. And don't forget to order number 16. So good  I will be back!

Wish we found this AYCE gem earlier.  The quality of meats is so good and for the price you can't go wrong.  
They do have signs everywhere explaining it is all you can eat and due to COVID, you are responsible for cooking.  Not quite sure why so many people get confused on this.  There are literally signs everywhere on every table and on the page where the QR code is.  

They were attentive and kept our sauces full at all times. We tried a bit of everything and also a few sides including the eggs, duMplings, rice and rice sticks.

We will definitely be back here and this is def our new spot.  Just know, that the garage charges $10/jr for parking, so I suggest finding parking on the street or unerring if you're close enough so you can drink as well.
Great affordable all you can eat. Interesting options like intestines are available too. Lot of music videos are played throughout restaurant. Staff is friendly. Great lunch special

We dined at 02 Korean Bbq Wednesday night and that is going to be our new spot! Impeccable, friendly and attentive service truly elevated our experience. They anticipated all our needs and the food was delicious. I recommend pairing the marinated kalbi steak and the sour apple soju, you won't regret it.
The ambiance was absolute, great music and vibe, perfect for a cozy date night with your special someone.

Another typical kbbq in the area. It's pretty pricey at $38/PP ayce for dinner and the service was really bad when I went. They took forever to come to take our order and we had to consistently follow up when we wanted a new meat order. And after we ordered a couple meats, the grill was burnt and charred from the sauce from the meats and they never changed it. When we asked for another meat, they grilled the meat on the burnt grill and the meat tasted completely burnt. So, I had to ask them to change the grill before they even did it. On top of that, the pork belly meat had soooo much fat on it.

Honestly, for this area and bc there's so many ayce kbbq places, at this price point I wouldn't recommend this place. The quality of meat is comparable to cheaper places and the service didn't help the experience.

There are days you crave for spicy, flavorful korean food!! This is just the place to be.
They have dine in with a lot of bbq options..Huge dinning area.
We did take out as we could access their regular menu. Ordered a bunch of stuff - spicy khimchi pancake, spicy khimchi rice, ramen, tofu stew! Everything was delicious.
We also ordered the apple mango soju and went perfectly with our food! They have multiple options for fruity as well as regular soju! Must try with the spicy food!!
cant wait to get back to Guttenberg and try this place again!

Just wonderful service!!! We came with a group of 16 people and they accommodate us so fast and well. The food is amazing it's a great Friday night vibe with music is top notch. If you're looking for a great vibe on a Friday night definitely come here!!

Ah finally get to check this place off my bucket list. If it weren't for the long drive, I'd be coming here WAY more often. The aesthetics of this place alone are great and provide such a fun atmosphere for eating endless amounts of bbq and banchan.

Okay, so I wasn't able to try their entire menu (I am a small girl with a small stomach), so I ordered my usuals: brisket, porkbelly, topblade steak. UGH WOW the cuts of meat were so good, such a nice marbling on the brisket, and the porkbelly wasn't paper thin, but not too thicc either, the perfect size in my opinion! The top blade steak was good too, but not noteworthy. They give you sesame oil, salt+pepper, some type of ssamjjang/doenjang, and another sauce I wasn't sure of. You grill yourself but the staff is always around to help (I like grilling by myself anyway so I didn't mind at all). We also ordered the steamed egg, which is our favorite side to order. It was so light and airy but tastes so incredibly good! They also have a full bar, and different drinks and drink towers. I wish I could have been able to try, but maybe I will if I come with a group of homies.

I literally drove almost 2 hours just to eat here! And it was really good so I recommend!!!

Honestly, this KBBQ experience was REALLY, REALLY good!

Let me tell you guys what we got.

1) Porkbelly: delicious, but wish they seasoned with salt and pepper and scored the meat a bit better
2) Thinly sliced beef brisket: stunning!
3) Kalbi marinated steak: great cut of steak, definitely has sweetness to it through the marinade. But eat with some onions and jalapeños and perfect!
4) Spicy Pork Bulgogi: delicious with onions and jalapeños! Definitely not spicy, lol, but for sure sweet to the taste. We like to cook it longer to get darker and crispier to kind of cut down on the sweetness.

We also got lettuce, rice, kimchi, jalapeños, and onions.

When you sit down, an assortment of bean sprouts, pickled veggies, sesame oil, salt, pepper, and few other sauces available on the table. They have options to also get soups, gyoza and more!

Staff were super friendly! The cast iron wasn't getting hot as we usually like it, but it was fine. Because it took super long to get hot, our meat began to steam a bit. But after about 20ish minutes, it was okay.

But do check them out! Dinner price is $34pp. Check out my Instagram for a full review! @foodiestateofmindxo

Complicated parking situation in a lot and the bbq joint is located in a "mall" that also has a ton of apartments. You essentially have to walk through a garage and through multiple stairways to get to the joint. It's usually not as crowded as other ayce locations such as cast iron (probably due to its location). There are a lot of meats to choose from and all the other fixings such as soups, rice cakes, and veggies. Meat quality is really good and the service is pretty fast, I wouldn't say the staff is overly friendly but they get you what you ask for in a pretty quick manner. For the price point and complicated location, I would rather wait a little longer for places like Cast Iron.

Not very accessible.

I have been here twice and both times i had an amazing eating experience. This time around i called for a reservation for 6 people. As soon as we got to the restaurant we got seated right away. My friends and I picked from so many different options of meats with vegetables. It was so much fun trying the meats with the different sauces they provide. My favorite one was the soy sauce. The meats are so fresh and delicious. I absolutely loved it. We also tried the SoonHari drink which you take as shots. We had the peach and green apple.

KBBQ is all you can eat so make sure you come with your belly empty. I will definitely be coming here again and again.

Gave this place a shot after biking on the Weehawken Waterfront Park & Recreation Center, definitely worth a stop.  Parking is a little troublesome, but the restaurant will validate your ticket if you park in the garage so it doesn't cost anything.

Hanger steak and top blade steak were our favorite picks.  Also the service here is top notch, I mean most KBBQ places they're attentive, but this place is something else, they're really on top of the grill which is great.

I'm giving this 4 stars because the way the grill is angled the oil has a tendency to "pop" towards you, it got on me a few times and while it doesn't hurt a lot but definitely happens often enough to be an issue.

We came here to celebrate my boyfriend's new job and it was AMAZING. One  of the best KBBQ places i've been to in a while. There were sooo many meat options and sides - stew, steamed egg, gyoza, rice cakes, etc. There was also thinly sliced radish that we would wrap with the meat and lettuce and it was delicious. Overall, great food, service and experience! Would love to come back.

Came here a few times and I really like this place.

Free parking in parking lot, just have to bring your ticket to restaurant to get it scanned.

Got the pork belly (thick), kalbi/galbi and brisket. It was very good. Don't forget to get the mushrooms, not on menu.

The price and the fact you can get kalbi/galbi or steak items without a price increase is great.  Bang for the your buck and great service although I did have to flip the meats here and there.

O2 is slightly better than cast iron IMO (both are good, just my preference)

Food so so service need improvement .
Before order make sure your dish with all in can eat . Normal they do not told you

This place is phenomenal!!
It is located within the Galaxy Towers area and is definitely one of the best KBBQ in North Jersey. Everything about this place from the service all the way to the meats were top notch.

For starters, safety and covid-19 precautions are handled super well and professionally here. Your temperature is taken and you are asked to put on hand sanitizer before you even enter the seating area. The tables are separated to ensure social distancing and masks are required at all times except for when you are at your table eating.

The staff was incredibly kind! I was with my friends and since this was their first time ever coming to a place like this, they had a few questions about the menu and how the ordering style works to which the staff was more than happy to answer. After The menu items and the ordering style was explained, we all felt comfortable ordering what we wanted.

The menu has quite a few options, which in my opinion, was good because they have a variety of meats to choose from for just about anybody. My friends both ordered the pork steak, and I ordered the beef bulgogi. As for sides, they have also have a few options, but we all chose to go with white rice. The sauces, veggies and water were all complimentary.

As with these style restaurants, you cook and prepare your meat to the temp/rarity you want it to be at. So the way it cooks is essentially completely under your own discretion and control. With that being said, the food was awesome. The meats were rich with flavor, the rice was really good and the sauces/veggies on the side were nice additions to have.

I can't say enough good things about 02. Everything from top to bottom really made the experience worthwhile and, for how nice the prices are, you can't really ask for better here. I would highly recommend giving this place a try.
Great food, service and fun ambiance.  I've never felt rushed even when the place is packed. It's a great place for a larger group of friends or family
Service was awesome, prices were reasonable, meats are fresh . I cant wait to go back. FYI that Soju sneaks up on u

AYCE Korean BBQ can be a big hit or miss and O2 thankfully does it well. It's a little more expensive compared to other places in the area, clocking in at $35 for a single dinner set option. First off, I love the grill, which is a massive iron dome that makes it easy to cook meat at the top and cook vegetables at the bottom where the oil trickles down. The meat winners of the night were the pork belly, which was thick and not mostly fat like some bbq places, and the pork jowl, which was buttery and tender. They have a wide assortment of side dishes in the set menu and my favorite was the "spicy fried rice cake" which you must, must cook on the cast iron grill for that extra crisp and char.

The downsides: the milkis cocktail, which is a blend of soju and a carbonated Korean soft drink, was very watery. It was a busy night, but more attentive service would've been appreciated. The bottom of our grill was burnt halfway through and while most places swap it out proactively, we had to call over our waiter to change it out. Some places also cook and cut the meat for you, but the waiters at O2 didn't.

Overall a fun place to get drinks and Korean bbq with friends. Just remember your clothes will reek of smoke for days after.
Delicious food, great atmosphere, and John is the MAN! He took such great care of us and made sure we had a blast. Definitely coming back again and again!
We use to come but this last time was disappointing in the service and the food. The music wat too loud.

Loved the food and the service. They have K-pop videos on play which give chilled vibes. You pay per person and have a selected unlimited menu. Once you order out of that menu then it's an additional cost. Definitely recommend! Can get pretty busy so I'd suggest to call and make reservations.

First time trying this place out last Friday and it wasn't bad. I was very impressed with the quality of the thin brisket. The other meats were the regular quality you get from any ayce bbq. Intestines were not good at all. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely come back for soju and Korean bbq since it's close to my friends's place. Would not recommend for high quality bbq

I'm a huge fan of O2's other location in Bayside, Queens.  The NJ location is equally excellent.  Like the Queens location, the meat quality is top notch, far better than anyone can usually expect from AYCE places.  The best items for us were the pork belly, tender kalbi steak, spicy pork rib and spicy pork bulgogi.  I do feel like there is a smaller variety of choices in meat here (I think there was squid and other seafood options at the Queens location but its not a big deal). You certainly will get your moneys worth here.

The service here is remarkably good.  We came during a peak time on a holiday and the staff was just flying all over but somehow covering every table without a hitch.  On top of that, they were insanely friendly and welcoming despite being overrun constantly by all the patrons.  Really they set a standard for service.

Strangely enough my only gripe with this place is the location.  The restaurant is located within a condo building with a mall attached to it.  The mall clearly was built in the glory days of the 80's and it really shows its age.  My kids remarked that it was a perfect setting for a B movie slasher film.  The parking situation is also a bit annoying.  Street parking, which would be the most convenient is understandably tight in a residential area.  The garage is located in the condo but you need to make your way through the Byzantine mall (which is half vacant) to the garage which has very poor directions to show you the way to the exit or entrance to the mall.  Good news is that the restaurant will validate the parking so it's free.  Definitely a great experience for dining and if you're into throwback walking tours from the 80's its worth a visit.

The service and food is still 5 stars, but the parking has gotten significantly worse. Took us 40 mins driving around the garage and there were issues getting reimbursed when leaving. I know it's not the restaurants fault but it definitely hinders the experience

Loved this spot. The staff was super friendly and was very helpful. This was an awesome all-you-can-eat spot and the price wasn't too bad for what they offer.

The only con about this place was the parking.
There is a garage next to the restaurant and finding a spot within the garage was treacherous it took us 15 minutes to find a spot riding in circles around the garage.

We have been to O2 a few times now and each time was fantastic. We have made a reservation each time we have been and I would definitely suggest doing that. There can be a wait as this is a popular spot. You can park in the parking deck for free or you can street park out front. The street parking is paid but it is a shorter walk to the restaurant.

Now for the food, amazing. It is $36 for AYCE and all of the selections are great. My favorite is the beef bulgogi - perfectly seasoned and very good. There is a great banchan selection and there are many drink choices as well. The location is large and good for a big group or for families.

Saw this place on tiktok and needed to visit! I've been to kBBQ spots in NYC and Flushing so I'll preface it with this: the spots I've been to normally grill it for you and move it off the grill when it's cooked... and normally order a la carte.

Here, it wasn't so clear? The server didn't bother explaining the menu or how it worked. Eventually realized it's all you can eat, and that they recommend ordering 2-3 meats at a time to try what you want (and to rightfully avoid waste). Still not sure if we cook our own meat or if they do it for you cause it was a combo and a bit overwhelming - my biggest fear is eating raw chicken so leaving a big chunk without cooking directions (but also without coming back every few minutes to check on it) left me very confused

Otherwise, the meats were delicious and I highly recommend the spicy chicken, pork bulgogi and marinated steaks. You'll probably want to come with a larger group so you can try more. The little side dishes and pickles were fabulous as well, and we enjoyed the gyoza too!

Recently went to O2 to celebrate a family members birthday. We had made a reservation and had a brief wait while they set up the table. When we were seated there was some bon chon at the table--some radish, kimchi, and bean sprouts.  There was also a variety of dipping sauces for the meats. The menus is available by a QR code which was located right on back of our bench seat. Their AYCE menu definitely did not disappoint. They had a variety of meats from beef, pork, and chicken and as well there were spicy meats as well.  There was also a good variety of side items to order like vegetables, rice, rice cakes, salad, lettuce, soups, steamed egg, and dumplings.   Everything sounded delicious--but resist the temptation to order everything. There is a surcharge for anything that is not finished. We started with the beef brisket, tender steak, spicy chicken, and galbi. And we had as well ordered some soups, vegetables, steamed egg, white rice, and fried rice cake. Everything was served fairly quickly and began cooking some of the meats. My favorite was the brisket!  It cooked fairly quickly and was so tender!  

Overall it was a great experience. The servers were quick and very helpful!  The meats were all very fresh and delicious!  They have a variety of different soju and beers. They also serve dessert of ice cream popsicles. Parking is conveniently located in the garage and the restaurant validates parking tickets. I definitely will come back again!  And you can't go wrong with a great AYCE Korean bbq restaurant!

Such a nice hidden gem! Wait can be extremely long and they don't take reservations. There's a pool bar down the street which is fun during the wait. Only thing is they tend to not call you when you are on the waiting list so you have to call in and check after the waiting time is up. Food was yummy! Worth the one and a half hour wait

We stopped by on a holiday weekday for lunch and thankfully there was no wait for a table. there was just one large party of rowdy teens and for whatever reason they decided to seat us (party of 4) directly next to them which I found irritating because the entire restaurant was empty. I sat my child down intentionally away from the other party but was soon advised that is the server's station where they need to come and cut/flip/cook for the table because all the smoke etc was going to be in that direction. it was just an awkward situation the entire time, but I enjoyed the food overall. we paced ourselves but was still stuffed. what I didn't enjoy as much was that most, if not all of their meats were not marinated. it was reliant on us dipping it in various housemade sauces, and I only enjoyed 1 of the 3 provided. I also don't think their menu is child friendly at all .. given my child  literally ate close to nothing, pretty much nothing. but the good news is they didn't charge my child.

This is my third time coming here because I love this spot a lot. Unfortunately I was a bit disappointed with my recent experience. The staff was not as organized and on point as usual with catering to our table.

Some downsides to my experience was the fact that they forgot to turn on the grill and let the meat sit there for 10 minutes until we figured out the issue. They did not bring us the sodas we ordered until we reminded them. They also did not bring out our rice so we were eating one part of the meal without the other. And we also had to remind them to switch our grills because it was covered in char. They are usually on top of all of this but I believe it could be due to low staff. Despite this, I would definitely give them another chance. Hopefully they have more staff next time!

I love truffle anything so when my best friend and I drove by this small intimate restaurant, we were intrigued!
Truffle can be added to anything here and we added it to all of our dishes. It did not disappoint.
We had the Caesar salad, truffle burrata, and truffle espresso martinis!! She ordered the rigatoni truffle ragu and I ordered the truffle cacio e Pepe. For dessert we shared the pistachio truffle tiramisu-wow. Chef's kiss!
The owner, Rudy, and staff are amazing! So hospitable, friendly and very kind. So happy that we bumped into this and really enjoyed it.
We will definitely be coming back!

i'm so glad I found this place as recommended by a tiktoker! very quaint and cozy restaurant. doesn't have more than 10 tables. we came for the Tagliolino Cacio E Pepe and it was delectable BUT winner was their veal bolognese. it was the perfect bite!!

I also tried their truffle espresso martini and although I love everything truffle, this was prob my least favorite drink  

their chocolate brownie cake was ahhhmazing

can't wait to come back for more

I was sold at "Tuscan Truffle." I made sure to make a stop here during our stay in the city. I was able to get a reservation for 4 through Resy at 8pm. Upon entrance, we realized this restaurant was super small, housing roughly a dozen guests. It added to the charm along with the signatures/drawings on the walls.

Along with drinks, we ordered:
+ BURRATA AL MIELE WITH FRESH SHAVED TRUFFLE: a super soft burrata with truffle oil and honey. This paired well over some truffle oiled bread.
+ TAGLIOLINO CACIO E PEPE: my friend ordered the cacio e pepe which was super flavorful. I'm not a huge fan as the pepper seems to always over power the dish. However, this was much more pleasant.
+ TAGLIOLINO CLASSICO: I ordered the classic truffle pasta. This was the perfect portion of creamy truffle-y goodness. They bring the dish to you and shave the truffles at the table. Hubby was a little upset that I didn't let him try a bite.

Had I had the appetite, I would have loved to try the other dishes such as the truffled mashed potatoes. The service was great. It is a husband and wife owned restaurant and they make it such a fun experience with the light jokes here and there. They end your night by handing you a Sharpie pen to write something on the walls.

I highly recommend the Oak Tuscan Truffle Lounge if you're in the mood for some truffled dishes. Buon appetito!

Such a charming Italian restaurant in West Village. The owners are truffle-obsessed, and happy to share their passion with you through their menu.

The setting is intimate, with a long, narrow dining area and only a dozen or so tables for two. For Valentine's Day, they decorated with a red theme and balloons. It's clear the owners care about the entire dining experience, including the space itself.

Food was fantastic, well worth the splurge for a fancy dinner! They find creative ways to work truffles into the menu. The espresso martini, for example, had shaved truffle floating on top, and it tasted amazing. I didn't expect truffle to work here, but I was glad to be proven wrong.

Appetizers were good - we tried the salmon tartare and the burrata with prosciutto. The burrata stole the show here, with a truffle-infused honey that really added something special to the dish.

For mains, I had the lobster ravioli, and it was phenomenal. Lots of lobster packed into each raviolo, and a delicious sauce that was rich, but not too heavy. And yes, shaved truffle was a really nice touch.

As far as fancy Italian meals go, this is a top notch destination for two!

Had a phenomenal meal there last night. Rudy and Svetlana were both welcoming and extremely nice to talk to throughout our dinner. We had a daily special bruschetta which was amazing. I then had the special veal bolognese with truffles and my wife had pasta with shrimp and zucchini, garlic and tomatoes. Everything we had including the MmmMmmm desert was delicious. Also was fun writing on the walls after dinner.

Definitely recommend and will be back when in NYC again.

Hubby found this place & we decided to stop by, had our rsvp so when we arrived a little late we did call no issues.
Once seated we started with a Bottle of wine, Pinot Grecio was good went well with our meal.
To start the Burrata & Prosciutto was delicious, melt in your mouth Burrata perfect match with the Bread w Truffle oil yummy combo.
On the food I had the Cacio e Pepe pasta very good, also the Cacio e pepe Ravioli's nice twist w these very tasty.
Also tried the Gnocchi & Pasta ragu, gnocchi was delicious nice light tasting very good sauce & the Ragu was very good as well, all meals with added truffle of course!
Such a small restaurant but very quaint, dimly lit nice ambiance almost feels like u are not in NYC very cute & cozy inside.
Service was very good they were attentive & on top of asking if we needed anything. Price wise doable , overall we had a yummy truffle dinner & a nice evening certainly worth the try.
Review#1700

Rudy Rudy Rudy, you are THE BEST. The establishment is to die for. Small, but packed with greatness in its menu.

We started off with the salmon tartare and bread basket (ciabatta with truffle oil). I never know how truly marvelous it would to have pomegranate seeds and truffle in a tartare. It's a lot to say we were amazed in the first rounds, because I feel as if there are no words to truly describe the meal that we came for.

But first. The drinks. The drink menu is limited to an aperol spritz, a beer if I'm not mistaken, and an extensive wine list. I got myself a delicious aperol spritz, and my fiance ordered a bottle of Super Tuscan that got me feeling a little funny (in a good way) by the time we left. In Rudy's words, they "want to serve food" and not some frou frou drinks. Totally understood!

Next came the entrees: the rigatoni with lamb and the cacio e pepe. Wow wow wow. The presentation 100%. The flavor 100%. The satisfaction we felt finishing the last bite 100%. So so so good.

THE DESSERT RUINED US. If you want to be able to order cannolis anywhere else, DO NOT ORDER HERE. It is too good. I almost cried. The tiramisu was also delicious, but the fiance and I could not shut up about the (honey) truffle-ified raspberry cannolis. Forever will be engrained in my memory.

The ambience. It is a small little "walk up and down and you've seen everything" kind of place. But for Valentine's Day, it was decorated to the nines. It was very romantic, and Rudy and staff even gave us little chocolates and free limoncello shots. This place is it, please expect us back!

This place isn't for the faint of truffle lovers - unlike most places, they do not skimp on the truffle shavings here!

Burrata al miele with truffle (4.5/5): my favorite dish of the meal! the burrata is fresh and tastes so great with the ciabatta bread with truffle oil from the bread basket -- this one got us making our "mhmm" satisfying faces :')

Tagliolino with truffle e fonduta di parmigiano (3.5/5): even the generous truffle shaving mountain couldn't save the sauce for me, it was reminiscent of Kraft mac n cheese

Brownie with ice cream and truffle honey (4/5): solid dessert and convinced me that I had to get my hands on truffle honey and drizzle it on everything I eat

It got lovely dining atmosphere, only 6 small tables for 2 people dining and 1 large table. The owner made a good explanation of the menu and introduced which one goes well with black or white truffle.
I ordered Tagliolino with white truffle adds on for $95 and my bf ordered ragu rigatoni with black truffle. Both were really delicious. I absolutely adore the scent of white truffle which was further enhanced by the creamy pasta.
The only thing about this place is everything is very salty. I'd suggest order something light to balance out.

We celebrated my girlfriend's birthday here and the restaurant did not disappoint.

Aesthetics inside were modest and beautiful, making this an ideal date spot.  The space feels a tight, but they're able to manage several tables in what feels like a long corridor.

Truffle, truffle, truffle.  You'll find truffle itself or some form of its essence in any one of the dishes.  The prosciutto and burrata was delicious; the white truffle honey balanced the salty and creamy blend of the dish.  My girlfriend got the risotto with white truffle, while I opted for the gnocchi with black truffle.  Both are amazing to say the least and they shave the truffle into your dish in front of you.

The white truffle is more expensive and it is a different truffle experience from the black truffle.  The black truffle has an immediate pop of the truffle flavor, but flees in minutes.  White truffle, on the other hand, subtly opens with the truffle taste and the flavor endures in your mouth for a much appreciated time.

For dessert, we had the fior di latte ice cream.  The truffle really shined and it makes you wonder why there isn't more truffle flavor in ice cream in the world.

To wrap up this review in a bow, special thanks to Rudy for making us welcomed and for celebrating my girlfriend's birthday with festive sparklers.  Everything was incredible from food, service, and experience, beginning to end. Kk

Small but cozy place, nice and friendly staff. If you like truffle, you would definitely like this place.
Almost everything is cooked in truffle oil. Appetizers were great: fried eggs, potatoes are great. Bread is delicious but it is not complementary (3$).
Pasta and Raviolis are good but nothing special.
The filet was cooked to perfection, well seasoned, delicious steak sauce.
In my opinion, the desert should not be cooked with truffle oil, your taste buds get confused between savory and sweet.
A little pricy though.
Overall, great experience.

It was my first time trying fresh truffles. Food was ok! The Salmon was a little bit overcooked. And the food took a long time to come out. The owner was very friendly. overall good experience but overpriced

My date was a huge fan of truffle and I came across this spot and knew i had to take her.

First thing you notice is this place is small yet quaint. There were maybe 5 tables total so you don't get overwhelmed with the crowd. This actually makes for a great intimate experience, perfect for a date. The owners were there assisting and chatting with patrons.

We ordered the cacio and filet mignon as it looked and sounded fantastic. First off the cacio was extremely creamy and tasted fantastic with the shaved truffle. Probably one of the best cacios I've had.

The filet mignon came with foie gras on top. It was cooked perfectly medium rare and tasted oh so good with the foie gras. It had me savoring every bite and wishing there was more. This came with a side of mashed potatoes. I don't even like mashed potatoes but whatever it was made with was amazing enough that I ate all of it.

For dessert, we had the cannoli with Nutella and mixed berry sauce on top. The dessert was crunchy and delicious, Nutella really making it so much better. Would recommend everyone to come try this place. The staff and owner is so personable and they make you feel at home!

Wow!  Just wow!!  Decided to check out this tiny hole in the wall (literally!  It's just 6' wide) because it looked so cute from the outside. Everything on the menu comes with truffle (yum!)  I ordered the Filet Mignon w shaved truffles on top, and OMG!! It was amazing!  My husband ordered the burger with shaved truffle and said it was the best burger he had ever had!!  And is still telling people about it!
This place is not inexpensive, but it is absolutely worth it!  We agreed that the next time we go we are going to order two extra burgers to take home for lunch the next day!  
P.S., Don't skip on the shaved truffle (which is an option).  It's 100% worth the extra $15!!!

This place should satisfy your truffle fix. They shave the truffle at table side once the food is ready and anything that doesn't come with truffle, can have it added on for $15. We ordered the lobster salad and added truffle also which I forgot to take a photo of, but it was 1 of the best salads I've had and I don't particularly like salads to begin with. It was pretty hearty with roasted pine nuts and a decent serving of lobster, the fresh shaved truffle just put it over the top. The truffle pasta with black pepper was excellent, everything I was expecting and the sauce was tasty from the fresh black pepper that I cleaned up the plate.

The burger was a bit of a surprise, I ordered this instead of an appetizer since the truffle pasta has no protein with it. The burger was cooked medium rare and can be adjusted based on your preference, plus I added truffle on it. It's paired with truffle potatoes that were well seasoned. I'd say the burger was enough to eat if that's the only thing you order, but the truffle pasta is almost like an appetizer in terms of portion size.

To finish dinner, as if there wasn't enough truffle, I didn't know I needed truffle honey in my life until I had this ice cream. It was amazing with the dried figs. Definitely going back to try a couple other menu items!

Definitely make a reservation for this spot as it's a small space with tight seating (about 5 tables only)! The food is amazing, and you can opt to add truffle on every single dish. We ordered 4 items: the Octopus Salad, Burrata Al Miele, Tagliolino Cacio e Pepe, and Filet Mignon Rossini. Highly recommend the first 3. The octopus in the Octopus Salad is super soft and tender and you can tell the chef spent some heart massaging it. The Burrata Al Miele is the perfect combo of sweet and savory from the mix of honey and truffle. It comes with bread on the side for the burrata. The pasta in the Tagliolino Cacio e Pepe was perfectly al dente, and the sauce was super really creamy and nicely peppered. I got a really fatty piece (almost all fat) for the Filet Mignon, which I didn't particularly enjoy, but the flavors of the dish and potato puree it was paired with were nice.
Love truffles, food was really good! They give you a marker to sign the wall - funny touch! The owner was super sweet and stopped to chat with us for a bit. Definitely recommend!

Walking in, the space felt cozy, quaint, and intimate yet not cramped when completely filled. Service staff were extremely friendly and welcoming to all patrons. We ordered the 3 appetizers - burrata, tuna tartare, and scallops - and the lobster ravioli to share between two people. The fresh truffle shavings were extremely generous and not overpowering for the burrata and ravioli. While not covered in truffle, the scallops and tartare were accompanied by a small dose of caviar. We finished off with dessert - tiramisu and espresso martini. The martini had truffle shavings in which added an interesting and unexpected depth of flavor. While the space was quiet when we arrived for our early dinner on a Wednesday night, all tables and chairs were filled as we were leaving

Hands down one of my fave Italian spots in NYC.

First off, the service was incredible. Rudy and his wife made us feel at home. We came here for my niece's 21st birthday because she loves truffle, and the food, familial vibe, and ambiance did not disappoint.

I made a reservation ahead of time which I'd recommend since there are only 5-6 tables and the restaurant is very small and intimate. We were a party of 4 and sat closest to the kitchen.

I believe we had the steak tartare as a starter. I LOVED the bread that came with it. It wasn't a skimpy amount of meat being offered, either.

We then ordered the gnocchi and 3 cacio e pepe dishes which already had truffle included (there's a menu that includes truffle for all items). Some of the best gnocchi and pasta I've had (and trust me, I am very picky about both dishes). They really took homemade to a whole new level.

My niece chose the cannoli as her birthday dessert and it was the best cannoli I've had. The Nutella inside was spot on but it was the flakiness of the pastry dough that did it for me. It wasn't all stale like a lot of other "cannolis" I've had before.

We hit it off with Rudy, the owner, really well and could tell how much this business meant to him and his wife. So happy we found this gem! It's not a tourist trap and I'm happy as a former NY resident to have found this place for my family to dine at.

Btw it is NOT cheap and you're paying for quality! So definitely treat yourself and your party when coming here.

Worlds narrowest restaurant! Pretty basic menu-offering pasta, risotto or tar tars with truffles on it. The restaurant smells strong like truffle! I had the basic pasta with fondue sauce and black truffles. I didn't splurge for the white truffles since I'm cheap and the small plate of pasta with black truffle was already overpriced ($44). It was good al dente pasta, but honestly not the best. The black truffle wasn't as sharp of a flavor as I hoped and my husband added salt to the pasta which was needed. I would have added a lot of crushed black pepper, I think that would have made it so good but I split the dish and my husband doesn't like a lot of black pepper and I like him so I do what he wants! It went well with a dark red wine that the server recommended. Overall, not worth the price at all, I've had much better pastas. Service was good.

This is a MUST visit. The husband and wife that run the restaurant are so nice and the food is absolutely incredible. The burrata is a must and the pastas are all incredible. It's a cute spot and the service is awesome.

Wow. Every dish was better than the other one. And they were all out of this world pricey, but well worth it. the buratta w truffles was the starter. One word. Amazing. the tagliano w truffles was next. One word. Amazing. the Oak burger w yes, you guessed it,  truffles was the close out. Also, very good. We have the Nebbiolo wine which was very good and prices at $65. Definitely worth a repeat.

Atmosphere - a really tight, dimly lit restaurant that only seats a couple of parties at a time. I would not recommend for those who may be claustrophobic or would prefer to be six feet apart from their neighbor, as the windowless restaurant is barely wider than my apartment foyer. Other than that, a really intimate place for date night.

We showed up a bit early but wasn't able to be seated till about 10-15min after our reservation time due to our previous party showing up late. There's not really anywhere to wait except outside, so not ideal if the weather is shitty (it was only a slight drizzle when we went).

The menu is pretty small. All items include truffles or could have truffles added. The options are black truffle for an additional $15 or white truffle for $140. We did not try any items with the white truffle.

We got the calamari and filet mignon tartare to start. The filet mignon was well seasoned, great flavor with the arugula and the side of bread (it says $3 on the menu but I don't think they typically charge for it). The calamari (off the special menu) was a bit too salty IMO.

The tagliolino was fantastic. The pasta is incredibly fresh, maybe some of the best in NY. The sauce for the gnocchi was a bit of a miss for us - would not recommend. The truffle is very subtle, not as potent as some of the other restaurants in the city we've been to, but maybe that's because we got the cheaper of the two truffles.

We finished off the meal with the cannoli, which the owner also provided free of charge. Fantastic cannoli, great pastry shell, chocolate filling will have you coming back for more, more incredible due to the fact that it was free.

Overall, romantic spot, hit or miss on the appetizers, pasta incredibly fresh and delicious, free amazing cannoli. Service is super attentive and the owner constantly checked on us.

The night left us with a $270 bill (including tip), not bad for a Greenwich Village restaurant.

Rudy and Svetlanna are incredible! The customer service and food both equal 10/10. Amazing experience. Will definitely come back! My boyfriend was a little unsure of truffle and now he is so on board! Especially after the truffle espresso martini. If you're visiting nyc, this place is 100% worth it!

Amazing! The food is soooo good and the best part is how generous they are with the truffle shavings. It's a very small intimate place only 6-8 tables, no bar.. but that's why all the focus is on the food and they definitely hit the nail on the head. Service is wonderful as well!

Delicious! If you love truffle please go! My bestie and I went and had such a great time. The food is amazing, service is really good. It's a small spot so not great for big parties. I'll definitely return.

This place is so unique and a great intimate spot in NYC. There are only about 7 tables but that's what makes the experience that much better. The restaurant itself has an amazing ambiance and feels homey. The owners really make the experience so much better as they engage with customers. They even brought out a huge plate of truffles to show us.

As for the food, there was not a single thing that we tried and weren't WOW'd by. We got the Burrata and Prosciutto with added black truffle, Cacio e Pepe with truffle, Lamb Ragu, Filet Mignon, and for the dessert the mmmmm so good. I highly recommend all those options. For drinks, we got the VIP Spritz and the Espresso Martini which is topped with truffle - honestly a surprisingly, great combination. They are not stingy with the truffles at all - we were pleasantly surprised with the amount of truffle given for each plate.

If you love truffles and an intimate ambiance, you absolutely need to come here!! Can't wait to come back!

Wonderful philosophy!

What a welcoming atmosphere!  Rudy and Svetlana served up one of the most delicious suppers I have *ever* enjoyed (lobster salad and filet) and made me feel as if I were at home in their kitchen.  I wish I were in NYC more often.  Grazie mille!

What a culinary delight!!!! Everything truffle! And when I say truffle.. they literally shave and shave and shave that black beautiful gem into all your dishes...  we had the salmon tartare, kale salad and the roasted potatoes...
please save room for the truffle oil chocolate cannolis.... perfection!!

Amazing little place with big energy! Family owned, personal service and amazing attention to detail. Rudy the owner and his wife are lovely. Everything we ordered was exquisite. It felt like we were guests in their home in Rome. We'll be regulars from here on!

This place is a dream come true for truffle lovers!! I live in San Francisco and will for sure add it on my list of places that I must go back next time I visit NYC.
We had a burrata with truffle and arugula, the truffle potatoes, and 2 pastas, one with truffle and the other one a gnocchi with fresh tomatoes. Everything was fantastic, fresh, and really delicious! They're very generous with the truffle serving, in most places they give you 3 small pieces of shaved truffles and at Oak Tuscan they really make sure you get a good amount.

The ambiance is really nice as well, black brick wall with cute quotes , only about 8 tables, with low light and pleasant music! You can still talk and enjoy dinner without being too loud.

Service is amazing, everyone was very nice!!

Can't wait to be back!!

We came here with our friends for a Friday night dinner. The food was amazing and so were the drinks. We all shared the prosciutto and burrata, arugula salad, and filet mignon tartar. For the mains we had cacio e pepe and their specialty burger. Everything was amazing and I loved how truffles were incorporated into each dish (even the espresso martinis!)

The place is fairly small, but beautifully decorated and super cozy. The walls are black and covered with signatures of all previous customers, which was a nice touch. The service was top notch and of course, Rudy and Svetlana were amazing hosts.

I would recommend this place to anyone and we'll definitely be back again!

This is by far the best place to have truffle. The food is just amazing. The owner is super cool. Love the location and the small intimate feel of this restaurant. Always a pleasure coming here!! Thank you

My husband and I were strolling through Greenwich village and stumbled upon this restaurant! We were intrigued by the size of this place and the decor! This restaurant is narrow and probably seats 10-15 people and is owned by a husband and wife, who are so friendly. Right when the doors open all you smell is truffle (not complaining at all!). This restaurant is very intimate and you feel like you're in Italy.

I started off with the "VIP spritz" which is an aperol spritz. Very tasty and not overly sweet! We ordered the caprese with truffle balsamic. It was burrata and tomatoes drizzled with balsamic and topped with basil. I highly recommend you get the bread basket to eat with this! The bread had a crispy crust with a soft center drizzled with truffle oil. The menu is filled with vegetarian options! I didn't know what to order because I wanted so many things. I ended up getting one of their signature truffle dishes - taglionili cacio and pepe with black truffle. If you're dining here, you HAVE to get the extra truffle on top. For the non-signature dishes you have to pay and additional $10 for truffle. It's definitely worth it though. My dish was so delicious. I think that's the fastest I've ever eaten a pasta dish. They also bring out bread with your dish so I used the bread to dip in the rest of the sauce from my entree. We didn't get dessert but we really wanted to. We were just too full.

The service was amazing here. You're really treated like family. The owners are so sweet and welcoming. I can't wait to go back!

Over priced with small portions that I left hungry. $52 for a pasta dish is fine if very delicious (it wasn't) and good portion (it wasn't). They charge for bread ($4 for bread - would think it's standard at an Italian restaurant esp with $50 pasta). Finally, when you pay for the check and they show you the square machine, the tip amounts are "after tax". So I'm paying 18% or 20% AFTER tax which is a scam. Don't go here thinking you'll have high quality Italian food. You won't

Like the name suggests, this cute little restaurant in West Village is all about Truffles!! (The mushroom, not the chocolate). I like the idea for a themed restaurant, and they do a good job incorporating truffle oil into all the dishes with an optional truffle shaving on top (black truffle was ~$9/plate, white truffle was more).

During covid, they have a few tables outside their restaurant on the street. On a weekend I'd recommend a reservation as all the tables filled up. Service was pretty good throughout the meal and I believe it was the owner himself who took some of our orders. It was a little harder to get the waiters attention later during the meal though as it got busier.

For the meal, we went straight for the pastas and tried the tagliolino cacio e pepe with extra truffle and the lobster ravioli, a special of the day. Both pastas were quite good! The tagliolino was quite buttery and creamy and had a clear truffle taste without being overwhelming. The lobster ravioli didn't have much truffle at all, but was very enjoyable as a seafood pasta. Finally, for dessert we tried the chocolate cannolis. These were perhaps the strongest truffle flavor of the night which was surprising and unique.  

Overall, if you're looking for a decadent truffle-rich meal, this is an interesting dining experience that's worth a stop. Would recommend!

SUMMER 2020 REVIEW:

If you're looking to indulge in your love of truffle, Oak Tuscan is the spot you want to go. Here are a couple things to know:

1. There is outdoor seating but is limited to smaller parties. I would call ahead if you have a large party.
2. Portions are small for the price point. But the ingredients are quality.
3. The cacio e Pepe is more of a mushroom truffle cream sauce... and comes with fresher noodles.
4. The menu has an option to add truffle to EVERYTHING. Definitely go for it if that's you're thing.

It's a good spot in the West Village to fulfill a specific craving.
Hands down the best Italian in NYC. I love truffles and this was an amazing experience. Delicious food and great service. Yum! Highly recommend.

Ah I feel guilty a little bit for not giving this place more stars as I really liked the staff and ambiance but I also want to be honest.

I'm really into the ambiance. It's just beautiful with a chandelier, brick walls painted over with black paint with little sayings like "I will always love you" written in unique spots. It has charming touches like intricate light fixtures on each table. It's a narrow restaurant, which gives it an intimate effect.

We started off with the bruschette. I enjoyed it. It was $14 for 2 pieces and each had a different sauce (one tartufa and the other sundried tomatoes).

My friend had the Tagliolino Cacio & Pepe ($27). I thought the sauce was creamy and quite good, but I was also not in love with it for some reason.

I had the filet mignon with the potatoes and I was not really into it... maybe I was not feeling the wine reduction. I'm not sure. I've just had better steaks in the city.

I feel like I was not really tasting the truffle in the way that I expected it. I tasted it the most in the complimentary bread.

In terms of service, they are very sweet and kind so I feel bad but it's possible they just need more support like maybe another bus boy or a separate host etc. I felt like the host was also the waitress for the entire restaurant.

We were seated at 7:40 pm and we received bruschette 30 minutes later. Then my friend got her entree 50 minutes after we were seated. She was really hungry and had finished her entree by the time I got my entree, which was at 8:40 pm. I think it's okay though but it's something to just sort of keep in mind that it takes some time to prepare.

Little things like receiving the complimentary bread-- we didn't receive it so we had to ask for it. Or just like our water being refilled- we didn't receive it so we would have to like try to wave out and let someone know etc.

The owner or chef did check in at one point like 55 minutes into our meal and he said like "everything good?" And we were like "yeah!" Because he seemed to be in a rush and also we were being polite but I actually didn't have my entree yet even though my friend had almost finished hers! I appreciated the owner/chef checking in though!

The host/waitress was also very kind.

Another random thing is I feel like they should have more non alcoholic drink options... they did not even have regular coke, just diet- which is not a big deal but just interesting.

Impeccable, what an expierence - Highly recommend!

Rudy and his wife welcomed my roommate and I to their decadent restaurant and it was remarkable. Rudy was extremely personable telling us the story of the restaurant, how they fared through covid and even giving us the history of the truffles he sources. His love for his restaurant and customers shines through his food. We started with the burrata with honey truffle and split 2 pastas the lobster ravioli and the Tagliolino Cacio peppe with added shaved truffle. They offer every dish as described on the menu or you can add $10/dish for added shaved truffle. They make the restaurant so welcoming to all customers and create and incredibly intimate atmosphere with the dark colored walls,quotes about love, pasta, truffles and a remarkable centerpiece chandelier at the center of the restaurant. Definitely a perfect date spot for truffle lovers. Would definitely go back and have already recommended and shared through social media!

Such an amazing experience! We love truffles, so to find a restaurant dedicated to them was a dream come true.
The space is so unique and intimate, very well thought out and while this would make a great date spot, we dined with our 10yo daughter and the owners were amazing with her. We loved everything from the food to the ambiance and the amazing passion this duo has for the truffle. We will definitely return when back in NYC.

Outstanding service & food! Owner Rudy is so friendly and makes you feel so welcome. He and his wife have created a cozy & elegant Tuscan restaurant focused on the famed truffle. I went with the most popular dish... Tagliolino Cacio & Pepe with black truffle. So full of flavor! The waiter came by to shave fresh truffles onto the pasta. What a delight! This dish is filling for one person ($41) and you may not have room for dessert lol There is a wine menu and other truffle infused dishes. You can basically add truffles to anything you order for an added charge. The decor from crystal chandelier to the loving quotes written on the walls, gives an intimate and cozy feel. Great for a romantic evening date or any dinner for two. There is a restroom available and Rudy even had an iPhone charger and cellphone light to take photos! Wonderful experience!
Amazing! Must do experience while visiting New York. It's a smaller place so it's perfect for a date night. I cannot wait to go back again. 10/10

Amazing little restaurant tucked away in West Village. If you walked past it, you would miss it. But this restaurant, you don't wanna miss if you love truffle. This is a truffle lover's dream. From the appetizers, to the entrees all the way down to the dessert, it's truffle'd out! I was in heaven when I had my first bite here. The owner Rudy was also very pleasant and welcoming. Highly recommend and a must visit for me now whenever I'm in the city!

Cute small restaurant specializing in truffle in Greenwich Village

Overall: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Value: 4/5

We got the two classic pastas topped with black truffle. Both were fantastic, very flavorful and the portion was right such that it wasn't overly filling. Feel like one of the pastas got more truffle on top than the other, but I guess that's the variation in hand grating. The bread was nice and warm as well, and perfect for scooping up every last drop of decadent sauce! It's a small spot so reservations probably recommended. Service was pretty good. The prices definitely aren't that cheap but truffle is expensive which I assume is the bulk of the cost... a nice date spot overall if you're willing to spend a bit!

This place is awesome.  The owners are super friendly and hospitable.  We went for a birthday celebration and loved it.  The food is delicious if you love everything truffle.  They have options without truffle but why?

Absolutely recommend this restaurant. I got the filet mignon tartare and ravioli with cacio e Pepe sauce and added truffle shavings on top and it was amazing. It was such a cute little restaurant and I was very impressed with the service. If you love truffle, definitely come by.
First time having a truffle meal. I know get it. The service was personal and attentive but not hovering which I prefer. The atmosphere was romantic and private. Would recommend. Expensive.

I went to Oak Tuscan Truffle Restaurant and was blown away by how excellent the food was. The owners, Rudy and Svetlana, made us feel right at home. I HIGHLY recommend the risotto and cacio e pepe. You will not be disappointed!

Not sure why this place gets alot of good reviews, food was just ok and nothing to brag about! For dinner i had the rigatoni and it was bland, need just a tiny bit more seasoning in my opinion. I'm sorry to say we won't be back! Its overhyped!

Just happened upon this place. The inside was okay, there was some seating and it had a colorful ice cream shop energy.

I got the "works" size which was a good size and very very filling. It felt very fresh and tasty. I chose what was in mine but you can pick from a prefixed menu too. I loved the peanut better crunch - definitely get it if you like peanut butter.

The employees take a lot of care into preparing and putting together the bowls. The layering is beautiful.

All their "bowls" are in cups which is fun. The prices are a little higher than other places I've been to in manhattan, but it is in soho so it makes sense. Although all the toppings were included and you could get as many as you want, except for the protein powder which was $3 extra.

This isn't getting five stars because of the price and vibes. Also because it's in a cup not a bowl, it's kind of difficult to eat at first since the toppings fall out a bit. The cup style does make it easy to walk around and eat simultaneously though.

Oakberry is a smoothie and juice bar chain with locations worldwide.  One of their newest locations opened last month in the Upper West Side.  The storefront is small, non-descript looking and has no signage whatsoever.  You can easily miss it if you are walking too quickly.  Honestly, I almost gave up on visiting this location.  They have strange hours which aren't posted anywhere.  On my first two visits they were closed--I went around 6:30pm and the next day at 6pm.  Finally, on my third try at 5:30pm, I found them open.
