At Oakberry's the bowls and smoothies come in three sizes (The Classic 12oz, The Works 16oz and The Oak 24oz) and in cups (not bowls). Regular toppings are unlimited. They are also Kosher, gluten free, lactose free, and GMO free.

I got The Works Acai Bowl with Granola, Almonds, Bananas, Strawberries, and Almond Butter.  It was delicious and so refreshing! The fruit was fresh, and the acai was sweet.  It's one of the better tasting acai bowls I've had.  I especially liked that they layer the granola and almonds with the acai which made every bite perfect.  The Works at 16oz was very big and I was full afterwards.  Probably should have gotten The Classic instead.

Overall, it was very good but I must note that this was one of the more expensive acai bowl that I've ever purchased.  While it was really delicious, it was a splurge.
This was not good. Bitter and bland. Didn't want to finish it but forced myself because of the price.

Very cute little bakery with rich desserts, pastries, and coffee. The baklava cheesecake was one of the best slices of cake I've ever tried, EVER . I had to eat it in 3 sittings because of how rich it was, but that just means I was in food heaven 3 times .

follow me on IG @MiamiCheatDays for more recommendations

The service was quick and fast. The staff were very friendly. There were a lot of options on the menu for both drinks and dessert and they all sounded good. We got a peach coconut refresher and passion fruit cake. The cake was very sweet and there was very little passion fruit flavor but the texture of the cake was really good. The refresher was also very sweet but many people were ordering the coffee. Would definitely come back to try the coffee.

Would not recommend if you are trying to sit down and eat here. There is only 2 small tables with a total of 4 chairs.

What a delightful oasis in the middle of dessert desert!

They have so many different kinds of desserts and they all look glorious! I can just look at them all day and all night.

Sadly overall the desserts are too sweet for me (which might be a good thing cuz If they dial down on the sweetness of items I would be living here and never leave lol)

Banana cream pie: I don't even like/eat banana in general, but I went bananas with the banana cream pie here! I was intrigued the moment I laid my eyes on it! The mile high cream looks adorable and delectable. It was so light and fluffy and I was amazed how the banana pudding/custard mixture blends together with the whipped cream and is just as airy and creamy as the whipped cream. It's like eating banana flavored cloud!

Ekmek: This is something new that I had for the first time and it was love at first bite! The bottom layers of kataifi dough was baked until crispy & golden, bathed in lemon scented syrup, topped with creamy thick custard & whipped cream & garnished with almonds. So much different flavors and texture just come together perfectly decadent and delicious!

Raspberry mousse: The raspberry mousse layer preserves the tartness of raspberry that I love!

Black & White Mousse: very decadent but overall too sweet for me

Tiramisu cheesecake: Just when I thought tiramisu couldn't get any better, it did! This is the best of both worlds!

Boston cream cheesecake: The smooth Boston cream components well with the dense and decadent cheesecake, but overall too sweet for my liking

They have some seatings in the back

They also have huge selection of fruit cakes which are calling my name to come back for them!
Food was excellent, drinks were tasty, and the employees were extremely friendly. I found this place randomly and thought they deserved a great review. The pistachio latte was soooo good!
Great spot! They have display cases full of pastries and desserts. The cinnamon roll looked incredible.

We ordered orange cake and baklava cheesecake. They have two small tables for dine in, but that's it, you are served out of the togo box. Okay.
The desserts were good, too sweet imo, but not bad.

Been in NYC 5 days and stopped in at alot of businesses over the last few days.
Late on this July 4th evening the employees at this bakery were far and away the nicest people we have encountered in New York city. Amazing people, thanks for ending our last evening on such a high note.
P.S. the baklava cheese cake was amazing. Liked it better than Eileen's!
We ate it before I thought to snap a picture .

My two favorite desserts combined into one! Found this place out of the blue and decided to trek out to Hell's Kitchen for it. Turned out to be totally worth it. 10/10 dessert. super thick and massive portions si even one slice you can share with other people. I didn't know they were known for other desserts but open re looking into them will be making another stop to rebuy the baklava cheesecake and trying their other great menu options.

Not much seating in the small space so would plan to take these desserts to go.
High quality desserts for a fraction of the price of most Midtown bakeries. Only issue -- their proximity to the gym

I really think they are a high 4 stars.The people behind the counter were wonderful. We went after a heavy dinner in search of something sweet. We were fortunate to find Oasis.I chose the White & Black Mousse, a rich and decadent dark and white chocolate mousse. My friends also ordered some decadent, creamy desserts.  It was a great way to finish the night.

Overall, 4 stars.

We're so fortunate to have such a wide variety of desserts available until midnight every night (or beginning at 7:30am, if you're an early bird).   Lots of different genres of desserts, but the Greek items seem to be the real standout.  Though any cake is going to hit the spot, because it's cake.

Ekmek: By far the standout.  Unlike anything I've had before.  The bottom is a bunch of thin dough strands that are cooked flaky, but soaked in a honey-like sauce until everything is syrupy.  On top of that is a thick and creamy custard layer, which is truly indulgent and great with the bottom layer of dough strands.  And to make it even more indulgent, a thick whipped cream on top.  So many great textures and so delicious.

Nutella Bites: Reminds me a little of an alfajores, but with Nutella in the middle instead of dulce de leche.  The dry shortbread-like cookies make this especially nice paired with coffee.

Rainbow Cookies: Love these.  Colorful.  Great almond taste in the cake pieces and tasty raspberry spread in between.  Really appreciated how fresh it tasted, since sometimes shops keep these cookies around for a few days.

Peach Tres Leches: A tad disappointing because it was nowhere near as soaked a traditional tres leches.  Reminded me those spongy cakes with fruit layers you often find in Chinatown.  Except here the cake layer was very lightly soaked in cream, so was a little moist but not like tres leches moist.  The peaches were a good pairing to all the cream though.

Seven Layer Cake: If you're a chocolate lover, this is for you.  So many alternating layers of moist devils food cake and rich frosting.  It is a bit intense though, so I can only take a little at a time.

Orange Cake: Actually had this at The Grind recently so have a basis for comparison.  Theirs wasn't as moist as it come have been, hence was dense like a pound cake.  I prefer when it's so moist it's almost falling apart.

I am so ecstatic to have stumbled upon Oasis Cafe! Offering a wide selection of drinks from coffee to refreshers, a few savory options, and desserts; there's bound to be something for everyone.

This time, I got to try their Honey Oat milk Latte, Cold Brew, Mini Fruit Tarts, Boston Cream Cheesecake, and Tiramisu Cheesecake. Everything was super good! They offer such unique flavors of cheesecakes, you can't help but want to try them all. Next time I'll be sure to try their Baklava and Dulce De Leche cheesecakes! Until then, I'll just reminisce on the one's I had.

The nicest cashier/worker let me try one of their honey date cookies (which was wayyyyy too sweet) but their strawberry tres leches and 7 layer chocolate cake slices were awesome. Super clean displays and there are a few tables in the back for dine in but I'd say mostly an outdoors/takeout spot for coffee & dessert! Highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area.

I don't think anyone understands how excited I was when an Oasis opened up right near my office in the city! I've been going to the OG Bayside location FOREVER! We all know it's hard to find real STRONG coffee out here for a European gal, so I had to go get my fix of freddo cappuccino!
I walked in on my lunch break, the two girls behind the counter were super friendly! The place is small, but super clean & the aesthetic is so cute! I ordered my coffee & had to get a rainbow cookie (or 6). They were staring right at me & I couldn't resist (anyone who knows me knows rainbow cookies are my love language oopsie
Coffee was perfect as per usual & rainbow cookies really brought some serotonin to my day! Will be back consistently!!!

Always walked pass by this place but I decided to give it a try last week and I was pleasantly surprised at how good their cakes were! It's a small shop but they have a large selection of cakes and cookies along with coffee and other drinks. I got their baklava cheesecake and mango cake and they are both bomb! Highly recommend :)
This is the best iced hazelnut latte I've ever had! I'm not sure what's the secret but I love it!

I ordered delivery, so I'm not sure how the service/ambience of the store is. Everything was packed nicely for delivery. They have a large menu and some of the items are better than others. I liked the fruit tarts and would order them again. Some of the other items were too sweet for my taste.

True to its name, this low-key patisserie is a haven of sweet, baked treasures--and in an area that is sorely in need of a dessert spot.

The flavors are Western and familiar enough to not scare your unadventurous relatives from Kansas, while the style of offerings are just slightly different enough to be a refreshing find (e.g. mango cake). We got the Boston Cream Pie cheesecake (cue dirty jokes), which was rich, indulgent and decadent without ever feeling heavy. At about $8/slice, it's more than enough for two. Wash it all down with an iced strawberry mint tea refresher and you have the perfect pastry moment.

A couple of us ended up at Oasis Cafe after dinner nearby at a restaurant lacking dessert options. Or should I say a dessert desert and Oasis Cafe was an oasis? Sorry, couldn't resist. 

Many of the treats in the case looked fantastic. I had my eye on a seven layer chocolate cake but in the end, I opted for the Boston cream cheesecake since it sounded unique. A successful mashup of two different types of cakes. Description from their website: "Tender chocolate sponge cake is topped with a rich dreamy cheesecake followed by pastry cream and ganache for an exquisite, unforgettable dessert."

Oasis Cafe was doing brisk delivery and takeout business, I observed. Unfortunately there wasn't much seating available. My friends and I were lucky in that we snagged the two tiny tables with four chairs in the back. A thoughtful move was to serve the cake slices in to-go boxes. This worked out quite well since I couldn't finish my huge slice. The employees working were all helpful and friendly. 

Doing a little research later, I found out that Oasis Cafe has another location in Eastern Queens. I would certainly try out more of their confections if in the vicinity of either location!

Ordered delivery from here for a co-workers birthday. I ordered the strawberry shortcake, their large 20oz frappe with almond milk, and small 16oz pink dragonfruit drink.
Everything arrived on time and was packaged neatly. She LOVES her strawberry shortcake. It looks delicious! And both of my drinks were delicious. The frappe is a strong coffee and I enjoyed it.
Everything was fresh. I will order from here again. Prices are fair for the quality and area. Definitely recommend them for desserts and drinks! :)

Amazing late night dessert spot. We got a piece of carrot cake delivered to our hotel. The carrot cake was perfectly moist, spiced and not too sweet. The cream cheese frosting was copiously applied to the inside and top of the cake. We also got several random small items. Nothing dissapointed! Very good and reasonably priced NYC dessert shop.

Great service here! Seriously what keeps me coming back... but also the damn cold brew coffee. I'm from San Francisco and I'm really picky. A lot of whatever coffee I've come across living here for two years. This place though. Please never change coffee! I think it's Guatemalan beans. But so good. The baked goods are made right.  The pastries are never stale.  I go to Amy's but it's hit or miss Sullivans is good but selection is limited.  Run don't walk.  If you're visiting nyc this is underrated spot you definitely want to visit, Get the banana cream pie.

Good looking desserts. Tried the mango cake and the fruit napoleon. Liked the napoleon better than the mango. Also ordered a pistachio iced latte.

Would give this place another try if in the area and looking to stop by for a treat.

I'd passed by sometime last year when Oasis was still under construction, and I was super excited that they were opening in Hell's Kitchen! If you don't know, Oasis has multiple locations. One of them is in Flushing, Queens where I grew up. It's an institution there.

This is such an excellent addition to the neighborhood. You can never have enough dessert options. Especially one that opens late! A great place to pick up some dessert on the way home after dinner in the area. As I did recently. I'm not a big fan of cheesecake, but their cheesecake is absolutely divine (an adjective I seldom use). It's nice and light, but still decadent. We got the tiramisu and dulce de leche cheesecake. They were excellent. Another night we got baklava cheesecake and 7 layer. They were both good too. I've had chocolate cheesecake from the Queens location that was good. I don't think you can go wrong with anything really.

Service was friendly as well. Stop by and treat yoself!

I had been bingeing on all things cake, cookies, and sweets since mid-January so when I passed by Oasis Cafe recently, I was deeply saddened. Determined to stick to my healthy routine before going on vacation and doing more damage, I decided to only get a pistachio latte.

Great choice because it is the REAL deal. Not that pistachio syrup flavor crap you get at Starbucks. No people, Oasis has little pistachio bits in your coffee.

Cute small shop that opened a little over a month ago. People were going in and buying some of the delicious looking desserts. I had some regrets, but I'll be back after vacation for them all.

Note: I almost passed by this bakery if it weren't for the "now open" A-frame sign out front. There was no name on the window when I went. Maybe they have one now, but if not, be on the look-out or have the address in hand.

My friend selected Oasis Cafe for dessert on our recent dinner outing. He had heard about their baklava cheesecake and we needed to try it.

The cafe was bright and modern, felt new. The staff were pleasant and professional. The technology was good and they nicely split our purchase 50/50 for us to pay with our phones. They have a couple of tables in the back. They don't have plates but you can flatten the cake boxes and make it work. We selected the baklava cheesecake and added a slice of dulce de leche cheesecake on their recommendation.

The baklava cheesecake was fantastic! We both enjoy baklava and we found the cheesecake to be an excellent addition. Perfect sweetness from the baklava with a creamy filling. The dulce de leche cheesecake was also a hit, a more conventional slice of cheesecake but delicious all the same.

The dessert case is sizable and we could go back 15-20 times, try something different each time, and never be disappointed.

Almost forgot to mention, the hibiscus tea was a perfect counterpoint to all of that decadent creamy sugar.
Omg the best desserts and coffee drinks in NY.  Service here is amazing the people are great!  Have to come try there desserts

Sent the husband in to pick out dessert and he was overwhelmed. He grabbed three small pastries -- a cream puff, a mini cannoli, and a fruit tart -- none are particularly my jam. But he loved them all and wasn't sad he didn't have to share :/

I'm so glad we've gotten a branch in Hell's Kitchen, I've had oasis cafe "saved" for so long but never made it out to their other location. Super affordable and they've great seasonal specials, the classics, and fun Greek twists on all the classics! It's honestly so hard to not want to walk away with half the store

Very very very strong! Curious if the owners are Greek as when I ate the cakes and drank the cold brew it just gave me the strongest feeling as the quality here for a lot of items are so high. I got a cold brew, spinach pastry, and a carrot cake slice. Everything was super moist. Most surprised about the cold brew because I was expecting something super basic when actually the cold brew held it's own. I will come back for an occasional treat as it is not an everyday thing for me. Curious if they do whole cakes as I would love to order a full cake for a friend's bday. Their app currently only works for the Flushing location at the moment. I tried to pre-order but got error messages.

Got the raspberry mousse cake and mango cream cake. Both were great. The raspberry mousse was everything though - a layer of tart raspberry puree on top of raspberry mouse, which was on top of chocolate mousse and a thin layer of sponge cake. Highly recommend.

I really enjoyed my oat milk cappuccino from Oasis Cafe! The large size was at a good price- it was $4+ (less than $5) for a large size with oat milk. I was happy with the taste of the coffee- smooth espresso & good ratio of milk:coffee! I actually enjoyed the cappuccino here more than a lot of the "artisan fancy" coffee places in the area. Service was quick and efficient.
I did not try any of the baked goods- did not see too many vegan options. I think I saw 1 or 2 cookies labeled vegan but I did not ask as I was in a hurry! But would love to go back to see if there are more vegan pastries.

Menu wise- they have a range of your typical espresso drinks like lattes, cortado, americano and also brewed coffee. They have a big case of pastries and if you have no dietary restrictions you should have lots to choose from! Can't speak to the quality of any of them.

Overall, this is a nice addition to the area. I never say no to more coffee/ cafes! I would return for coffee there as I want to try their pistachio latte which I hope can be made dairy-free.

I've visited this cafe/bakery close to a year ago when they just opened this location on 9th Ave . I ordered pickup today . Upon arrival it was very calm, quiet and not to many people inside, just as I remembered it to be before. You get a very zen feel walking in. Customer service was a bit dry, not to friendly and that is why I rated them 4 stars. No greeting upon arrival just stares lol. Any who I ordered a strawberry cheesecake slice , a Nutella cheesecake slice and a Oreo mouse slice. They also sell pies, cake slices and other sweet treats and drinks .  The slices were $6.95 and I had a coupon for a free slice, so I only paid for 2 out of the 3 slices (great deal btw). My mom and husband said they enjoyed their slices a lot. I also enjoyed my Nutella slice. It was very moist and flavorful. I would definitely visit again as this establishment is on the top of my list for best cheesecakes in NYC they just need to work on the customer service aspect of it all and they would be good to go.

Love this coffee shop! Also and incredible bakery!!
Go here for all your beautiful (and delicious) pastry needs. They are so gorgeous and also extremely delicious.
Coffee is also top notch!! Can't wait to return!
Also- the staff working was amazingly kind and friendly/ would go back just for their cheery attitudes
A++++
The baklava was phenomenal. Notes of pistachio and chocolate really complement the honey coated flaky treat. We also loved the peach tres leches to share. Will be back as often as I visit ny!

Cute neighborhood dessert place. Perfect if you're looking for late night sweets and don't want to get it from a deli or Whole Foods. I live in Hells Kitchen and my options are Amy's Bread, random deli, Juniors Cheesecake, and Mia's, and Oasis Cafe beats all in terms of taste, variety, and business hours.

I had their Nutella cake, mango cake, and tiramisu cheesecake and they're all so delicious. The cafe has a couple tables there, but I see this more as a take out place. Hope this is here to stay!

Oat milk latte and coconut refreshers.  Happy people behind the counter so kind and welcoming beautiful smiles.   Pastries are beautiful.  I had the tragona. Really really good.  Not over sweet. Perfect.  The coconut baklava was really good too made fresh.  The coffee and refresher were really good.  

Thank you Oasis.  Wonderful Time!

Before I get started on my new found addiction to Pistachio oatmilk lattes... and the incredible pastries... the customer service is fantastic!
Sally in the morning is the bomb.com!
James and Demari are super helpful, always packaging my giant indulgent orders to go ohhh so carefully!
FAVES: trigona, almond cookies, rainbow cookies!!(better than any Italian bakery... swear!),

I live in the area and used to frequent Juniors for my cheesecake fix, but I recently tried the dulce de leche cheesecake from Oasis and this is definitely going to be my new go-to spot! It was super rich and creamy but not too sweet. The workers were also really friendly.

I can't wait to try all their other desserts!

One year later and I continue to visit this Cafe because it continues to be great, the staff is always so friendly and attentive. The desserts taste great, the coffee and the teas, also they're one of the only (if not the only) cafes that I've noticed that stays open til late compared to the cafes near by.

Delicious cake!
One of the best bakery to stop by after 10pm. You won't regret!!! Give them a try!
Great sweets at an affordable price point! Raspberry mousse is a classic. A lot of fun coffees and teas, too. And there're matcha lattes!
Oasis Cafe is refreshingly different. Love that they offer a variety of cakes, pastries, and treats. Tried a variety and they're mostly delicious. The coffees and drinks menu is also fun.

Delicious cakes and bakery! Really enjoyed their desserts!
Berry Napoleon Whole Cake will be the winner tho
This place is dangerously delicious. All of it. EVERYTHING. (Note the photo is a custom item, I ordered the Tiramisu cake without the cream cheese and decorated it)

As some of the reviews have mentioned, the staff at Oasis Cafe were super friendly and professional. I took a long time deciding what pastries to get and they were extremely patient. I ended up choosing the mango cake, which was a tad too sweet for me, and the strawberry tres leches which was delicious! I cannot wait to return and try more of their desserts.

I stopped in here for a quick sweet treat and was very pleased! I got the baklava cheesecake and it was amazing, so rich. My husband got a crème brûlée and a decaf americano and enjoyed both. The staff was very friendly. Highly recommend!

This place just opened near me and I happened to check it out while walking through the neighborhood. The desserts here look beautiful and are very affordable. I got the Fruit Napoleon and Fruit tart and both were delicious and large. I haven't tried the drinks here yet, but I will definitely come back and get a coffee or tea sometime!
Stopped in after the opera. Perfect spot to grab a latte for the ride home. The dessert case was packed with gorgeous goodies. Grabbed a Nutella cookie. It was buttery and chocolatey.
Brand new cafe in the neighborhood. Coffee and deserts were great. But service was even better. There open until midnight so def stop by when your craving a late night desert.

A convenience store and deli. It has a full menu of typical Middle Eastern. Oasis Deli And Grill is an unexpected find. Has good prices that are so cheap. There's not many places you can get food cheaper than you can here.

I got the falafel sandwich for lunch. It's $5 and comes with lots of falafel pieces. The falafel is kind of crumbly but it's still good tasting. Much better than places where it's not fresh. The have choices of sauce. Hot sauce is really good on it. The falafel absorb it and gives the sandwich quite a spice.

Hard to believe a convenience store has food this good and fresh. It can be hard to find it. This is past the big stairs on 187th Street.

Ordered from them this morning
delivery guy called that order was available
went to lobby
no order
no delivery person
called OASIS only repsonse I got was that it was not their problem....no attempt to figure out what happened...
rude, unhelpful, don't need the aggravation
will go elsewhere

The food is excellent and totally worth the money. The takeout for the two times I've ordered has been uneven. The first time I ordered through delivery.com and the order was correct, food was hot, with the sauce served on the side as requested, and ready to go quickly. The second time I called in and instead of getting the chicken and lamb I asked for I only got chicken with the sauce already on top, food was cold. Still delicious and fresh, however. I think the person who took the order probably misheard me and prepared it so quickly it had time to cool off, the cold sauce added on top probably didn't help. Didn't stop me from scarfing down. I would totally order again just be aware that calling in might be a little haphazard. Also, these guys are very nice and the place is usually packed with people ordering lunch. Support your local business!

Waited for an hour and twenty minutes for an order of grilled cheese from three blocks away and still didn't arrive. Restaurant are blaming the delivery guy for not showing up while I see on the map in the app that he is in the restaurant and waiting for the order, just like Grubhub told me...  so super late and liars..? No thanks!

Oasis Deli and Grill is a fantastic spot. It's a great atmosphere here. Every single thing that we have purchased was very fresh and delicious. Service was fabulous and everybody working here was incredibly nice and hospitable. You will not be disappointed!

I would be careful about ordering food from here. Use to be such a good place. The arrogant, rude person  cooking the food does not wear a face mask and uses the same towel he wipes the sweat from his face to wipe the counter he prepares your food on. Disgusting, during a pandemic that is spread by your breath and body fluids.

I ordered from them a couple time. For me I don't like this place that much I mean my salad doesn't look good like I thought  for $10 sald but my boyfriend love their tuna salad that he can eat 3 time in this week. Let say this is one of a good spot to go during this hard time and delivery is always on time.

I love having this place around the corner! I mostly stick to their halal offerings: the falafel and lamb, to be specific. Not only are these sandwiches a killer deal, they're also delicious! Plus, they have seasoned curly fries for when I'm feeling extra indulgent. The lamb is maybe a little over salted, but I'll take that over bland any day.  My only wishes were that they had some pickled veggies to throw in my pita, and green hot sauce (zhug) in addition to the regular red stuff that all the halal places in the city seem to have. They also have all your snacking needs covered, along with deli sandwiches, but really, come here for the lamb and falafel.
Always delicious and quick delivery! I highly recommend this place. They have great bagels and falafel
Awesome burgers and fries, awesome falafel.  From an Israeli neighbor, "well, they're from Yemen! What do you expect"? Open really late.  Good folks, too.
HORRIBLE experience! These guys are unprofessional and rude, to top it off, crap food which is guaranteed to get you hospitalized. Can't wait for this fly by night nuisance to file chapter 11.

This new deli is very updated, their food menus has a lot of delicious choices to pick from and the prices are reasonable, the cook is awesome  and the service is fast here. I had the vegetable omelette and it tasted pretty good, as well for their coffee.

I live right next to this place and I go all the time it's a tiny deli all the staff is super nice the food is cheap and it's not the best but for what it is it's great, but they have the best damn gyro in the world! I highly recommend.

Great addition to the "hood"!!! Excellent food!! I was in the food business for my whole life in New York City and I don't think I've ever seen a cleaner place than this. I've been in hospitals that were less clean and tidy as this place. All the staff guys are friendly. Great burgers, falafel, Philly Cheese Steak and YES, you can get a hand dipped cup of mint chocolate chip ice cream. It's GREAT to have place open late for an emergency midnight trip for ice cream, slim Jims, and rolling paper. Oh....and the music is wayyyy cool.

What distinguishes this deli and grill from some others nearby are FLAVOR and FRIENDLINESS. Where else can you get a spicy chicken sandwich that is just bursting with flavor and spiciness? Or their tasty lamb over rice with mixed green salad and hot sauce? The gentleman who is most frequently preparing the orders is just amazing. He is a perfectionist who never gets an order wrong and can smile at a customer's small child and offer her something to munch on even as he prepares several orders. And they have an amazing variety of snacks other than potato chips. Watch the kids who come in every day. They love the place! Three cheers for Oasis Deli and Grill!

I write this review for a bacon/egg/cheese breakfast sandwich and coffee I purchased there last week.
The sandwich was perfect with PLENTY of bacon on the ubiquitous NYC BS roll.  
Coffee was strong and smooth and the combo was $5, which is a deal!
The only trouble is, I am not sure this deli is still called "Oasis Gourmet Deli" anymore.  
It seems as though the name has changed, but am not sure what the new name is!
Sorry!

I think this is the best bodega in the area. Great deli sandwiches at a pretty good price for this part of Harlem. They also have a pretty decent selection of random cleaning supplies and other household items for being a little store. The big downside is that it's not open 24 hours.

Came here on a weeknight after a run to grab a smoothie and the staff was super friendly, they gave us small samples of some of their signature smoothies. Some of the smoothie names are super cute like MTA, UPS, NYPD... All of them were so good and it was so hard to decide which to get. I might be biased because I'm always craving a smoothie but they've really perfected their ratios and smoothies here. Would definitely come here again for a quick smoothie to satisfy the cravings and cool down on a hot day!

5 Stars.  Period. Great food. Great service. Great staff. The owner Abdi worked non stop to cater to his crowd that was lined up to the door and he did it with a smile and greeting for everyone. He constantly gives out samples instead of throwing the overages down the drain like Smoothie King and Tropical Smoothie Cafe does. My favorite was the oatmeal and the Coffee Cocoa almond milk smoothie. I'm a skinny girl but I had to try the açaí bowl  that was laden with bananas, apples, fruits, nuts  and berries as well. So good I found room in my belly for it. The ginger turmeric shot hit the hot spot and I left out with a pineapple ginger juice for the road. I thought the prices were too low for such high quality products but I understand they are trying to make sure it's affordable for everyone and not about the money. I love this place. Can't wait to return.

This is my new favorite smoothie shop! The owners, Abdi and Menen, are very friendly and welcoming. Most importantly, the smoothies and juices are delicious. There is a wide selection to suit whatever mood you are in. I have tried the Cold Filter and the Blake King so far- the Blake King has chocolate almond milk, coffee, almond butter, vegan protein...need I say more?  

At the location on 124th, the juices can be steamed as well. This location does not have a steamer but other than that it is the same menu. I tried the Cold Filter as a hot beverage and it was an intense, slightly spicy flavor but it was soothing for my throat.

I look forward to trying the food menu- my sister ordered a tuna melt ($6) and it was a generous portion.

The shop itself is small but cozy- a couple wooden tables, a small bookshelf, and a keyboard on the counter.

Go grab a smoothie--you wont be disappointed. The owners seem  planet-conscious, caring, and their menu reflects it. It's pretty affordable too compared to other juiceries in the area (Support Local Shops!)  Also the owners host a multimedia space several doors down. I perchance snuck into a comedy show on vday.

There are several of these similar Juice Bar's around town. I was very excited to see one coming closer to us.

However,​ they are almost never open. Either they need to​ update their hours, or open according to the hours they have posted.

I'm not sure how they are staying in business when the space is open about half of the time that it should be, but I wish them the best.

The food, juice, ​and smoothies are great, but you can't ever rely on visiting and it being open.
Yelp/Grubhub processed my online order to go and the place was closed when I went to pickup the order. 2:50PM on a Thursday.
Unpretentious but friendly with quality tasty & healthy food - even had a keyboard  for people to play if they wanted to  ;D

Best smoothie and breakfast I've had at an affordable price.  Portions are pretty large. Aside from the food and drinks, the employees are super friendly. It's a really nice place to sit down with friends and family. The ambience is chill, positive and much like a cafe. This is my new neighborhood spot!
Super healthy! Super friendly! Super thankful you are in our community! Oasis ROCKS food, drinks, smoothies.....EVERYTHING! Thank you Oasis team

UNREAL. Real, flavorful ingredients. No BS. I got the mixed veggie soup and asked for the spicy cilantro sauce on the side. Just WOW!!!! Flavor unreal and so fresh and delicious. Also the soups aren't salty at all which I loved. Also got the mango smoothie with papaya pineapple mango and coconut milk. delicious. Will definitely be back!!!
Stopped by after an intense run and was not disappointed! Absolutely delicious smoothie. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu.
Service was excellent, fast and welcoming. They give you samples to try and that was helpful to make my decision.
Needed a last minute smoothie for my wife and found this place randomly. The service was top notch and I ended up getting one myself after tasting a free sample. Highly recommend!!!
Amazing smoothies and juices. Great service and welcoming interior. Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Ate here today for lunch with my sister after working out at Cyclebar in 68th Street. We had both ordered and shared together the works pizza. Overall, it was really good and delicious. The service there was also really good and attentive. I couldn't agree! Finally, I would definitely eat and come back again next time! :)

My go to pizza place on Uber Eats and I finally went for the first time in store on Saturday. I love getting the build your own personal pizza with a thick crust whenever I order this on Uber eats. I like how many options they have for toppings and sauces. The pizza always comes out crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They also are very GF and Vegan friendly in my opinion. Will continue ordering all my pizzas on here for the foreseeable future and highly recommend!

So, I've been here a handful of times since writing that last review, and It's so sad to say that the quality of this pizza has gotten worse. I remember when I wrote my last review, what stood out to me was the crunchiness of their unique crust. It's not much more soggy than it was before; even fresh out of the oven, I find that it doesn't hold its shape and tastes like a globular mess in my mouth.

The service has also gone down. They're slow. And by slow, I mean slow all the way around. They're definitely understaffed, but they also don't work with any sense of urgency. They're trying to take care of mobile orders, in person orders, and who knows what. I once waited in line behind one other person for 15 minutes just waiting to PLACE my order. Then there was another 15-20min before I actually GOT my order. The past few times, the cashier has also been super short with me, despite the fact that I'd been waiting for a long time to place my order, giving me one word responses and rudeness that did not mix well with my own annoyance at the fact that I'd waited so long in a one person line.

There was a time when I'd actively recommend coming here to people in the area, but now I don't think I would.
The pizza is good but I got delivery through doordash and they're missing half the orders. I called them and they're like yeah it's here u have to come pick it up. Bruh!

I like selecting my own pizza  toppings.
Waiting for hot fresh pizza is nicer than having that street pizza!
Time to sit and eat.

Excellent pizza and service is par excellence! Staff are friendly and Akim is wonderful!.
My favorite pizza in UES NYC...Muffled Trushroom!

This place used to be really good but in recent months--Every time I place an order the pizza that arrives is black. I'm attaching photos from two separate instances so you can see what I'm talking about. Almost a week apart. I keep trying because it used to be so good. The prices have gone up. The food is not cheap and the quality is unacceptable. why are they blackening the pizza crust? Is this a new thing? Is it something I did to them that I'm unaware of? I really don't understand and I really want my money back (which doesn't look like Lei since nobody answers the phone and I ordered through the app)  and I would also like to understand WHY nobody answers the phone there. They should close or, get a new pizza oven....

The pizza here is absolutely amazing. I got the personal classic cheese and needless to say it definitely hit the spot. To me personally it's probably the best pizza I've had in a while. The worker literally makes the pizza right in front of you. Based on the taste, the ingredients are definitely fresh. If you order here please say yes to the oregano, it's awesome. The service was super quick also. I waited probably no longer than 10 minutes to get my order. And how could I forget the cheesy breadsticks. Pretty similar to papa John's but the cheese is way fresher.
Very mediocre pizza - a tough city to compete in. This is NOT an authentic NY pizza experience. Try to find something truly NY since you are here.

Ive always loved oath pizza but ... where is the rest of the toppings - this is the bella and ive gotten it before and it shouldnt be like this.

Ordered takeout on a saturday at 7 pm (they close at 10) no way they ran out or at least should tell me.

AND didnt include my sauce for my breadsticks...

My favorite pizza. I miss them on Broadway. I build my own and o love the vegan options. Service is always helpful with a smile. Ambiance large enough to eat inside for small groups. The staff will come wipe down the tables once people leave. Customers are nice and helpful too.

Had the thin crust garden veggie half pizza, which is about the equivalent of a pretty large slice.  It was made to order, so everything was super fresh, and it took only about 5 minutes.  Lady who took my order was very friendly, place was clean and comfortable.  Great alternative to your typical reheated slice.  I'll be back!

I initially found this place on Uber Eats and has always been my go-to pizza place due to their vegan cheese! I'm not usually on the UES, so when I was in the neighborhood, I knew I had to finally try fresh Oath Pizza in person! The restaurant itself was modern and clean. I love the variety of options that Oath Pizza has to offer when it comes to Build Your Own. It's hard to find a pizza shop with vegan cheese, espeically without up-charging you for it. The service was speedy and the servers were nice.
Vegan and omnivore options. The crust tastes like a fried scone. Light but crunchy. Delicious! Super nice staff. I will be back.

Nothing is quite like a perfectly balanced cheesy pizza, and it almost feels too good to be true when you know it is comprised of wholesome ingredients. Oath Pizza feels like a dream come true with their chickpea crust that actually tastes delicious and has just the right amount of crisp and chewiness. We've had the Make your own personal pizza twice now and it is hands down one of the most enjoyable pizzas we have had in a really long time. Whether it is simply toppings or quirky- your really won't be disappointed. We are already excited about our next oppurtunity of ordering it again!

Oath pizza is absolutely delicious!!!! The place is nice, and the staff is incredible. Everyone was so friendly and and accommodating. There are so many options for pizza and you can even build your own. Absolutely recommend!
Pretty pretty pretty good.  Chick pea crust is a must!  Veggies on top; don't stop!  Delivery was fast. The pizza didn't last. That's my Oath to you.
The pizza here is amazing! The staff was helpful and speedy. Ordered here several time for work lunches and each time has been GREAT. So good that I've recommended to friends in the area!

EVERYONE working behind the counter was SUPER NICE, FRIENDLY and HELPFUL.   We LOVED the pizza; and their greek salad was very good as well.  I'm writing this review after visiting there for the first time, after a friend recommended it.  Me and my girlfriend will definitely be back.

- Paul -
Excellent pizza quickly with great vegan options.  Service was kind and food was excellent.
ordered for delivery.  the pizza was totally burnt when it arrived.  and I paid for fresh mozzarella and there was hardly any on it. Complete joke.

Oath's Pizza was put on my radar thanks to a Yelp event I attended unfortunately location wise it's not very convenient to me so I can't stop by often. I happen to be in the neighborhood at the place next door & of course had to  come in for a bite.
I had a buy one get one coupon thanks to my friend & another yelp event got the Walley & the Impossible pizza.
Love me some Walley, great tasting crust the basil pesto & mozzarella plus roasted garlic are a great combo! I wanted to try a different one The impossible pizza was actually very tasty the meatballs were good with the fresh basil, spinach & cherry tomatoes.
I really like the different sodas they have the Orange was great & so was is the black cherry one.
Love me a good thin crust pizza & this place definitely gives u that great combo, small location , good service & reasonable prices.

I come by oath all the time and they never disappoint. Always fresh ingredients and cheap with the hunter student discount too!

Tried the cookie pizza for the first time and it is super sweet but perfect for a sweet tooth craving with a glass of milk or something!

Came in on a busy day and it was just Akeem working by himself. He had such a positive attitude and bubbly personality despite being he only one working the line on an immensely busy day! Will definitely come back often for good pizza and good vibes!

The food is amazing, ingredients fresh, and delicious every time. I prefer the regular crust myself, it's chewy and so good!
All the employees here are courteous and respectful, haven't had an issue in 2 years coming here.
BUUUUUT
This one star is for management to pay attention - how do you think it's ethical or safe to have only one person working while shifts on their own? It's happened multiple times that I come and there's only one person taking phone orders, online orders and in person orders as well as making all the pizzas! Honestly not sure how you haven't been reported yet - that's just not right. There's no manager in the store either! It's unsafe for the worker who is on their own, and it's unethical that they're doing this amount of work. You should take better care of your employees - this is unacceptable.

Edit:

I resent the dismissiveness of Luke T in response to my review. It's like he copied and pasted it from the manual. If you actually care, you'll listen to the customer's concerns, which are about your lack of ethics in management - and not the workers performance. If you're striving for "a quest for a better world" as you preach in your video, that includes how you treat your employees. Spend more money to make sure there's at least 4-5 people working at a time - didn't your daddy paid college education teach you that happy workers = better long-term success? Is your "feel good movement" for the customer only? That's a bit backwards but shows your true colors. You know the quality of your pizza will suffer if you have only one person working the lunch rush right?

Your actions make it look like that you're like most other sheltered trust fund folks who claim sustainability, it's just a buzzword to fulfill your bottom line, which is profit. Your actions don't match your rhetoric and it's just not believable. Hopefully this will serve as a reality check for you to take accountability and change things. I can't believe you just tried to gaslight me to save face! You don't deserve my business.

I have literal picture proof that there was only one person there and it's not the first time. If you actually care about your workers you'd look into what I said instead of just trying to save face online. I'm embarrassed for you, you must do better. There was only one worker there and no manager - and somehow he did the lunch rush on his own. It's not the first time I've seen this at this location. Do better.

I started going into businesses and asking a lot of questions about their food sourcing- this place makes their own crusts in Nantucket (hope I remembered it correctly) and has GF AND V options!!! You can make your own pizza how you want, they even have kiddie sized pizzas. Absolutely delicious. The staff was so welcoming and friendly and answered all of my questions. Their produce is ethically sourced and sustainable to the best of their abilities. 1000% recommend. This is perhaps one of two places in NYC where you can build your own personal pizza. Would definitely come again!!!

First, the staff was great- they said hi to me when I walked in, were timely in getting our pizzas made, picked up our food when we finished eating, and were just genuinely nice people. For a faster food style, I wouldn't expect all of this. The pizza was good. We got the mushroom truffle and the supreme style. I really liked the supreme. The mushroom truffle wasn't my favorite. If you are looking for a no frills option for pizza, this is a good option on the UES.

I keep trying to order from this place bc the gluten free pizza is really tasty but something is wrong with their seamless. Prices are incorrect, details are wrong. I've been charged double what things cost because their seamless is seemingly set up incorrectly.

They've sent me non-gluten free crust at least twice because their seamless account says certain things are gluten free and aren't... disappointing. It's not worth the hassle to end up cooking my own food.

Staff is always really understanding but wish their management would just deal with this issue so they can stop losing money.

5 stars was easy to give for two reasons.

1. The pizza was tasty.

2. Akeem is the most friendly person I've ever met at a pizza spot! We showed up and were told the place was closing, so we said "no worries" and after Akeem said "I wish we had some extra to give you" we kept trekking up the avenue block. After getting about a block away all the sudden we hear someone yelling towards us and the voice was slowly getting louder. It was none other than Akeem with a cheese pizza in his hand. He told us a customer was waaay late on picking it up so we were welcome to have it. We gladly accepted. The amount of effort he put in to do something so kind for us will not be forgotten. I will for sure come back whenever in the UES.

Pizza was pretty good! They were just a little slow at making it and it could have been in the oven for a little longer.

The personal pizza crust is thin and crispy and the care put into the sourcing and variety of toppings is nice. Tasty and you don't eat it all and feel guilty :)  

The create your own option is solid but they had good looking pizza options on the menu too.

I wasn't hip to OATH Pizza but I decided to roll the dice when I treated my staff of 60 to lunch!  OATH came through big time!!!  I ordered a variety of 100% FEEL GOOD pizzas that included the Chickpea Crusted Pizza and the incredible Spicy Mother Clucker (my favorite)!!!  The Chickpea Crust is good but that Spicy Mother Clucker was the best - it had the right amount of heat without drowning out the other spices.  Ordering with Maria ("y Jo") was could not have been easier!  Special thanks to her and Manager Akeem!!!  All of pizzas arrived in tact and warm!  I look forward to placing more orders with "Maria y Jo'!!!
Did a build your pizza with banza chickpea crust, it was delicious.. can't wait to try again!

literally heaven on earth omg
everyone in nyc needs to go here at least once
i wish i can give it more than five stars !!!
god and the angels literally blessed us with oath pizza !!

There is a male employee not wearing his mask today while preparing my food. I kindly asked him to put it on but he said this is this their store policy so he doesn't have to. He added if I don't agree with that then I should go eat somewhere else.

While the delta COVID cases are rising in NYC now, people who get vaccinated doesn't mean 100% safe. You still have the chance of getting COVID. So wear your mask please.  Protect yourself and protect others.

The organization here needs to work on customer service. After my delivery order got canceled, I was given an unreachable phone number to contact to fix the issue. The phone number ended up telling me to send an email to their customer service for support, which to this day I have not received an answer because apparently they're sooo backlogged with that as well...

So I never got my pizza and spend some time with the credit card company to dispute a charge for pizza. So yeah...order delivery at your own risk.
Such good pizzas the service is fast and calm environment ! The works is definitely the best pizza there and I loved the pepperoni. A little pricy but worth it !
Great service. The staff is so friendly and I loved the chickpea crust. I'll definitely be back.

Shawanda , Maria, mikey and bre , the dream team of pizza making with Maria running point premier ingredients with taste and expedite service no reason for me to eat pizza anywhere else I will be a repeat customer I pledge the oath!

I've always been happy with Oath pizza. But today's visit was outstanding!  I received extra special attention from Akeem and Destiny! My pizza was brought out, as I was double parked.
I haven't visited this location all summer, but after today, I will certainly be a more frequent visitor! Thanks to Akeem!

-Andrew F.

I love path pizza. Since I've been on keto this is the only pizza that doesn't knock me out of ketosis if I order the cauliflower crust and eat half, I'm good!  

I typically order the build your own selfie and love it. It's small, thin and crisps up well.

Delivery is great and always friendly!

I was harassed by an employee at Oath Pizza. I placed an order through GrubHub but had to call the restaurant because there were no options to select a sauce on the app. The man who answered the phone (05/03/2023 around 10 pm) was cursing at me and saying very vulgar things. Someone then proceeded to call me over and over from a private number to harass me. I feel very unsettled by this situation. Please be careful going there because they seemingly employ very unstable individuals.

Order pizza here if you hate pizza, because you'll never get it delivered!

Historically I've had issues with this location in terms of delayed delivery times, etc. but I tough it out because I'm GF and love the pizza.

However, this past Friday night really crossed a line. I ordered via the Oath website around 6:00 PM for a predicted 6:43 PM delivery, allotting for an extra 30 min in typical Oath delays. 7:05, my order is still not at my doorstep and I call the restaurant, which reassures me that the order is leaving the door at the moment and en route to my grubby little hungry hands. 7:25, food still isn't there - I call the store back who INSISTS the order went out, but on the tracking system said the order is still at the store...

At this point it's 7:35 PM and I had somewhere to be at 8:00 and unfortunately didn't have time to deal with the BS of Oath since they were making me run late. Because of this horrible customer service, lying, and disorganized delivery system, I was not able to eat dinner that night since I was running to work.

BTW.... Three days later and I'm still not refunded!!!!!

One of the best pizzas we had !!!!
Amazing ! Tasty !!!
And the staff OMG KINDEST PEOPLE EVER !!!
We will visit for sure again :)...
Akim YOU ARE THE BEST

First experience review, dining in for lunchtime- damn, this thin crust is delicious. It's got a flaky quality like a pastry, it's unlike anything I've ever had. That being said, ratio is important- a delicate crust requires delicate toppings, otherwise it flops and becomes soggy, defeating the purpose of a thin crust. Go easy on the cheese!
Otherwise, the customer service is amazing- Tyshawn was attentive and super nice! He clearly cared about my experience during a busy hour.
Great pizza and the staff were very nice and accommodating! Would highly recommend trying this place out!
Amazing crust absolutely delicious. Can't believe it's gluten free. You need to try it
Great pizza place, friendly staff...and the Chocolate chunk cookie pizza it's AMAZING!

So good!
Tasty food, friendly staff and a excellent service!

Best Pizza in NYC. Vegan, gluten free and vegetarian choices. You cannot go wrong on your health.
I will definitely come back to this place.

This pizza is really good! I am not a huge fan of regular pizza, as I would definitely have to be in the mood for it, but I do enjoy a personal pie with thin crust and inventive toppings.

I was able to try a plethora of pizza, including:

Muffled Trushroom
Bella
Walley
Sausage
Luau
Classic Cheese

All were exceptional. Their crust is super thin and the flavours are explosive for such tiny pizzas. I could have definitely had two pies to myself. I think that's why I like their pizza so much; I can eat a lot of it before getting full so there's a huge opportunity to try many different flavours. They also offer gluten-free options so free is something for everyone.

José was very accommodating at this location. He was very nice and made sure we were taken care of.

Half of a personal pizza and a salad came out to about ~$30, which is a little pricey in my opinion. They also forgot to add chicken in my salad which was a bummer. But I gotta say- it was delicious! Will def be giving it another shot.
Very delicious tacos at the LIC Flea.  We got carnitas and a Korean taco.  Both were tasty and served quickly.  Two for $7 was the right price.

Inedible. I spent $20 on delivery, took two bites, and literally threw it in the trash. My only review of this is "inedible" but Yelp requires more text for a review, even though my entire review is simply "inedible."

Fantastic! And right off the 33rd Street 6 train. It's an easy stop on the way up or downtown.

I ordered the steak and chicken enchilada on Meal Pal and the guy was so sweet. I was pretty late and he didn't roll his eyes or refuse service. Threw in a diet Coke because the register wouldn't let me buy one.

I will be back.

I love salsa verde and the chicken enchilada was smothered in cheese. I liked the beef ,too, quite tender.

I will be back. Kips Bay, Murray Hill: these are pretty much shuttered. I tried to go to the Times Square location but they weren't open (at least not when I arrived).

But I'm thrilled to have discovered these well above average enchiladas. (The two enchiladas also came with a small guacamole and sour cream.)

An unfortunate visit to Oaxaca Taqueria.

I came in with high hopes seeing their Instagram buzzing with their photos of flavorful tacos and the like. My boyfriend and I ordered the barbacoa, carnitas, el pastor, brisket, and I can't remember the last as all were unmemorable. We also ordered the overpriced $13 chips with trio 4oz to go cups of guac, queso, and salsa too.

The outdoor seating looked closed and the overhead lights weren't on but we sat down anyway. The employee eventually turned them on before we started eating. She was kind.

The food took quite a long time to be delivered and all in to go containers which she hadn't asked if we were taking them to go. I thought maybe they are handcrafting each of these tacos to be really great. All of the tacos were dry. The foliage in the outdoor seating area indicated the how dry these tacos were to be. They lacked flavor. With the opening of each taco, I hoped for a better experience. I didn't get one. Drenched in salsa, we eventually made it through them all. The two stars are for the chips and the queso which weren't so bad but even still, small in size. We were hungry but a disappointing $42 meal that I could've made much better myself.

Got a chicken burrito here last night, veg burrito is $8 add meat for $4. Price wasn't bad for nyc average size for the price. The food is very fresh, the management was attentive and kind! You can def taste the freshness each ingredient. I wouldn't say this is authentic by any means but def hits the burrito craving and feels better than chipotle lol. I'll prob be back here due to convenience, over all a good spot, curious to try out other items on the menu.

PURCHASED: Barbacoa Burrito
TOTAL: $8.50

PROS:
+ Nook-like space: close and intimate. But with enough space to mingle around while listening to some Tejano music.

CONS:
- Barbacoa is tough: the meat is not tender. It taste a degree below Chipotle barbacoa on a bad day.
- Wet burrito: Nothing is worse than a hot burrito tightly wrapped with too much ingredients that had too much "liquid" content. Ever had soggy sandwich like tomatoes
- Lack of balance: The veggies were sparse (see 4th photo in the series).

IMPRESSION:
Folks were nice here. For what I paid, I should have gone to Chipotle and got a Barbacoa burrito. Unfortunately, I do not think I would consider searching up this restaurant and going to again. I may return out of convenience of location. However, not as a destination to take my friends/family for a planned evening.

I read the reviews before ordering DoorDash. Since it was mixed I went ahead and rolled the dice hoping for a 4 or 5 star meal. When the food arrived, everything was packaged really well. The tacos all looked good. They were hot and carefully prepared, in appearance. The chicken tacos and potato tacos were okay, average. The Al Pastor was awful, like barely edible. It was floating in oil. In fact, there was so much oil, it was all over the bag and other tacos. And it tasted bad.

This taco place is pretty good, but not your typical Mexican food. The Korean taco is a perfect blend of spicy and sweet and has a unique flavor. The al pastor and carnitas are pretty good. Their three taco deal for 12 comes with bean and rice and is a good deal! Love their elote with chipotle creama as well!

Ordered dinner via DoorDash. I got the Barbaoca Quesadilla and the Grande Barbacoa Burrito. Overall, the food is very filling. The quesadilla was pretty good. I felt that, although the burrito was super filing, it lacked some sort of taste or flavor. It was quite underwhelming once it was devoured.

For MealPal enchiladas last week: I once again literally started writing the review as I ate it. These dishes are a work of art everyday such that I come for 4 of 5 lunches via MealPal. Again, the best such dish I've ever had and I've had hundreds of Mexican dishes with chicken in all forms, but here, the flavors beg for lengthy descriptions. The chicken breast is so soft, pulled, and flavored with such a great combination with marinaded vegetables and pickles and Spanish cheese atop sprinkled with cilantro which altogether give us so much interesting flavor. The significant sauce already needed not the sausage accents to give it the umph. Totally lovely.

If you are vegan, vegetarian, or thinking about ordering the beyond meat burrito or taco, DONT. I took 2 bites of the burrito and almost threw up. The "meat" tasted and looked like dog kibble and had a hard texture. The burrito was also so incredibly dry, no amount of hot sauce or salsa could fix this. Absolutely disgusting and my mouth is offended.

Quesadilla with cheese was good but cold.

So disappointed.

I need tacos, and I need them right now. I especially need tacos after a 2pm Friday workout having only had oatmeal for breakfast 6 hours earlier. Battling the locker room shakes was easier knowing I would soon have tacos in my face.

Oaxaca is super convenient to my office, is quick, and tastes good. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if you are in the area and need insta-tacos, feel free to pop in.

The three taco plus rice and beans special is ~$13, on par for a midtown lunch. It's a good amount of food, though I do wish the tacos were 12% larger. When you're starving, they are a solid 4 bites. If you're eating like a normal person, I'd say you could get 6 or so from each.

The rice and beans are good, but do need a little salt. For taco fillings, I usually just go with some variation of chicken or beef, never been disappointed. I did have pork one time, and I thought it was a little fatty. Hungry for guac? They have it, and it's definitely good if you're in the mood for it.

Oh, and they have cans of Tecate, so if you're really feeling like a boss you should definitely shotgun one on your way back to the office.

Oaxaca Taqueria is a shockingly solid choice for plant-based Mexican food! It's a small, unassuming place that's easy to walk past without noticing. But the food is consistently good, and they have an impressive array of vegan options (an entire vegan section of the menu)! My go-to order is the papas y rajas burrito, with roasted potato, poblano pepper, rice, beans, and pickled onion. Hearty, satisfying, and flavorful. Their homemade salsas are also excellent. And the service is very quick: takeout orders are ready almost instantly.

Hungry for a burrito that WASN'T from Chipotle, I came across this place on Yelp. Even though this place, at the time, had 3.5 stars, I couldn't find any other solid options in the area, so I decided to check it out. It's a smallish joint with a few 2-person tables and a larger nook to seat a bigger group. It has a cozy vibe with warm lighting, accompanied by friendly staff.

I got the 10" barbacoa burrito and esquites on the side. There's a generous amount of meat in the 10" burrito--I could only finish 3/4 of it in one sitting! Everything was seasoned well, but I wish they had put more lettuce and pickled onions inside. The esquites are basically elote off the cob with their special spicy sauce. They may have been too generous though because the corn was swimming in a pool of spicy sauce. Nonetheless, everything was tasty and price was reasonable for dinner(~$15 total).

Cute little ducked off restaurant. Everything was delicious! The meat was so well seasoned and I loved the soft taco. I don't think it's a corn taco, I feel like it's made with wheat. It was great, I prefer that over the corn masa anyway. The cashier was nice and so helpful. I also recommend trying the purple hibiscus drink. The corn was good, it's a little spicy but I love some spice

Been here twice now and it was great. I've tried both the tacos and enchiladas as well as the guacamole, all were pretty good. Unfortunately I wanted to get the corn appetizer but they were out of it last time.

It is a very small place so if you get there at a busy time you might have trouble finding a seat. My complaint with this place is that everything is made on "to go" dishes and plates, so even if you are eating in, everything gets thrown out! It makes me upset to think of all the waste that could be saved just by washing reusable dishes. That being said, this place reminds me of a takeout joint in Mexico, which might be the point. I like that the kitchen is out in the open so you can see all the action going on.

The host who takes your order is very friendly and organized. He is very quick but accurate wth the orders. He even remembered my tap water about 10 minutes later without me having to remind him!

​Oaxaca Taqueria is a basement version of Chipotle. But that isn't a bad thing its a way to describe from outside looking in. This place is the bomb.com/eatingaffordable that is how I would describe it. The burrito whether big or small has more filling in it that Chipotle version of it. The seasoning is also remarkable. The food and music is very Mexican authentic I would come back.

But what is Oaxaca, is it a city, form of worship or something that is behind the meaning of the name? My wife enjoyed the tacos, and my friends loved the food. This restaurant is overall budget friendly and recommends anyone who wants good on the go Mexican cuisine to stop by.
Hidden gem alert! Found this place after a date gone bad . Three taco specials with rice and beans. As good as I ever had. Go and feast! Easy on the wallet too

You guys make the most delicious food, but somewhere along the line you started making $12.5 burritos like 5 inches long. Please start making normal size burritos again, I want more than just a snack for that price, I love coming here but honestly find it hard to justify the cost every time I get a burrito this tiny.

I wanted guacamole but:

A) it was way too hot in the restaurant (they could of opened the windows like every other spot being that it was 70°) and B) the tacos were very greasy.

We came across Oaxaca walking to the subway after a movie. I wanted some guacamole so we obviously thought that we could get some there.

I wanted to get a large order and some chips. Then I looked at the menu and also the smell was very enticing. I decided to order the 3 taco combo. It comes with beans and rice. I asked the girl if I could get a order of guacamole instead cause I do not eat the beans and rice. She told me that she couldn't do that but she would swap out a small salad. I said sure. When we left I didn't bother checking the bag because I figured I didn't have to. Well the salad wasn't there.

The pastor pork taco was hard. The pineapple was good but that and the lime were the only thing that was.

The shrimp taco was just ok. Nothing special.

The Korean taco was decent. Again nothing that would make me want to order another.

Long story short. I didn't care for the food. The lady that helped us was pleasant.

I also wanted ice for the water I bought but they didn't have any. Eh.

Interesting establishment. Food is good we ordered a taco and the Chicken Quesadilla, the drinks were alright 2 white wines and canned beer. Definitely more of a order and pick up the food or use the Doordash/Grubhub establishment. There is no space inside to sit, we were a group of 3 and the outdoor area was ok but you order inside and wait for the food and drinks. Doesn't feel like a place to dine in or out, sorry.

My first foray into the products offered by Oaxaca (I still am not 100% on how to pronounce this word) was actually at the Clinton Hill location, but this location is much closer to where I live, and is actually much cooler since it's hidden and sort of subterranean.

I've only had one item here, the burrito. I opted for the carnitas, which was really good, since it had a number of very fatty pieces which came in the thing. Part of the problem at chipotle is that all of the meat is very lean, so it does't quite have the same flavor- in this sense, I'm glad that there's another burrito chain that isn't a carbon copy of chipotle

As I've said, the burrito is the only item I've had at Oaxaca, since I felt like the tacos seemed a little overpriced, but they did look decent. I think there are some deals to be had, but you'll have to look at your individual store, since I think each oaxaca could be different. They also have a point system here where if you provide your email, you can collect points towards a $5 discount. It's not some outrageous point system where you need to visit like 200 times before you get anything, so I considered it to be worth it, and signed up

I came here awhile back with some coworkers after imbibing in a few fancypants cocktails at a speakeasy-type bar nearby. It was on the coming dime since this was a team bonding kind of outing so that was nice...but food afterwards to ease our ragey, booze-fueled munchies was on us...so we wanted cheap, but yummy.

After spotting the warm glow of this hole-in-the-wall eatery I exclaimed to my crew, "LOOK YOU GUYS!! TACOS!!! YOU GUYS WANNA DOOOO TAAAACOS?!!" - I was buzzed and this is how buzzed Steph communicates. I kid you not. Lucky for me they all nodded enthusiastically and off we marched, single file, into Oaxaca...like the hungry little ants that we were.

For having enthusiastically yelled about tacos earlier I ended up getting a chicken burrito and it cost me about $7.50. For a burrito in Murray Hill that isn't from a Taco Bell kind of spot, this is GREAT. Tacos were about $3-4 depending on their innards.  

My chicken burrito was pretty small without much girth (so many jokes here...so many jokes...) but it was also cheap so keep this in mind guys who can eat their weight in food - for me, a girl of below average vertical stature - it was just what I needed. I left full, but not too full that I felt gross and pukey. Considering that I was really hungry - this was like the Goldilocks/Baby bear of burritos - it was "just right".

My coworkers all opted for tacos and one opted for a quesadilla. They were happy with their tacos and I was happy I didn't go that route. They seemed not very filling to me and without much substance inside. I prefer my tacos to be filled with lots o' meat, cheese, cilantro and sour cream and these seemed to have more greenery than meat.

My coworker who ordered the quesadilla was jealous of my modestly-sized burrito and he ended up getting anther quesadilla and was still hungry. Guys, you might need 2 burritos here to leave content.

Beverage-wise - the hibiscus aguafresca here was okay, not too sweet which I really like. They also have sooooo many hot sauces here - really fantastic selection of all the standard and necessary Mexican hot sauces - my beloved Cholula sauce included.

Overall, I really liked this place. Good tasting food with good flavor + friendly and efficient service. I would totally come back here again if in the neighborhood!

Tasty Tacos, Good Guacamole, Easing Eating Enchiladas

I went here on cinco de mayo to get some tacos to bring home and they were quick despite the heavy amount of orders that were coming in.

The food was good for a take out spot and if I decided to stay it is BYOB! I got the 3 taco special, 3 enchilada special, chips and guacamole. The specials come with rice and beans which are very bland. I thought the enchiladas came out well with the melted cheese on top and it has a little bit of guac on the side. The tacos were good too and the chicken was my favorite. If you are in the neighborhood and looking for tacos quick this is the spot you got to go to.

In short:
- Good food
- Fast Service
- Friendly staff

This place used to be very good, but unfortunately, it isn't nearly as good as it used to be. The quality of the food, the prices, and the portions changed dramatically. I ordered a barbacoa burrito and the barbacoa looked, tasted, and smelled like dog food. Since I used to really enjoy it there, I gave it another shot but it was still very bad. The employees also mess up the prices every time I have gone there over the past year. Often times I found myself paying a few dollars more and sometimes a few dollars less for the exact same stuff I got. The portions are also a lot smaller than they once were. I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.

UPDATE: JUST NOTICED MANY OTHER REVIEWS ALSO SAYING THAT THE BARBACOA TASTES LIKE DOG FOOD.

MealPal Rating

Meal: Barbacoa Burrito

Wait Time - 5/5
Portion - 4/5
Taste - 3/5
Accuracy - 4/5
Value - 3/5

Too much rice.

Had their lunch special twice, which is a great value to get two or three tacos paired with rice and beans. This is a super filling meal, except I just couldn't find the right flavors that left my belly satisfied. The value is still there for lunch, but I just don't know if I could learn to love this place.

I've tried out the Al Pastor pork which seems to be the favorite here. There's also the Korean BBQ fusion and the shrimp. I was a little confused with the hot meats and cold veggies or vice versa with a cold shrimp pairing. I didn't love that, so it threw me off a little.

Located on a lower stoop, this restaurant offers seating at the bar as well as a few tables. There is a big lunch crowd that picks up the specials to go so you'll find yourself crammed around a group. They do whip everything up quickly and I love the fact that instead of joining everything together in one plate, they separate it when you order it to go so that the flavors don't blend into one another.

Meh. It's just average. I got the carnitas burrito small size with guacamole as an add on. I'm giving this 3 stars because the crunch of the overlap flap of the burrito is nice-they cook it longer in order to get that. They're either paying attention to detail or I just got lucky. Everything else is nothing to write home about. The pickled red onions don't really work with the other contents of the burrito- overpowers because the flavors inside are pretty lacking. Service was also friendly. Won't be back as there are plenty of other Mexican food joints in the area.

You know how people always talk about "hole in the wall" places that have the best food? This is one of those. You'd almost miss it walking by on the street, but it's some of the tastiest Mexican food I've ever had. The staff are incredibly nice + friendly too. I've ordered from here several times and have never been disappointed. My family recently placed a big order with some very specific recommendations, and Oaxaca absolutely nailed it - everything was perfect. This is my go-to! Highly, highly recommend.

The 5 stars are mostly for the taste and deliciousness of their tacos...

I ordered the "Pollo Guisado" & "Barbacoa" Tacos. Both were very yummy, but hands down the Barbacoa Tacos were soooo delicious!!

Staff was nice and helpful. Music was playing when I walked in... Only thing is they need a little back office or something, because they were handling paperwork as they took my order (I understand the place is tiny, so they don't have many options).

This location is definitely best for ToGo orders or just a quick casual bite as they only have a few small tables.

Over all enjoyable experience and will for sure be back to indulge in the Barbacoa Tacos!! YUM

Wanted to try this place badly for over the past couple of months, I finally grabbed the chance to go and it was ok. The lunch specials were reasonable and the tacos are tasty but I was disappointed that at the time we went there wasn't any cups for a glass of water. They also have the Mexican corn but the chipotle mayo on top is super spicy which made it unenjoyable for me. The tacos are good and they also have my favorite hibiscus drink but I will stick to those if I ever go back

Awesome authentic tacos plus some really good unique variations. The Korean style taco with beef and Kim chi was so well flavored. Yummy! And the chicken mole was classic all the way. Double corn tortilla perfection. Really simple place bursting with yumminess. The staff is super friendly too! Really good folks working here and making your visit a great one.

I wanted to try this local spot and had a pretty mediocre experience.

In terms of service, I was very pleased! It was my first time and the girl walked me through the menu very nicely and gave me recommendations.

I ordered the Korean taco, carnitas, and the al pastor. The carnitas was my favorite but still wasn't that great. It had too much stuff on it to the point that I couldn't taste the meat. As for the the al pastor, this was my least favorite since the pineapple overpowered the taco. Finally, the Korean was solid with a good kick.

I probably wouldn't come back but food wasn't too bad.

It's an okay burrito. I had the 12 inch tortilla with carnitas. I was craving a San Francisco style burrito and was hoping this would be close. It wasn't but it was still an alright burrito. A little on the expensive side. I never realized this was such a big chain resto until I looked it up. The guys working there really seemed to care about what they did which is refreshing to see.

Come be transported to the magical city of Oaxaca, uh Wait, I hope the food there is better..

Tacos:
1) It's great that the tortillas are slightly toasted and have texture but they're wayy too dry
2) AL PASTOR seems to be the best one with its adobo flavor but I'm not a fan of the pineapple, the acidity outshines the meat's seasonings
3) BARBACOA was tender but lacked some oomph; red pickled onions were awesome
4) Special MOLE taco was NOT enjoyable, mole sauce was pretty bad, lacked flavor and had a gritty texture

Enchiladas:
VERDE OVER MOLE - Really enjoyed the bright green verde sauce that is poured over the enchilada, nice acidity and great flavor; again mole lacked depth and flavor, very gritty

Small quaint location off E 33rd St; looks better than they taste

Recommended: Pollo Guisado, Verde sauce For enchilada, Al Pastor, Papas y Rajas
I ordered the 3 vegan tacos to be delivered, they were truly inedible. They tasted like plastic and dog food. I can't believe they would charge money for those.

Ordered delivery and it was possibly the worst food I've ever had delivered. The tacos arrived cold, the tortillas were so soggy you couldn't even pick them up. So much grease. The meat was ice cold and seemed ill-prepared. The $10 guacamole for 1/3 cup of salty, sour, mush should probably be a pass. Save yourself a stomach ache and pass.

We came in for lunch around noon and the first thing we're told is that, "they've had a slow start, so it may be about a 5-10 min wait until the food is ready." The restaurant opens at 11am, so I'm not sure if what kind of an excuse this is, but in any case, we can wait 5 mins, even if it's just tacos.

20 mins later we finally get our tacos. I ordered a Diet Coke and asked for a cup of ice with my soda and he said that they don't have ice. I don't understand how a restaurant doesn't have ice - is that even legal?
