The tacos that we ordered were tiny. I mean, they didn't even completely fill the small tortilla that they were in. It is obvious that this place is trying to cut corners with its food.

Avoid this place because their service is terrible and you're better off going to a local deli that serves tacos. They'll actually serve you in a reasonable time, not give you excuses, and give you a normal to better portion for what you order... and they have ice.

I will never come back here again and I'm upset I even came here once. My wife and I paid over $35 and we left the place still hungry and late to our next appointment.

Offering up an array of double corn tortilla tacos, I've sampled the carnitas so far. Filled with pork and garnished with onion, cilantro, and lime, they are surprisingly among the better ones I have had.

And at $3.75 a pop, their prices are pretty good, too.

Hole in the wall taco joint in Murray Hill that's under-rated and hard to spot! The prices at Oaxaca Taqueria were not absurd as other taco restaurants in Manhattan. Normal priced tacos average around $3.75, with a killer lunch special of 2 tacos (may get a surcharge if you get fish tacos) with beans and rice for a total of $8.66 (tax included). The tacos are small, authentic Mexican street tacos, so while it's a nice size for a taco deal, I could use an extra taco for satiation purposes. I ordered the barbacoa and the chorizo-- barbacoa was BY FAR the better option. The chorizo wasn't bad, per se, but it was grainy and didn't pack the same flavor of the barbacoa. Other lunch specials were offered, I believe a torta option and burrito option were given. However, I am always partial to tacos.

Therefore, I gave this place a 4 for their authentic tacos and the fact that they offer lunch deals; however it would get a 5 if I could get more in the deal (even if the price increased slightly).

Even though it's summer, it was hotter inside than out. The al pastor taco was cold and the meat was not as soft and juicy as I would have liked. The chicken quesadilla tasted like a tuna melt. I was very disappointed with the food.

The service, however, was excellent and the guy was very attentive. I just wish the food was better.

I've been searching for good tacos for a long time, and this place has 'em. A hole in the wall underground, its a little hard to find, but when you enter the door it feels like a different world. The interior is warm, and although the place is small it is very welcoming. The tacos themselves are adequately sized and priced at $4.00-$4.50 a taco depending on what you get. Or you can get the trio of any 3 for a little over $11.00. I tried the trio if their special tacos and they were each better than the last. And although I didn't get the chance to eat them fresh there, I definitely will relish the opportunity next time I go. All in all, great tacos, welcoming staff, cozy atmosphere.

Now I'm not saying I know much about authentic Mexican cuisine, that being said... I've worked in the city for twelve years, I know a good burrito. This place is a legit spot for just that. I pregamed with a delicious chorizo taco and washed the meal down with chips and salsa. I recommend. If I wasn't so stuffed I'd eat some more!

Cute and hidden-ish lower level spot. Almost missed it walking over.

Now with a full vegan menu with Beyond Meat. Munching on a perfectly seared 12" 'Pollo' burrito with smoky flavored beans and fresh crisp veggies. Never going back to the  Chipotle that's couple aves closer to the office. .

Well, ordered from here on Cinco De Mayo, so I expected a long wait.  One hour into waiting I gave them a call.  Hey, sorry, just checking to make sure you got your order?  Yup.  One hour and 45 mins into waiting, my wife calls.....
"Hi, yeah it's been almost 2 hours, is the food coming?  It's okay if you're too busy, please just let us know and we will order else where or just cook at home....but we have kids and they are hungry".
Yeah, no it's coming.  Give us 20 mins and it will be there.
2.5 hours later.   They took their phones off the hook and stopped even answering.
 I get it, you're too busy or whatever the issues are....but please, just tell people that and we won't be waiting around for food for that long!  I guess I won't be ordering from here again :\.

Pronunciation guide by your friendly non-Spanish Guy (joking:)

Oaxaca: Wa (as in what) Ha, Ka, Wa-ha-ka/Oaxaca

Already had dinner so I stopped in here for a snack. Had a personal favorite, Esquites and a Horchata to drink.

For people who don't know Esquites, think of it as Elote, (commonly worded as "Mexican Corn,") but served in a bowl instead of just being well on the cob. It's a South/Central Mexico food, such as well Oxaca. It's corn flavored with lime, some cheese, some hot sauce or chile powder, salt and mayo.

The version here had a bit more mayo and was quite spicy. Nice little treat.

Horchata, as noted by another person is a bit too watery here (even for being an agua fresca.) Needed a bit more cinnamon also.

Food overall here is a bit pricy, around a buck or so more than you'd expect, but it's quite good. I'm surprised at the super poor reviews, I mean it is Murray Hill so it can't be dirt cheap or else the place will be losing a whole lotta $ daily and would close quite soon.

Place is super small by the way, not many tables, everyone there was speaking Spanish, felt very different there.

This place is in-between a 3 and a 4 but I'll give this place a 4 for the little snacks as the other reviews are way too low for how spicy/good the Esquites is.

Yes, it's a local chain, but don't be put off. The tacos taste like some I had in Mexico. Try the barbacoa. The lunch deal is very good. I've only had tacos, but the menu offers more. Nice staff, too. New York doesn't have a lot of taquerias, and this is a good one.

Got the 3 taco deal with rice and beans.  I ordered:
* the rice and beans was just Meh, not that flavorful.
This place was just okay.
The meat was not as tender as I would have liked it.
If you're in the area and craving tacos then come here but it's not the best that I have had.

Please skip the salad it's the worst decision ordering a salad at a taco place. It feels like a rip off.  They just give you pickled onions and top it on some about to go bad wilted lettuce. Pretty bad if you ask me. Had one bite and couldn't even look at it again. It's because The dressing is also horrible so sour and too vinegar flavor. Never never order a salad from here!

I seamless-delivered the 3 taco deal

I didn't realize the deal came with a side of rice and beans, but I quickly found it  underwhelming anyway. The rice was under-cooked and the beans were bland. Litmus test of authenticity was immediately failed given that no latino could ever sell that.

Nonetheless, who cares about the rice & beans when the tacos are great. I ordered the braised beef, braised pork, and stewed chicken. Individually, they were all delicious, but as a group, you could easily sense the lack of creativity as their preparation/seasoning seemed essentially identical to one another. It seems as if the recipe for their proteins are exactly the same with only the protein itself changed among the tacos.

Overall, I was impressed. I'm looking forward to taking advantage of their byob.

4/5 means great. 5/5 means damn near perfection and Oaxaca isn't quite there.

Very disappointed. No utensils. No brownie that I ordered. I requested the corn NOT to be spicy. It was so spicy that it was inedible. The mole was not good at all. It was also so incredibly spicy that it gave me a headache. I can handle spicy but mole is never ever supposed to be this spicy. I don't even know if this should be classified as mole as it didnt have that chocolate/ nutty like texture and taste. As for the corn, I asked for it not to be spicy.....it's like they did the opposite and made it as spicy as they possibly could.

Restaurants don't seem to care anymore about the special instructions section when you place an order.  They also don't ever seem to include a few napkins and utensils.  They also never seem to double check their delivery orders before going out.  It's getting frustrating. I would NOT recommend this restaurant for those reasons alone.

I have to agree though with the poster below....the guac was very good. It was fresh and had a slight lemon /lime taste which was refreshing. The chips, quite salty, were the best thing in my order (that is saying something though). I don't think they were homemade though but they were good.

I applaud Seemless for contacting the restaurant and getting my money back for the missing item.

The price is sure right at this place, and the people seem cool. They also take part in Mealpass which is great.

Black beans only which is a minor bummer; but it's very well possible Oxacan food only uses black beans.

Burritos are hearty and the pico has a nice pop. My major problem is that both the burritos I got weren't rolled great--the ingredients weren't mixed at all. Worst of all I had pico drip on my coat because they either used too much or rolled it poorly. (Foil was still on the bottom half of the burrito when it dropped.)

Solid experience, but I'm not going to go out of my way again to check out any of these places.

loved it!  Josh helped me with the catering for my weekly staff lunch.
everything he recommend that we order was delicious! especially the KOREAN TACO & Shrimp Quesadilla.
cant wait to order from them again!
thanks JOSH!!!!

Wow! What flavor and tastings from Oaxaqueno... We ordered the Chorizo Homemade Quesadillas and Omelet Oaxaqueno Lunch.. So flavorful and delicious. We finished the two plates before we knew it. The meats were well prepared and cooked. The ingredients, peppers and onions we mixed so well and you hardly knew they were there! The Chorizo was outstanding. It bursts in your mouth and the spice does not even hit until you swallow and begin to digest what a flavor. The rice and beans were a great add on but they only complimented what was great food. Food portions are economical but the flavor makes you want to order more. A great change for us in the neighborhood. Definitely on my favorite list to go back and this time, eat inside.
Tasty fried food that's very bad for you. I've ordered from this place several times. They're almost always on time and the delivery guy is always friendly. So I like this place.

To describe the Pla Todd... the light sweetness of the tamarind sauce with a hint of heat, against a delicate filet of bass, almost required me to close my eyes to savor respectfully... The flakiness of the fish juxtaposed against the crispiness of the fry gave every bite the best of both worlds. Each visit of the pickled daikon and carrots to my tongue reset my taste buds, renewing the experience of the next bite. Don't forget the fried Thai basil leaves which practically dissolved in the mouth. Hot out of the kitchen, it made a cold night better. It was a generous portion which I had promised myself I would not finish, but sometimes I break promises. 

The restaurant was packed and alive, so our only option was to sit at the bar. The service was excellent. It was so on point; I would've thought we were the only customers. It was the perfect way to relax, unwind, and ease into the night.

OBAO had a nice intimate dim vibe. It was relatively busy but we were seated right away. I found the place on Yelp had 4 stars, checked out the menu and was set on the Lobster Pad Thai. My husband got the shrimp Pad Thai.  The difference in price was $30, $18 for the shrimp and $48 for lobsters.

I was looking forward to some succulent lobster paying the extra price but was disappointed. The lobster was severely overcooked and chewy like rubber. It was difficult to eat with all the elements of the pad Thai separated out on the plate. Had to take the green onions out of the glass and cut them myself. Looked nice but not practical. The noodles had more of a sweeter taste than expected so had to ask for chili paste to add some heat and balance the flavors. The noodles were also overcooked and gummy.  The original Pad Thai was much of the same.  Not a great experience.

Location is everything and this restaurant convenient located down street from Penn Station and good street of diverse restaurants before going to a show or event in city.

Reservation recommended especially for weekends.

Food was delish and no wonder my friend recommended this place. We ordered a lil of everything and all dishes 5/5. Pork belly so crispy not fatty greasy. The Sambal calamari crispy and cooked to perfection. Pad Thai shrimp full of flavor and best dish of all. Drinks were nice size and happy hour priced since our reservation was midday on Saturday afternoon.

Ambiance was full of people and not too loud where we could hear each other speak.

Service 3/5 very aggressive no customer service skills and charged wrong not divided evenly with party of 3.

Service Was reason short of 5 stars.

Obao was a restaurant that I checked out with some friends while I was in New York, as we wanted to try out some Thai food around the area. It wasn't too busy when we got there, so we were able to get a table for five pretty easily and were seated right away. The inside of the restaurant has a nice ambience with cool lights from the ceiling, so this seems like a pretty good place for a date night for example.

I decided to try out the Pad Thai and the Crab Fried Rice, as these usually are dishes that are solid at most Thai places. These weren't too spicy and the flavors were pretty solid, although they were a bit pricey (maybe not by NY standards though lol). The portion sizes were pretty decent at least, and while it was not too far off from other thai food I've had it was still a good meal and I enjoyed going there. I also tried their mojito for a drink, which was quite aesthetic and pretty refreshing to have.

Overall, this is a cool Thai place to check out if you're around the area and for groups of people to go to.

Came here upon recommendation from my friend & the interior was super dark with colorful Thai accents. Loved the sleek and traditional look.  We all shared the Pla Todd, Roasted Duck Noodles, and the Crab fried rice.
The pla todd was a crispy, flavorful fish and the crab fried rice had the juiciest crab meat. I wish the rice had more texture but it was still delicious. And I really enjoyed the roasted duck noodles but some of the duck pieces were a tad dry. Would still order again.
We also shared the Fresh Shrimp Summer roll as an appetizer and it came in two huge pieces.
We loved the two drinks we got: Lod Chong & Comrade party. Lod Chong had a sweet creamy (slightly strong) aftertaste and the Comrade Party had the tastiest rim and flavor. I want to come back for the drinks for sure.

After seeing this place on Tiktok, I really wanted to try. As a Vietnamese person myself, I haven't had much Vietnamese fusion, nonetheless Viet-Thai, and all I can say was that I was blown away. My boyfriend and I arrived right at the start of dinner time, so it was pretty empty. The inside of the restaurant was so beautiful and romantic--dim lighting with lots of SE Asian decor--and the staff was so kind.

We ordered a Tom Yum soup, oysters, spicy lemongrass kalbi, and the bo luc lac. Everything was phenomenal. The tom yum was so flavorful, yet light and had tons of shrimp and mushroom in it. The oysters were very fresh and although a bit bigger than I would like, still delicious. And both entrees were soso delicious. The meat was juicy, tender, and the marinade was heavenly. Would definitely recommend and come back again.

Went for Friday dinner. Lovely restaurant in Hell's Kitchen area. Very popular so reservation is highly recommended.

Great food and service. Very flavorful and big portion. Drinks are good. Bartender is very nice.

I would've loved to try their Bun Bo Hue, but they were out so I ordered the Pho Bo. Service is very attentive and they have direct wireless communication with the kitchen, so they can answer any food questions on the spot. Ambiance was very nice.

Pho Bo - 3/5, I was kind of let down by the Michelin star rating. I expected an exceptional bowl of pho but the taste was on par with many other places I've been to in California. The slices of meet were also quite leathery; I wish it was more tender.

Couldn't decide on what to eat on a Wednesday evening. Was originally thinking of a restaurant in Times Square, but the group ended up heading to Hell's Kitchen just a few blocks from where the hotel is. One of my work colleagues had made a last minute reservation for 8 of us as we were all walking out the door. She had mentioned that Happy Hour is going on right now and they could seat 8 of us right away!

Obao offers HH up until 6pm and we had just under an hour to be seated and enjoy good food and good drinks. All of us were starving and the company was just right for a few drinks!

When we all arrived, the female server had menus for all of us and quickly started taking drink orders.  Surprisingly all drinks came out at the same time, nice and refreshing that it hit the spot.

I was very impressed with presentation and how fast all of our food is delivered, almost as close to how pictures were on the menu.

Once we were done, I needed to rinse off my sticky fingers. Restrooms were on the same floor upstairs.

I'd definitely come back again, perhaps come back earlier for HH or a night cap next time. It's super convenient to the hotel which only takes less than 15 minutes by foot. I really like whatever playlist/Pandora they had it on, lots of familiar Top 40's music!
Delicious all around! Dark, intimate ambiance. Great service. The braised short rib was fall off the bone tasty.

Really good vietnamese and Thai fusion. I usually come here when it's busy but they were always able to cater big groups for mere here (6-9 people)
I reccomend their fried fish, short rib pho, short rib appetizer and massaman curry! The flavors are explosive.

I wasn't a big fan of their crab fried- it was plain for me, and their duck was ok. But I was extremely happy with this place overall

Stellar thai fare in HK worth the attention it receives.

Despite all the other Asian and
Thai options around the area, this place stands out. The prices are really cheap for the amount you get. The flavor is certainly strong but not over done in any way.

I did get a large chunk of unmixed white pepper that made all of us cough. Just remember to mix your noodles beforehand!

I absolutely loved Obao. It is a sophisticated and modern restaurant that serves Thai and Vietnamese comfort foods.s. The cocktail menu incIuded some pretty and fancy libations. The Flunk Flink was a sweet tropical drink flavored with lychee and coconut.

The Pad Thai was highly recommended by the bartender. It was delicious, so I'm glad I paid attention to him.  It was one of the best Thai dishes I'd ever had.  It had savory shrimps, a perfectly cooked poached egg, and crunchy peanuts.  It was actually more than enough for me, and I took the leftovers home with me.

Five stars. Beautiful decor and amazing food.

For starters we got the spare ribs with honey tamarind glaze and it was sticky goodness! the braised pork was suuuper tender and perfectly flavored. We also got the Vietnamese Crispy Pork Belly and it came with lettuce to make delicious wraps with! The pork belly was fried to perfection where you could hear the crispy loud crunch in every bite!! i don't remember the last time i had pork belly so crispy and ASMR-perfect.

The star of the meal was hands down the short ribs massaman curry. the meat literally fell off the bone 'cause it was unbelievably tender. the curry had a super fragrant coconuttiness that was balanced nicely with peanuts. We also got the Crab Fried Rice which was your typical fried rice with egg but the crab meat was pretty juicy. The portion size was also filling, so not bad for $25.

The One Thousand & One Night had gin, fresh blueberries and strawberry liqueur but barely tasted like alcohol so perfectly dangerous haha! The thai iced tea was decent but the tea flavor wasn't as strong as I'd like.

We of course had to end the meal with dessert so we got the taro custard 'cause of how unique it sounded! there was a small side of sweet sticky rice so it's like 2 desserts in 1! it was served under a suuuper pretty glass cover filled with roasted coconut smoke! the taro flavor grew on me and definitely reminded me of a banana cake from its consistency and flavor. However, it might be considered pricey for $13 for just 1 small slice with a patch of sticky rice.

Overall, I would highly recommend the spare ribs, pork belly and massaman curry here! I've heard a lot about the lobster pad thai so hope to try it next time!

What we ordered:
Spare Ribs w/ Honey Tamarind Glaze ($12)
Vietnamese Crispy Pork Belly ($16)
Crab Fried Rice ($25)
Short Ribs Massaman Curry (GF) ($34)
Taro Custard ($13)
One Thousand & One Night ($16)
Thai Iced Tea ($4)

I have been to OBAO (this location only) so many times and the meals are always enjoyable. I wouldn't say it's the best Thai food in NYC, but it does the job! They are a fusion of both Thai and Vietnamese, but I think they do the Thai dishes much better. Their pho is alright, but the Khao Soi is my favorite. The curry and the noodles are phenomenal. The Basil Fried Rice is another favorite of mine. The portions are also very fair. OBAO also has a wonderful happy hour where cocktails are discounted and I suggest the Bruiseberry Mojito! The  servers here are friendly and accommodating. Additionally, the ambiance is nice at night. They dim the lights and add candles to each table! This time, I got the Steak Bún and it was just okay. The noodles were too wet and thin for my liking and it could've used some more meat.

I got takeout from OBAO recently and was pleased with the food that I got. It was good but it wasn't anything that wow-Ed me. The kimchee fries were good but there wasn't that much of that kimchee topping, the pork belly was delicious and I would definitely get again, and the green curry - it had a good kick to it. We picked up from the restaurant and the ambiance at the restaurant looked great and we got our food pretty quick too which was great.

We made reservations online (requires a credit card and $10  per person charge for a no show) and when we arrived the place was just about full.
We started off with the Flunk Flink and One Thousand & One Night libations, luckily arriving just before the Happy Hour special cocktail pricing ended. We enjoyed both, although I did find both too purposely sweet.
We also ordered a carafe of name brand (vs the house) sake, which was really just a small bottle, but we each got 3.5 sake cups full. It was pretty good, but not the best I have had.
We appreciated that a carafe of water was left at the table, which is always nice.
For appetizers we decided on the steamed dumplings (4) and the Vietnamese crispy pork belly. The pork belly, topped with pickled daikon and carrot and wrapped in a lettuce leaf (you do this at the table)  tasted just like a BLT-minus the T. Crunchy goodness.
The steamed dumplings were dense but not heavy, and I liked the chili soy sauce which the dumplings were placed on.
The roasted duck noodles dish was o.k.,  but my dining partner didn't realize this was served stop a bed of lettuce, which he was not a fan of.
The presentation and the taste of the Khoa Soi Duck leg confit was outstanding; a slightly sweet, slightly spicy, rich and complex soup with wonderful flavors. The duck was moist and flavorful and the crispy noodles added an extra textural element. My only critique is that cilantro was not mentioned as an ingredient.
I am not a huge cilantro fan and like to be warned when it's in there.
Generous portion for leftovers and was so looking forward to this for lunch the next day.
Service was attentive, the bathrooms were clean. The place was somewhat cramped and the music  too loud for the space and amount of ongoing conversations. It seems there is an upstairs dining area, but we did not see it. No outdoor seating.
Good luck with parking-take the train, cab, subway or walk,but it is a vibrant, popular scene for some great food at reasonable prices.

SO GOOD!!!

My boyfriend and I were staying in Times Square and were craving Asian for dinner. We found OBAO based on location and good reviews. And we agree!!!

The cuisine is Asian fusion. We ordered a few dishes to share...

- First, the dumplings with pork and shrimp. There were five on the plate and a bit smaller than excepted. However they were packed with meat and flavor!

- Second, we split the lobster pad Thai. Also, delicious! The pad Thai was so good and I eat a lot of pad Thai lol. The lobster was a unique touch. You got the tail and the two claws. HOWEVER, they don't give you any tools to crack the claws, nor small forks to get the meat out. It became a sticky mess pretty quick. Definitely recommend asking for a side plate for the shells too. This could be an easy fix by the restaurant, but I definitely found it odd that they didn't provide the right utensils.

- Lastly, we split the Korean short ribs that just magically fell off the bone. I will say they varied in size and amount of meat so splitting them felt a bit unfair between the two of us.

- We also ordered two cocktails each. I can't remember the names, but they were yummy!

The restaurant sits right between Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. It's right in between the two neighborhoods, so if you are staying in Times Square it is the perfect location to get away from the large crowds.

I'd recommend a reservation, but might not be necessary on a week day. The seating area is quite small and intimate, so again a reservation is recommended.

While the vibes we great, it was a tad loud in there. My only complaint is the amount of dust that is just sitting in the chandeliers and other fixtures hanging over the dining tables. It was pretty unappetizing to look that.

Food is delicious, mains serves one person. Drunken noodle were pretty good. Kimchi fries were good but could use a bit more flavor. Cocktail Obao Sunray was delicious and potent. I wish they used fresh leaf to garnish though. The service was quick and friendly. Bathroom were clean and maintained. Perfect for selfie :)
It's a speakeasy restaurant that don't make you scream or feel you've gone deaf  overall pretty good experience

Came here for my birthday dinner, and damn was it the right move! Asian fusion is one of my all time favorite cuisines, and it was a hit among everyone in my party. Our server was incredibly patient with us and made great recommendations that we all enjoyed. Also the drink I got was just GIVING birthday! A great place to have some good food and just vibe

I've been to innumerable Vietnamese restaurants both in the states and in Vietnam, and this one is slightly below average.

But the real negative for me was that i ordered a Bun dish.  I asked the server if this came with spring rolls.  She said you needed to add them on as a side fir a few extra dollars.  "Fine," I said, "add that to my order."  At which point she announced to me that they were out of spring rolls.  oooook.  No spring rolls at a Vietnamese restaurant is kind of a big problem, especially at 12:30pm when it's not like you sold out.  Noticing that spring rolls and summer rolls were the exact same price on the menu, I asked if, given the circumstances, I could have a side of summer rolls for the add-on price.  No.  I could not.  I could have asked for a manager, I supposed, but I was trying to enjoy a Sunday brunch and so I rolled my eyes and moved on.

Would not return.

Oysters 6.12/10- incredibly fresh but kind of average tbh way too fishy imo. Really highly rated on Yelp tho. Great presentation, also really good happy hour deal

Flunk Flink 10/10- lychee infused sake, coconut rum, syrup and lime juice. This cocktail was so good- it was very refreshing and although had a strong taste it was great. Had some floral notes to it and the flavor of the lychee was very fresh and not artificial which was great

Pretty vibey restaurant in Hells Kitchen, fusion cuisine of Thai and Vietnamese. They have great happy hour deals and the restaurant gets pretty busy. Service wasn't good, took around 45 minutes to get our oysters and the cocktail and we also had to remind them we placed an order

The food was good and service was fantastic. They were able to accommodate our large group even though we were late for our reservation.

I got the chicken green curry, which had a nice kick to it but wasn't overly spicy. I wish the rice was a bit fluffier, it seemed like they put too much water, but otherwise ok. My friend got pho which had a surprisingly small amount of soup, but she said it was still good.

One disappointing thing is that the A/C is controlled by the building and they blast that thing on High... I was freezing in there lol. We asked the waiters to turn it off and they couldn't do anything about it. Bring a sweater!!

We had reservations on a Thursday night and were sat immediately upon arrival. The interior decor is cute but where our table was upstairs the fan was blowing on me the entire time and it was a little cold. It's also loud in here as you're sat very closely together.

The food came out pretty quickly after we ordered. We got crispy chicken wings as an appetizer and to be honest I was pretty underwhelmed. The wings really weren't crispy at all and didn't taste seasoned. The bun Bo hue I got was delicious though, great amount of spice and depth of flavor for the broth. The noodles were cooked well too. My viet friend said she really liked her dish, it had noodles with pork chops and shrimp. I'm not sure of the name though.

I made a reservation for three here, and we all had different dishes. The pho, pad thai, and duck red curry and all were very good. I got the pho, and thought while it wasn't the best pho I've had, it hit the spot on a rainy day and wasn't badly priced the the area.

From trying a bite out of each dish, I think my favorite of the three was the pad Thai. The decor and service here were pretty good, if I'm ever in the area watching musicals and wanting Thai or Vietnamese I would consider coming back, but I probably wouldn't come out of my way for this place .

Stopped here while visiting NYC. The food was amazing! We ordered the crispy pork belly, pork & shrimp bun with spring roll and spicy lemongrass kalbi short ribs. It was all delicious!! To drink, I ordered the obao Sunray. This drink did not disappoint. It wasn't overly sweet nor too spicy. It was perfectly refreshing. Service was great too. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly. The atmosphere here is warm, modern yet cozy. I will definitely come back here next time I visit NYC.

Nice cozy place for delicious Vietnamese food! The menu goes beyond typical pho and bùn options.

I tried the basic beef pho, to help recover after a long day. It was excellent! The pho broth was savory but not too heavy. The noodles were hearty, veggies fresh.

The service is prompt and efficient and prices are fair for the area.

The crispy rolls seemed over-fried to the point that I couldn't bite into them. Wait staff took them away immediately, no questions asked.

OBAO was a very pleasant experience. The restaurant was clean and the service was impeccable. At every course of the meal, we were treated very well, and every item was well presented.
The drinks were strong, had nice presentations, and were throughly enjoyed.
We ordered sharable items (mushroom dumplings, papaya salad, and the cashew chili chicken entree). The papaya salad was pleasantly spicy, the mushroom dumplings had a flavorful texture, and the cashew chili chicken was perfectly seasoned).
I highly recommend OBAO and after posting my check-in, a fellow Yelper mentioned, that OBAO was one of their favorite restaurants. I agree and will gladly return for another memorable meal.

My goal for this date night was for something reasonably priced while out in the city all day.

Hell's Kitchen is always a good neighborhood to try and this Thai spot made my dinner date night with my boyfriend.

The cocktails shocked me for I am not too crazy about fancy cocktails but they knew how to pair every alcohol so perfectly.  

For dinner I got the drunken noodles with chicken and my boyfriend got the pad Thai with shrimp and we were both pleased and can't wait to come back again

Soo, my friend tells me that she wants Pho, and finds a spot randomly... and we come here and find the best Pho spot in the area! What a luck!!

She is a Pho Pro and I am a complete nub, like never tried before, so she wants it to be delicious and cool, cos I have to experience all the cool things, right!

We came in around 10ish and is was packed! Lots of people in line and everyone was happy . A host was super sweet and at the base managed to find us a spot to fit in.

Bartender was super sweet, he saw that it was not much space for three of us and switched us at a bigger spot at the bar, and set up the whole plate/water situation before we even moved. Very nice of him, since we didn't even try to bother him during this busy time.

I decided to go with a Pho Bo- a classic beef version and I didn't expect anything, cos h haven't tried Pho before,but I loved ramen so I was sure it would be something awesome.

I was so impressed how much thinner Pho is! I loved the lighteness and the fullness of the broth! Moreover I enjoyed that we also added line and mint to it/ something I didn't expect, and I think those engredients enhance the flavour so much!! Beef was amazing and well done, and I felt like I can eat two more portions after that! Loved my experience in this place.

Also, our bartender was very attentive and efficient , this is what Great service is- attention in details when you do not ask for them. Thank you!
Very nice ambiance. The waiters are very friendly. The food is decent, lacks flavors. There are better Thai/Viet restaurants in that area. Very fast service.

Tried this spot for lunch with coworkers and it was great! Large space with cool vibe and music.
We tried the branzino, pad Thai, basil rice and a few other items.
All were fresh, abundant and oh so tasty!!

,

(Overall: 77% | C) - Obao has beautiful ambience with nice decor and lighting. However, I found the service to be slow and the servers to be inattentive. I might've ordered dishes that are not their specialty, and saw lots of room for improvement overall.

(Thai Tea: 72.5% | C) - The tea flavor was mild and was further diluted with a significant amount of ice, making the drink very bland. While the flavors were nice, it was a great travesty that they were not more bold.

(Som Tum: 82.5% | B) - The authenticity in the green papaya salad flavors come through. However, I found the salad to lack enough spice for the variation I ordered to give it a sufficient kick. Additionally, the portion size is unnecessarily small.

Obao in Hells Kitchen never disappoints. This location, unlike the midtown east one, is well managed and the food quality and service is consistent and always good. They know how to serve a pre-theatre crowd.

Decent Viet/Thai place near Time Square. Needed a last minute reservation and they were able to accommodate a group of four. Cocktails were a bit too sweet for my liking. I got the Shrimp and Pork Vermicelli Bowl. The pork was overcooked and tough, but the shrimp were grilled well. The Crispy Egg Rolls were a bit on the oily side and could have been fried better. The Papaya Salad had a good spice for medium and was pretty decent. The Eggplant Stirfry was really good though!

We decided to try to this restaurant because of the great reviews it has on yelp. This restaurant it's usually very busy, so I always recommend you to make a reservation.

We got seated right away, friendly staff, great atmosphere as well as decoration.

I had very high expectations for the food due the reviews; however, we were a little disappointed. We started with the Kimchi fries and I got the Bruiseberry Mojito. The drink was very good, fries were good as well but a little overpriced. We then got the Spicy Cashew chicken with White rice and the Pad Thai with Shrimp. The Spicy chicken cashew was very averagely. The Pad Thai came with an over easy egg on top;
However it was almost like a boiled egg because it was way over cooked. The Pad Thai was still good but I would say I've tried better.

A true gem, from appetizers to entrees, everything was flavorful and delicious. Fall off the bone meats and a perfect blend. The kimchi fries were delicious and the rib appetizer was also fall off the bone and very juicy. My main entree was massaman curry and it's amazing. It was the spotlight of my meal. It was so good im coming again for dinner tommorow!

My buddies and I enjoyed every single thing we got here. Shared basil fried rice, roasted duck noodles, short rib massaman, viet crispy pork belly, kimchi fries, and pho bo. Most of us voted viet crispy pork belly as our favorite bc the meat was so perfectly cooked and the sauces that came with it were absolutely fire. I think while pho bo, basil fried rice, kimchi fries, and roasted duck noodles were good, I've def had similar at many other restaurants so they were not as memorable. Presentation of every dish and the interior decor of the restaurant were also beautiful! Would definitely come back.
We've been coming to OBAO for over a decade. 10 out of 10 pho, pad thai, and pretty much everything else on the menu. Highly recommended!

Everytime when l
Order even online or In person ,preparation time 40 mins . At least ! And they always say; about 10
Mins . Nah . Pls tell me how long . Don't want wait that much

Stopped in here for a pre-broadway dinner. Overall, I had a lovely experience and would come to dine here again.

Here's my rundown of the food I ordered:

- Roasted duck noodles: very flavorful, worth ordering again. I loved that these were not too oily. I loved the tangy/spicy dipping sauce on the side. These were a great new take on classic drunken noodles. This will be a dish I crave again.
- Mushroom dumplings: these were unique and i loved the dipping sauce, I'd be happy to order these again.
- Ribs: the bartender recommended these but I was unfulfilled with this dish. While the ribs were very tender, the glaze was too thin and so these lacked flavor.
- Matcha explosion: The ice cream was just ok, I did not care for the icey texture and the cake was bland. The candied pieces and red bean paste did help elevate this dessert but I would not order it again.

For a Wednesday night, they were very busy and had no table available. I recommend snagging a reservation for this spot before coming.

I sat at the bar and really did not care for the large tv they had at the bar. It cheapens the elevated space and does not match the environment.

The service was super friendly and helpful.

4/5

We came here after a Broadway show. They were open late and delicious! The food tasted fresh and came out fast. This place rivals most Thai food restaurants. The flavors were on point and it all tasted really good. The service was good and friendly. The space was good but it was the end of the night so it seemed a little dirty, but again it was the end of the night. This is a solid place and very reasonably priced for NYC.

I absolutely loved the food and vibes at OBAO!! My friend and I ordered the pad see iew and roasted duck noodles. Both were delicious and the order came out real fast. We made a reservation for 11:30 (right when it opens) and it was already pretty full so I highly suggest making a reservation. The restaurant has a decent amount of seating. Perfect for a get together with friends or birthday celebration! I also think the pricing of the menu items was really reasonable, especially being a restaurant in NYC! I'll definitely be back!!!

Overall rating: 9/10

Been to this location for dinner several times over the years. Service is good and friendly staff. They don't seat incomplete parties so make sure your group gets there on time. There is seating on two levels. Happy hour daily from 11:30am - 6pm.  Seating also at the bar. Tungsten lighting make the ambiance nice but a bit hard to read the menus...

Check out the special cocktails - I've enjoyed the Flunk Flink and A Long Winter drinks...

Appetizers: Steamed dumplings and spare ribs are very good.
Crispy spring rolls are ok.

Entrees: Roasted Duck Noodles is so far the favorite dish...very tasty and highly recommend it. Definitely will be one of the go to dishes.
Shrimp pad thai and pork chops are also good.

Gender neutral restrooms upstairs.

The lighting and environment in here was soo nice; however I didn't think the pho was super special in any way. Same with the iced tea. I did like the pad thai with shrimp though. It seemed like the staff was trying to rush us out, which was not nice.

Came here after work on a Monday at about 5:15pm, and the place was nearly empty.. very different than an hour later, where it became flooded with people, so I recommend making a reservation for a time after 6pm.

The food was delicious! We started out with the dumplings and spring rolls (no photos available because we ate it that damn fast). The wings were pretty good, and perfectly crispy, but the highlight of the dish was the garlic sauce on the side. We also had the papaya salad, which was light and fresh, and to finish off, I had the Bun Bo Hue pho, which was great, especially the broth.

The ambiance was cool, place was nice, and they also have happy hour! Great place to check out in NYC.

Food: 5/5 | Service: 4/5 | Experience: 5/5

My party of 4 was able to be seated immediately on a Monday evening. Interior decor is beautiful - gold and black reflective walls. We had to rush our order, and the servers were very accommodating. Bathrooms are located on upstairs floor.

I got the pork belly with Chinese broccoli, which came with a bowl of rice. This was delicious. There was a generous portion of tender pork belly and the the dish itself was savory and had a bit of heat. We were able to get served food within 10 minutes as a rush order.

I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a while so I ventured here on a Tuesday for a 6:30pm reservation for a friend's birthday. Upon entry the hostess greeted me right away. The food was tasty and actually pretty good. However the service needs a lot of work.

Bartender was not friendly at all. Never smiled. Never said hello. Never asked can I help you or what can I get you. Felt like we had to beg for service. And the drinks were not good.  Just get beer or the sake.

The service at the table was rushed. As soon as we sat down 2 minutes later ready to order. Normally prompt service is great. But when we said we need a few minutes literally a minute later another server comes and asks are we ready to order. Followed by another server 2 minutes later. Needless to say that set the tone for the remainder of the dinner. My guests and I really could not just sit and enjoy our dinner. Everything was on warp speed.

My 3 stars is strictly for the food so shout out to the cooks.  Next time take out only.

I love everything about OBAO. Great food, great people, fun atmosphere. This is one of my go to places when I want to have an uplifting meal in a fun place in Hell's Kitchen. I would highly recommend trying OBAO if you haven't yet. I don't drink, but the drinks look great if you are into that.

We made reservations for 3 over the phone. Although, the person who answered wasn't getting the name correctly so when we arrived it was under a different name. Reservations were for Sunday at 5:30. There were a lot of people waiting, so definitely recommend making one.

The food was pretty good, and the servings were adequately sized. They actually made the food really fast, to my surprise, since they were busy. We ordered kimchi fries, cashew nut chicken, pad see ew, and basil fried rice. We still had a little bit of leftovers.

It's a nice spot to have dinner before a Broadway show. Great location.

Foods was ok. Nice service.
Like the pork belly A LOT!
The fries was kind of too sweet.

We came to the restaurant on a Sunday evening. It was pretty empty at the time we were seated in the back in a booth the back was cutely decorated with a lot of flowers.

For food, we order the papaya salad as an appetizer followed by drunken noodles, chicken, green curry, and pho. We also got a Thai iced tea. The food came out super quickly. The papaya salad almost came out immediately. The drunken noodles were completely mild (I know this can vary at different Thai spots). The green curry contained a variety of different ingredients and came with a side of rice. Not going to lie, I came to this dinner already pretty full but the portions felt pretty big. The food wasn't bad but also nothing wow. There are definitely better Thai spots in the city.

Atmosphere (5/5): The front of the establishment is a long bar seating that faces the kitchen. The back opens up to a dining room with plenty of seating. The lighting is on the dimmer side.
Service (5/5): I was seated almost right away. The wait staff was very friendly and checked in on us often.  
Food
Short Ribs Massaman Curry (5/5): Wow, the broth was so rich and flavorful that I could just have it straight. The short rib was extremely tender where the meat fell right off the bone! It also wasn't overcooked that there was any toughness or loss in moisture. Just all around delicious. The sweet potatoes soaked in the soup and then peanuts provided a nice texture crunch to the bite. I definitely plan on coming back again.

"All of my love, all of my kissing
You don't know what you've been a-missing
Oh boy, when you're with me
Oh boy, the world can see
That you, were meant, for me"
(Buddy Holly)

Three of us had a fantastic lunch at OBAO. When we walked in, just a few tables were occupied, but when we walked the place was jam packed. I saw a lot of young Asians in there, so this must be a hip place for the young professionals in the neighborhood.

Our lunch orders were Spare Ribs with Honey Tamarind Glaze ($12) - "6 hrs. braised pork spareribs tossed with honey tamarind glaze served with Vietnamese table salad", Pad Thai with Shrimp ($18) - " stir-fried thin rice noodles with shrimps, bean sprouts, chives, and crushed peanuts topped with a poached egg", and Vietnamese Crispy Pork Belly ($16) - "Served with lettuce wrapping, pickled carrot & daikon, sweet soy and spicy green dipping sauce."

The Pork Belly was my order and I couldn't have been happier with it. First of all, it was a pretty good sized order and there was enough ingredients on the serving dish that I must have made 5 delicious lettuce wraps. The pork belly was fantastic, crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside. And those dipping sauces (especially the spicy green one) really complemented everything .

The food and service were great (our water glasses were refilled twice.)

Overall, this was a very enjoyable visit and consumer experience.

Some of the dishes here (especially the Thai ones) are better than any I've had in California. It's amazing. So good that my picky husband wanted to come back for a second time on our trip to NYC.

We ordered the following:
Bo luc lac (shaking beef)
Basil fried rice with shrimp
Papaya salad
Pad see lew with beef (my favorite)
Pho Bo (100 authentic)

EVERYTHING and I mean everything was authentic and bursting with flavor. It's insane how much depth the flavors were. Multidimensional. I was very very satisfied with the meal. I kind of wish we ordered more because we finished everything. The drinks were also very delicious and not overpowering.

The restaurant is narrow so it might be a little cramped if you have a group bigger than six. It's nice and dark, yet you can talk at a normal volume without disturbing others. Good for kids as well. Service was fast and food came out amazingly quick.

I had Le Bernardin this week too, but I'd pick this place over it any day of the week.

Pretty disappointed with my experience at OBAO and it wasn't even due to the flavor or quality of the food, which was in fact really good.

I initially ordered a vegan pad see-ew ($18) with tofu and vegetables which was also advertised as such on their menu. When my food came, I took a bite and realized that they had incorporated egg into my dish. I reached out to the server to point out this mistake and they didn't seem to have the best reception to my concern. There wasn't any sense of an apology when she took my dish away to replace it with what I ordered.

Five minutes later, the new dish arrived and it was significantly smaller than my original dish. It went from four or so pieces of tofu to... just one. Just take a look at my photos and see for yourself.

For the hefty price, I really wanted to like the place. The ambiance was good and the menu options were fine, but the service and food didn't meet my expectations, even though my dish ended up being pretty tasty in the end.

We came here for their $45 dinner Restaurant Week. The place stretches pretty far, with even an outdoor patio in the back.

The place was very dim, in a very unaesthetic way. I could barely read the menu. There were also bugs flying around our dishes the whole time, which they're aware of, given they even had a fly swatter.

The appetizers were bomb! I was not expecting so much juice to come out of the Crispy Crab Dumplings, but they were so flavorful! The tofu skin did a great job in holding everything together. The Shrimp Sugar Cane was not as juicy, but still a fun one, given how the shrimp pork meat was wrapped around a sugarcane.

My entree pick, the Soft Shell Crab Garlic Noodles, sounded good, but it wasn't anything worth getting. The soft shell crab pieces were my favorite for its succulence. The biggest disappointment was the stir fried egg noodles, which was way too salty! I could not finish from how unhealthy it was in addition to the fried crab. The Pho Short Rib was way better, with a flavorful broth!

For dessert, we picked the only 2 options: Mango Sticky Rice and Taro Custard. Both had the same sticky rice base. The mangoes weren't ripe, but it still matched better than the overly sweet taro custard, which tasted wet and spongey.

While the food was a hit or miss, the waiter was what truly made our meal. He informed us about free Thai Iced Tea or Sapporo Beer if we left a review. He was also QUICK in refreshing our water glasses and asking how we liked the food throughout our meal. We had a great time because of the service here!

Stopped in for Happy Hour and had intended to eat dinner here, but after receiving cold food and lackluster service we left pretty quickly. They were pretty crowded so not sure if that was why the service was poor. Still, dumplings were cold and not tasty. The happy hour pricing isn't great either.

Great food and great atmosphere. Delicious Vietnamese restaurant in a great location with multiple Asian restaurants within the vicinity. Also serves other Asian fusion dishes as well. Exceptionally friendly staff with high speed service. Portions were filling as well. For appetizers, Kimchi Fries are a must have. Beautifully crispy fries drenched in Sriracha mayo, scallions and spicy pickled cabbage. Main course consisted of Pho Bo - flavorful broth and thinly sliced beef brisket. Pad See iew, sweet flat noodles with beef was delectable. Also ordered the Green Curry, however it wasn't as flavorful as the other dishes. Almost bland to the taste.
Recommended Dishes: Kimchi Fries, Pho Bo, Pad See Iew

This is a decent sized restaurant that was already almost full with diners at 6:15pm. (Later, I discovered even more seating upstairs). A nice restaurant with dark wooden tables and chairs. Luckily, we had reservations. We were seated quickly and a short time later, our waiter came over. I initially started with their flick flunk, a cocktail with lychee infused sake. I've been on a lychee kick for the last several months and, unfortunately, the cocktail was not to my liking. But husband really liked it. So he acquired my drink and I ordered their mixed berry mojito. Tasty, but not enough rum.

We ordered 4 dishes--the spare ribs, pork belly, pork chops and Chinese broccoli. They were all delicious!  The pork belly was wonderfully crispy and served with lettuce leaves for us to make our own wraps. The next favorite was their pork chops, thin and tasty. We felt like the dish kept going. Albeit they were thin, but they gave us 6 chops!  How they tasted reminded me of the Chinese beef jerky that I enjoy. The spare ribs had a nice crispness to it, but not enough of the honey tamarind glaze. Chinese broccoli was thinly cut on a diagonal and then lightly cooked.....tasty but watch out for the chili peppers!  I would definitely return to try more of their dishes!
Not memorable. We came here for a quick bite. Though the service was good, my basil duck was a bit too spicy. Will I be back? Probably Not!
As you all know, I love Thai food and Obao has some of the best Pad Thai! This Pad Thai included Shrimp, egg, and some incredible noodles. I love dining here too! It has a beautiful interior
I loved Obao! The food and drinks were perfect, and the interior was very cool. Our server was super nice and attentive as well!

LIVE Cockroach on the wall walking around like it owned the places. If you can see them out in the dining area imagine what's in the kitchen. Disgusting. Couldn't even begin to comprehend eating after that.

Friendliest service ever!! Also super worth it from a cost perspective. Really delicious flavors as well at this elevated modern Thai/Viet spot. The ambiance is lovely and the back seating area has a lofty natural light vibe with pretty plant decor hanging from the ceiling. The pho hit the spot and fried rice was perfectly seasoned. The appetizer veggie was only $8 for a size that was perfectly split between the four of us. Mushroom dumplings were also juicy and yummy. Dishes were served quickly too. You really get your bang for your buck here in terms of ambiance, service and quality of food! Can't wait to come back, highly recommend.

OBAO is a popular Thai restaurant on 53rd - food is pretty good and it has a good atmosphere for dining out.  We were sat outside, but in the New York summer it was pretty hot and humid.  They had just opened the outdoor area, so they were still setting up fans and an AC unit.  It was cute out there with some fake flowers hanging from the ceiling, lights, a tree etc.  Music was a bit loud, which makes diners talk even louder.  We ordered the calamari, papaya salad, green curry, drunken noodle and drinks.  They forgot our noodle dish, so they apologized and brought out some Thai iced tea and then a bit later another round of drinks for us which was unexpected and nice.  Will be back as it is a solid Thai spot in the area!

Food was delicious!!! We met up with some family friends and they recommended this Thai restaurant which was super bomb. I ordered the Khao Soi and it was sooooooooo goood. I was deciding between that and the curry and the server recommended the khao soi. They used my favorite noodles and the chicken was extremely tender. They give you a knife but you literally don't need one because the meat just falls of the bone. It has a bit of spice but it's not too much where you can't enjoy it. I would probably order the same thing if I were to come back. My only comment is that middle seating area is really tight so people or servers would be touching my back and the table is skinny. But overall very good food.

Love this spot! Had a great time here with my friends the other night and great thing they have happy hour specials!  unfortunately most of the dishes didn't make it for photo! But they had great flavor. We had ordered the grilled short rib, shrimp fried rice and the drunken noodles! Would definitely come back again!

Came here on a weeknight without reservations and was promptly seated. We ordered the spring rolls, calamari and wings as appetizers. I will say the calamari is very interested and worth a try - it's not your typical breaded fried calamari.

I love their cocktail selection. The lychee fink funk was delicious! Also love the gin chrysanthemum one too.

Udon noodles were average. Wish I had a chance to try their desserts.

Ordered the duck noodles and I must say it was not that flavorful and the duck was dry too. Portion size wise the amount of food was like two fist full of noodles for $20. The service was good, but the food wasn't worth the money imo. Maybe I should've tried their specialty dishes

The place feels cozy and the food is way better than what I have expected. I got the fried calamari, kimchi fries, and entrees like viet pork chops, pork and shrimp bun, and bun bo hue.

Our table about got drinks: comrade party and Flynn flunk. Highly recommend. Comrade party has spicy salt rim which was a good touch.

A hidden Gem! This restaurant is a few blocks from our hotel, needless to say I'm glad we made the choice to dine here. The service here is excellent, fast and clean! The atmosphere is also fantastic. My mother and I have a shellfish allergy, which was able to be accommodated. Instead of having shrimp in our rice and Phad Thai we were able to substitute for chicken which did not take away from the flavor at all. In addition, our server and manager Wen, mentioned the happy hour specials so my mother ordered the black berry mojito which was sweetly refreshing. We frequently travel to NYC and this gem has been added to our favorites list. Can't wait to come back.

Got the bun Bo hue, flavor of the soup was amazing. Loved the bouncy noodles as well. Didn't expect to have pork belly in my bun Bo hue so that's a first but it is meat so I won't complain and the brisket was really good. But I did wish we didn't have to pay 3 dollars for fish balls. My bf got the duck and it was very deep in flavor and so fragrant.

Not pictured were the dumplings, papaya salad, Thai iced tea and the calamari. Really recommend the calamari and the Thai iced tea, for only 4 dollars it was a decent sized cup.

Tip: front of the restaurant seating is tables and chairs the back is high tables and high chairs/stools.

Everything here tasted fine but it was just the kind of food where you took a bite and it was slightly worse than what you expected it to be. Again, not bad, just not as good as your expectations.

Starting with the spring rolls, even though they had the classic crisp that you see from the photo, the meat inside felt like biting into a log. It was too thick and was a sausage-like consistency. It was almost like they were frozen and defrosted to serve to us, which I doubt is actually the case but the point is that it tasted like that.

The roasted duck noodles were decent-- I thought they had a great texture, but they were missing flavor. Again, not by a lot, but just enough where they left you wanting a little more from them.

Good ambience, though! I caught up with some friends here and it was definitely good enough for that. It was just the food that left you missing that something to make it a complete meal.

Highly recommend having your next lunch for dinner at OBAO. The dishes we ordered were fantastic. Everything had so much flavor. Our party of 2 had the Bun Bo Hue, Roasted Duck Noodles, and Pork Belly Chinese Broccoli. Definitely give all 3 a try. If i had to choose a favorite, it's the Roasted Duck Noodles. It was cooked to perfection. The noodles were just perfect. Not to soft or hard, and so moist! While the Bun Bo Hue was delicious, I was surprised by how small a portion it was. The smallest portion i've seen at a restaurant. A little disappointed with that and the warm tea that we got. It was freezing outside and a hot tea would have been nice.

Service was fast and friendly. I recommend sitting towards the back of the restaurant, because it was much warmer, and a very different vibe from the front of the restaurant.

I met up with a college friend of mine and The waiters weren't the most hospitable. The location on the west side looks more aesthetic and nicely decorated. The east side location has a cool back room with booth seating with a long table in the middle. Unfortunately you can't sit in the booth of its just you and another person. We ended up sitting at a high table beside the bar area. I loved that they had hooks for bags under the high top tables.

We ordered the shrimp chicken dumplings appetizers- they didn't taste like either. It's good to have the shrimp chunks still there to tell the difference.

I ordered the chicken Tom Yum Soup which was a big portion, the flavor was alright and the 2 lychee martinis which were DELICIOUS!

Have been to OBAO in Hells Kitchen several times and decided to try this Midtown East location. What a difference and what a Major Disappointment! Terrible food!

Tried the crabmeat fried rice. Super bland and almost inedible.  None of the appetizers or main courses tasted anything like their description or like the dishes in the other location . You probably need to travel to South East Asia to find the flavor profiles represented in the menu - the divide was like a continent apart.

Asked the server for some spice three times and it never came.

Ambiance was casual.

Went here with a small group and the service was impeccable. One friend had asked for a custom drink and they were more than happy to help. The food was also so so delicious. Had the excellent Papaya Salad and the Massaman Curry that I cannot stop talking about! It was great portions, balanced taste, and just so flavorful! It was also a nice restaurant to catch up as there is a bar but there is also quiet seating in the back.
Drunken noodles were delicious. Oysters and sauce were fantastic. Pork belly was crispy. Service was very good!
Came with my friends, ordered cocktails and pho. Both were delicious! Will definitely come back again

Food: 5 stars

Service: 1.5 stars

Obao has a great crab fried rice and short rib massaman curry. If you get the food spicy, it'll be nice and spicy! We ordered the Tom yum, chicken wings, short rib masaaman, eggplant curry, and crab fried rice- which was amazing!

However, service is lackluster. People are relatively rude. Also they default to an 18% tip...

Michelin recommended and I can see why, but I didn't enjoy my experience. They sat 5 people in a 4 person table and we were missing plates.

I wasn't blown away despite popularity. But the food is still great!

Food: 7/10
Ambiance: 9/10 - low-light vibes
Service: 10/10

a cute asian fusion place that we stumbled upon! The decor and seating is very nice on the inside and there's actually a lot of room towards the back of the restaurant. My table ordered three drinks (obao,  flunk flink, and a long winter) and they were all so good, you can't go wrong with any of them! We also ordered the calamari and papaya salad for appetizer and the server recommended us the crispy fish and lobster pad thai which they freshly got in the morning. We also got the short rib curry and omg it was so good, the best dish of the night! We had amazing service as well but unfortunately i don't remember the guys name (i think it started with a B). would def come back!

This place is such a great little hole in the wall for lunch/dinner that won't break the bank! My friend is gluten free and she approves of this place too! She's a big fan of their rice noodles in the Pad Thai and of course all of the drinks are amazing.
Plus, there's a pretty great happy hour that goes later than most places!

You're out of your mind if you give this anything below 5 stars.

The Drunken Noodles are PHENOMENAL.

The Short Ribs Massaman Curry is PHENOMENAL.

The drinks!? PHENOMENAL.

I dropped by with a large group during a weekday for a lovely Asian Fusion lunch. They had a good amount of space on the Monday, and there was no wait. Most of the food I noticed was either Vietnamese or Thai inspired.

Service was great with QR code menus. I ordered the Khao Soi chicken (northern Thai curry with egg noodles) which was pretty good. You could tell the chefs in the kitchen pay attention to detail - presentation definitely elevated my dish and the other dishes my party ordered. The back room also had some lovely natural light which is rare in the middle of Manhattan.

Great sit down spot for a lunch crew on a weekday!

Came in on Saturday, noticed the Happy Hour sign for the weekend so came in to get a drink and something quick to eat!

I ordered a cold sake as my drink, it was okay. Nothing really good, definitely a cheap sake that you could drink if you had to.

For a snack, I picked up the kimchi fries and a side of pickled radish/carrots. Both were perfect. The fries were super crispy, the siracha cheese sauce or whatever it was had the perfect heat, not too spicy but had a great kick. The kimchi on top was very crisp and good, I love a good kimchi moment! The pickled radish & carrots were tasty, would stop by again just to pick some up to go and have in my fridge. Need the recipe of that!
Korean seafood grill that will leave you coming back!!  Really good clams and scallops.  The best is the hangover soup!!
Great atmosphere, yummy drinks, delicious apps. Service is very friendly and knowledgeable. Love the drinks and apps here for a quick meal. Will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu.

Yummmmmm. We loved the rib's appetizer. It has a nice fish sauce/vinegar sauce with it. We were trying to compare it to iron chef's Chef Morimoto's spare ribs but we decided that these don't compare. Not because it's bad but because it stands on its own. That's the dish that stood out the most to me.

Win the manager is amazing!  The food and service were wonderful. Had the shrimp basil rice that was outstanding. The papaya salad also great.  The Tom Ga soup was delicious.  For our first visit I was very impressed and will be back soon. Awesome all around!

Was walking around midtown east after work looking for an affordable place to eat and OBAO didn't disappoint! They had a wide range of dishes and cocktails. My friend and I ordered a cocktail, wine, the crab fried rice and the fried chicken dish.

My lychee cocktail was too sweet but the rest of the food was delicious. Our server Beer was very attentive and the manager Win is extremely kind! Will definitely want to come back for happy hour!

Came in with a big group (16) for lunch. Fern, our server was incredible. She took care of everyone with ease and did not miss a beat.

The appetizers were all decent... would skip on the dumplings. Calamari was really crispy and the sweet-chili sauce had perfect amount of heat.

Pad Thai was perfect... very saucy and the poached egg is a fun addition that made the noodles even more delicious. Pad kee mao was also very good -- not spicy more sweet.

Will def get takeout here in the future since it's right near my office!

Wow! This spot is really a gem. Everything from the food to the service was amazing.

Food- for apps we had the calamari and spring rolls. Both were delicious! The sauce on the calamari was really good and added a nice kick. For our entrees we shared the basil fried rice and crispy chicken wings (not pictured). The fried rice was delicious. It was super flavorful and the portion was big enough for two. The sauce on the wings was delicious as well. For dessert we shared the figgy cake, I would skip this. The cake itself had a weird aftertaste almost like a cardboard flavor but the sauce and ice cream made up for it.

Drinks- we came in during happy hour so all house drinks were $10. We had the comrade party, flunk flink, and the one thousand and one nights. All the drinks were delicious, my personal favorites were the comrade party and flunk flink.

Service - amazing service from the moment we came in to the moment we left. Our waitress was attentive and super sweet, she informed us about happy hour as soon as we came in and encouraged us to take advantage of the discounted drinks. The food came out super fast too. We stayed in the restaurant for about 3 hours and the staff didn't rush us out or say anything about the amount of time we were seated which was very nice.

Overall - delicious food, great service, and great drinks. Definitely recommend!
My go- to place for a nice  semi-casual dinner in the neighborhood. It can get a little crowded but it is good for a weekday dinner. Good happy hour and good food options.
Food and drinks were AMAZING. Would absolutely come back for the pho that I had. The space is a little small so come early or make a reservation.

This Thai-Vietnamese restaurant offers a wonderful dining experience. The staff is friendly and well-informed, providing excellent service. The food blends Thai and Vietnamese flavors well, making for some intriguing dishes. The spring rolls are crispy and filled with herbs, while the Pho Tom Yum offers a balanced mix of spice and comfort. Overall, it's a satisfying culinary experience that lives up to its promise of good service and creative fusion cuisine. Highly recommended.
Great food and cocktails. The massaman curry and the short rib was huge! Worth the price for sure.

OBAO is one of the best Thai places in town. I've had enough Pad Thai to consider myself a connoisseur and this restaurant's took the cake. The service was very fast and I never felt like I was waiting around. The ambiance was great, my girlfriend and I both agreed. I wish they would open up the back patio, though.

I got the khao soi for myself and mushroom dumplings to share with my friend. I had a good amount left over of the khao soi because it came with a pretty generous portion. I loved the khao soi! I don't see this on many restaurants' menus so I gave it a try. The soho base tasted like a coconut curry with a slight kick of spice to it. It came with thin cut noodles that were cooked perfectly and the chicken was nice and tender. The mushroom dumplings were also yummy and the spicy sauce was my favorite!

Service here was good and quick. Our server was really helpful in describing the dishes and helping us decide what to get.
Solid restaurant with great vibes.  The food was great and affordable, and most importantly, service was excellent.

When in midtown and you don't know where to eat, Obica is a nice option.

The menu is limited as everything is already prepared. The sandwiches are fresh and the mozzarella cheese is delicious. We enjoyed the chicken sandwich. The coffee and cocktails are also very good.

One major negative is that the bathroom is in Trump Tower....

I wasn't as impressed with this place as a lot of people seem to be. The inside was really nice and the service was pretty good. I did ask for ice water several times and just couldn't get it which was a bummer.  I ordered the pappardelle with duck ragu and orange zest. The pasta was so so good, but I felt like the rest of the meal was very heavy/greasy. I honestly couldn't even finish it all.  I also thought it was unnecessarily expensive with small portions.

Oof, the service here is slooooow and it's expensive. I've come to pick up food to-go and have had table service and both are experiences are incredibly slow. I took two interns here for a "quick" lunch and I was embarrassed by my choice to eat here. We all got paninis but it took over half an hour to get the food they just needed to toast. 3 paninis and a sparkling water came out to $78... Don't come here unless you're just trying to waste time away from your desk.
Beautifully designed and decorated with exceptional service this quaint eatery features delicious cocktails and amazing food. The attention to detail and warm staff make this a must visit!

I never knew that mozzarella bars were *a thing* and this restaurant was recommended by some of the folks at nearby Bonhams. I came in just before the lunch rush and ordered the Baguette Prosciutto Crudo sandwich. About how much I would expect to pay for a sandwich in the city - $13.50, and it was a pretty decent portion. Quality ingredients and I now understand the allure of a mozzarella bar. I also enjoyed the seating area as it was covered but with lots of light and and airy feeling.
A most disappointing lunch!   Mediocre burrata, cold grilled vegetables in an overdressed salad, with cheap croutons (which were not mentioned on the menu). Don't waste your money
Bad service, workers barley talked to us. Asked for bread multiple times she responded as "oh yeah?"  Unprofessional trying to look fancy. Birthday balloon said nothing about birthday.
Yummy food, pleasant staff, but quite slow. They should hire more help. Going at lunchtime is quite the wait.

In a cute spot and the Inside is trendy and aesthetically decorated with greenery and art. Staff was all helpful and friendly. The drinks and food were so amazing. Would come back for the pizza and drinks again
Very average sandwiches and not very good coffee. There are better places in the area for lunch.
Terrible food. Terrible service. Waiter and host not friendly at all. Won't recommend ever.

We went for lunch, most of the dishes we ordered were very good.  Without a doubt, their mozzarella was the best, very creamy and absolutely delicious--although a bit on the expensive side.  We were a large party (8 total, including kids), the service was great.  Would go back again, but probably for special occasions.

I'd give it 4 stars for the food only, but given the exceptional service, I have to give it a full 5 stars.

Being close by my office, I've has lunch here a few times. Regardless of whether I ate pasta, salads, or even just mozzarella and tomatoes, this place always serves great food.

Now, as far as the service: exceptional. I've had the luck to be served on multiple occasions by the same server (unfortunately I still haven't had the chance to get his name). This guy is truly amazing. He gives a level of service that I haven't even found in Michelin-star restaurants sometimes.

I wouldn't make this place a destination restaurant, but if you're in the area and want to have good food and exceptional service, then definitely come here.

The food was good but the service on a less than busy night was sub par. Our 2nd glass of wine was ordered when the food was delivered but we didn't receive it until we were finished and ready to leave.

This place is mediocre- we were a very large group and ordered a variety of things, everyone said their food was just fine. Service was okay, they forgot one of the guests food (came about 10-15 minutes after everyone else's) and mixed up the drinks then charged us for the mistake even after we said something. They also snuck in a gratuity and didn't mention it. There are some many more places in NYC that are 1000x better for the same price. I would not come back here.

I placed a preorder for pick up. When I got there it was still about a 15 minute wait where many other customers were served ahead of me despite my order placement 40 minutes prior of a premade sandwich and side salad. So disorganized and terrible portion.

My go-to lunch spot to eat indoors or to take back to my desk. There are a lot of options for everyone but I swear by the Ciabatta de Pollo panini. The options are quite pricy but you're getting high quality food in Midtown. Don't be intimidated by the line because they move pretty fast taking orders.

I've comehere several times because it's across the street from my job when I first started coming they had lots of pastries to offer and the guys behind the counter really nice.
Now, 98% of their food is sandwiches and lunch items.
They don't serve really any danishes they'll be a couple but they get sold out quickly.
And a few of the new staff (women) don't smile and seem SO miserable and have a nasty Puss on her face.
Because of that I actually would stop coming here but unfortunately there really isn't any other place in the area that serves muffins or danishes or croissants.
they didn't even have butter and jam for the croissant.
Really disappointed now.

Obica is not all its cracked up to be. My mother and I reserved a table last night and it was not a pleasant experience. Service was horrible. After being seated for 20 minutes, no one greeted us or came to take our drink order or even pour us a glass of water. We had to yell constantly to grab someone's attention. We did not even know who our server was. The food was bland and served lukewarm. When we were able to place a drink order, we simply got a bottle of sparkling water for the table and it did not arrive until we were basically halfway done with our meals. I would not recommend this place and will not be returning.

Ordered a caprese panini and just like what someone else said, it was very bland. Never had one that did not come with sauce, but I guess there's a first for everything...just a bunch of ingredients slapped into a baguette for $11

My friend also ordered a pasta dish for $20, and it had exactly 10 pieces of pasta. That's $2/piece. Not to mention that it tasted watery and definitely not al dente. The excessive price was just another issue to add to the disappointment.

We ran across this place while we were walking around the city. We couldn't resist!

There's a to-go counter where you can order, but if you'd like to enjoy a glass of wine, you'll want to get a table. Of course, we got a table. They brought some fresh bread, oil & vinegar to the table with some water right away.

We ordered the Burrata al Tartufo, accompanied with Prosciutto Crudo di Parma & the Pomodori with two glasses of the 2014 Ochetti Nebbiolo d'Alba. Everything was delicious. The burrata was very fresh and we loved the tomatoes and olives that were served with it. It was also a generous portion of prosciutto & tomatoes to go with the burrata.

Service was fantastic. They were very friendly and attentive. The owner even came by and chatted with us for a bit, which was nice. It was a very nice location in the atrium and it's perfect for taking a break from shopping to grab a bite and enjoy some wine.

They have a nice selection of wine and a happy hour, as well. They have a lot of options on the menu that look delicious and I know we'll come back here the next time we're in NYC.  I definitely recommend stopping by, if you're in the area. Cheers!

It is really nice to have a restaurant in your building's atrium. Since it's literally just an elevator ride away, I frequent here for coffee mainly but from time to time will order a breakfast sandwich. The croissant with egg, mozzarella and prosciutto is literally heaven. I have eaten here for lunch as well. Their salads are good! You can never go wrong with an Italian spot.

Originally we had sushi in mind but couldn't get a table at our place of choice- stumbled upon this spot with a pretty happening happy hour. We ordered all of the food specials along with a few specialty Italian cocktails. Highly recommend it.

So I gave this place two chances because it came so well recommended by a local who has discerning tastes - same person who recommended that phenomenal Basso56 (see my review on that).

It's on the east side of the Trump Plaza complex, so you are at the edge of the security bubble, but it doesn't tamper access to the place, which is on the lobby floor of the building.  Open, airy place with lots of floor to ceiling windows.  Service is excellent, and the servers are very friendly and good.
