On the two visits, I have tried the mozzarella sampler, and the troffie with pesto sauce pasta.  I have also tasted the prosciutto/speck, and the olives and cherry tomatoes.

So, there is no doubt that everything is super fresh.  The charcuterie, tomatoes and olives are very good.

On the mozzarella: very fresh, but bland on flavor. Average by authentic Italian standards.

On the pasta: I was excited to see they had troffie (mispelled with only one "f" but that's OK) which is the actual type of pasta that goes with pesto sauce back home, and you can't find it at your regular supermarket in the US. However, the actual pesto was a disappointment.  I've had pesto that tasted closer to the authentic stuff out of a glass jar from WholeFoods.

The quality of the food is ok, service is great.

I ordered the squash soup, but it was pretty bland. Unimpressed by the soup; I had to add a lot of pepper in it to have some sort of flavor.

I also ordered the antipasto and it was ok. The olives were tasty, cheese was good, but it was overpriced for the quality.

The cappuccino I ordered was great!

The service was great - I had a pleasant chat with the waiter. I would come back for the coffee when I'm around the area again, maybe not the food.

Obica is not very good, unfortunately. I had a panini from here which was supposed to be pressed, but barely was.  The filling and the bread were not only cold although I did not expect them to be, but they were also very bland. I work in the building, which would make it very convenient for me to eat here, but, unfortunately, I don't think that will be happening again anytime soon.

Came here for lunch on a Monday. I ordered the  $10 tomato & basil bruschetta and a $17 caprese salad. My husband ordered the $38 grand bufala tasting dish.

My bruschetta was tasteless. It had no salt or garlic on it. It was essentially a few small pieces of basil with olive oil poured on the tomatoes scooped onto one slice of bread. The amount of tomatoes was scant and for $10, I would have expected a lot more.

The caprese salad was very fresh, however again lacked any sort of flavouring. There was no olive oil or balsamic vinegar given. You had to ask the waiter to provide balsamic vinegar to flavour the salad yourself. Then had to add olive oil and salt to the dish.

My husband enjoyed the bufala tasting dish, but for $34 this dish is not worth what you get.

As Obicà has many different types of mozzarella cheeses we had asked the waiter for an explanation of the different dishes. He was not very helpful at all and essentially just read the menu back to us.

In addition, we had Hilton Club gift certificates that we wanted to use for the meal. These are essentially gift certificates that you can use at multiple restaurants. When we asked the waiter about using them, he said that we can only use one coupon at a time. However, no where does it say this. So I asked to speak to the manager, at which time the waiter said "the manager will just say the same thing." I insisted to ask the manager and the reply came back as, yes we were correct in that we can use is multiple gift certificates.

Overall, food is overpriced, tasteless and with poor service provided. Would not recommend this place.

Wish I could tell you how drinks and food taste here but, we were turned away at 5:23pm. We just wanted ONE drink before attending another event but were told they do takeout only.

Perhaps they would serve you for lunch but don't bother trying after 5pm.

If your a lover of cheese you have to come here. The decor is great the staff is great and sometimes you might even get a free orchestra playing in the background!

Interior: Beautiful! Full of trees, birds and music playing in the background with transparent windows to see the outdoors in midtown. So if you want to "eat outside" but don't want to be outside then come here! There are plenty of places to sit outside of this mozzarella bar as well. If your wondering where the food is coming from it is downstairs somewhere lol

Food: I came here with co-workers and anything with mozzarella here is SO GOOD. The cheese is super soft and the bread in the beginning is great. If your super hungry don't go here haha but if your trying to stay light and healthy for a meal then yes come here.

Overall: Fresh fresh fresh game is on point here. Go here on a summer or spring day and it will be a long lunch because your going to be enamored by your surroundings and by the deliciousness of the food.

We were wandering the mid-town area and wanted a light lunch. The hubby remembered "That Mozzarella Bar" he wanted to try. Not being one to say no to fresh mozzarella cheese, I said Sure!!

We ate at the counter of the mozzarella bar. Seating was tight as I was right next to the cash register, but the staff was very friendly and accommodating.

We had:

Butternut Squash Soup with Goat Cheese - it was served lukewarm (not sure if that was intentional) and relatively flavorless. The hubby and I added balsamic vinegar to pump up the flavor - we failed miserably

Mozzarella Sampler - one piece of fresh mozzarella - needed salt but was tasty; and smoked mozzarella - tasted okay if a bit too salty

Eggplant Caponata - I really enjoyed this, it had the right mix of tang and salt. The hubby didn't like that there were beans in it - he is a bit of a caponata snob.

They were also out of burrata which was disappointing.

For a mozzarella bar, we expected better mozzarella.

Horrible service.   There's one person working the counter and he didn't keep track of who's in line and and will randomly take orders from people he chooses.  Was not even busy at 3pm.  Not even an apology!.

The most delicious olives you will ever taste
Salads are so fresh and good for you.
The spread that you receive at this place is so impressive
Delicious cheese, olives, bread, pesto! Stop here for an nice lunch or a real cup of coffee
Fabio the owner is always around so you know the places is always perfect. Stop in and have a glass of wine or coffee and enjoy a taste and quality of Italy

Obica has a lovely atmosphere and great service. However, the food was just okay. The pepper and sausage pizza and the ravioli were nice and enjoyable but not standout. The burrata I had high hopes for but was not impressive. The brussel  sprouts were a major disappointment. They were super bland and not cooked well. I would definitely skip these. Overall, it was enjoyable but I would stick to the carbs (pizza and pastas).

Amazing Food great service
This is fantastic can't wait to go back for my 5th visit

Un cibo veramente fatto bene.

Enjoy the space (bring food from somewhere else)

The best thing Obica has going for it is the airy atrium it's situated in - but of course that's a public space with with lots of open tables for the taking.

Obica itself is overpriced and middling. I've ordered there a bunch of times because I work nearby it's consistently disappointing. Whether you get the crostini, the salad, the soup, or the pannini, you'll find that the portions are small, lacking in taste, overpriced. Grab something from the myriad good fast casual places nearby and enjoy the space.

It was a pleasant visit to an old favorite spot from my days when I lived in Milan, Italy. I used to frequent the Fiori Oscuri location 2/3 times a week.

This location on Madison Ave is a bit of a far cry from the Italian outpost. I was met by a lovely waitress italian girl with a "bowl" haircut. She was super nice and spoke to me in Italian off the bat.

I was sat at the bar and asked me for my drinks. Small bottle water, glass of rose. To eat I ordered a burrata with bresaola. It was all very delicious on my dish included 5 slices of bresaola, 4/5 olives and a tiny burrata ball over a handful of spinach leaves. Here lies my problem. The burrata was half of the size of the burrata I was used to and for $18 I was very disappointed. Rosé by the glass was awful tasting as well $10 .

Ended my meal with a tiramisu $10 which was big but not the best i've had. This is subjective obviously but it was a ramequin with 3 lady fingers on the bottom and then cover with tons if cream. Its not Sant Ambreous tiramisu but its half way there.  

My lunch cost $44 pre tax and tip. Not worth it for the tiny burrata. I'll take my burrata business elsewhere.

The pasta is hard to chew.

The coke must come from some leftover coke bottle.

Ham is really good! And I will give a star for the delicious Italian ham.

Service is 2/5

Obika should be a 5 star place - and although the 3 stars I awarded the place seems to suggest otherwise - it is actually quite close to deserving the full five star treatment.  

Ok, for this one - I'm going to roll out the full, long-ass, Yelp-style "story review."  My story begins when my lovely girlfriend, Kasey, insists I check out the new Mozzarella bar while I'm visiting NY.  She hadn't been there herself, but she had heard some of the hype - and wanted to dine vicariously through me.  Convincing my Italian friends/hosts to stop by a Mozzarella bar was, unsurprisingly, the easy part.  Unfortunately, calling Obika to make reservations was not.  

Finding the correct phone number was complication #1.  Both Yelp and Menupages featured incorrect numbers.  After some moderate to serious web-surfing, though, I finally found the correct number.  Sadly, when I called it - a recording merely informed me that they were not accepting reservations at this time.  Nonetheless, we decided to just head over to the place and try to get a table for dinner.

Unfortunately, it turns out Obika isn't quite open for dinner (at least not on the night we stopped by).  This is complication #2 for those keep track.  However, there were a significant number of homeless people and similarly listless people hanging out in the lobby area that houses Obika.  The only person of any authority around was a woman emptying the trash cans for the building.  So much for dinner at Obika.

Still, we would not to be deterred for long.  Do not tell me we can't have delicious, fresh mozzarella: Yes We Can!  (note: this is my mandatory not so subliminal Obama reference for this review.  Get out and vote bitches!)

So, the next afternoon, my friend Carlo and I returned - and lo and behold - Obika was open, and the homeless folks had moved on - or were otherwise forced to move on.  

Best yet, the food was delicious!  Fantastic salumi - and delicious, creamy, fresh mozzarella.  So why only three stars?  It has nothing to do with the experience the evening before.  Instead, I'm deducting two whole points because the service was just plain stupid.  Our servers were incompetent, slow and generally unhelpful.  One of them kept asking if he could take our salt and pepper even though the place had emptied out and we were still actively eating our food.  Also, when we needed anything (more food, more drinks, our bill) - we'd have to flag down our server twice - once to ask him for something and a second time to remind him of our request.  Both of the servers we encountered just seemed generally slow and unprofessional.  

The place is brand new - so I'm sure they are working out the kinks.  The food is spot on (though a little on the expensive side).  If the servers learn their jobs (or are replaced), this place will be a whole lot better - potentially deserving five stars.

Went here for lunch (Take out) with a work friend.  It's a kiosk inside an atrium next to Niketown.  Yummo!  I had a pannini with prosciutto crudo, fresh mozzarella, arugula and Olive Oil.  Somewhat pricey but the ingredients make it worthwhile.  My sandwich was so fresh and tasty.  I would go back in a heartbeat.
Great staff.  Carlos was excellent and pasta was great, and the mozz was superb!  It was cool to grab a bit here during my biz trip to NYC.  Would go again.

If you really love Mozzarella, and you go to Obika for that reason, then you will NOT leave upset. For $21, I'd suggest the sampler that comes with 3 kinds of Mozz, tomatoes and bread with oil and balsamic.

The Stracciatella, Trecciona, and Burata Mozzarellas are all delicious, adn presented beautifully. The atmosphere is amazing, especially on a nice, snowy day like today.

The Stracciatella is my favorite,it's more of a liquid-y texture, served with a spoon to put on bread, although I could eat this stuff alone. The other two are very smooth and almost creamy, so tasty.

Of course, Obika doesn't offer anything exciting aside from the Mozz, but the Mozz gets them 5 stars. Go here for the Mozz, not paninis because they're nothing special.

This place is a hidden gem. I was surprised. I was trying to find someone near my concert to eat that wasn't super busy and I could relax. Found it. I had verdicchio glass, burrata with truffles , squash soup, salmon salad, and Americano. Everything was super fresh, the atrium is gorgeous and peaceful, the food was quick and delicious. The burrata is the best I have ever had. Nico was my server and he was very nice and respectful.

Def bringing people

I love eateries that focus on one or two things, and do them really well.  Places like Obika, Porchetta or Baoguette are the antithesis of the mega-institutional chain restaurants.

This place got some mega-buzz from eater and midtownlunch, so I took my time to check it out after the buzz subsided somewhat.  They seem to have improved their operations a bit from the critical first impressions, as the service was pretty quick, friendly and helpful.  

The counter is a cornucopia of food porn worthy spread of sandwiches, salads and fresh mozzarella.  I found myself bouncing between the panini's, baguettes and crostini's, staring longingly through the glass display case like a bride-to-be picking out an engagement ring.  

Settling on a simple sandwich of prosciutto and fresh mozzarella, a chocolate/nutella pastry and a glass of homemade grapefruit juice, the total damage ended up being around $16, a bit pricey for the portions received.  However, the flavors were beautifully simple, bold, and satisfying.  It doesn't get simpler than the clean taste of mozzarella, the salt of the prosciutto and crispy bread.  Love it.

Unfortunately, the price range and small portions are way too decadent for an every day lunch spot unless you're on an expense acct.  Worth checking out, but don't expect a bargain.

More Obika Coverage:  midtownlunch.com/categor…

The worst service ever. There is  rats all over. Had to get up and leave the restaurant. It's incredible how a restaurant in Manhattan is so dirty and disgusting the food was cold.  the female manager was disrespectful. would not recommend this place.

Two stars, one star for Mr employee of the month who said the tables are for customers only when I sat down, one for the $10 cold sandwich that had 80% dried up bread and took a layer of the skin in my mouth off from chewing on it.

Great mozzarella bar and they are perfect at what they do best which is mozzarella. I wish other items on the menu were as amazing as their counterparts in Milan. The tomato with basil is good but could be better and the sauce left me feeling that something was missing. Overall a good lunch place to get away from the midtown craze. The location is beautiful - enclosed by glass walls so there is a lot of great light from outside.

Obits has some good foods but they have THE WORST staff working for them.  I'm would never go back.  We ordered lunch and was told we couldn't sit at one of their tables.  We were told we ordered the food to go.  The whole place was empty but we were told to leave after we bought lunch there.  That's really good business.  NEVER!  NEVER AGAIN!!!!!
Coffee was average. Food selection wasn't that good. The corn muffin was dry, the croissant was bland. If you like mozzarella, they're decent for that.

Cannot imagine what the fuss is about. Tomatoes were scattered about a plate, unwashed and some withered with 1/4 full bowl of pesto and some spinach. The mozzarella was tiny, over priced. Service was not friendly... I was told by the only waiter they were 'slammed' so I had to find my own seat amongst the dirty place settings. For $25 at a bar with uncooked appetisers, you can do much better.

I was walking down the street looking for a place to grab lunch. I saw this place and quickly read the yelp reviews on my phone to be sure. I ordered the Spinach salad with chicken, pomegranate and sun dried tomatoes. It was the most mediocre salad I've had in a long time. The spinach wasn't that fresh and had long chewy stems. There was supposed to be balsamic vinaigrette and it had no dressing. The waiter handed me a bottle of balsamic vinegar. I would never go back.

I actually came here about 2 years ago and only just got round to reviewing as I recommended it to a friend visiting NYC. I would 100% go back here. The staff were helpful, funny and friendly towards my sister and I. It was a while back but I know we had a delicious lasagna and one of the salads, both of which were excellent. Not overpriced for its location either. I'll be back if I get the chance!

4/5 as atmosphere a little crowded and loud
The food is fantastic! Buffalo mozzarella is quite difficult to find in the states. Not here! Plenty for everyone. All of it melts in your mouth. Enjoy!!!

Great lunch spot if you like mozarella. We had the classic as well as the buratta with black truffles. On the side we had pomodorini&prosciutto crudo. Everything we had was great although i have had creamier buratta so i would say that was average.

I like the food here, but it's overpriced. It's right by where I work, but they recently changed the menu to make some items more expensive. I like how they have good quality cheese, and real burrata, but I think the portions are quite small for how much they cost. However, the staff is really friendly, available, and helpful. I appreciate how they are good at getting you in and out quickly when you're in a hurry.

Our party of five just enjoyed a delicious, delightful, leisurely lunch at Obica, Madison Ave.  Our group was  large enough to sample a great variety of dishes from the menu, and we found ourselves smacking our lips over each plate sampled, and congratulating ourselves on our choices.  We believe there could be no poor choices here and look forward to another visit  to enjoy what we may have overlooked today!

Met some friends for lunch.  Came here a few times and always enjoyed it.
The pasta and salad are fresh. Pasta portion could be a little bigger. Staff are friendly. Will come back again.

The people who work here can't seem to get it. I ordered a caprese and they could not understand I wanted a salad not a sandwich. I asked for ice water as well and they kept forgetting to bring it to me. When I finally got my food there was a sticker left on my tomato. The food tasted pretty good though.
Great little cafe in NYC. Food is delicious and people-watching is ideal. Everything is very fresh.

Just had the Pollo Rupsante salad and would recommend. I like that they are true to the Italian brand and provide olive oil and balsamic rather than salad dressing. After 4:30 pastries and other items are half off.

I go to Obica every morning for their exceptional coffee and friendly barista! I am quite particular and have not found another coffee shop in all of midtown that compares to the quality and taste, while offering speedy anticipatory "neighborhood feel" service. For me it's always a quick grab & go but they get it perfect every time! The barista and manager are both exceptional as well - always recognizing regulars by name and remembering their orders/preferences to start the day right. I can't say enough good things about Obica and the wonderful team!

I always receive excellent service from management and the barista team at Obicà. I visit pretty much every day before work for my morning coffee and enjoy seeing the staff each morning. They create a fun and welcoming atmosphere for their customers. Obicà has a great food selection for breakfast and lunch when I need something extra to go with my usual coffee order.

We ended up in the midtown east area on a Friday for lunch when there was a mild blizzard outside. I was really surprised at the lack of places to eat in the area considering 5th ave and all the shopping.  I guess when you are really hungry and cold you become desperate for anything. We stumbled into this atrium and checked out the menu. It was a nice open air room with a beautiful snowy sky and tree view. We decided to do the take out because they had more options we were looking for. I opted for a Caprese Panini and the Split Pea soup....it was delicious and really hit the spot. I'd love to come back and try all the options of cheese! I have never seen such a cool idea before!

Food bangin. That big appetizer (pictured), the Octopus, the drinks (2 rounds of Hendricks and tonic, two glasses of white and this mezcal cocktail that was top tier good!) we also had the panna cotta and a delicious affrogatto. Mmmm
Service was also great from the host to our original waiter. But when his shift was over he let us know, we closed our tab with his said goodbye and then we were left with this bad vibes waiter who we didn't particularly care for. After we finished eating he just left all our plates and glassware on the table and a woman who I think was the manager was left to clean it up. She was super cool too. Not him...
Over 3 hrs and $300 plus dollars later we left with full bellies and full hearts at the time spent at this place. Go here!

Got the Bufala DOP pizza which is basically just a margarita pizza. Really good! Nice size, I ate the whole thing. Thin crust, juicy sauce.

Our waiter was hounding us at first about drinking, and finally stopped when I told him we were not planning on drinking. Then our service after was not so great.

A bit expensive for what it was but good food.

I visited Obicà today with an old friend as it was recommended to me. However, we both left feeling hungry :/. I'm writing this review from the point of view of someone who was looking for a nice Italian place with solid portions that wouldn't break the bank. While the food was yummy, the service was friendly and attentive, and and the ambience was lovely, I just felt bummed that I spent a good chunk of cash only to leave hungry.

We ordered the Mozzarella di Buffala, which is Mozzarella made from buffalo milk, which we were informed is a bit healthier and flavorful than cow's milk. I appreciated that they brought a bottle of extra virgin olive oil to the table to add to our cheese. It came with 2 olives, 1 halved cherry tomato, and some spinach. It was quite yummy, but I wish it came with more on the side to fully enjoy the experience and taste the flavors with other sides. It was $15, which I wasn't necessarily mad at, but I found myself wishing for more.

We then decided to split the carbonara, which was delicious, albeit $26 for 9 noodles... which was a tad disappointing. Long story short, this is not a place to share an entree and app with a friend, it's a place where you need to shell out ~$35-50 to feel full (in my opinion). I'd recommend this spot for special occasions or business meals, but I wish the prices were more reflective of the portion size.

3 stars for this place. Food was good but Carbonara = $26 for 8 noodles? Wish the prices were more reflective of portion sizes. May be a fun spot to have an app/drink, quick bite, etc. Probably won't go back and will instead frequent places that you'll get better bang for your buck
Good service and ambiance though

Swung by for an afternoon lunch. Very tasty and just a leisurely lunch in their nice outdoor setup. The mozzarella app tasting platter was a nice opening and my cacio e pepe was super tasty! Nice wine list and overall great service without being overall helicoptering so we could just enjoy our meal. Would definitely revisit to try out more!

Came with some coworkers after work and we ordered way too much food, but it was great.

We started off with two pizzas, a classic margarita which was our favorite and another one that had potato chips on it. I didn't really like that it didn't have sauce. We also shared the mozzarella bar experience and it's perfect for 4-6 people to share as an appetizer.

For my main meal I got the sea bass, but I wouldn't recommend it. It's a very lightly flavored dish and based on the appetizers I had would select something else.

For dessert we shared a flourless chocolate cake and passion fruit pana cotta.

The staff brought the drinks and food very timely and offered recommendations. They had some fun music playing.

It's a nice place to come with friends.
Great pizza and very friendly staff. Can order and get it to go with very little wait

Everything here was fabulous. The food, the wine, the service, it was just *chefs kiss*

My friend and I were in the mood for fresh pasta and wanted to try somewhere neither of us had been before Obicà was the winner. I was shocked at how large the interior of this restaurant is. There's a huge bar and lots of seating options.  

The wine selection here is excellent but nothing compares to this squid ink pasta. The pasta contained shrimp and had a tomato cream sauce with pistachios. Pistachios! Who would have thought they'd taste so amazing on top of pasta. You could beautifully taste each ingredient as the flavors melt together in your mouth. Yum. I'm definitely coming back for this.

Solid restaurant and great for a larger group! The food service was excellent and pivoted well despite us having a large group. The space easily accommodated our group of 8 with ease and we were well spaced away from other groups. The interior was beautiful.

The food was quick and solid. We had an array of dishes but really solid Italian dishes from shareable apps, pizza, and pasta. I would give the pasta dishes high praise because it was the highlight of the food. The cocktails were also really delicious with staples and seasonable options!

Came here for a work dinner with a group of 16 people. Given the size of the party, the reservation was made weeks in advance. In spite of this the restaurant seemed completely unprepared to handle us.
We placed our orders for appetizers and main courses a few minutes after being seated but we waited for 2 HOURS before we saw a single morsel of food. I don't think I've ever waited that long for dinner service but since it was a work event I felt obliged to wait it out with everyone else.
When the food finally did arrive it was cold and underwhelming. Despite the name of this place, the burrata was just okay - many better ones are available in Manhattan.
We also never received and apology or explanation for what caused the delay except "we are having some issues on the kitchen". Every single one of our party left completely disappointed. This is a large space that was built to handle multiple large groups so really not sure why service was so poor !

We have walked in and out of this restaurant a few times over the last few years. Every time we tried the vibe felt off and the attitude seemed a little too high. But ... we decided to finally give this place an actual try and walked in and stayed for a meal.

Boy am I glad we did. First, the place is beautiful. The ambiance is welcoming. It was early, so lots of seating. (5:15 on a Friday.)

Service was stellar. The waitress was knowledgable, personable and attentive, even though we weren't drinking, which always scores well with us. But the back waiter and other staff were on top of their game.

We started off with the bruchette:

Stracciatella, Pan Seared Prawn
and Fried Artichoke

'Nduja Spicy Spreadable Sausage
and Mascarpone

The Stracciatella was delicious. THe 'Nduja was good, but not as good.

I had the SCHIAFFONI with Organic Tomato and Mozzarella

The hubby had the TORTELLONI with Pumpkin, served with
Taleggio DOP Fondue and Amaretti Biscuits

Both were tasty and well portioned.

Then he finished off with the MASCARPONE AND PASSITO CREAM
with Sbrisolona Crunchy Almond Cake

It was a delightful and lovely meal. We were in a little bit of a rush. But will definitely be back.

In town this week for work and we were looking for somewhere that would take a reservation for a group of 10.

Food was fantastic. Drinks were even better. Will definitely be back next time in NYC!

the good:
- manhattan!!
- cuteness factor
- katherinem, our server
- pappardelle al ragu for me
- salmon benedict for her
- a couple of bloody marys!!

the not so good:
- nothing to see here...

This place is big, plenty of seating, make reservations just in case. We got a sampler of all the cheese and it was worth it! Wish we got something to eat with since it was pretty bland after a while to eat it by itself. We got a side of bread which went well with the cheese. Place was pricy but the cheese plate was worth it. It was a lot for 2 people, took most of it home. Def worth a try

The food is good. I like the fried mozzarella a lot ... the fresh mozzarella is really good too.

We sat at the bar and tasted four things including the pumpkin soup. It was all good and we like the ambiance.

They have a fun happy hour from 3:30 to 6:30 when they pop open a magnum of special wine and share it. A great idea to taste something special. Cheers!

We went to Obica with friends after an evening museum crawl nearby and by the time we got there around 9pm we were told kitchen will be closing soon and we won't be able to sit at the table but we can sit at the bar which we did. We later relocated to the window high tables and ordered food before kitchen closes.
We ordered meat plate and burrata. The cheese was good but the meat finished so quickly among the 5 grown men lol. I ordered duck pappardelle which was good but nothing to brag about. The dish I liked the most was arugula and prosciutto pizza. The truffle pizza was fine too but not as good as the arugula one. Baked salmon looked wonderful but I didn't get to try it.
I bet that if you come here with a reservation in advance the experience is completely different so I will definitely give this place another try but I want to sit in the dining room.

Overpriced for what it is. Go to The Smith instead. Bland pasta, mediocre drinks, and waiter couldn't be bothered. We should have taken a hint when it was empty, but felt bad and wanted to try it.

$140 for the brushetta app, 2 pastas (vegetarian), 2 drinks, tip & tax.

We did think the pasta itself was fresh.

Came here for an early dinner after visiting the Harry Potter store across the street. The mozzarella
Dish we had as an app was very good. However the entres were nasty. Not sure who came up with this menu... I ordered the gnocchi dish, which was hard to chew and the composition of the dish was odd and poorly executed, there were walnuts and Gorgonzola and caramelized pears- very sweet pears! The dish tasted like dessert! My daughter ordered the duck ragú dish, which for some reason had an orange zest that overtook the entire plate. Awful selection of flavors that did not work together. We tried to fix it with salt, pepper and Parmesan cheese but nothing could salvage this one. We sent it back and ordered pizza, which also was subpar! The cheese was rubbery and the sauce was flavorless. I would never go here again. The entire experience was disappointing.

Came as a party of 6 around 6 pm on a Thursday night and was able to grab a table right away. We decided to do family style as there were a bunch of dishes we wanted to try. Between the six of us, we got

- Tasting of Mozzarella (4/5): this one was fun! It was cool to try out the different mozzarellas. Definitely overpriced at $40 for three tiny balls, but a fun experience.
- Tasting of Proscuitto
- Octopus (3/5): the sauce didn't go well with the octopus in my opinion. And the octopus was tough, not tender as I hoped
- Foccacia Oregano (1/5): I was hoping for something soft and fluffy. It was hard and crispy and not what I was hoping for
- Foccacia Pomodoro (1/5)
- Tartufo Pizza (4/5): probably the best dish of the night. You could definitely taste the truffle flavor and there was plenty of ham.
- Proscuitto Pizza (2/5): there was a TON of proscuitto on this. I thought it honestly overpowered the taste of the pizza itself, but if you love proscuitto, this might be a good pizza for you
- 'Nudja Pizza (2/5): this was relatively bland as well? There wasn't that much flavor and the sausage was a dollop at the end of the pizza that resembled more of a sauce than what you would associate with a sausage
- Spaghetti Neri (1/5): this was completely bland. Although the noodles were al dente, the sauce had zero flavor. This was a really disappointing dish

All in all, it was a unique experience but likely not one I'd do again. Besides the Tartufo pizza, the food was relatively mediocre and slightly overpriced.
The food seemed wonderful but the service was horrible. We could barely get service. Very rude.

The food was ok, not as elevated as they want to seem. The bread is hard and kind of stale. The ingredients aren't too fresh. It's definitely the type of place where if you aren't ordering a large amount and racking up a bill they want you gone. They also don't let you sit and chat and relax at the end cause they take all your plates and drinks the moment you say you aren't ordering more. Def wouldn't recommend or return.

We stopped in because we were dying of thirst so we hit up the bar area for some refreshments. We had several of their fresh squeezed juices and I would honestly stop in to this place if I was in the area again just to get them. We didn't get any food, so sadly I can't rate them on that, but to us the drinks were worth a shout out.

Every staff member was super courteous and friendly, and it had a nice relaxed vibe.

My party and I came here for the Restaurant Week brunch menu, and I had conflicting opinions about my overall dining experience.

The first item I want to discuss is the bufala dop pizza. I had high expectations, considering that this is a $20 personal pie and this restaurant prides itself on its mozzarella. While the mozzarella was tasty, the overall pizza was bland. Crust didn't hold up too well either.

The other item that we ordered was the gnocchi, which was absolutely delightful. The pesto, crispy cured meat, and the tomato confit blended so well together with the pillowy gnocchi that I wish they upped the portion. Granted, authentic Italian food doesn't serve pasta in heaping portions the way Americanized Italian restaurants do, so this is just me being greedy.

So, I had a bad experience and a good experience, which is why I leave this review at 3 stars. I will note that the staff was nice, and the ambience is exactly what you'd look for in a weekend brunch spot.

Tasty Italian spot with good service! The restaurant is pretty big and sound can echo but our table of 7 got great service. We got a meat/cheese board as an appetizer, a bunch of pizzas and pastas for entrees, and then affogatos and espresso martinis for dessert.

This place has long been on my to try list and i'm glad I finally went! I was in town for a few days to visit friends and went to get dinner on a weekend night.

Crowd was a mix of families, dates, friends - leaning toward a more casual atmosphere.

The venue itself was quite gorgeous. A more casual seating area in front, bar stools, and a more enclosed area in the back, dimly lit etc.

I think the menu has something for everyone - and can easily accomodate a range of personal budgets and dietary preferences. We both had pizzas and they were well made - not burnt and an appropriate serving portion.

this place would easily get 4 stars - except, the waiters would not stop hovering over our table. We were there for maybe 2-3 hours (but the place was not packed, clearly there were several empty tables near us) - and during this time, waiters kept coming by every 20 mins or so even while one of us still had a plate full of food remaining. We were probably interrupted maybe 5-6 times or more. I totally understand that restaurants were looking to turn over tables, but there were clearly empty tables literally right next to us and it's not like we were planning on being there forever. it's been a while since Ive gone out to eat in the city so maybe this is the norm these days - but honestly.. should one literally hold a fork on the dish to signal that the food is still being eaten?

To say I was blown away by this place is an understatement!
The mozzarella is completely authentic and imported from Italy itself, but it's so fresh that tastes like it was made five minutes before they put it in front of you. My husband and I shared the burrata, sausage pie, and the cacio e pepe and loved each dish more than the last. Though the burrata is a little small, you cannot rival its freshness and the zucchini crisps that it comes with are to die for. The sausage pie was probably the best sausage pie I've had in the States and the cacio e pepe was delicious.
We also shared a bottle of wine and were happy to see the show they put on for us while uncorking and pouring (especially since we had ordered such an affordable bottle). Do not sleep on this place- we will definitely be back!

I was going to give 1 star because my experience at the bar while we waited for our table was not pleasant.  However, once we sat at our table, things turned around. Our server was great, very friendly and made good suggestions.  He really knew the menu well.  The bread basket was great with the olive oil side.  The gnocchi was delicious and a good portion.  The tiramisu was a perfect ending.  We all enjoyed our entrees and how quickly we finished our meal.

Food: was lovely. The cheeses were obviously fantastic and the pastas/pizzas were made well with fresh ingredients. A bit on the pricier side, but very lovely.
Ambiance: nice setup with good lighting - great for anything from a date to a birthday.

Honestly a really excellent happy hour with quality wine (like stuff I'd order off the regular wine list, not just a cheap house pour) Italian cocktails, small plates and pizza. We stop by here whenever we're in the area for a glass of something good and a plate of something covered in mozz. Bartenders are always, always super attentive and friendly, and it's never crazy loud or overcrowded like some of the other over-hyped spots in the area. Haven't tried dinner, but we've ordered some small plates off the regular menu and have never been disappointed!

My friends and I decided to go to Obica for our friends birthday dinner. We had made a reservation for a party of five and when we all got there they seated us in their main dining area. The space is large for an Italian American restaurant. I had never heard of it so I was genuinely surprised to see such a spacious restaurant in the flatiron area. When it came time to order I ended up getting a Prosciutto Di Parma Dop Pizza which was topped with mozzarella, tomato, and arugula. A good portion for one person and definitely something you could share with another person too! Even though it was really busy the service here was great and fast. I'd recommend this place for group outings for a seated dinner in a spacious place.

I wish I could say I loved this place, but I can't.  The dishes were all standard Italian dishes, but one a stand our.  Even the prosciutto  was tough.  The mozzarella, particularly the buffalo was good.  Service was fine and the wine menu was decent.

The appetizer is very good and the lasagna
is very good
Tiramisu is a must for dessert with a cup of coffee
The atmosphere is very nice and the servers are
very attentive
By the way the expreso martinis is delicious drink

Amazing Italian Flavors, with warm and masterful New York service. I had the warm and savory Potato Gnocchi with a cool and Refreshing Paradiso Cocktail, and it was the solution my rumbling stomach needed after it struggled to recover from a suspicious work conference sandwich that troubled me earlier in the day.

The rudest and most unprofessional experience. We had a large table so I dont think the server knew the tip was guaranteed. Our server comes up and when we look at the menu, he tells us in a rude and snippy manner "I will take our order later and all at the same time appetizers and main course." We were surprised as we wanted to order appetizers and then decide on the main course.  Bizzare as that was, the food portions were small, service extremely poor and of course the server got an item wrong in the group order. The right dish again took 20 to 25 minutes to arrive. A very disappointing experience and cannot recommend this place at all. We had people visiting from Switzerland and Israel but the bad service with bad food really was embarrasing.

Amazing spot for dinner. The food is amazing. The Margherita pizza was so simple but my favorite item. The sauce and crust was so good but the cheese was the star of the show. Great atmosphere and decor.  A great place to bring a friend.

I found this restaurant via a food app in NYC and decided to give it a try with some girlfriends. We had 7:30pm reservations on a Tuesday night. It was an unbearably hot night in NYC, so I called ahead earlier that day to make sure we could get a table of 4 for inside. They said no problem and that they made the note.

I arrived first at 6:25, and the host said I couldn't sit down until my entire party was here. Annoying, but a lot of restaurants in NY do that, so I understood. The rest of my group trickled in over the next 5 minutes, and we were ready to go at 7:35. The host said that there were no available tables (even though the entire back of the restaurant was empty), but there was one finishing up. He asked if we wouldn't mind waiting 10 minutes at the bar. We ordered a round of martinis and margaritas while we waited, and the bartender took FOREVER to make the drinks. We asked for 3 dirty martinis and 1 margarita, and he gave us 4 martinis instead....after almost 20 min.

Once we finally got our drinks, it was nearly 8:00...30 min past our reservation time. While we were sitting there, we noticed that the host had sat parties of 4-6 immediately when they walked in, but he hadn't notified us that our table was ready yet. My friend went up to him and asked why we hadn't been seated after 30 min, and he sat us right away. No apology.

Then, by the time we sat down, we were ready for another round. The bartender literally took another 20 minutes to get our drinks! We put in some apps for the table- bruschetta, mozzarella platter, truffle pizza- and later, our main courses.

The food was average, to be honest. Our waitress was hardly present, and she forgot to put the truffle pizza in. There was no apology or comped app, and we wanted the pizza regardless, so they ended up bringing it after we had already finished our main meals. It was not good. It was flavorless and all the toppings fell off because it was so hot.

From the host to the bartender to the waitress, service was pretty horrible. The food did not make up for the poor service, and I probably won't be back.
I need to try some other dishes!  Great open bar and enjoyed my seafood linguini.  Service was enthusiastic making a return visit a must.

One of the more fancier places so get your wallet ready!

It's well worth the price. The food blew me away, I felt rich after eating here! I went back the next day to eat it was so good! You can call ahead for reservations too.

Nice little bar area, the Italian bourbon is surprisingly good. Even the sparkling water is amazing.

I had the pumpkin ravioli, a couple of mozzarella salads, and some truffle ham pizza.

If I ever go back to the city, I'm most definitely stopping here again.

Hands down this restaurant gave me so much confidence after eating here.

Nice people but the service was really slow, the mozzarella was flavorless and the bread was stale.   Stale bread makes me want to throw a chair across the room.

We only ordered salads.  We sat there for 40 minutes with our thumbs up or a**, and still the salads never arrived.  We paid for the stale crap, and left.

AMAZING is the word to describe.  We must have had 4 different servers and people checking on us. If you have visited Milan then you know it's impossible to get the same quality in US.  Somehow they figured this out.  The bread from the pizza melts when you eat it. It tastes like the pizza I have had in Florence. No stuffed feeling and the pizza is NOTHING like nyc pizza. Not tough or chewy at all. Warm veggie salad with chicken. gnocco frito and antipasto was a hit. Wish I had taken more photos meal service and ambiance 5 stars.

Disappointed.
The bread was old. The salad was not properly seasoned. Stuff is nice but not very enthusiastic. The food is mediocre and bellow. Unfortunately for me and my company and our night off. Definitely not coming back.

I still do not understand why this place has only 3.5 stars on yelp... I randomly stopped here for a small bite with my husband in the middle of the day and the food, wine and service was amazing!! I don't eat meat and I had this grilled veggies and a smoky burrata (btw it is was to die for... similar of what I had in Italy) My husband had the Casper with pecorino pasta and he loved it... I can see the service not being that good whenever it is crowed but it was definitely worth stopping here for a quick bit and great wine The manager was really friendly and thoughtful The bartender was not that friendly but the service was good I cannot complain. I will definitely come back whenever I am in the area.
Decent, but not satisfying enough to go there on purpose. I ordered Pappardelle and the lemon stripes in it was devastating to the taste. The duck rugs was also uninteresting.

I've lived in NYC for over 20 years. My father and his girlfriend were visiting and wanted us to eat at this restaurant for a Sunday dinner. They had a lovely time there the day before and so wanted to give it another go.

It went off the rails from there. First off this is a corporate restaurant. So don't expect the love and care you get from independently owned restaurants.

Midway through the meal, I asked for an old fashioned. I asked what kind of bourbon they had. The waiter didn't know and asked me to pick one from their drink menu. There were about 10 options with no pricing. So I picked the second one listed, assuming it would be one of the normally priced items. At no point did the waiter approach us and say the the bourbon I ordered would cost $50 MORE THAN A REGULAR BOURBON.

After the meal and discovering this on the receipt, we placed calls with the restaurant manager and emails to the company about how we felt taken advantage of by this deceptive pricing. Their response was too bad. I know customer service has been weaker across the country, but overcharging and not explaining what we're paying for is malpractice. A simple we're sorry and let's try to find away to make you comfortable would have sufficed. Instead they chose to pick a fight and say we were stupid for ordering it.

If you value your money don't go here. If you want a fair priced meal don't go here. If you want good service, this is not the place. It's as coldly corporate in the restaurant as it is in their office.

The staff is super nice and very attentive. The food is delicious, the burrata melts in your mouth and the food was all amazing. Each wine tastes delicious! There is only 1 bathroom, which is definitely a downfall.

Newbie bartender gave my credit card to other tab,

3 bartenders talked for 10-15 mins after I asked check, later I said can I just pay I need to go.

One guy goes sorry he gave your credit card to other people but we will not charge you. Hello? Thanks for making me wait when y'all know you lost my credit card and duh you are not suppose to charge if you lost your customer's credit card, you are not doing me a favor. Instead you should compensate me.

No apology, they scattered, rude.

Will never return.

Came here for their weekday lunch special - $21 for 2 courses. No reservation was required, the place was about 1/3 full when we got there. Variety of options were available under the lunch special. I opted for their polpette (meatballs) and eggplant parma. My colleague went for the mozzarella ball and pesto lasagne. Bread was provided whilst we waited.

I enjoyed the polpette - it was freshly fried, sauce to the side so it stayed crunchy. Likewise with the eggplant Parma as well. It tasted homely and was quite enjoyable to eat.

All in all it was $27 with tax and tip. Wouldn't do it every week but will definitely go for a treat every now and then!

Definitely an awkward setting, almost seems like no one really planned the decor and just set chairs and tables everywhere. Some real bar tables at the entrance then along bar that sits on the side Kewadin to a room with tables spread around and then some more tables on the run behind.
The food is ok we papaste but lacking a bit of Flavor, for instance i had a duck ragú pasta that the No sauce at all...
The pizza was better though.
Service is soft...
I simply can not recommend it because they do not live expectation to the prices they charge

Seven stars if I could. The dining experience for brunch took me back to Italy, the pizza at Obica is why you'd travel to the gastronomic center of the universe. Obica has locations all over Italy, and it seems that the tradition carried over nicely to New York.

Exceptional staff, airy decor, and the fresh flavors you can only appreciate if you've had modern Italian cuisine is what makes the place one of the few places in NYC I'd care to return to.

Not that much to say
Stay away
From food to service
I know are difficult times but
Also
I understand
If you sit down you expect
Some sort of service
I dont want to offend anyone
But its a.scam
From start to finish
One star for the
Dessert sampler

This family-run French kitchen is located on 29th Street in Chelsea, nestled between 8th and 7th avenues. They specialize in serving traditional and beloved French dishes.

The restaurant boasts a spacious and pristine atmosphere. I particularly appreciate their sporty vibe and modern design. Additionally, they have a shop next door that offers an array of French goodies.

Taking advantage of the pleasant June weather, we opted to dine alfresco. To start, we indulged in a nice bottle of Chardonnay, accompanied by appetizers of Escargots de Bourgogne: French snails from Burgundy baked in blend of parsley, garlic, and butter, and Paté de Campagne Maison: a homemade country paté served with cornichons. Both dishes were complemented by warm, homemade bread. When we requested more bread, our waiter gladly obliged, earning them an extra star in our book.

For our main course, we decided to share the Pâte au crevettes: fettuccine with a savory combination of butter, shrimp, and garlic, as well as the Poulet façon monsieur Georges: chicken breast marinated in thyme and rosemary, served with fingerling potatoes, string beans, and a creamy mushroom sauce. My partner found the chicken dish to be cooked to perfection.

To conclude our meal, we indulged in the Cheesecake Maison: a homemade cheesecake served with a raspberry coulis. While we thoroughly enjoyed all the dishes we ordered, the standout feature of this dining experience was the exceptional customer service. We wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone seeking a memorable culinary experience.

The vibe is definitely different than I expected. It has more of a modern vibe, with high metal tables, instead of a more homey-French look. It was pretty empty on a Saturday night, so I wouldn't worry about having a reservation. Staff are very attentive.

Escargot ($17) - probably about 6 pieces, already de-shelled. Tasted fantastic and a lot of butter. They gave us two baskets of fresh bread, still piping hot, which was a nice touch.

Foie Gras ($25) - tasted good, with a decent amount of foie gras. Served with a small salad.

Risotto ($28) - mushroom risotto with truffle oil, carrots, leeks, and Parmesan. This was overall pretty disappointing given the price point. Didn't taste much truffle and the leeks were a tad hard to chew. They were quite overwhelming. The huge chips of Parmesan on top were great though.

Definitely on the pricier side, but the food tasted authentic. The menu is pretty small, so definitely make sure you know what you're going to get. Seems like they have daily specials that aren't on the menu as well.

Petite soirée en famille très sympa juste en face de notre hôtel !
Notre petit chien a été accepté en terrasse ! On a passé un trop bon moment.

I was looking for an authentic French restaurant. This come up from the search.  I like this place because seating is spacious and comfortable.  Food is good.   Foie gras tastes really good to me but no everyone can appreciate the strong taste.  The salmon cook perfectly but I like to be a little salty.  Carbonara is fresh.  Everything is good   Likely I will come back for another round

Lunch at OCabonon was one of my birthday restaurant outings. Laura & I had a grand time eating excellent French cuisine. The menu is quite limited in their offerings. We both had escargots sopping up the juices with pieces of bread. Laura chose the wild boar daube with mashed potatoes. I had the skate served also with mashed potatoes and sautéed multicolored. beans. We drank glasses of rose champagne. Crème brûlée was a dessert that we shared.

Service here was pleasant. This restaurant means a shed in French and it looked liked one. On one side is also a boutique with everything from books, table linen, yogurts and tins of chocolate all from France. On the other side is a large room with rows of assorted wines. The unisex restroom has an old fashioned weighing machine more for decoration.

No customer service!   Terrible environment!

I came with 20 people.   We were in their party room upstairs.  We've been coming to this location every other month for years.  It's never been for the food.  The french fries are always burnt.   I've had an undercooked risotto and a different time, a dry,  overcooked chicken.  Deserts are nothing special.   As an amateur baker, I can make much better french patisserie at home.  

This time,  I ordered foie gras.  All of us ordered between 7:40 and 8:00.  Everyone got their appetizers,  and soups,  still nothing.  Then my friends got their entrees, nada.  I asked the staff to check for my order,  no response.   My friends were finishing up and I asked again, I also asked for the manager and 10 minutes later,  again.  The food came after 9:00 and then the manager followed soon after.   He did not apologize but made an excuse about a busy kitchen.  My dish didn't require cooking so this was a bad excuse.  Then the manager showed me that the order didn't come to the kitchen until 8:50.  I ordered it an hour earlier, Still no apology.  

This place is terrible.   Our group has gotten considerably smaller because people won't come back.  Half grumble about the food EVERY time.
Came in for a quick lunch. Escargot, soup, quiche Lorraine, Niçoise salad. Washed down with a glass of Sauvignon blanc. Perfect lunch!

4.75 stars for great food but only a few shortcomings; will round up either way. Came on a weeknight without much expectations. There was plenty of seating but the restaurant did fill up. The service was a bit on the slower side but very friendly. We did not have a late reservation but they did run out of one of the night specials - Chilean Sea Bass. Only one of us at the table could order it.

1. Escargot - Delicious buttery pesto sauce. The escargot came out smoking hot just as it should. The bread at this restaurant is 5 stars!

2. French onion soup - Average. I'd rate 3.75/5. Nothing too special here.

3. Chilean sea bass - Tender, juicy, flavorful! Not overly fishy or salty at all. Came on a mushroom risotto which was cheesy just the way I like it.

4. Complimentary macarons - Blueberry. Not too sweet. Perfect crunch and texture!

Overall, a pricy but enjoyable night with slow steady service. We were happy we were not rushed out! They do run out of food items so come early. I would come here again.
Try to get to this spot whenever near Penn Station after a show. Nice wines and good fish entrees. Our guests always love it too!

I came here for a one year old birthday party on the upper level which was so nice. The food was fantastic from the tuna tartare, the sliders, the charcuterie board and more. The service was incredible and everyone was so nice. They had cute i love wine pins and stickers for the customers. The best thing is I found a parking spot down the block which is so hard to find in Manhattan on a Saturday night. The service was to die for and the place was so cozy. I would definitely recommend for a date night or wine night with the ladies.

Tres French and tres magnifique. Chelsea is blessed with an authentic French wine bar l/ restaurant and shop. It's been rough without tourist traffic, but this place ensures and offers an experience that feels authenticity French.
We went Friday and ordered:
Fab Franc
Mendoc/ Bordeaux
Cheese plate
The wines were top notch and since I liked my friends wine so much, he bought me a bottle next door at the shop. The cheese plate was superb. There was one from Lyon and one from America that were exceptional paired with a warm baguette- French heaven in Chelsea.

Nothing but positive things to say about this place!

The food was fantastic, fresh and hearty.

Their onion soup was superb and as authentic as it gets.

Their salad was also surprisingly filling, and I tasted a bit of their chicken with the mushroom sauce and thought it was phenomenal.

Very pleasantly surprised with this place, and am eager to come back.

Great wine selection and playlist/music, by the way!

We had lunch here with friend we hadn't seen in over a year and ended up staying for over two hours catching up.  Ambience conducive to conversation, all three of our meals were fabulous, wine selection great and the service was excellent.  wonderful experience from start to finish.

Nice ambiance. Good staff but the food was awful when we came for lunch. The croque monsieur was cold in the middle. The tarte tatin was mediocre at best. I've lived in France and am married to a French person so I am very familiar with what French food should be like and this wasn't it. Really disappointed. Was hoping this was going to become my new local go to.
Delicious food, good wine, cozy atmosphere and great service. Would recommend the Quiche.

I have never really been able to experience a lot of French food especially in New York but was excited to try out OCabanon when my friends suggested it.

We arrived on a Sunday night around 7:30 or 8 PM. The restaurant wasn't too busy and we had a nice amount of space to ourselves as a group of six.

We ordered at few appetizer platters to share and wow they were so impressive. Great flavor, choices and presentation. For dinner I ordered the risotto and the flavor was wonderfully nice, moist and creamy. It just got a bit too heavy for me towards the end of the meal.

One of my friends got their roasted chicken and I believe that is definitely a must order item - lots of well seasoned and juicy chicken meat to chow down on.

Since I checked in on yelp I was able to receive a cup of cappuccino and it was just a great way to end the meal.

All in all, even though I don't have much experience with French restaurants I found it to be a wonderful dinning experience. My French friend who we went as well complimented the restaurant highly and stated how it just served delicious, non pretentious  food.

Restaurant is nice. Close to the Garden and Penn. Inside is interesting decor. Chairs are very uncomfortable. One table of our party of 10 was wobbly but server found a shim. Service was pretty good, they definitely tried and that was great.

The apps and sides were INCREDIBLE. the entrees were "ok". We ordered one of every side, seasoned well. There was a cassoulet special that was better than ok. Mussels special was good, super salty. The cheese plate for five was good too. The 1/2 chicken was really dry, ratatouille side was really good, but couldn't save the dish. Salmon was served with lemon in cheese cloth but was otherwise unappetizing.  The potatoes au gratin with the steak were "good".

Close to four stars, but three stars "ain't bad" either. For the price, it was still a decent deal in a great setting.

This actually deserves to be downgraded more to a three and a half star review than four. But, I chose to go up to four. Not entirely sure why.

We had another wonderful dinner at OCabanon. The food was delightful.

I had the Filet Mignon, cooked medium rare. Jayson had the Foie Gras and the Duck Confit salad, two of his favorite foods.

As we had a show to catch, this was really just a pop in for a quick date night dinner at one of our favorite finds.

Here's why I dropped my original rating to 3 1/2 to four stars -- and really it's for the same reason I should probably have gone with four stars originally since my issue is primarily the same one, and one that seems to be consistent with this place -- I felt both times that we were made to feel less than welcome when we were seated, and almost forgotten about after we got our table.

This time it was relatively early, and the place was empty. First they seemed to scoff that we didn't have a reservation. (Again, it was pretty empty, and barely half full when we left an hour later.) We asked to sit at a table in the back room, which is far cozier, which was completely empty, and they wanted to sit us at the two top (the entire room was mostly two tops) that was immediate in front of the server stand, where a server was on his knees getting things out of the cupboard below the register. Why would we want to sit at a table in an empty room where the servers would be bumping into our back, and where there was currently a server getting plates and things out of?

Then we got seated. And, much like the first time, it just felt like we were forgotten. I hope it's not because we don't drink. Huge pet peeve.

Also I was a bit annoyed that my husband asked TWICE if the duck confit had bones and our server assured him it did not. Then it came out and it had bones. He didn't want to complain. But he HATES food on bones. This could have been avoided.

That said, the food is sensational, and it's darling spot, which works well for out with friends (in the front) or more of a romantic night out with your honey (in the back.)

Just wish they seemed treated their guests like they mattered a little more. As a result it's gone from my can't wait to get back to list to my if we're near there, maybe, possibly, we might again. It's no longer a front runner.

Came here for an early dinner before a show at MSG.  We had a Pulsd voucher so shared an appetizer, dessert, and a bottle of wine plus our own entrees.  First our server, Ximena, was so welcoming.  She explained everything that came with the voucher and helped with suggestions.  Throughout the meal she checked on us and made sure we had everything we needed.  She definitely made it not only a pleasant experience but made us feel kind of like VIPs.
Now for the food.  We started with French Onion Soup.  It was flavorful and delicious.  Sometimes the soup itself can be bland with people relying on the cheese for flavor but not here.  We both got the chicken dish.  I switched out the potato for Gratin Dauphinois which was excellent.  I tried the fingerling potatoes which were great too.  The chicken was so moist and perfectly cooked and the sauce was heavenly.  My wife never finishes a meal, and this was a generous serving, but she ate every last bit!  I wished I had taken a before and after photo.  We finished with the profiteroles.  They were kind enough to split them into 2 dishes (without us asking) so we could properly enjoy them.  Needless to say they were a perfect ending to a perfect meal.
We will definitely be back here.  The food and experience were all you could hope for.  They are also in a perfect location if you are going to Madison Square Garden.

I was looking forward to trying this restaurant and visiting the shop next door. We were a bit disappointed. We were there for an early dinner on Saturday. The menu was not the same as was online. We were told the website hasn't been updated in awhile. The only fish option that was on the current menu wasn't available. The escargot was very good but our dinners were underwhelming. We asked for coffee with our dessert and we were told they ran out of coffee.

The shop next door was cute and had some nice French items. With so many choices in this area we were disappointed that our choice didn't live up to the current yelp rating.

This place is super cute for a catch-up with friends. Met my girls here and I noticed some people couldn't figure out the entrance. It can be hidden so keep a lookout when you arrive. It gives a sleek, lounger's paradise feel. Happy hour specials only apply at the bar. Plenty of high-top tables with an area in the back, to the left, for regular tables and seats.

Prices are a bit steep. Ordered a bottle of chardonnay ($50) and salmon as my entree ($29). The food came out at a good time so I know they took time to cook it. My salmon came with a variety of vegetables (asparagus, broccoli and carrots, with a side of mashed potatoes. Anyone who knows me, knows I LOVE mashed potatoes. The meal was good. Not overly salted and seasoned just right. Cleaned my plate in an instant. Service is attentive without being overbearing so we were able to catch up nicely. Cute spot for dinner or just munchies.

Thankfully we had 5:30pm reservations for a Thursday evening because the place was packed. Being the location it is, I had a feeling that would be the situation between drawing from the MSG crowd and those looking for a quick bite after work.

I was impressed with the space. Very cute and much roomier than expected as they have additional space in the back which lends itself to a whole other room. Yes still very intimate if that makes sense. The staff were helpful and charming with their French accents. I appreciated we got to sample each glass of wine prior to committing.

As for the food I feel this was user error. Instead of sharing French staples we enjoy such as the pate, escargot, mussels and so forth we split their tapas plate thinking great... chef selection of 5 tapas taking the brainwork out of it. Needless to say we were disappointed. It was heavy bread based and not that flavorful. The croque monsieur was dry and even the salmon beet crostini tasted more crostini than anything else. Same for the lobster flatbread. Felt dry and just like eating dough with limited topping. As mentioned we didn't order the way we should have to our liking. I wouldn't discriminate coming back here. I was tempted to give this place 3 stars but because we ordered in the way we did it but deserves the 4 starts due to menu selection, establishment and staff. Would definitely check out again next time in the area.
Great food and service. David, the jack of all trades, suggested the wines for our escargot and then our risotto dish. I cannot wait to return.
phenomenal.  excellent escar and risotto! server David was knowledgeable and it was a wonderful experience

Great pre-MSG meal without the mad rush or fanfare. I'm not the biggest connoisseur of French food, but this place will convert you.

Great dishes, sizes and prices - wines were great too. Bonus: they have a shop with French delicacies and goodies next door.

Excellent evening... We had the pleasure of attending a private party here and everything was just wonderful. Upon arrival our drink orders were taken while we mingled with the other guests we were served an array of wonderful hors d'oeuvres... Meats, cheeses, fresh bread, foie Gras on toasted baguettes, little shots of gazpacho, and many other tasty bites... They had many varieties of cocktails, wines, champagnes, juices, and we had a cappuccino too! It was a wonderful evening. I would love to return for dinner sometime.

I live close to this restaurant and finally decided to check it out. They have outdoor seating and also seating in the little store next door which happens to be a French grocery store. The inside kind of has  a railway layout with a couple of high tables at the back and by the bar. However I was pleased to discover as I was leaving that there's a bigger dining area to the side of the back. Now to the food:

I would say this place definitely feels authentic. ( most of the waiters are French and a couple of French people were there for dinner). What drew me were the thick cut fries, however they don't make those anymore because of complaints from the tenants upstairs so that was a bummer.

I ended up ordering the smoked salmon salad. The portion of smoked salmon was definitely filling and the salad was very delicious- just some mixed greens, tomatoes and mangoes with a light dressing. I found the proportions to be perfect, I got a hint of onion in the salad but there were no actual onions, which I thought was genius.

The food came out about 5 minutes after I ordered. The waiter was attentive and nice. Food was delicious, forgot to add that it came with some sour dough bread. Very delicious, I would definitely be back to try other items on the menu.

We came here on a Tuesday evening. It was very quiet, just two other tables taken. Sat outside and were greeted promptly by the only server.
We ordered the foie gras terrine to start: it took a long time before we got it, and it didn't have much taste, it was quite bland and the figs had a bitter taste.
My main dish was a special of the day, which also took a while to reach our table. It was the gnocchi with a mushroom creamy sauce with spinach and Parmesan cheese. It was ok. The gnocchi were of the "slightly pan fried" variety rather than the fluffy and tender Italian type. The sauce was fine, creamy, but nothing to write home about.
My husband decided to have an appetizer as his main, and had the tuna tartar. It tasted nice and was fresh.
The server was very attentive and polite, who made sure we always had bread and water glasses filled, without interrupting us too much.
We paid about $100 for two appetizers and one dish, and no drinks. Considering that the food was either "just ok" or tasteless, price seemed too high for what we ate.
Would not recommend.

Love this spot! Walked past on a late Sunday afternoon, and I'm glad we stopped by. We dined at the bar and our experience was great. If you check in, you get a free coffee, so be sure to do that. The service was exceptional and our food came out quick. I'd personally recommend the Risotto. It was so flavorful and filling. Glad our waiter suggested it. My cousin really enjoy the homemade pasta w/ shrimp.

A lot of great options on the menu. I'd definitely return. Be sure to check them out! There are great seating options- outdoor, inside, and apparently in the back as well.

Had a very good meal here. The service was wonderful!! Our server was so sweet and brought over markers and paper for my daughter to color on. She was thrilled. Plus she gave us some extra avocado for my daughter to eat and didn't charge us. That was very nice of her!!!!

It's a cute restaurant with a little shop attached. We didn't check out the shop this time, but hopefully we'll get a chance in the future. We sat in the back and it was very comfortable. Nice decor. Little dark but you can see well.

The food was superb! I forget what it was called but my dish had white beans, duck, sausage, pork belly and I think one more meat. Delicious!! And we got this great bread when the good came out. It was warm and a little crunchy. So good! My friend ordered a burger. She said it was good.

So many thing on the menu intrigued us. The menu has changed so some of the images of dessert you see here on yelp are no longer available which is disappointing but there's still so much good stuff.

For dessert we got coffee and these little shot glasses with different types of mousse. Amazing! And it was the perfect amount for two people.

Definitely recommend and plan to return
great place with great foood. lots of good workers and a super nice owner that provides a great ambiance with great food all around.

I only grabbed drinks here for happy hour, but I was very pleased with their wine happy hour menu (red, white, rose, sparkling and sangria). Wines were $7 and seemed to change daily (or weekly). I had a French Sauv Blanc and it was very tasty. For reds, they offered a (red) Burgundy. Pretty legit wine selection for $7/glass.

The place itself is adorable, it's very 'wine bar like' and reminds me of being in Santa Barbara or a wine region of Europe. I would expect a place like this at or outside of an actual vineyard. Very authentic. (They had a little gift shop area and an area where it looks like they do private events which is always an A+ in my book).

I didn't eat here, but it smelled really yummy and it's close to my offices, so I will definitely be back! Price seemed very reasonable overall!

My friends and I ate here again.  The proximity to MSG is one reason but the food is definitely a draw as well.  This time I tried the hamburger which is stuffed with bacon and short ribs.  It was really wonderful.  The French fries were nice as well.  Due to the blackout at the JLo concert, we ended up going back there while cabs were at a minimum and the subway was closed.  We had drinks and snacks.  The fries were especially good once again and service was friendly and great.  It will continue to be a go-to place for myself and my friends.

On a Saturday afternoon, circa 4, I decided to drop by this place for a quick snack (and depending on the menu), dinner.

Besides just being happy about being indoors in the very cold NYC weather, I was even more excited about the 'happy hour' sign outside the place as well.

I stepped in, and found myself the only patron at the place. Also, there was only one person on staff for me to be wined and dined with, the bartender. Later, I would see many more staff coming from the upper level (I think they were having a staff meeting).

After seating myself at the bar, the bartender kindly shared both the happy hour menu and the regular menu. After looking at the menu and happy hour menu, I decided to go with a glass of red wine (Cabernet Sauvignon) and oysters off the happy hour menu.

I got my order in promptly, and munched on the oysters (which were pretty fresh, and had a very good taste). The wine was nice too.

Notably, I found the regular the menu lacking in 'affordable' options (average entree looked to be about $24 a plate).

Overall, it was a decent experience. The staff was very nice. But I don't think I'd be back there to dine if not for happy hour.

The Quick: Cute spot for happy hour with great food. Menu online is outdated and they often run out of things. Location kind of out of the way, great for Penn commuters

The Details: The Brie with black truffle-- have you ever heard something so beautiful? Really warm and intimate place that still manages to be big enough for plenty of happy hour goers. Steak was cooked perfectly and the wine options are limitless. Nice spot.

The Damage: $150ish for two glasses of wine total and dinner for two

I was looking for a place near MSG for a meal before an event and found this place. Not too many people when we came in around 5pm but definitely started to pick up around 6:30-7pm.

The food was decent. Onion soup was tasty and great to dip bread into. The rack of lamb was cooked the perfect medium. The presentation was also overall good, although the asparagus with the lamb could have been placed a bit better on the plate.

Atmosphere perfect for dinner with a friend or a date. Wish the candle on the tables were real and not plastic. The place makes it like you're in a basement cellar, which I believe is the intended feel. Shelves on the wall are lined with bottles of wine, and there's some old decorations like a giant map and old-fashioned scale by the restrooms.

Service was great. I tend to drink a lot of water, and our waiter constantly came over to refill the glass.

Will likely stop by again for another meal if I'm in the area

A great option for a bite before a show at MSG or after a day of traveling.  I would definitely recommend getting the Tapas plate which is a chef selection of 5 tapas.  The portions are generous and it's great for sharing!  I also love the risotto, which is made with mushrooms, truffle oil, leeks, and parmesan - very flavorful and comforting.  The salmon is solid as well: cooked rare and served with roasted veggies and mashed potatoes; it's a good traditional option.  The Saucisson chocolate is the must-try, though: literally a chocolate sausage!

Prices are on-par with the area at ~$25-30 for an entree, $10 for a dessert, and $16-19 for the tapas sampler depending on how many are in your party.

Because I liked the place so much from my birthday dinner here with my best friend just a week or so ago, I decided to introduce the place to my husband for date night last night.
It started so promising. Spoke to Cedric on the phone who said they were booked but encouraged us to walk in and he will find us a table. That he did, initially was gonna sit us by the right side/store but in a second he decided to give us a better table at the back, where the wine shelves are. We appreciated that.

Amadeus or Amadieu was our server and at first he actually was nice and attentive. From placing our orders to serving our starters (Brie Truffle), it went okay. The bottle of Merlot was also nice. Then service took progressively longer from there. After waiting for 15-20 mins for the appetizer to be cleared, our almost cold Filet Mignon were served. They also didn't cook it right. Medium went to me (what my husband requested) and he had the Medium Rare (what I requested), so to not make a fuss anymore, we decided to just exchange our steaks. It was also not medium rare, it was bordering rare. Anyhow we didn't want it to affect the rest of our night so we just decided to enjoy our bottle of wine. 35-40 mins after, our server has somehow forgotten us while checking on everyone else and chatting with coworkers so after 45 mins we just decided to call his attention for the check, intentionally skipping dessert that's actually included.

I regret praising this place and introducing it to my husband as my new favorite restaurant. Despite the lackluster and very disappointing experience, we left a 20% tip. Very sad how I thought this would have been a place to bring more family members and friends. Huge letdown.

Came here through a Pulsd discount and I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. We got the Brie as the appetizer with steak as the main.

The Brie was absolutely amazing. Incredibly tasty and we kept on asking for second and third of the bread just to have more. It was cooked to the point where we still got to enjoy the tasty top.

The steak was also cooked to perfection. The potatoes on the side were also incredible. Lastly, they have this type of steak sauce that paired amazingly with the actual meat.

Overall, this was a great experience and I'm happy I was able to find this diamond in the rough. Would definitely be back!

Wow!!! What a burger...the OCabanon burger!!!

Authentic French cuisine and great bar close to Penn Station but away from the riff raff
