I've been here twice both times were amazing!

Staff: I honestly think this is the most attentive wait staff I've experienced in NYC. When they were packed the first time, nothing but check ins. When I got a PULSD- still attentive.
When I see this I'm not saying it lightly or just to be nice. Our water was always refilled, our wine was always refilled; and we were asked how we were and given a cute bon appetit. A napkin was slightly out of place, and my other party stood up, so someone sweetly folded it and gave me a smile.

Food: It's was completely full of flavor, right down to the veggies. I am someone who over seasons, my partner under seasons- we were both completely satisfied and didn't need anything. I'm the queen of needing a1 or hot sauce, not at all in this case.

Ambience: I do love to complain about music, I'll admit- however in this case it was nice. They didn't do French; but it was quiet and along with the vibe of modern French in NYC. The lights dim more at 7-ish, which is a nice switchover.  

Don't think twice about coming here/buying the pulsd. The price is worth it. BE SURE YOU TIP WELL! They more than deserve it!

We had the burger along with the tuna tartare! All with great flavors...The burger meat was cooked to perfection at medium.  Kudos to the chef!  Also, our waiter was fantastic! We didn't get his name, but he was working yesterday around 11:30 am.  He was one of two waiters --while we were frequenting the restaurants in NY over the last week-- who actually cared about providing great service -Thank you! It was worth my time to write a review.

We ate here last night and had a fantastic time! We were in the south of France this summer and were missing the cuisine. OCabanon delivered!  First off, the place is gorgeous and so spacious yet cozy.  The owners are super welcoming and Diana took excellent care of us all night and accommodated all my requests.  The food was so delish and fresh--huge menu so we will need to return soon to try other dishes.  Really love it here.

Ate here again last night and as always, has a wonderful time.  Food is so delish and everything comes out beautifully plated.  The owner is friendly and welcoming. Our server Andres was excellent and we had a wonderful conversation! Will be back!

I'm torn between a 3 and a 2

Thursday night at 9:30
Sat at bar
Service: fine
Ambience: nice
Cocktails: fine
Tuna tartare: yummy
Mussels: plentiful, but the broth tasted strongly of rosemary--nothing else
Fries: tepid and limp
French onion soup: looked great, but NO
FLAVOR--I added salt and pepper, but it was just bland

Two drinks, an appetizer, soup, and mussels entree came to $100 with tip, so fairly expensive for mostly disappointing food.  (If it had been less expensive I'd have awarded 3 stars.)

Went here with my co-workers and loved everything we ordered! Last minute pick by my team but was worth every second!

The place was very aesthetic, wish I took a picture of their beautiful artwork all around the restaurant, definitely a chill vibe for a relaxing lunch.

In the back room they had an amazing wine wall! My co-worker had fun looking up all the wines through that vivino app haha.

Now for the food? Amazing all around. I went very conservative, choosing a salmon burger with home fries. I never had a salmon burger, so I was definitely looking forward to it. And it didn't disappoint! Only thing recall being cumbersome was that the burger couldn't hold the avocados.The fries were not deep fried! They were broiled or something of that nature, definitely would've wanted some deep fried goodness but potatoes are always great.

Last but definitely not the least (the most if anything), the escargot was super tasty! Never had it before honestly, and I was very happy with it! Loved the butter along with it and used it with the bread!

Very glad to visit this place! Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a bite around the area!

Highly disappointed.. we were expecting so much more.

We visited around 10PM on a Saturday night and the place was dead. We were the only people seated, which was fine with me since I wasn't looking for a loud space.

We ordered the risotto and seafood pasta. The risotto is basically a vegetable risotto where the carrots were undercooked/crunchy, onions were not chopped but sliced, and lacked the mushroom flavor we were mainly interested in. The seafood pasta was even more disappointing as it basically didn't have ANY flavor. The shrimp was big and juicy but that was about it. I ate the shrimp and left the rest untouched. We also ordered charcuterie and it was pretty average.

The entire experience was not really worth the money we paid.

A good friend returned to New York and wanted French food so we paid a visit on a recommendation. The place was almost empty, so we picked a quiet spot in the back. The waiter was kind and attentive. The most impressive was the wine collection, and the waiter's pick of white wine was delicious.
The food, however, was disappointing. We ordered escargots, salmon burger, and mushroom risotto in truffle oil.
The escargots we had as appetizer were very salty. there were 6 tiny pieces of snails just drowned in olive oil.
Salmon burger was just mediocre.
Risotto was despicable. I could not taste any truffle. Carrots were undercooked and overall made the plate taste too "healthy." Rice was too firm for my palette although not undercooked.
The restaurant could be so much better but I felt like the owners or the chef lost the initial passion or effort.
The food and restaurant is great, but honestly my favorite part was the French shop attached to the restaurant! So cute.

One of the coziest spots in the area, a stone's throw away from Penn Station for the commuters struggling to find a good sit-down meal.

Only real drawback was that service was supremely slow that night, hopefully we can give this place another go.

Summary: Fantastic, well-crafted food, great service, and a pleasant atmosphere. Definitely on the pricey side, but pretty worth it IMO.

I went here on a Tuesday evening while visiting NY on a business trip. It was at about 7:30pm and I was by myself, but I selected this restaurant after reading the many positive reviews on Yelp. I saw the burger, read about the burger, and decided that the burger was to be mine. I walked into the festively-decorated (spooky) restaurant and was immediately greeted by a friendly hostess. She asked me where I'd like to sit: front, bar, or back. I elected for the back and was brought to a table that could sit for. There were a decent number of diners already there (many of which spoke French), but there were also some tables open.

Soon, I was introduced to my server for the evening, Nizar. He asked me if I wanted tap or sparkling water and supplied me with the drink and food menus. To note, the food menu doesn't align exactly with the online version (for ingredients and prices), but they are mostly the same. Nizar gave me a few minutes to look over the menu and then returned. I then ordered.

Diet Coke - Yes, I put it here. The reason why is because they serve little 8 oz glass bottles for $4 each. Be aware :-)

The Burger - This creation combines so many amazing ingredients together in such an artfully crafted way as to only be described as quite masterful.  I ordered mine prepared medium and it was super juicy, fresh, flavorful (especially with the supplement of chipotle sauce), and was pretty filling. The burger also came with a nice side salad and a basket of steak-cut fries with ketchup, both of which were quite enjoyable.  That burger, though...that's a solid burger.

After eating both of these items, I decided to use my Yelp Check-in offer to get a cappuccino, and then ordered macarons to go.  The cappuccino was nice and frothy. Back at the hotel room I discovered that he macarons were amazing. Great flavors and textures. Even flavors that I don't normally enjoy were really REALLY good.

Throughout the whole meal, Nizar was friendly and attentive. The total (pre-tax) came to $40, which is certainly not super cheap, but is actually warranted for a meal and experience that was as well executed as this. I look forward to returning with my wife next March :-)

COVID-19 review: Solid cold brew, great ceramics, amazing pao de queijo!! Literally every time I see my trainer at the Complete Body on 14th St, I immediately walk to O after our session and get a pao. Such a satisfying, well-sized treat, and truly nothing better than when you get one fresh out of the oven. I've been eyeing their matcha muffins, scones, and loaf cake slices as well, but always end up just ordering my pao de queijo.

Very, very cute interior + logo as well - PSA to the owner, please make a blue sweatshirt with yellow text (like the apron). I will buy it instantly.
Overpriced! The Brazilian bread was ok. Their cold brew was way too bitter and their alfajores were $3 for the tiny thing. Would not really recommend unless you have to

Cute little coffee shop on the corner of 6 Ave and 12th St. My friend and I came to this location because we were looking for places that have a decent amount of seating. It was really easy to find a place to sit around 2pm on a Saturday. We tried the Bahia Latte, which is more like a mocha. I personally liked it because it tasted like an Abuelita's Hot Chocolate.
Decent coffee and was delighted to see a dish of alfajores. Nice buttery taste but I'm still troubled by  how something as small as a tea-light candle could be $3.

I really wanted to like this place :-( The vibes were really good and the employees were very sweet, but the drinks and food especially were incredibly underwhelming. The iced matcha w/ oat I ordered was way too milky - it kind of just tasted like a straight up glass of milk. And the dish (ricotta toast with seeds and honey) was huuuuuge and very filling, but again, kind of tasteless. Nothing was terrible by any means, but nothing was exciting either. Don't think I'll return here anytime soon.
Crowded, Expensive, No Public Wifi. Was convenient had a double espresso was a bit Bitter

The staff is not friendly. We've given this spot so many tries because the location is convenient, but we are done. Coffee isn't good. Very expensive. Also my pet peeve is when coffee shops don't fill the coffee to the top and they leave the cups here about 30% empty. Won't be back.

I came here to grab coffee with a friend on a Sunday morning. This is a cafe that serves Brazilian coffee and healthy dishes like acai bowls, smoothies, etc. I ordered a beetroot ginger latte. The latte had a strong ginger flavor surprisingly and the color was a pretty pink color from the beetroot. So why 3 stars? The service was a bit lacking. My friend ordered an acai smoothie and went to ask about it since it was taking a while. The batista gave her attitude even though my friend asked nicely and it was about 10 minutes after ordering. I showed my COVID-19 vaccination card to dine inside but they do have tables outside. I may or may not come back depending if I'm in the area.

The coffee is good and the food is OK. Considering there are 1 million coffee shops in Manhattan, the only reason I stop here is because it is right next to where is stay. I do it out of convenience versus quality.

The people who work here are slightly rude. I don't have any specific story about why - it's not something I can put my finger on.
Delicious pao de queijo!  Excellent service and ambiance. Cute merch!

I always thought the cafe looked so inviting from the outside and when I finally was in the area for lunch, I picked up the farro burrata salad. Such thoughtful creative options and very much worth a stop.

Visited randomly on a random day. Ordered americano and latte and banana bread. The coffee was very mediocre. Nothing too special about beverage and food. The staffs were pretty nice. Interior was pretty cozy and cute.

Love this place! Really good, healthy, yummy food made with seasonal and fresh ingredients. The roasted yams are fantastic and the perfect lunch. All their coffee and drinks are also spot on. The interior is very cozy and ambiant. Great spot to get some work done, meet w friend, or read. There is no public wifi. The staff are all very friendly!

Had a craving for a hot chocolate- maybe the holidays - maybe the hint of winter in the air. Team was friendly and casual. Everybody sort of doing their own thing. Ordered a hot chocolate- $6 - what I got was basically like warm steamed milk with just the subtlest hint of cocoa powder that was almost discernible through the milk. Haven't been here before. Unlikely I'll return. Seems like they have a variety of food options and a large menu but I'd avoid the hot chocolate.

The coffee is good, and the decor gives a very comfy vibe. The cafe is very crowded, almost no right place to stand. And there is no-laptop rule here. Tho not quite understand why, I kinda feel intimidated by the "cool cafe" atmosphere.
(My review is based on my personal feeling. I'm def sure that there would be many ppl liking this place!!

By far the worst "arepa" ive ever had, if you can even call it that. Maize dough was cold and crumbly. Way overpriced.

One of those times you feel legitimate grief after purchasing something.
Cafe uses high quality ingredients and is super cozy. The chia pudding is delicious! Quick service.
Ordered an ice coffee - very bitter, I threw it out.  The girl who waited on me was very, very nice.  Iced coffee is $6.00 - way too expensive.
The cafe interior was cozy and nice! Met a friend here for coffee and stayed inside comfortably for 2-3 hours just enjoying the atmosphere.
I love this place and come all the time for pao de quiejo and oat milk lattes. They also have alfajores sometimes!

Imagine a picnic put together by a chef whose style is colored golden by the California sun. A bounty of creative, veggie-friendly fresh food. Gourmet yet relaxed. The leafy green sandwich, the lentil feta salad, the roasted yams, and pao de queijo are all excellent. Coffee is good, but is perhaps ironically the only point here which is merely good.

O Cafe is a decent little coffee shop sort of in between the West Village and Greenwich Village.  It is Brazilian themed, hence the "O" in the name.  I am not the biggest fan of their coffee, but that is personal preference.  Their hot chocolate is amazing, though.  They also have really good pastries, such as gluten-free chocolate brownies that are amazing.  The main event pastry-with is the pao de quejo - or cheese bread.  They are little cheese bread balls that are simply amazing.  They are impossible to not stop eating.  

The staff is super friendly.  They have places to sit but have often found it hard to find a seat.  I don't know if I would come here just for the coffee, but the cheese bread is worth a trip.

It's alright here.... not really good or bad. Service guys are quick and good. Tables are everybody shared.
I ordered 2 of Americano.
I will try here again

I got an oat milk chai latte and I wasn't expecting it to be $7 lol, but since it was that expensive I was hoping that it would be super tasty. The chai was mediocre at best because it was basically just oat milk on ice, like wtf. I will say that the inside of the café is super cute and a great place to do work! But this place is expensive for no reason. If you're looking for a really good chai latte, I would recommend Pause Cafe I'm the Lower East Side; that's a drink worth every cent!

All in all, you can skip this place on your daily stroll, it's definitely not worth it.
$6 for extremely watery and nearly tasteless "cold brew" coffee.

This place is a rip off. I asked for large cappuccino and croissant.  After a charge of $11 they served a small cappuccino and then told me that its the only size.  Horrible business practice. And the coffee is nothing to brag about.  Stay away!!!

Really tasty lemon dressing for the quinoa salad. Not the most filling entree but if you're going for something super light, refreshing, and healthy, this $13.50 salad hits the spot.

Place does have a bathroom, outlets, and internet.
Very nice and friendly staff here. Really good chia seed/coconut/granola bowls or acai bowls. Enjoyable lattes. Cute decor and overall warm vibe. I enjoy coming here.

After researching on good coffee shops where to work I came across O Cafe. The place is big enough yet cosy without feeling to cramped. They arranged wide tables to share but also have a section of cute tiny single tables just to fit your cup of coffee. On the side green plants make this place very European. There is a lack of plugs to charge your laptop so go with full battery. The croissant was ok, I had better and the coffee (cappuccino) was ok. This is why I have a 3. Don't get me wrong this is a good coffee shop, but being obsessed with coffee shops myself it is not one of the top on my list in nyc! Pro: plenty of sitting, nice atmosphere.

Stoppen in here for a hot chocolate last weekend.  The staff are very friendly and it was a cute place with lots of seating.  They also had beautiful ceramic mugs.  The hot chocolate was good without being overly sweet.

This place is such a cool spot. Baristas are total masters. Even if there is a long line, they turn out those oat milk lattes with style and grace. The almond croissants are lit, and they have some great vegan bakes goods as well. They also have a great little pantry moment if you want to grab a non-alcoholic cocktail for later or some locally pickled beets. Very hip cafe.
Slowest service ever. Latte was weak. If I wanted a cup of steamed milk, I'd just do that at home. Not worth $6.
I'm kinda mad that I spent $10 on a flimsy concoction between to dry a** pieces of bread. I couldn't believe how unsatisfying this excuse for food was! They should be ashamed of themselves.

Great place! Love coming here to get a coffee/tea/snack. Great chia seed pudding. Their ceramics are beautiful and the crowd seems loyal.

Only note - please get more mugs/cups so customers can get drinks "for here" and not waste a to-go cup on a sit-down coffee. I've ordered a coffee to stay three times and have had them tell me they're out of mugs so it'll be in a "to go" cup anyway. Not a dealbreaker but not ideal

Simon and Garfunkel tunes circa 1973. Rustic furniture. The arrangement of plants give the cozy place an innate bohemian feel. Great for focusing on writing and/or catch-up chat.

Seats are hard to come by here.  Be a predator for   Me time here.  There are dates apricots bananas and apples for sale next to the baked goodies. Good mix of vegan, glut-free, and traditional. I like how the bench area seconds as storage for trash bags. Space is precious here for everyone.

The Bar staff are witty and seem tight knit. But we're always open for random folk to join in on the fun.

The wifi is spotty.  BYOI.

The Butternut Squash Soup is more broth than hearty. Each spoonful has hints of warmth and savory spice.  The sunflower spelt toast was a hearty compliment.

The Panther Drip coffee was very velvety. Multiple cups were ordered.

Sometimes it's worth it to go out your way to be comfy.

Oh man. If you look up the phrase "gone downhill" on the Internet you'll see a photo of O Cafe. The food and beverage quality is the same but the people who work here...it's either like they're chewing gummies from the time the doors open until they close or they haven't slept in weeks. They are so indifferent. All the attentive people who used to work here are gone. They knew your name, they were friendly, they knew your order before you did. This new crew couldn't care less. Fernando (owner), if you're reading this: Light a fire under these people. Wake them up!

You pay for WiFI as it's NOT FREE. The first 30mins only. So certainly don't come here to work online. Great coffee but snacks and food is overpriced for what you get. I'm not very impressed with the polenta cake prices at $6, you can only taste the sugar, not the flavors. Friendly staff and pleasant ambiance. I'll come back here for coffee and chats.
Wow, I had the burrata dish (with olive oil, spice, pickled red onions, and toast) and I cannot stop thinking about it!!! It was so so so so yummy. I'll be back!!!

Truly a shitty experience. Half greeted by a semi cationic cashier with whom I had to repeat my order 3 times. Seemed like ever time he blinked he forgot where he was. After noticing a few drinks being made to customers that came after me. I got closer to the counter and he asks me what am I waiting for? You took my order 3 times 10 mins ago. (How can you forget) the barista another dip shite asks me again. Please if you are the owner of this fine establishment I beg you to train and be present. Coach in the moment. I will not be patronizing this location too which I have been over the past 8 months which is roughly $2000 year.  I will be spending it somewhere Else. FYI you need to ventilate the cafe always smells like cheese.

I've been here twice now, as it's one of my client's favorite meeting spots. It's always packed, but if you wait a bit you can usually find a spot. It's quiet enough to focus on work, but not so quiet that you can't have a conversation. The coffee is excellent (I've only had their regular coffee), and I love that they have oat milk! I also had one of their bowls, a delicious coconut rice with avocado, shaved coconut, and other veggies, served warm with a scrumptious, light sauce/dressing. The rest of the food menu looks fantastic, and I noticed lots of folks ordering their desserts, as well.

It's a great spot to catch up on some work or meet with a friend (or in my case, a client!). Friendly staff and pleasant decor! Will absolutely be back!

OCAFE is a nice place to go in the area to kill some time and grab a coffee. I was meeting someone nearby and got there a little too early, but thankfully Yelp saved the day and recommended this place to me.

The atmosphere is pretty small and cozy. They sell wine for $10 and have three different varieties. I tried one and, while it wasn't great, it was better quality than I expected from a place that is essentially a cafe.

They have healthy food too, which I didn't get to try but might be back for someday because it looked good.

Really like the food and Vibe here.  They recycle and compost. Have vegan and GF options. Committed to a well rounded healthy menu. It's is kind of pricey with the expanded food selection. That Offsets the cost of having nUt and oat milk available for all beverages. Downside: plastic straws and lots of paper cups, no stay cups. Boo. Happy 8th anniversary, hoping you look toward even more eco friendly service options.

Conveniently nestled between West and Greenwich Villages, with some of the friendliest service I've seen in a coffee shop in quite some time.

Sometimes you need an Iced Green Tea on a rainy day. Knock back a few before feverishly typing on your laptop!

Yes. The reviews are right. There is a distinct, not-so-charming smell of cheese that hits your nostrils upon entering. A plain croissant and latte cost me $8. More expensive than most cafes. The croissant is fried with an oil different from most bakeries; it's strong and overpowering.  A croissant should taste of dough and butter, not weird grease. I won't get it again.

I was feelin the plant explosion walls. Wasn't feeling the smell and prices.

This is such a cute little place, with pretty decor, chairs and tables. Perfect spot for chatting and studying! Service is quick as well.

This is a review just for the pão de queijo (small baked cheese roll). They are really delicious and a little chewy. It is a little expensive for such a small portion, but definitely a staple when coming here!

Very good chai latte, spicy and not too sweet, just the way I like it.  The latte was a bit warmer then lukewarm, so no burnt tongues if you drink too fast!

There's plenty of power sockets along the walls for people who want to work on their laptops, or someone who desperately needs to charge their phone. I generally fall into the latter category.

Like other reviewers have already stated, there is a weird odor that lingers in this cafe.  The smell hit me the moment I walked in.  There was a decent amount of people sitting, so I thought it was just me who was smelling a chlorine mop stench.

If I'm in the neighborhood, I would stop by for another chai latte, to go.
Big fan of the place. It's got loads of healthy options for breakfast or really any other meal. Great coffee drinks & best of all- pao de queijos!!!!  great little cafe spot!

Love the kale sandwich, with black olive spread, goat cheese and red cabbage.
The cappuccino is smooth and not bitter. The staff is friendly and the people watching is always entertaining.

Cute little spot. There are a variety of items for breakfast and for lunch. I enjoyed my ricotta toast and almond milk match latte. This place was pretty full all morning which is always a good sign. They had Stevie wonder playing in the background. The pastries are fresh and most of the food is made to order. I love the vibe of this place. The only downside is people are a little too hasty to grab your seat and are willing to throw out your stuff to get on heir laptop. I love this place but the experience of having my stuff thrown out when I just went to ur the bathroom has left a bad taste in my mouth.

I had latte Bahia which tasted like a mocha latte. The coffee is nice and the store is cute, but the staff has a a little bit attitude. I am not sure if it is because I use CUPS to order or they were busy.
Great location and food was delicious.  Our server AJ went out of his way to make my Son's birthday extra special!

I recently celebrated my girlfriend's birthday at Ocean Prime, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment we walked in, the service was exceptional. Our server, Jesus, deserves special mention for his superb attentiveness. He not only greeted us warmly but also took the time to inform us about the day's specials, setting the tone for a fantastic evening.

My girlfriend is a seafood enthusiast, and the calamari at Ocean Prime lived up to its reputation. It was nothing short of elite, with a perfect blend of flavors and textures. Personally, I opted for the filet mignon, and I can only describe it as heavenly. Cooked to perfection and seasoned just right, it was a culinary masterpiece.

One thing to note is that Ocean Prime's menu items are à la carte, so the bill can add up quickly. My steak alone was $71, and the roasted garlic mash, while delicious, came at an additional cost of $20. However, I can confidently say that the dining experience and the quality of the food make it worth every penny.

In summary, Ocean Prime exceeded our expectations. The exceptional service provided by Jesus, the delectable seafood and steak offerings, and the overall ambiance left us with no choice but to give it a perfect 5 out of 5 rating. It's a restaurant that truly delivers a memorable and delightful dining experience. We loved it!

This restaurant came as a recommendation from the doorman at The Michelangelo hotel.  We arrived on a Tuesday just after 9:00pm and were immediately seated, but I have a hunch reservations are encouraged because this place was packed and now I know why.  The restaurant itself is beautiful and comfortable.  We started with the shrimp cocktail, for entrees it was grouper and scallops then finished off with the carrot cake.  Staff was very attentive and knowledgeable.

We will definitely be back next time we are in NYC!

My friend and I came here for dinner. The restaurant was so cold, not the people, but the temperature inside this enormous dining area was breezy to cold. I suggest you bring a sweater or jacket. Pray that the food will keep you warm.

We had Sheikh or Syed wait at our table. We had appetizers to start. I had a Surf N Turf appetizer, including beef and scallops. This appetizer was very rich in flavor. The rich flavors from tender, juicy meat, and scallops resulted in rich flavor. Recommended appetizer! My friend had goat cheese ravioli. That was delicious too. For entree, I had Bronzino and she had Chilean Sea Bass. Although I always liked Bronzino, this night, I thought her Chilean Sea Bass was so much better than my dish. My Bronzino was too dry. We ordered asparagus and roasted garlic mashed on the side. Those were very good. Our server was excellent! He was attentive and professional and his Surf N Turf recommendation was fantastic! Before leaving the premises, we got brave by ordering butter cake! I can't believe it's butter in the cake that I ate.

That cold temperature made me stop ordering more. I would have ordered more if the A/C temperature had been reduced to 70. Sorry that I had to leave after all that, lol! Thanks for the smooth handling of our dinner! Beautiful place and excellent service!

We came as a group of 5 to celebrate a birthday. Wowwww the food was so good. We shared to start crab cakes, lobster Mac and cheese and it was delicious. For main meal we had a combination of steak, salmon, filet mignon and lots of sides. We ordered tater tots, truffle fries, Brussel sprouts. The food was so good. We wanted to keep eating. Now the service. We had two servers supporting the table. They had a great energy and were so kind and patient. They made the birthday experience for our two birthday ladies special.

This is one of my dad's favorite restaurants. I usually don't like going to a chain, but this was an exception. It is extremely expensive for what you get, but we had a gift card so we felt it was worth it. We spent most of the money on drinks. The food was good nothing to really write home about but still good. The service was fantastic, the staff is very well-versed on the menu, and then go out of their way to make your experience exceptional.

We had a reservation but came in a little early, they seated us at the bar until our table was ready. The drinks were amazing and looked like an artwork! The servers and the food were really good. It's too bad I don't have the pictures to show how each plate was presented with such attention to detail.

This place is nice for a celebration or fancy dinner. Reservations are easy to make. Workers are all nice and accommodating

When they ask you what kind of water you want just a heads up you have to pay for water- there's no free tap water (they don't tell you) but the water was actually really good lol

Lobster bisque was so flavorful and a good amount of lobster & was cooked perfectly

The Chilean sea bass was so buttery and melt in your mouth! So good! 10/10 would recommend!

French onion soup was so good and had a good deep flavor! Good around of cheese as well

Lobster Mac and cheese was addicting! Lobster cooked well and good flavors

Filet mignon was slightly over cooked and dry. Shrimp scampi was cooked well.

Butter cake was too dense and not that strong of a butter flavor compared to other butter cakes I've had.

A lot of the meals we ordered were the specials of the night.

The berries and bubbles drink was delicious! Well balanced and they make the drink in front of you

Came here for Mother's Day brunch and loved the ambiance! The staff was very attentive and I loved how they had tiny flower decorations on each table to celebrate Mother's Day.
The brioche french toast was definitely the highlight of the meal. The lobster and short rib was also pretty generous for portion sizes but was a little heavy. Overall, great food and perfect for a special occasion.
Everything was amazing. Loved the music as well. Food was extremely enjoyable. Ambiance and the service was A1. Our server was very attentive

Love Ocean Prime. One of my favorites in the city. I devour everything here, the food is delicious and fresh. I like their tuna tartare, fries, calamari, scallops, and their truffle mac & cheese as well. Can't forget their tator tots. The fish is great, delicately cooked, I get the Branzino! for dessert, I always try different things, but really like ice cream. The cocktails are lovely, I have this one bartender make my espresso martini with reposado, never misses!!! The ambience is very dim lit - fancy, for anyone in a meeting or family. The service is amazing, I love the staff to be honest. from the servers, to the bartender to the top of the chain. I've met them all through out business meetings and celebratory events and they take care of you. Definitely recommend for whoever is in NYC looking for really fine dining.

Shoutout to Enver (wonderful service!!!)

We came back here and everything was delicious! The ocean roll was SO FRESH and I loved every bite, I wish it didn't end. The protein to rice ratio was perfect, I could taste the tuna and salmon in every single bite!

The Chilian sea bass is on another level, the fish was cooked to perfection and the sauce on the bottom was so flavorful. I highly recommend getting these items!

We also tried the ribeye with bearnaise sauce and sea scallops. The seafood here is top notch.

The berries and bubbles drink was innovative - get your phone ready for the instagram! I could have prob knock back 5 of these, so refreshing.

This is my second time here and I will be back. It is always an amazing time here. From the drinks to the food, everything is a 10/10. Our waiter was amazing. Gave us the best suggestions. The lowlights really give date night and the music was perfect. The DJ played the greatest songs.

I took my mom to Ocean Prime for her birthday. We'd planned to go somewhere else but ended up here last minute, and despite it being pretty busy on a Tuesday, we were still graciously given one of the best tables.

There's literally nothing bad (or even neutral) that I can say about this place. Everything was excellent - from the ambiance, to the food (particularly the Sea Bass, it's to die for!), to the service... and specifically Enver! He took the best care of us - with a smile and kindness and great attentiveness all evening. He helped me create for my mom the most special celebration, and a lovely, warm memory. He helped me surprise mom with special dessert cake candles, obliged to take multiple photos of us with enthusiasm (and they came out really great), and was just an all-around beautiful presence for us, along with the rest of the highly professional and attentive staff.

Big thanks for the wonderful wonderful experience! I will definitely recommend Ocean Prime to anyone, and will always gladly come back again for other special occasions.

Right before a broadway show
This is the way to go for seafood and great drinks.
It has a great atmosphere. The service is top tier. Order the miso broccoli and calamari.
Fun spot. Nice atmosphere. Went for our kids birthday and was lovely. Food was excellent and the staff was attentive.

Amazing restaurant and experience. Beautiful/elegant restaurant. Surprised a friend with dinner reservations here for their birthday. We started at the bar as we waiting for our table and enjoyed the prime passion, old fashioned and pineapple picante for drinks. The complimentary popcorn at the bar was a pleasant surprise and a delicious one at that. For appetizers, we ordered the tuna tartare which was incredible, point Judith calamari and prime roll. For our entrees we ordered the branzino, blackened snapper and 8 oz filet mignon. Our sides included the miso chili roasted broccoli, truffle mac&cheese, smoked gouda tater tots, and brussel sprouts. My favorite was the broccoli and truffle mac&cheese.

Our waiter Shaikh was wonderful. Very attentive and helpful with ordering. He also surprised the birthday person with a delicious ten layer carrot cake. We all agreed it was the best carrot cake we've ever had.

My team of 8 had a celebratory lunch here, and it didn't disappoint. Ever section we walked pass on the way to our seats gave a different vibe. We were seated near the staircase, so I had a great view of the entire restaurant.

Our waitress was very attentive, she checked on us often and was very knowledgeable about the menu. Her only downfall was forgetting my tea with my dessert. I guess only the espresso and coffee lovers got love. After telling her twice, I was over it.

Now to the food...

Crab cake: amazing, filled with jumbo crab meat served with a sweet and sour slaw that only enhanced the flavor
White Truffle Caviar Deviled Egg: smooth creamy and delicious. It's not your grandma's deviled egg, that's for sure.
Calamari: fried and seasoned perfectly served with a sweet and sour sauce. It was different, but a good different. It gave me an Asian feeling.
Lobster Bisque: my colleague enjoyed the rich creamy soup and left nothing in the bowl.
8oz Filet Mignon: cooked to my liking with a Cabernet sauce that was to die for, I almost licked my plate.
Ten layer carrot cake: moist and delicious, but not too sweet.
Warm Butter Cake: Ehh... I've had it from their competition across the street, so I couldn't help comparing the 2. I prefer the other restaurants version.  

All and all a pretty good experience, they have a little something for everyone.  I can't wait to go back, maybe next time I'll get my tea.

Bartenders  - ALTON MY FAV ! However they're all great .
Service is amazing . Food is great entrees and apps steak tartar and crab cakes yummy . Steaks are top tier

Besides some stodgy not too fresh bread and a slightly too sweet carrot cake , my experience at ocean prime was great . The restaurant is beautiful and modern and dimly lit for a nice date night . My server , Tai I think was her name added to an already great dinner by being sufficiently attentive and friendly and seemingly genuinely sweet . This is one of the more expensive steakhouses in the city but it also offers up excellent salmon which is what I had as my entree . The teriyaki sauce was mild ish enough to still allow the fish to shine . Paired with the white rice and the toppings of cilantro and other seasonings was just absolute perfection in every bite . I can eat this everyday but at 57 bucks I'll probably not . I also had a great house salad that has to be the best salad I've had in my life . I'm not usually into salad nor impressed by them but after removing the feta cheese to play it safe,  this had me saying wow afew times . I would legitimately have this salad for a late dinner etc and I've never even done that before so thanks to this place I have a new found respect for salads ! So to recap , this place was an experience . I loved it and it's already top 5 of my favorite restaurants for the complete experience it offered but most importantly , excellent food !

Ocean Prime is my favorite restaurant in the city! The food is great. The servers are attentive. The interior is nice and spacious with enough lighting to see but not too dark where you have to be careful walking.

I'm a big fan of their Bubbles & Berries drink. It's entertaining to watch and has a great balance between sweet and tart.

The Filet Mignon and Chilean Sea Bass are pretty standard as other establishments but it is always fresh. The meat is very easy to cut into and isn't cooked too tough.

The highlight and my favorite is the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie! It is like eating a puffed up Reese's Peanut Butter Cup. You definitely have to try it if you're a fan of Reese's or order their Butter Cake as an alternative!

Ambiance definitely is reason to go. A place for celebrations and to impress. Come classy but comfortable. A ton of stairs for the restroom and additional seating.
Service disappointed. Obligatory but would not even allow or provide a tasting of wines to decide; glasses not bottles. Never had that happen even at a sub-star place. Always had Staff oblige and make suggestions but not here. Didn't even return to ask did we want anything else outside the Brooklyn Lager. Eventually ordered the Black Orchid, which was well-balanced, nice but extremely weak.
The Blackened Snapper was beautiful but underwhelming. It needed flavor.
No salt, no compliments. Pretty much the same theme for each item, except the Lambchops.
The Chops came grilled in an au jus and perfectly roasted garlic. The four (4) Chops were seasoned well, tender and delicious.
The accompanying Garlic Mashed Potatoes were smooth but again, needed seasoning and butter. The Garlic chips were a nice addition but could have added more.
The Lobster Bisque was too heavily rouxed and the Sherry was not cooked out.  Again, needed seasoning and more Tomato paste, double concentrate would help for depth and flavor. You get approximately a Tablespoon of chopped Lobster. Not worth it.
The Jumbo Lump Crabcake was good but basic. Mayo, saltiness and salt seemed to be the filler. Added fresh Lemon juice and hot sauce for a bit more pizzazz. Cooked beautifully but fell apart with each bite. The Slaw was DELICIOUS!
Had with Beet Salad, golden and red. Came with toasted sliced almonds. Good but again, needed seasoning or a flavorful and fruity Vinaigrette.
Technically, overall, this would be a 3.8 but the ambiance is definitely a 4.5-5. There are others that are better, especially at this premium price.

1000 STARS!! Attended a private event here. Everything about the event was first class. From the service to the entertainment to the food. The event was held in the back two rooms. There was a private bar and heavy apps. The food was plentiful and quality. I only saw 2 servers but they worked both rooms and trays were full of food. The trays just kept magically appearing. There were also individual stations they they kept refilling. A meat and cheese station, dessert station, and seafood and sushi station. I can't stop talking about the level of class and professionalism displayed in simple plates drinks and service by this establishment. Definitely recommend.

We went to Ocean Prime for lunch, and it wasn't too crowded or too empty. The vibes of the place are cool too, with a lot of greenery on the walls to give it a nature feel. The staff was super friendly and made great recommendations on what to order.

We started by splitting some apps and sushi: the ocean roll and dynamite roll were pretty good, but the hamachi crudo and the calamari were our favorites. Spectacular start to the meal: 4.5/5 on apps.

I ordered the chilean sea bass (pictured), and while it may have been a bit smaller than expected, it didn't disappoint. The flavors of the fish, the potato puree, and the broccolini complemented each other perfectly. The fish was cooked absolutely perfect, tender and smooth without falling apart. 5/5 dish.

This is a lively and popular restaurant in the seaport area.  Service is friendly, informative and attentive.  The food is quite good.  Standouts were the lamb and the scallops. The wedge salad and beets were good too. The ten layer carrot cake was enough for five people.  Wine list is decent as are the signature cocktails.

Intimate, upscale, and cozy. The staff were exceptional in service. Although I did not have a celebrity sighting, our servers treated us like celebrities and truly catered to our needs. They were able to provide us a nice patio area for our large group. Food was flavorful and the servings were in satisfying proportions. We didn't leave hungry after spending a fortune.

Overall A+ experience and the reputation of this place certainly lives up to its name and high rated reviews.

Came here to dine after attending their location in Washington DC with family and I was immediately impressed. Their food, drinks, decor and ambiance a 10/10.

If you're looking for a 5 star experience I would highly recommend Ocean Prime. Our waiter was on point and checked in on us without being overbearing. #majorkey I can't wait to come back!

I had the most amazing 30th birthday dinner here last night. Hunter was an amazing server and even surprised me with dessert for my bday. He knew the entire menu in and out and we went with all of his recommendations from the drinks to the food and everything was delicious. He recommended the ravioli, au poivre for the steak, truffle Mac and cheese, warm butter cake, and the carrot cake. We wanted a sparkling wine more on the sweet side and he recommended the Brut Rose, J Vineyards and it was perfect. I love all Cameron Mitchell restaurants and this was no exception!

We came here for Mother's Day brunch. Everyone was so welcoming. The service was great.

My sister and I each got a cocktail. Given the amazing NYC cocktail scene, we thought our cocktails were very basic.

We shared the deviled eggs, a sushi dish and the crab cakes. Our parents really liked all the apps.

For the entrees, I was the only one who didnt stick to their Mothers day brunch and got the ribeye with a side of mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts. The sides were bomb. The ribeye was tasty, but I asked for it to be medium rare. It seemed to be on the rarer side. The same went for my dad's steak. He had the steak and egg special on the brunch menu. The people at the table by us looked like they had to send their steaks back to be cooked for a little longer.My sister and mom each got the surf and turf. They really enjoyed it.

For dessert, we each got a caffeinated beverage. The cappuccino was on point! We split two cakes. The warm butter cake definitely was amazing. I would come here again to have that. The carrot cake was good too but maybe on the sweeter side for us.

My wife and I had a celebratory dinner at Ocean Prime last week. From start to finish, our experience was nothing short of exceptional! From our initial encounter at the check-in desk to our service all throughout the evening, we were treated with smiles, warm greetings, and friendly advice & recommendations. Our server, Nore, was fantastic - he was courteous, always checked in at the right time, and every recommendation he made was spot on.

Shortly after being seated, we were given a basket of warm breads with whipped butter. The breads were enjoyable, and we had to tell ourselves not to eat too much of it so we didn't get full before we got to our food. For apps, we had the Beet Salad and Jumbo Lump Crab Cake. Both were delicious and a nice warm-up for our respective main courses of Blackened Snapper & Chilean Sea Bass. Both fishes were flavorful without being over-seasoned. They were cooked to perfection and had no unpleasant fishiness. While neither portion was huge, they were satisfying, especially in concert with sides of Jalapeno Au Gratin and Asparagus w. Hollandaise. The potatoes may have been one of my favorite "simple" sides I've had in recent memory at a comparable restaurant - they were nothing fancy but well executed and with just the right punch of flavor and not too dense/heavy.

While we were satisfied after our meal, we opted for dessert anyway and ordered the Chocolate Torte. To our surprise, Nore also brought over a Crème Brulee "on the house". We opted to share the Crème Brulee there and asked for them to pack the untouched torte to-go so that we wouldn't overdo it. The Brulee was exquisite - it was not too thick and was sweetened perfectly and the torte was fantastic the next day as well.  

As for the restaurant itself, it was attractive, spacious, and with high ceilings. We were seated in a corner booth section so we were not surrounded by people and could have an intimate meal. We opted to dress nicely for the evening since it was for a special occasion, but you could get away with more casual attire (some folks were way too casually dressed for this setting if you ask me but there is no strict dress code). On the other end of the spectrum, there were several folks in very fancy dresses and some nattily-attired gentlemen as well.

While we dropped a pretty penny, it was well worth it for the quality and service we enjoyed. We would most definitely return though this experience set the bar awfully high. Kudos to the chef and all of the staff we interacted with! You all made this a wonderful meal and evening for us.

Celebrated my 8th wedding anniversary here last night. I cannot recommend Ocean Prime enough. Everything was excellent. The food (we ordered from the restaurant week menu and they have really great selections available), the service (Jessie was so sweet, helpful, quality service), the ambience. We were told happy anniversary as soon as we walked in. They even gave us a small floral arrangement for our table. It's the details for me. Highly recommend for any celebratory dinner. Thank you, Ocean prime! Thank you, Jessie!

The food here is good! And was very filling.
I had the filet mignon, side of mash potatoes and cream spinach and butter cake for dessert.
Great service and our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and made necessary adjustments and accommodations for us when needed. For the drink, we had the bubbles and berries which is a fun and fruity cocktail that definitely lives up to its name!
Ambiance is great. A good environment for a business/work meeting or date night with your boo. Make reservations!

We had a very good pre-theater meal here recently! The service was above average, and our server was very familiar with the menu.

The scallops were delicious and a bigger portion than I expected. My friend enjoyed her surf and turf as well. A classic chophouse menu, but with something extra!

Check out the bubbles and berries drink with dry ice--it was a fun touch.

The service was really good! All bussers took away our plates and our server gordon was really friendly.  I was blown away with how good the goat cheese ravioli was, you can taste how fresh the pasta was. The seabass was really good and seasoned perfectly. I would recommend the seabass for sure! The steak was cooked perfectly but I think it was a bit tuff for me. Also really loved the bubbles cocktail, so sweet and Instagramable

My family and I absolutely enjoyed my experience ! The waiter whose name I cannot remember (I'm so sorry) made my brother feel special and cared for on his birthday ! This experience made my mother and I feel accomplished in surprising my brother. Our only complaint, our waiter forgot to bring my mothers food. We understood the night was busy, we tipped well anyway.

Horrible Salmonella Food Poisoning
I ate here and became violently ill. Horrible painful stomach cramping and IT was uncontrollable. Sweat and chills and pain... for 11 hours. We called the restaurant, they apologized and to make it right with a gift card.
But I've never been so ill, had IV fluids, dehydration and fever.

It's probably a good spot otherwise, this is just my cautionary tale.

We had a fantastic time at Ocean Prime this past weekend. It was our first time bringing our daughter to the city and to the restaurant. Our waiter Enver was amazing and treating our little girl like a princess! Highly recommend.

I love a steakhouse. My homegirl been talking about Ocean Prime so we finally made it here. Omg the service is excellent. From the host to the food runner the server, service was prompt and friendly. Inside I would describe the ambiance as a modern steakhouse. Cozy dim lit but not pretentious at all. On the menu there is something for everybody even sushi. I ordered my usual and of course everything tasted amazing. Though I would say portions are somewhat smaller compare to other steakhouses but it was so good mi nuh care. Definitely will be back.

we dined at Ocean Prime NYC last night with 4 other friends...Peter, our waiter was excellent..not only was he informative about the menu but very attentive to our needs..the food and service was top shelf

Linda H

Pretty packed on a Saturday night, Ocean Prime was a really nice dinner spot. Marnie's cucumber gimlet was a non-sweet cocktail with panache. The bread bowl was pretzel bread and regular, very nice. The nuts in the house salad have a peppery kick, which was a nice touch. The blackened snapper was tasty, and the Florida Grouper was rocking good; both were perfectly cooked. The special fish was sadly over cooked. For dessert, Sophie enjoyed the sorbet (lime), which was super-sour. And the best part of the meal was the peanut butter chocolate torte, which was peanut butter mouse atop a chocolate cookie and coated in chocolate. It is like the most decadent Reese's cup you ever tasted.

If you are looking for aged beef or wild caught fish while in New York, you cannot go wrong here. Our Company had a dinner with approximately 45 staff. We had a private room with dedicated servers. Service was impeccable. All dishes came out timely and proper temperatures. Feeding that size of a group that quickly in itself was impressive. Great place for a large group.

Horribly overrated and overpriced. Booked this restaurant weeks in advance for my birthday however we were seated 15 minutes after our reservation. We also were not greeted as we walked in even though there were four girls just standing there talking amongst themselves. Once we sat down I did enjoy the complimentary pretzel rolls they brought to the table. Calamari appetizer was just okay but came at room temperature. My husbands tartare was not the best he said. The crab cake was the highlight however and was delicious. The entrees were slightly better for half of us. The grouper and filet mignon were hits. I ordered the dynamite roll which was just okay. I can get a better roll in CT for half the price. My husbands tuna and salmon roll was missing the salmon. The sides of garlic mashed tasted like the ones from a box and truffle mac was okay. For dessert the majority of the table ordered butter cake and the rest of us got crème brûlée. No one enjoyed their dessert. I truly have no idea where these reviews come from saying that the food/dessert is the best. Service was also subpar. Plates kept being taken away when people were still eating and it felt like we were being rushed out even though we were a party of six. We will never come back here and I would never recommend it. There are a million other places in the city that serve better food, have exceptional service and have way better pricing. Over $900 including the tip for six people for a completely lackluster meal.

We had a lovely meal here. The ambiance and staff are wonderful. Love the outdoor space!

We had:

- Ocean Roll - terrific, I would order this again and again

- Sea Scallops with Risotto - terrific, the scallops were cooked to perfection

- Ahi Tuna - delicious and perfectly seasoned

Terrific restaurant, we would definitely come back!

The food is top notch. For appetizers we had the calamari and the Asia sauce was to die for. The crab cake needs work. More flavor and a bit more crispy. For main course, I had the teriyaki salmon and it melted in my mouth like butter.  The sticky rice below was great. I just wish I had a bowl of that. For dessert, we had the tower high carrot cake and it was amazing.

Good steakhouse in midtown.

Came here for a work dinner and they did a great job accommodating a group of 25. Food was perfect. Ambiance is classic steakhouse.

Annoyed that I came in on a hot day and asked for a replacement water glass because a bug had flown into my glass, and nobody brought me one for the remaining 20 minutes or so of my meal.

I'll be back again and again. My boyfriend are visit this ocean prime location quite regularly however our last trip really took the cake. We were placed on the upper level in one of the private rooms. Our server Hunter was truly exceptional. From his item recommendations to his charm, everything exceeded our expectations. My boyfriend ordered the halibut which I think was the special that night, I had the blackened snapper and our friend had the lobster tails with 6oz filet. The seafood tasted fresh as always and the snapper had a nice flavor. For sides we ordered mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese and broccoli.
Lastly. Do yourself a favor and order a strawberry lemon drop. Amazing!
Lovely place, our sever Enver Praci was so sweet and took care of us :) Would visit again.

We really enjoyed our time here celebrating my dad's 60th birthday. The food and service was amazing. Our waiter Shaikh was so kind and attentive. He gave us roses for our table and a complementary chocolate cake. Loved our time here would totally recommend.

I went to this place for a work appreciation dinner. I must say that the service and food were all good. We had personal attention so that could be why.

The food was amazing and this one cocktail was so good too. The cocktail was called Berries& Bubbles - Belvedere Organic Lemon & Basil Vodka, Marinated Blackberries, Fresh Lemon, Domaine Brut and Dry Ice Smoke. The lobster roll that was brought out as hor douevers were great. The Hoisin Chicken Sliders was so scrumptious that I ate two or three of them. The Caprese Skewers were good too which had fresh mozzarella, tomato, basil and balsamic. They brought out appetizers for the table afterwards which was delicious. The Sonoma goat cheese ravioli with golden oak mushrooms was brought out for the table and it was so tasty that we asked for more. I ordered the Caesar salad for myself  which had crisp romaine, parmesan garlic dressing and brioche croutons. Ordered the 8oz filet mignon which was cooked the way I wanted it. Last but not least for dessert, I chose the warm butter cake which had fresh berries, vanilla ice cream and raspberry sauce.

Food - Excellent *****
Service - Average ***
Ambience - Good ****
Location - Good  ****
Food tastes Good ! But I don't like the soup not so much. lunch special is small but it's enough for me.
The older chick don't listen... they need to bring back the other lady  or let the guy run the front...

This is my go-to for Chinese in the area. I order pick-up and it is usually ready on time and in good quality. While I can't speak to much else on the menu, the general tso lunch special's my main order, and it's quite good. Comes with pork fried rice and soup, all for a fair price

We were kind of apprehensive because of the mixed reviews but... we needed a new go-to for Chinese in the neighborhood and BAMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!

It was soooo bomb.. several reasons. Let's start off with what we ordered:

- Scallion pancake: layers on layers and layers. Crispy on the outside and chewy layers on the inside. There were so many scallions too. We really enjoyed the dipping sauce as well.

- Crab rangoon: they were folded in cute little triangles with tucked in corners. Super flavorful with lots of imitation crab meat, not just cream cheese.

- Kung Pao chicken: SPICY and good. Lots of veggies and peanuts. They did not skimp on the chicken either. Thank you!

- Chicken and broccoli: My parter LOVED this. It is usually his go-to dish for Chinese so I am happy that he really liked it. He really liked that the broccoli had a crunch to it and it wasn't limp and soggy like most Chinese carry-outs.

Then, the order came so fast! Like lightening speed. The delivery guy was so nice too.

That is all. I cannot wait to try other things on the menu.

BYE

While in Harlem I had a taste for Chinese food and decided to try a different restaurant than the one I usually go to when I'm in the area. My daughter recommended this place because she recently tried their wings and loved it. I ordered a small pork fried rice, crab Rangoon and a Canada Dry ginger ale. It was ok. The pork fried rice was more like yellow rice with roast pork not the actual fried rice served at most Chinese restaurants. I prefer oily pork fried rice with more of a fried look to it if that makes sense. However, I really liked the crab Rangoon. They were stuffed really well and had a great fresh taste.

I don't understand the low reviews. For a local, uptown asian/Chinese restaurant, it is one of the better ones, much better. Their dumplings are delicious. They use a thin dough and the filling is excellent. Due to dietary constraints, I've ordered the steamed chicken and broccoli and it was fresh and the broccoli was not overcooked. Other dishes were equally as good. I'm picky about Chinese food and all other area places just don't do it for me.

Ocean Restaurant you are absolutely amazing, I had a spectacular experience here yesterday. It is pleasant place. Fantastic menu items, Sesame Chicken was my choice and it was really magnificent. Team are super friendly and service is really swift. Ocean Restaurant - Definitely a new spot of mine.

The food smelled rancid and had to throw most of it away.  The dumpling sauce had an especially revolting stench.  I spent about $100 and it went in the garbage.  This is the single worst food delivery experience I have ever had.  Don't believe the fake, positive reviews.

If I could do 2.5, I would. The place is decent, but the fried rice is often burnt or nothing more than yellow rice with some veggies. The egg rolls are on the soggy side, not crispy. The people who work here are cordial, but cannot, for some reason, ever muster a smile or genuine friendliness. I go here because it's convenient. It's across from the hellhole I currently find myself residing. The best, crispiest egg rolls from a chinese carry out I've eaten are at New Kam Sheng in the Bronx.

If you've got nowhere else to go, it'll suffice. If anything else is open or near, generally, try that.

I ate here for the first time and ordered the drunken noodle on Seamless. I rated it 4 star because the food was delivered in under 30mins and the delivery guy was nice. I've had drunken noodle from other Thai restaurants and love it, here it's subpar. I ordered medium spice and all they put was crushed red pepper on time. In my opinion it took away the authenticity from the food.

The food here is very good compared to other Chinese food closer to me. They delivered my food in 20 min I ordered beef and broccoli and scallion pancakes. The scallion pancakes are amazing! Beef and broccoli is good too. They threw in a egg roll and soda

This Chinese restaurant WAS my go to place. Their pork fried rice is one of the best I've tasted. However, I recently ordered from this restaurant and was highly disappointed. I ordered the chicken and broccoli lunch special and was faced with an unsettling piece of bone. I don't want to be rude, but the bone appeared claw-like. I contacted the restaurant and explained to them what I discovered in my food. They were indeed receptive and agreed to replace my meal. Although I wanted a refund, my coworker suggested I try something different and "safe". That will be the last time I order from there. This experience makes me apprehensive about ALL Chinese food.

The food is decent tasty and clean ( for Chinese food) but I've never experienced so much disrespect from their DELIVERY SERVICE. I guess they stopped coming upstairs to deliver the food for safety reasons, which is annoying because one day the guy kept ringing the bell and I kept buzzing him. I thought my intercom was broke until I heard him yell from outside " COME DOWN". The second time I ordered the delivery guy texted me  and claimed he called but didn't. I called Ocean and they said he left but they will call him to come back. When he came back I asked him " sir your delivery team don't ring the bell anymore" and he rudely said $19. So I asked again and he said ( in a nasty tone) NO I CALLED YOU.... your phone out of service?". I will no longer order food from here because of their rude DELIVERY guy, I'm a paying customer and I don't appreciate being disrespected.

Just experience the worst thing in here..I dropped a 20$ bill In the store and I didn't even know..the lady was acting like she was cleaning up and pick my money up then started talking to her co worker  in their language..and laughing ..so I go to reach for my money and it's not in my pocket..I told the lady I be right back because i think I dropped  it in the previous store I was in..but I didn't tell her that....she asked me how much I lost..but I didn't tell her my reason for leaving..she just kept beating around the bush asking how much I lost ..I said 20 dollars..I kept asking did she find it and give it to u she said yea I'm like give me my money..why didn't any of u ask was this mine and instead of laughing ..I was just amazing how I'm always in there.. but they pull something like this..my last time in there will be today

I randomly ordered take out Last evening. Ultra greasy. Literally my noodles were swimming in it. Not ordering from again. The sesame chicken tastes good but once again overly greasy and over breaded. I try not to leave bad reviews but this has to be addressed

Let me start off by saying I love their food. Recently I ordered delivery and the courier called and when we made it downstairs there was no one there. It is bad enough they refuse to come up and I am understanding of that due to the building I live in and the area.

With that being said, if you don't come up for your safety at least give residents time to come down from 8th for and a slow elevator. I called and complained to a man who was kind and did apologize but, told me I would have to come in and pick up my food.

I have an illness that is difficult on my body and order so that I don't have to go pickup food. So this on the customer service scale was terrible. My order should have been redelivered and for the severe inconvenience they should have added even something small to my order as a good faith apology gesture. So at low & behold  we had to pick up the food.

I did reach out to Seamless and was reimbursed for an order totaling $50.00. I just wish we could get good food (which as I mentioned they had) along with good customer service. I took this as a 1 time incident as I have since ordered from them and now explain to courier to please give us time to get downstairs.

This place is my go-to Chinese.  Not fancy, kinda pricey for what it is....but it's decent, and yummy, and quick!

The sweet and sour chicken, the egg foo young, the general tso's...so good!

Never order on phone---- ONE HOUR LATER the order came- I cannceled it!!!!
TERRIBLE! I'm starving !!!!!
So upset!

So it's been established that the girl on the phone is rude. She is. Last time I went in person she forgot to put in my order when I placed it & said I'd be back. They she  pretended it was indeed cooking yet I still had to wait an additional 10 minutes. I put up with them cause they're the closest to me but I should really try and find another place. I've currently been waiting on my order for almost an hour.

BE PREPARED TO WAIT FOR IT. They will never deliver in less than an hour and that is being generous. I have never gotten my food delivered in less than an hour and 20 minutes, in fact my last order took over 2 hours. Saying this, I have only ordered twice giving them a second chance. Any time I have called to ask what is going on they say "yeah, yeah, on its way, very busy". I'm a very understanding guy, but when I've waited almost an hour and a half and then I am called to come downstairs (22 floors in a less than reliable elevator in my semi-converted project building) to get my food, I'm not terribly inclined to recommend this place. Now, I actually used to deliver food on a bicycle here in NYC so I can't, in good conscience, take this out on the delivery guy...but then again, he's the one that won't come up and deliver my food. If I had the intention of making part of the trip to get my food, I would have ordered pick-up from the Chinese place closer by. Like I said, it's 'fine' for this area.

I made the mistake of ordering from here twice so I could hopefully save others from doing the same. DON'T DO IT...order some kind of cuisine you think you don't like if that is the only option...as long as they have a reputation for actually delivering the food. OR don't eat...if you're OK waiting for this, you'd be better off waiting until you have the time/ability to go and get something to eat when you want to eat because by the time you get this you'll be past hungry and will probably have eaten any kind of "snack" you might have lying around.

I've been living in the neighborhood for 6 years but I don't get out much to see what in my area to eat. My boyfriend order from this place grubhud.com....The food to me is fresh very  tasty. ..snice then we have orders twice and about to order to nite....love there different flavors of wings and different flavors of fried rice...

Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. Waited 1 hour for the food. Called them to cancel it. Ten minutes later they rang the bell. My boyfriend answered. Everything in me told me to send it back but we paid and ate it anyway. The house special egg foo young had two shrimp the rest was omelette and onions. Ordered a shrimp roll. Not in the bag. The beef lo mein tasted refrigerated and old. However we got 2 free sodas. I asked for a Pepsi and root beer, got 2 Pepsi. I can't tell you how over Ocean I am. I took their menu out of the menu drawer. Yuk. Go somewhere else.

Ocean's food is good but the customer service is horrific. The girl who answers the phone is completely inept. I ordered of Shrimp with Broccoli w/ White rice and very little sauce.  I told her that I was going to pick it up. Simple right? Clearly not.  I get there and she sent the order out for delivery.  I didn't give her the address! I had to wait for the delivery man to come back to bring me my food. I was pissed but I pay and head back to the house.

I get home and my Shrimp and Broccoli is DROWNING in sauce to the point where the bag it is in is saturated with sauce. Please note that this was not one of those cheap Styrofoam containers, this was a sealed plastic container that sauce was oozing out of.  I had to strain the sauce out!

Then, I open the rice container and it is brown rice! WTF?!! I call them back and lose it. I am like "Deliver my white rice NOW."  She says to me "Fine, we'll deliver it but we want the brown rice back." WOW.  Whatever lady, take your undercooked brown rice back. I didn't want it in the first place, that's why I ordered white rice!  35 minutes later, I finally get my white rice and gave their brown rice back. They are 4 blocks away from here. 35 minutes. Out of control. NEVER AGAIN!

They Suck! Screwed up my order too many times and then the girl argues on the phone with me to never admit she was wrong AGAIN!!  The guy who covers for her said I was a liar...and ordered something I hate?? What??? Assholes!!
The fried chicken wings are amazing! Usually a very good local option for Chinese food.

Do not waste your time or money. It's been an hour an a half and I still haven't received my order and I literally live two blocks away..."it's coming".  It's not worth the wait for this mediocre food.

They did an excellent job with our business group of 25 and the private room in the back was well appointed. I had the halibut, Tuna app and salad. Clams on the half shell and oysters at the bar were the highlight.

It's large, and a good place for large functions. Not a date spot in my opinion however.

For our semi-annual meeting of Lviv classmates, this time around, we chose Oceana for its seafood selection, and we weren't disappointed. The place has a white interior that provides the feel of a laid-back San Francisco seafood restaurant. We all had the Tasting Menu.

Pro tip: Unless you're not very hungry and only want a single dish, I highly recommend the 4 course Chef's Tasting Menu for $95. It's a great deal because, unlike other tasting menus, you actually get to select from the regular menu 1 appetizer, 1 pasta, 1 main dish, and 1 dessert. It becomes an even better deal if you select higher priced options.

I arrived a little earlier than my friends and decided to order a Smokey Old Fashioned, which was rebuffed by "No" from the bartender. To which I responded, "Just an old fashioned?". The bartender said, "Much better." This drink was such a heavy pour that it was strong enough to last me through the dessert.

For the appetizer, I chose the Yellowtail Crudo, while some of my friends opted for the Tuna Tartare. I would say that Tuna was the winner here since flavors of acidity and saltiness complemented the Tuna better than the poppy seeds and spicy sauce did for the Yellowtail. But that's nitpicking, as both options were superb.

For the pasta, everyone went with this establishment's staple, the Lobster Scampi. Perfectly cooked pasta, layered with delectable pink cream sauce with hints of basil throughout, bombarded with generous chunks of buttery lobster. I usually avoid pasta dishes at an establishment of this caliber. But this was a satisfying pasta dish without making me feel heavy or bloated.

For the main course, I went rogue and ordered the Seared Scallops, one ordered the branzino, and most went for the Halibut. There's a reason why Halibut is a favorite of most visitors here - it is perfectly prepared with a flavor profile that is truly enjoyable. The Branzino was ok, but not really outstanding in any aspect. The Seared Scallops were delicious and had an excellent complement with hash browns, sauce, caviar, and greens. It truly had an amazing combination that created an enjoyable taste. It would have been the clear winner had the portion not been so small. In Spanish, cuisine terms, it was closer to a pintxos portion than a tapas portion. A main dish with only two scallops is laughable.

For the dessert, I chose the Pistachio Semifreddo, while my friends went for the Chocolate Cake and Lemon Cheesecake. Pistachio Semifreddo had a very good flavor with that nutty undertone throughout and a crumble base. Overall, it was a good unremarkable dessert. The lemon cheesecake was memorable, with citrus flavor throughout the dense sweetness of the cheesy goodness. The chocolate cake is a star here, as it pairs the rich chocolate cake layer with dark chocolate coating, contrasted by several fresh berries.

A thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Came for a late lunch with a former business associate. Upon arrival, it was fairly crowded, but the crowd subsided by the time we were done. The layout was very nice of the restaurant and perfect for a lunch, business meeting or a dinner.

I intended to go with the Salmon before I arrived, but then I noticed the three course lunch would suffice. I went with the Steak Frittes ($8 upcharge) with creamed spinach. The other two courses were a salad and a dessert. The Caesar salad was standard, the sorbet was great. I didn't carry for their spinach and didn't really eat any of it, but everything I was pleased with.

The service was great and overall, I had a great experience here and would return.

We ordered chef tasting menu.

Highlights:
- good portion of food (I was able to share a bunch with my 2 y/o)
- nice atmosphere with great service
- lobster spaghetti was awesome
- great dessert with beautiful display
- reasonable price

Cons:
- other courses were not impressive
- soft shell crab too salty

Coach/coachee lunch with my two coachees. I have been taking advantage of our per diem and have been taking them to nice places. I think I got the wrong restaurant because this place wasn't all that great. My first time having fried squash blossoms and it was way too much batter and filling. You can't really taste the squash blossoms. The pasta was pretty good. I cannot really tell you what it was because it has been a while, but I recall eating the entire plate and being very full, which is rare for me. I don't think I will be going back here for lunch unless someone suggests it. Expectations exceeded reality.

It was very busy at the bar, the tables in the back room watch emptier has a lot of people were hanging out after work I think.

Assist station was close to the bar and they quickly brought me back to the private room that are host had engaged for the evening. We had a pre fixe menu because of the size of the group, we had seafood platters that we shared, bread with some olive oil, and I have the mahi mahi fish with the potatoes and broccoli rabe which was cooked properly but nothing amazing there.

Best part of the meal by far was the vanilla panna cotta at the end of the night, dash of sorbet on top and the strawberry and crumbles making for a perfect balance with the gelatin creme.

Likely I'll be back to try some of the other fish or desserts another time!

Beautiful restaurant with excellent service through and through. The food was delicious overall, although the fried calamari was more average than anticipated for this level of a restaurant (=heavily breaded and fried like any restaurant chain)  . Ask for the grilled octopus (made and usually exclusively served at the sea food bar) they are not on the menu but they will serve it at your table if you ask. It is absolutely amazing.

First off, this place is huge! I was really surprised by the number of tables / booths / bar seating there was. Great for a company dinner, date, or for a group of friends. This spot is really gorgeously decorated as well and the ambiance is great.

I actually did not really look at the menu before coming here but was thoroughly surprised by how affordable the tasting menu was! An appetizer, a pasta, an entree, AND a dessert for $95!

They gave us a bread basket at the beginning (delicious). We ordered the Tuna Tartare which was honestly incredible (super flavorful) and probably my favorite dish. The squid ink pasta was good, nothing super special but the scallops were a great addition that elevated the dish. The Sea Bass & Crab Cioppino was very good too -- personally reminded me of Venetian seafood dishes. The pistachio dessert was incredible! I would say the portion sizes were absolutely perfect for the number of dishes we received.

Great service, great food -- 10/10 recommend!

(Dined 11/24/2022 TH @ 4:30pm): There was no traditional Thanksgiving meal in this ocean of a restaurant!

We ended-up at Oceana for Thanksgiving dinner when I continuously struck out on my handful of top restaurant choices in the area. I wasn't a huge fan of turkey and truly loved seafood, so maybe this was a good omen! I even cracked a wry smile when the scene from "A Christmas Story" where the family went to a Chinese restaurant for Christmas played in my noggin. Did we have a swimmingly good time with a break from tradition!?

PURCHASE
2018 San Salvatore Falanghina White Wine 750ml Bottle ($75.00): A real cork, light yellow color, light citrus melon pear aroma, low body, subtle citrus pear flavor, subtle dry finish, subtle dry citrus pear aftertaste, and low astringency yelp.com/user_local_phot….

4pc Focaccia Bread (COMP x2): Fluffy, seasoned, and served with a creamy-esque olive oil, we asked for more yelp.com/user_local_phot…!

Shibumi Oysters ($4.50 x2): From Washington state, these bivalves were small and not very meaty yelp.com/user_local_phot….

Creamed Spinach ($14.00): Surprisingly a huge portion mixed with roasted garlic and lemon in a buttery broth, I enjoyed it best while it was only hot yelp.com/user_local_phot….

Thanksgiving 3-Course Prix Fixe Meal ($125.00)
~Shellfish Bisque: Creamy silky goodness with only one meaty piece of fish yelp.com/user_local_phot….
~Grilled Swordfish: A glorious succulent thick piece of fish that gently cae apart with a side of creamy fennel was simply glorious yelp.com/user_local_phot….
~Orange Dreamsicle Parfait: Tasted very similar to the childhood frozen dessert with an obvious nod to a breakfast pastry, this was a dream to eat yelp.com/user_local_phot….  

Thanksgiving 3-Course Prix Fixe Meal ($125.00)
~Lump Crab Cake: A lovely large mound of soft crab encased in a fried crust atop a bisquelike broth yelp.com/user_local_phot….
