~Short Rib: Small fingerlets of moist tender meat that was good but not great atop a pureed potato-like base with soft glazed baby carrots yelp.com/user_local_phot….
~Chocolate Custard Brownie: More of a s'mores but still a delectable dessert yelp.com/user_local_phot….

Green Tea ($6.00): A pot of hot palate-cleansing soothing tea - aaahhh!

SERVICE
Online reservations through Resy was a snap. When we arrived, a very friendly hostess greeted us and chatted while they readied our table. Once at the table, our male server provided menus, recommendations, and water. Once we ordered, he returned with focaccia bread as we macked out! Then, a male sommelier appeared with pairing suggestions, we made a selection, and voila we had glasses of wine - yes! Eventually, a consistent procession of food came out, and throughout the course of our meal we were checked on, wine was poured, and empties cleared away. At the end of the meal, paying for the check was quick and easy - superb!

PARKING (Varied; N/A this instance)
We took about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Otherwise, I didn't see any lots but believed there were spots along the main drag of 49th St. and all surrounding streets as well as a plethora of nearby subway stations - 'nuff said.

ATMOSPHERE, DÉCOR, AMBIENCE
A sleek modern large floorplan with two distinct indoor dining areas with an assortment of chairs/tables throughout along with a sizable bar and several wine display case coolers. Plenty of natural lighting came through the many large wall windows while a ton of electric ceiling lights filled in the rest at night. Several TVs only at the bar while no music played in the background. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

ATTIRE
I was dressed in a suit and dress shoes for the holiday. Otherwise, business casual would be the bare minimum.

OVERALL
Oceana from start to finish was nothing short of spectacular and would love to return to try their standard menu. I preferred hole-in-the-walls versus fine dining, but I felt they hit all the right marks - 'nuff said. I found complete value based on the prices, service, and experience noted above (TOTAL paid experience was around $385.00 BEFORE any discounts and/or tip). And, they accepted my credit card of choice... AMEX! 5.0 STARS

Was pretty busy on a Thursday evening with what looked like many business dinners. Plenty of seating available though as it's a large space. Looks like they can accommodate larger groups. The branzino with salsa verde was delicious and well portioned. Service was good. Good option for business meal or a celebration. Maybe a bit loud for a romantic date.

I'm a bit surprised by some of the reviews, but as usual, my meal here last night was nothing less than stellar. I've been coming here for years and have never had a dish that wasn't excellent. My mom and I came for dinner and had the 3-course theater menu to accompany our Broadway show.

The scallion focaccia bread they served the table was outstanding: super soft, and the flavor was mild but not overpowering with onion. It's definitely one of the best breads I've ever had, and I know my carbs!

For dinner, I had the swordfish ceviche. The flavors melded together perfectly, and there were sizable chucks of fish. Loved it! I had the monkfish with brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes as my second course. Whew! This was so amazingly seasoned I wanted to go back into the kitchen and learn all of their seasoning secrets! Those potatoes were so creamy, and I loved all of the other components. My mom's steak and fries were very tasty as well. The steak was juicy and cooked perfectly.

For dessert, I had the orange creamsickle parfait. It was an orange lovers' dream! So tasty! My mom had the mixed fruit sorbet, which she loved. All in all, it was an excellent meal per usual, and the service was on point: very attentive and sincere.
Impressive high-end seafood restaurant in midtown.  Portions were a wee bit small (I required two entrees) but there was nothing not to like about Oceana.

Solid midtown option if you want a break from noisy steackhouses.

Their lunch & theatre prix-fixe menus are an excellent deal. More expensive at dinner.

We had great wine and seafood that night, alongside a complimentary anniversary cake. Kudos to the staff !

Amazing experience over here from start to finish.  Every part of the dinner was perfect.  The service from the beginning was outstanding.  We were running late and the restaurant was so nice when we call to let them know.  When we walked in she remembered and was very welcoming.  She also checked our umbrellas and items.  Our servers at the table were really great too.  Incredible attentive and quick including the restaurant manager.  Our food was out of this world.  We got the 4 course chefs tasting menu and loved everything we tried.  There was a really loud table of 4 next to us.  Everyone at the restaurant was visibly annoyed at this table and giving them looks.  Our server was so nice and offered to move us to another part of the restaurant.  The restaurant is huge and the main dining room had a very elegant and modern decor.  We loved all our food items.  My favorite was the halibut.  It was so good I wanted to get another one.  Obviously the quality of the food was exceptional and even though it was expensive well worth the value.  We did get enough to eat but next time we would not do the chefs tasting menu.  The items are smaller when doing the chefs tasting menu.  We would just order each item because it would be larger and we loved the food that much!!

Arrived here for a birthday dinner celebration on a Saturday night. The host asked us if we are watching the broadway show after. I am assuming they asked you this to flag your table as "in a rush" or not.

We (5 people) were seated and ordered scallop crudo, burrata and seared octopus as appetizers and malbec wine bottle. I really enjoyed the burrata with crackers and seared octopus. Then bread came out while we waited for our mains. For our mains, we shared the squid ink pasta, lobster scampi pasta, filet mignon, grilled swordfish and creamed spinach as a side. My friends loved the lobster scampi (I am allergic to crustaceans). I, on the other hand, enjoyed the swordfish sauce with the corn and filet mignon. The squid ink pasta was decent.

An hr and 45 min into our dinner we realized we had to leave for the next event. We were full and had a bit of leftovers. Because we couldn't find our waiter we started to put our coats on to indicate we had to go. Shortly after one of the servers came over and we asked for the check. I wish we had a little time to try their dessert or receive a small birthday treat. Maybe next time!

Came for lunch on a weekday. Found the experience to be fine. The restaurant itself is really nice and spacious. Most of the guests seemed to be local workers.

The food was okay. The salmon burger was only okay: it wasn't very flavorful, so was a little difficult to eat. It was essentially just a basically just a salmon patty on the bun

Fries were tasty and they give a huge portion.

Talk about going downhill.  This place sure has .. used to be very good but now the seafood dishes are poorly prepared , smaller portions and way overpriced. Sad but true  .. Just getting a coke served in an can (vs a glass bottle) just says it all. It's now just a basic midtown costly mediocre restaurant.

Put on your best dress today and go spoil yourself, this restaurant treat u like a queen and a valued customer. The food was so good even if i wanted to i didn't leave the last noodle on the plate. The server was nice , the restaurant is beautiful i enjoyed it

My partner has been curious about the theatre menu offering so we decided to go before a show on a Friday night. This place is huge and was actually surprised at how busy it was at 5:30 since that is kind of early for dinner.

Of course, I had to get the oysters for my set menu and it was delicious! Loved the mignonette sauce with it and the oysters were a very good size. I ordered the moules frittes and the mussels were good but the fries were disappointing. The surprise hit was actually the monk fish that my partner ordered! The fish was good and the sides were delicious. I definitely, recommend the monkfish! The creamsicle parfait dessert was so good, much better than I expected! I don't know if I had a low expectations but the cake was so moist and had this lovely orange flavor to it.

I will be returning for this theatre menu!
Outstanding in all ways. The food, freshness, service, and atmosphere were all excellent. Really enjoyed our lunch. Not inexpensive, but worth every cent. Thanks!

So good!! We did the $95 4-course chef choice ( we were able to select our own choices from each section) It was beyond amazing! The noise level was loud but it was also very busy.. I didn't even notice after 15 minutes. They also remembered it was my birthday. Our waiters name was Felipe he was beyond great! He offered amazing recommendations, and remained attentive to our needs throughout the night.

Food was amazing, service was incredible, ambiance was perfect! We had an amazing time celebrating my boyfriends birthday, just the 2 of us.

We did the tasting menu and it was worth every penny!

My husband and I dined here before a show at Radio City Music Hall. The staff respected our time constraints and made our dining experience memorable. I have a gluten allergy and our server George made sure to explain my options and the chef provided gluten free versions of their offerings. The sommelier was informative and entertaining!  Overall, everyone we dealt with was welcoming and professional.  The food and special cocktails were delicious. We will definitely return to this fine establishment!
Great service and terrific seafood.  Convenient to theaters and shopping.  Mentioned it was a birthday and received a delicious chocolate cake!

My better half had picked this place out.  It had great reviews, was reasonably close to our hotel, and looked very nice.  It also had sea food, and after all the steak houses, it would be a nice change.  It was a Saturday night before the New York City Marathon, and this place was busy.

We arrived a few minutes prior to our reservation, and were seated promptly at a nice table.  The first thing we noticed was the Noise Level - which was VERY LOUD.  Like so loud, it was difficult to hold a conversation.  The problem was the acoustics - hard floors, hard walls, and no absorbers.  That's life.

Our waiter arrived, and I asked for a wine list.  Also, the restaurant sommelier arrived and offered his services.  I declined, since I know how to pair wine with food selections, and have a good knowledge of wines.

Then it got slow.  We waited 15 minutes for our waiter to come back.  We did note the table seated 5 minutes after us to our left had their orders taken, received drinks and appetizers while we waited.  And waited.  Interesting.

Our server finally showed up, and we selected a half bottle of Pinot Noir since we were going to a different place later in New York for a few specialty drinks, along with our appetizer and entrees.   Our bread and water arrived at that time.

The bread had a slightly salted top, and worked well with the olive oil which was served with it.

While we were waiting for the food, the sommelier arrived with our wine selection.  This is where things got interesting.  The sommelier removed the cork, and pocketed it.  This is unusual in my experience, but I let it go.  

I usually give the cork a sniff - I know you can't tell much, but you can get a feel for whether the wine is corked pretty readily from the unique odor if that happens.

Then the sommelier gave my wife the test taste - as I ordered, it should have been offered to me, which is a minor protocol breach and a first in all my restaurant visits.  

Fortunately (or unfortunately), my wife and I have had 4 corked bottles in our life, and three of them within the last week.  She took a sniff, gave me the raised eyebrow, and took a taste.  Then she said "I think you should taste this."

Yep, it was corked.  The flavor is very shall we say, distinctive.   Kind of like a moldy basement in this case, and flat.  I informed the sommelier that I felt the wine was corked, so he took it for a taste.  (away from us...)

He came back and said "I'm not going to disagree with you, but I sense no TCA here.  If you don't like the wine, I'll replace it."

Let's break that down:
He isn't going to disagree with me, but says he doesn't feel the wine is corked (as he could sense no TCA)?  Seems like he's disagreeing with me, because we could both smell it and taste it.  And it ISN'T a good taste.

We told him the bottle was unacceptable, and we selected a completely different half bottle (we went from the Pinot to a Chardonnay) to avoid a repeat issue with the same brand (from our prior experience where we had 3 bottles in a row of a Bordeaux which were corked).

We got past that, got the Chardonnay which was good, and then the food started to arrive.  We split a Caesar salad which had anchovies on it (folks, it isn't a Caesar Salad if it doesn't have anchovies).  Each salad had two house cured anchovies on it, and they and the salad were very good.

For the main course, I had their Swordfish and my wife had their Roasted Cod. And things got stranger.

From the menu, the Swordfish was supposed to be served with fregola, clam fricassee, caramelized fennel, thyme.  3 clams were present but I didn't see a fricassee, and instead I got a corn veloute, which was good, but not what the menu had said would come with the Swordfish.

My wife's Roasted Cod was supposed to have corn veloute, braised leek, and black garlic.  The braised leek was there, but no corn veloute and no black garlic.  

Are you confused yet?  We were.

It seemed as if service was by committee - we kept getting different servers bringing in parts of the meal.  Our dessert menu was brought by a bus person.

Maybe they had an off-day?  I'm not trying to be picky, but this was the only disappointing meal we had in our stay in New York's Manhattan area.

I came here for a business dinner, and even though I wasn't paying for it, I didn't think the food was worth the price.  I was thinking of trying the chef's tasting menu but decided against it since I didn't need an entree and pasta dish.  The octopus for our appetizer was my favorite part.  It came with a pine nut harissa sauce which paired perfectly with the octopus.  I really didn't like my main dish though which was the grilled sword fish.  We also got creamed spinach on the side which was the best part of the entree.  Drinks were also pretty good.

Really lovely atmosphere very close to Radio City Music Hall - that proximity is what drove us to make a reservation to eat there. Food was good, but what was telling is that for such a well-regarded fish restaurant, those of us that had the chicken and the raviolis enjoyed that more than the person that ordered salmon! In fact, our guest that ordered salmon didn't finish it!

Cocktails were delicious, as well as the desserts. Our waiter seemed dead inside and thoroughly uninterested in his job. The sommelier Matthew that came to our table however was outstanding. All other public-facing roles were enthusiastic and welcoming.

In all, a decent experience and not regrettable, but not one that I would choose to repeat - expensive and not outstanding.

Booked a 5pm reservation on a Friday night which happened to be my husbands birthday. We arrived at 4:30 and sat at the bar. The host/manager was kind enough to give us drink menus and dinner menus to browse.

When our drinks arrive we did a cheers to my husbands birthday.

We asked the gentleman about which oysters he recommended and went with half a dozen Peeko & half a dozen Kusshi. Delicious. So fresh.

At 5pm on the dot we were escorted to our table. The restaurant is beautiful. Our waiter was so nice. We got more oysters as an appetizer along with the seared octopus. Enjoyed both.

For entrees my husband got the gnocchi and I got the salmon. You can tell how fresh the gnocchi was. I was jealous of his meal but mine hit the spot.

We opted for coffee & tea before asking for the check. Before the check arrive the waiter brought over a piece of cake with HAPPY BIRTHDAY written on the plate. Compliments of the restaurant. Thank you to the manager who made it happen!

Definitely recommend. Close to the theaters if you have a show to see after.

Said to be another 'seafood standout' restaurant in NYC, the same Livanos family who own my fave City Limits restaurant acquired this particular beaucoup space with a soft glow main dining room and large bar area roughly 20 years ago plus another 15 elsewhere in NYC.

Prices border on blow-out, so order carefully. One for a special occasion like ours for Christmas Eve dinner. I don't mind the $38 price tag for a substantial fish- but theirs is super thin. My fish had a nice char that rested on a unique Sweet Potato mole. Dozen RI, ME and WA oysters were briny and plump, the buttery baked potato side (sans bacon) had itty-bitty lobster pieces. Hubs liked his $45 Seared Halibut with romanesco, smoked leek, bacon cream but was also on the small side. My Vegan daughter ordered 2 Vegetarian appetizers that were made into Vegan main courses. And my mom enjoyed her super small $49 hanger steak.

Our main courses actually had wonderful taste- just small. What I did have an issue with was our rubber "grilled octopus" appetizer which our server kindly brought another. Still rubbery it was.
Service was excellent and so was my cocktail that hit me quick. My daughter enjoyed her Rosé and hubs and my mom had their neat Jack Daniels. But with a name like 'Oceana', I was hoping it would give this seafood restaurant more respect because all you'd expect is royal treatment seafood.

I brought my fiancé here for his birthday, which just so happens to be on Valentine's Day. I really wanted to surprise him being that it was our first birthday celebration as a couple. So I already knew he loves seafood,and I asked around because I really wanted to make it special for him. After searching for a week or so I came across Oceana!! When I tell you, he still talks about how amazing the food was and the service was great! The server was attending to us and made sure we were good. Since it was his birthday they brought our a cake for him and they even offered to take our picture! We will definitely be returning, for another special occasion!

Thank you Oceana, you definitely impressed us!!!!

Other than difficulty getting lemon with my water service was good. The seating was odd with two of us seared at a table built for four and sitting awkwardly(we're childhood friends socializing). Food is competent but nothing memorable other than the Roman beans which I loved.  Was nice to see Albarino on the wine list, chardonnay rarely cuts it unless it's Chablis

Lately I prefer the smaller more personal restaurants. This is a fairly large etablishment. My suggestion is this is a great place before seeing a Broadway show and getting an above average meal but not as the sole destination.

Came here for a work lunch earlier this week. As one of the classics for a quick bite in midtown, Oceana delivers exactly what it promises: a reasonable range of good quality contemporary food at a fair price. The 4 dollar signs are a product of the seafood and caviar towers, both of which we avoided.

The tuna tartare was a burst of freshness, adequately seasoned with pickles and onions. The addition of mushrooms and bottarga certainly added a unique texture to the mash for this dish.

For my main course, I ordered a burger (medium). The aged cheddar was perfectly melted onto the juicy beef patty, which was sandwiched between lightly toasted but heavily buttered buns. I would have preferred less butter on the buns, and pickled onions instead of bacon, since it might work better with the aged cheddar. The fries were delicious and stayed crisp throughout the entire duration of my lunch. The serving size was huge - no way to finish these fries without sharing.

I would recommend Oceana for anyone seeking a high-quality lunch with colleagues or business associates in midtown.

I was drawn to come to Oceana based on their theatre menu. The fixed price $55 for 3 courses is a great deal (although I could honestly do without dessert)

Started off with a strawberry margarita and I'm like omg why don't I make one of these at home!? (Pro tip: bartender says he uses lemon juice instead of lime juice)
For the starter I did the ceviche and it was wonderful. For the main I did the hanger steak. SUCH A GOOD CHOICE. I was reading an ebook since I was dining alone and I literally could not concentrate on my book and put it down because all of my attention was drawn toward that wonderful steak.

Absolutely would recommend and return

This was a tough one to rate because there was a lot to like about it. But what ultimately pushed me to the three star side over the four star side was the service, which is the one thing that is the difference between our coming back again or not. We eat out a lot, and to me service is as important as the taste.

Here's the thing ... If the restaurant was busy, it might be understandable. If it had been New Year's Eve at 10 p.m. (or even at 8 p.m.), it might be understandable. But it was 6:30 on NYE. Not even half the restaurant was full; maybe a quarter. A good number of servers and back waiters were literally just standing around.

That our server walked by us a countless number of times without ever asking us for a drink order; or that it took over an hour for him to actually take our food order (after having to flag him down originally to take our oyster order), is just inexcusable and bad waitering.

Speaking of oysters, we ordered more than a dozen, two of each. I was dumbfounded that the person who brought the oysters out didn't take a moment to tell us which were which; and I was even more dumbfounded when we flagged our waiter over to ask him and he told us that he would have no idea and we should have asked the guy who brought them out. Wait, what?

And speaking of oysters (part two), I was surprised that at a place like this, given that seafood is supposed to be their specialty and that their oysters are at the prices they are, that they would be served with most not being released and having shell fragments.

Well, there went us ordering another dozen-plus.

Our waiter was not so much in the weeds that he could not stop to take our order in more than an hour. And he ABSOLUTELY was not too in the weeds to take time to stop and ask us at ANY point how things were, if everything was okay or if we needed anything. That's ABSOLUTELY INEXCUSABLE.

And NO, it had NOTHING to do with being NYE. The restaurant just wasn't that busy. My husband is a server at a well-known restaurant. Even if they were that busy, at some point, someone should have simply asked how things were. But, they weren't that busy at all.

This isn't a new place. They didn't just open. Oceana has been doing this long enough to know better and to train their servers better.

Food-wise the restaurant (sans the issue with the oysters) was mostly spectacular. The tuna tartare was nice. Though the octopus was over-cooked and a bit tough. My steak was absolutely, perfectly cooked, which is not something I often find. Most places don't do medium rare correctly. And Oceana was spot on, melt-in-your-mouth perfection. My husband had the veal chop.

I mean while the food was great; honestly, if the service isn't up to par and causes more annoyance than enjoyment, it's nearly impossible to enjoy the food or experience because you're sitting there stewing and getting irritated by former.

That's exactly what happened to us and what ultimately will be the reason I'm likely not to come back despite being our kind of restaurant and close to home.

Had a lovely pre-theatre dinner here. This is a classy restaurant with really good food. It is pricey and definitely busy but unlike some of the restaurants around the theatre district that seem to just churn out mediocre food - this one is really great.

I had an excellent tuna tartare (wished only for a pinch of salt and would have preferred a cracker to the heartier bread but it was still very good) followed by the lobster scampi with some housemade pasta.  My teen co-traveler had the calamari appetizer and then also had the lobster scampi.  We also enjoyed 4 of their gigantic cold shrimp.  A post dinner cappuccino and a hot chocolate rounded out our night.  The food was exceptional. The lobster scampi was quite pricey but it sure was amazing! The service was good though at times they were busy and we did have to flag for assistance from our primary waiter (not for water refills and such--the other attendants on the team had that well covered.). The fish dishes coming out to some nearby tables looked great.

It's also beautiful inside. Really nice. One downside is it's a little louder than I would prefer for such a high-end restaurant but guess it goes with the territory!
Overcooked, overpriced halibut despite staff's apparently scripted raves about it on a very slow Friday night where kitchen staff looked bored and uninspired. Spend your money elsewhere.

Impeccable service and the best Oysters Rockefeller ever. Quiet, upscale ambience.
Highly recommend
It's a exceptional spot for a classic dinner with a great dining setting ambience. Moderate proportion if you there for the scenery

Great spot for a corporate lunch.  Food was delicious and service was very quick and discreet. I had the salmon burger and fries and it was cooked perfectly.  My coworker had a pasta dish that looked perfectly cooked as well.

This place is always packed after work and during happy hour. It's a great place to meet colleagues and centrally located in midtown. The food (sliders especially) and drinks are great. The only issue is that because it's so packed the service is slow and the wait for a table is long. They would be smart to expand their outdoor seating with more tables - Will be back to the bar!

The best upscale seafood restaurant I've been to in Manhattan. A large establishment with a lively crowded atmosphere. The service was timely for my party of eight and very professional. Impressively memorable!

The service is amazing.  My first time here and it was a reunion of friends.  My friend chose Oceana because her mom loves seafood.  We had to push our reservations back several times due to the traffic for my friends coming into town.  Oceana staff were very accomodating.  We all enjoyed our individual dishes which included the monkfish, sole buerre, lobster, risotto.  Appetizers included gazpacho, grilled octopus, fried calamari and a selection of oysters/clams.  Even though we were the last seating at 9pm, they did not rush us through our meal.
The food was delicious. I had the grilled branzino. My date ate filet mignon. Service and ambiance the best.

Holiday treat! We ordered the Hanukkah Latke sampler for the holidays and when picking up, saw the beautiful and grand restaurant that may be one of the few places I would feel comfortable eating indoors. Likely in pre-COVID times this restaurant is packed with the theatre crowd, but currently the tables were spaced quite far apart and the restaurant felt very spacious.

Now the important part - the sampler was delicious. It included "Latkes Four Ways" - with smoked salmon and cream cheese; smoked trout, sour cream, trout roe; whipped egg and red cabbage; and short rib and pickled onion. It was a treat to try the different latkes, and made for a fun start to our meal. Lastly, the staff was over-the-top kind. We will definitely be back to dine in the restaurant.

Having eaten at Oceana several times, lunch and dinner, must say I've never been disappointed.  The food is exquisitely prepared, fresh, delicious.  Service is first rate, attentive, thoughtful, always smiling.  Even though the restaurant is big, you'd not know it, for, even full, the noise is not loud, you can hold a pleasant conversation with your fellow diners.  Very pleasant place!  I highly recommend it. Oh, don't get fooled by the name, there's something for everyone beyond sea food.

Oceana restaurant was very busy on a Thursday for an early dinner. The bar area was packed as well as the large restaurant space. The service here is impeccable, attention to every detail. Alejandra was friendly and engaging. We loved her! The bread service was warm focaccia. There's nothing like warm bread. My husband and I started out with cocktails, I had a very well-made Paloma. We began with appetizers - he had the grilled octopus and I had the yellowtail crudo. Both appetizers were delicious. The grilled octopus was grilled to perfection and not rubbery. The yellowtail was fresh and buttery.  We the  ordered seafood dishes for dinner. My husband had the branzino and I had the halibut. Both fish were fresh, prepared deliciously and tasty. I ended with a cappuccino which was perfectly frothed. I do recommend this restaurant for its fresh fish, stellar service and great cocktails & food. Just be sure to make reservations before you go.
Overpriced restaurant but close enough to theater district to get a nice dinner before a play

This used to be one of our absolute favorite restaurants... We used to look forward to the chef's table for all of our special celebrations. This is the first time we have ever walked out of a restaurant. The service was amazing (the staff were kind and attentive) but the chef was pompous and rude and the food was inedible. This was the first time we ever got up mid meal, paid for what they brought out to us and left. The food was absolutely horrible. So disappointed to see such a great restaurant go downhill

Oceana is beautiful inside and out. The restaurant brings business men and women, families, and smaller parties especially during the lunch rush. The staff are friendly despite how busy it can get and I enjoyed my meal. I had the burger (I can't remember if it was the Grass-fed Burger or the Angus) with french fries and didn't have any major  complaints or incredible praise. The outdoor seating option is great if you're still not comfortable with indoor dining, but just note that you might have to deal with some wind. This is an expensive option for food I didn't find out of this world, but definitely a nice option if someone is treating you or taking you for a celebratory occasion.

Fancy seafood place. Perfect for a night of fine dining with a full bar that would be the envy of any high end restaurant.
Luxurious interior space with just great food and service . The price is high but if your in town for one night and must have a great dinner; go here.

Had a special birthday lunch here, with no reservation.

They did a 6 ounce filet mignon to perfection with some fresh broccoli and buttery rich mashed potatoes.   That was perfect.

I ended up having the simple "spicy tuna" rolls which came with 6 pieces and was possibly the best sushi I ever had.

The atmosphere is special and memorable and you feel like your "among the beautiful people" of NYC.

There was a small mix up in the pricing, since their computer was charging the dinner prices for the lunch item...but we caught it and they corrected it.

I'll be back for another special occasion soon.

Tik tok made me try this restaurant called Oceans and I enjoyed every second of it. This sea inspired restaurant located in Union Square was a perfect experience of taste and aesthetics. It was certainly a seafood lover's paradise with everything from nigiri to ceviche. There were surf and turf options to meet everyone's appetite.

Price range: $50-100 per person

What we ordered:
*What's it called? (cocktail)
*Pacific Rim (cocktail)
*Jacob's Ladder (cocktail)
*Ceviche Mixto
*Charred Spanish Octopus
*Braised Lamb Belly Casarecce
*Alaskan Black Cod

Really good food.
I really enjoyed my visit to oceans, every plate we had was delicious and the food got to our table really fast. The place is beautiful and has excellent acoustics, it was packed and we weren't overwhelmed by noise.
I loved the tsunami and the roll and would recommend ordering them, the truffle fires in the other hand were just ok maybe instead of ordering those try the lobster mac and cheese

We loved Carlotto so wanted to try this place. It was good but overall a bit unremarkable. We liked the free focaccia to start (which I believe is the same as the one you pay for at Carlotto), the Madai snapper from Japan, which we got as sashimi (a 2 lb fish was $88), and the seafood rigatoni. My husband loved the key lime pie. The wild mushroom soup and the octopus with fava beans were fine but nothing special and tasted pretty average.

It was our anniversary so they were kind enough to put a candle in the dessert we ordered and bring our separate candies on another dessert plate that said happy anniversary. It was a nice touch.

Service was also good and attentive. They even called my cell after we left to let us know we left the leftover food we had packed.

It may have just been what we ordered so will come back to give it another shot. Definitely want to try the black cod as that has had great reviews.

They treated us so well here. We stopped in on a rainy afternoon in between lunch and dinner service for a drink at the bar. The last couple lunch tables were heading out, so we were the only ones there for at least an hour. Yet, at no point did we feel like we were an inconvenience, even when the dinner staff came out for their pre-service meeting.

After our drink we were craving something sweet. The kitchen wasn't technically open yet, but our awesome bartender worked his magic and was able to order us a chocolate molten cake which was to die for.

The restaurant is stunning. High ceilings, elegant decor, a stately bar. It's also huge. There is an entire back room and downstairs areas for private parties.

Can't wait to come back to try dinner!

Oceans was a great dining experience. We had three servers attending to our every need. My water was never more than half empty, I always had a fresh espresso martini at the ready when I hit the bottom of the last, and our dinner was brought out in stages so we were never overwhelmed. The Garden Roll was textured and flavorful. The Mac and cheese was decadent, as were the truffle fries. The espresso martinis were smooth, lightly sweet, and frothy. 11/10!

Everything about this place was incredible. We went to a movie nearby and my friend had seen Oceans online so we decided to just stop buy and grab a bite. We had no idea how upscale it was (high tech toilets!) and we were in our clothes from Barbie. The restaurant was empty as they had just opened so we were able to just walk in without a reservation. Even in an empty restaurant we felt very underdressed.

We started with drinks. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the flavors of each cocktail and recommended drinks to us. He checked on us often throughout the night made sure we were always taken care of.

We had intended on only grabbing a quick bite but when we saw how nice the place was we realized we needed to try a quite a few things while we were here. Our food started with the free warm Focaccia. Then we got west coast oysters (very fresh), the Rocketman sushi roll (good but nothing crazy special) and the crab cake. The Crab Cake was the best of our starters. It was mostly REAL crab meat and the bed of sauce under it paired very well.

For our main course we had their Langoustine Rigatoni special and the Alaskan Black Cod. The flavors were absolutely there for both and you could tell how fresh the fish was. For dessert, we ended with the warm doughnuts (which I can never say no to if it's on  menu). They were light and small and the perfect way to end the meal.

first time here for dinner was last night with 3 other people. easy to get a reservation, wasn't crowded at all at 8 P.M on a Saturday but was a full house shortly thereafter. reminds me heavily of Ocean Prime (a chain restaurant but a great one!)

our waiter, a woman from Poland, took great care of us and really knew the menu. prompt and kind but unobtrusive.

friends ordered an incredible white wine from the *extensive* wine list (can't remember the name but it was like $170 from the Austria section.) I'm usually not a fan of white wine but looved the sip I had of it. + Shoutout to the Oceans' sommelier!! Didn't catch his name but his wealth of knowledge was impressive and he helped the table make an incredible choice. I did have a Pacific Rim cocktail which was well made!

the menu is my pescatarian DREAM. sushi, sashimi/nigiri, whole fish, wide variety of appetizers, entrees, and raw bar items.. YES YES YES. everything looked incredible and we planned on ordering more but were way too full after the Seafood Tower (large portions and a great value.) Speaking of, the tower came with oysters, clams, mussels, peekytoe crab "dip," shrimp ceviche, tuna sashimi, jumbo shrimp cocktail, and marinated calamari. didn't like the calamri.

Also ordered the Platinum Osetra caviar service as they were out of the Siberian Sturgeon. didn't love that it was served with toast points as opposed to blinis but was delicious nonetheless.

whole interior is meticulously thought out. gorgeous and kinda old world industrial. fresh seafood array on ice by the kitchen. spacious bar with almost any spirit you can imagine.

must come for a nice seafood dinner!

The epitome of fresh catch fine dining. If you're tired of steakhouses and annoyed by Omakase, don't chase Michelin stars and TikTok trends just because it seems like everyone is doing it. Restaurants like Oceans (which is a minor typo away from being Oceana) are where you should be spending your money. At this price point, one dish needs to blow you away. Here, the whole fish, unagi, *and* lamb casarecce all blew me away. None come at predatory price points. Try this restaurant.

I had a busy morning at work, and walked to this place, as I was dying to try some seafood while in the city. I couldn't decide what to do, so I ordered both a seafood dish and some sushi.

The Rocketman sushi was just as amazing as it sounded. It was a delicious roll topped with seared salmon. The salmon was super fresh, and the sear of the salmon mixed with the small hint of truffle set this off. Now the Alaskan Black Cod. Baby...this changed my life. The cod was very, very fresh and had an almost buttery taste to it. The glaze on the fish, caramelized, just perfectly  and it gave the fish a nice sweet taste to go with the creaminess of the fish. I didn't love the vegetables and broth it was atop of, but who cares; this fish was a dream.

This was definitely the best meal I had while visiting New York.. and I was there for an entire week. I was eating everything under the sun! This definitely lives up to the hype and the delicious pictures. When I come back to the city, I'm definitely swinging by again.

Restaurant weekkkk has arrived and this is a great choice in general. I part took in the Lunch Restaurant Week menu. The portions were large and very filling. My starters was the Octopus topped with shredded onions. It was quite tasty, not salty at all. My main was the Faroe Island Salmon. Not the best salmon I had but still was pretty tasty.
Definitely would go back after Restaurant Week to explore the other things they have to offer.

I recently read an article about the popular Japanese New Year lucky food called the buri. After reading further, I discovered that consuming buri has significant health benefits. Very few restaurants carry this type of fish. I learned this place has it, and this particular dish has black truffles and peking duck broth.  

The complementary bread was so good, and I devoured it because the Sancerre was coming out through my pores. The Toro tartare topped with caviar the wonton crisps. It was a great starter dish.

Then the grilled buri came in - one of the amazing dishes I've ever had, and the Sancerre cuts through the flavors of the dish, making it balanced.

The place is so pretty. I would consider having a birthday dinner or a girls' dinner here. By the way, the bathrooms are tech based, where everything functions by pressing buttons on a wall mounted keypad. Service was great.

We love Oceans New York, though admittedly we have had a love hate relationship with them over the last couple of years, which is why I gave only four stars and not five.

Caviar and oyster wise, it's top notch. Though I do find the toast they serve with the caviar a bit on the low-rent side of things and seemingly not in keeping with the quality of the caviar. It doesn't really mesh well for me.

What bothers me, and why I can't give that fifth star, is the service. Technically, it's perfect. They do the right things-ish. Most seem to be well trained. BUT, we are not drinkers. (Though we tip much better than most of the alcohol crowd.). And it always becomes abundantly clear that despite a sizable check (oysters, caviar, apps, steaks, etc ... you do the math), the attentiveness of the servers seems to go away and become extinct the minute we say we only want sparkling water.

That's one of my pet peeves (or in the opposite cases, one of the things I tip extra generously for) when a server changes their demeanor and service for people who don't have a high alcohol bill. Drunk does not make them better tippers. Often, it's the opposite.

None-the-less it has been one of the reasons that I often don't jump when my hubby suggests there.

But, it's still high on our list of faves in the city, when I can move past my irritation and high expectations.

Oh my goodness, where to begin! Oceans is such a fabulous spot! I came here for my birthday dinner in November with a group of 5 and we had the best time!

We were seated for our reservation right on time. Our waiter was wonderful and knowledgable about the menu. If he wasn't around, other members of the staff were around to assist.

My martini-loving group all ordered martinis and they were fabulous - definitely recommend (standard vodka martinis and espresso martinis).  I ordered the Charred Spanish Octopus and Tomato & Cucumber Salad. I wish I could have this meal for every meal until I die (lol). All of the ingredients were so fresh and delicious and perfectly prepared. The other members of my group were very pleased with the variety of dishes they each ordered.

I look forward to returning and trying more of the menu!

Wow this place is amazing. 5 stars.

Little did we know it's restaurant week and there's a prefixe menu to order from.

Seafood tower, house salad, filet mignon, and cheesecake. Service was amazing and each order was brought out timely, not rushed. I loved the house made focaccia bread - to die for. Seafood tower had half a lobster, oysters, clams, ceviche, and the pokey crab salad thing. House salad could have used more dressing but the star of dinner was the filet mignon. Cooked medium to perfection, the demi glaze sauce was devine. I actually finished my plate and that never happens.

Bravo Oceans NY. This was truly a delight. Service was excellent.

Service

The waiter and waitress was attentive. Food came out promptly.  No extended wait time at all.

Food  & Libations

Taking advantage of restaurant week. I had the mushroom soup which was amazing. Great flavor paired with the croutons. For the main course i had the Cod which was light and buttery. Great tasting overtop crunchy bok choy! My ginger inspired cocktail was perfect to go with my meal. Flawless meal.

Ambiance.

Very chill vibe. With sea inspired decor. By far the best bathroom I've used! If you go here check it out!

Returning or nah ?

Is this even a question? Hell yeah !

Came for dinner with a friend. Definitely make a reservation, because this place was packed on a weeknight. I started with the spyglass cocktail, which was excellent, then tried:

+ Little gem caesar
+ Maryland crab cake
+ Alaskan black cod - great
+ Truffle fries
+ Lobster mac and cheese
+ Braised lamb belly casarecce
+ Carrot cake

On the whole, the apps were better than the mains and sides (especially the crab cake), but the casarecce was amazing - definitely the highlight. Would come back!

Being here because of NYC restaurants week.

Nice place. Amazing taste & service.
Salad's size was out of my expectation. Fresh.
Little pear cube in tuna tartare sparks the whole dish.
Beware of their raisins in salmon. They added some sprite but may be not good for teeth.
Food was impeccable, service was second to none, and the place is gorgeous. Could not believe it wasn't packed but it was Labor Day weekend. Will be back here and soon!

My friends and I had a nice dinner. The place is elegant and service was attentive.

We start off with The Seafood Tower which I wasn't too impressed, but the shrimp cocktail was really good. The Charred Spanish Octopus was tasty and I loved the Alaskan Black Cod, it was cooked perfectly and delicious.

Bit pricy, but great food.
Ambience, service, everything was great.
Recommend for special occasions.

Oceans reminds me of Trulocks without the stone crab which they only have once in awhile. They do have bidets in the water closet so that was a treat! Lol. I ordered a delicious appetizer which was the bluefin tuna tartare without pine nuts. It's small and perfect since I'm not that hungry and just wanted to sit at the bar and feel the positive vibes here!

Wonderful ambiance, expansive wine selection, amazing food and stellar service: what more could one need in a restaurant?! I came for lunch yesterday with my colleagues. We dined in a beautiful private room downstairs. Everything was fantastic and I was throughly pleased with each course that I had: tuna tartare (starter), Alaskan black cod (main course) and the blueberry cheesecake for dessert. I also was able to try the chocolate truffle torte which was silky smooth and had a deliciously rich chocolate flavor. This restaurant made for a truly memorable experience, and I look forward to returning again soon to enjoy another fantastic meal.

The drinks here were great! This is a good date spot. Must order dish: sushi, lobster mac, brussles, lava cake.

We started with the tuna tartare and fresh focaccia bread. The Maryland crab cake was a great app but small. The Cesar salad was good, shrimp and salmon sushi were yummy. The lobster mac is a staple dish.

Best dessert was the molten lava cake! Can't go wrong!

Really unexciting (but not bad) food in a beautiful, luxurious space. Came here on a Saturday for lunch and the place was basically empty. Ordered a variety of seafood and nothing was bad, but it was all pretty mediocre. My favorites were the shrimp scampi and the broccolini. Ordered the cod because it's popular but I thought the sauce was too sweet. Came mainly for the space and ambiance which was nice, but the food was so not memorable that I probably wouldn't come again. Also, the service wasn't great. Our waiter was very friendly but he forgot 2 items, which made the lunch really drag out.
Amazing food and very quiet which is a nice change for NYC! David Rockwell interiors. I'd definitely go back especially with customers or just needing a respite from the city.

I love treating myself to a nice dinner here. The seafood platter is always super fresh, the focaccia bread and oil/butter they serve it with is always the perfect complement. And oh my god, you CANNOT skip the Rocketman roll. It is one of their signature rolls and it is unlike any other sushi roll I've ever had. They char the miso glaze atop the roll and it makes for an incredible umami experience.

We also ordered a braised lamb casarecce pasta, and that was also extremely flavorful and delicious. I am surprised that one place can make both seafood and meat dishes perfectly. Oceans definitely pulls off their fusion menu extraordinarily well.

/)/)
( . .)
( づ one of my fav restaurants in nyc! The fish was incredibly fresh and def recommend trying the crab cake. It was the best one I've had so far!!!

We also ordered the halibut, which was super creamy and light, lobster roll and lobster Mac n cheese. The mac n cheese one was so cheesy and delicious. Also recommend trying!

The vibe, the service and staff is outstanding. Also they offer a variety of (non alcoholic) drinks which all were super delicious.
Loved everything about it! I didn't feel like it was overpriced for what we got. Totally worth!

My friend and I were greeted warmly by the hostess. Our server Carlos was the best. His knowledge of the menu was superb.
We ordered five appetizers, including the Octopus, which we found was not that great. Crab Cake and Tuna tartar was very good.
For main We had the Dover Sole and another fish. Comparatively, the Dover Sole was overpriced, $90.
The decor and attentive staff is worth mentioning.

Came here for my girlfriend's bday and the service + vibes here are amazing. The hostess was very welcoming and came to check on us multiple times. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive--I don't think our water cups were ever empty. We ordered a non-alcoholic drink called "Early Riser" and this was delicious and very refreshing.

As for the food:
Parmesan truffle fries: Standard fries. They're good
Crab cake: 10/10. They do not skimp on crab meat and would come back just to get more of this
Salmon: They do an amazing job searing the skin and that really adds to the dish. The flavor itself is also just standard. Not the best but it's good. The vegetable(s) paired with the salmon were a bit too plain in flavor for me. However I will say they nailed the texture with the cauliflower bits, nuts and raisins.
Black Cod: You could tell right off the bat that this fish was very fresh. You could taste the natural sweetness of the cod and the Asian inspired flavors complemented well. This dish was very unique and it was interesting to try out.

We were very full right after our meal and were going to opt out of dessert since we have a bad habit of over stuffing ourselves. However our waiter and general manager surprised my GF with a NY style cheesecake with a blueberry sorbet stating she couldn't leave without some dessert! The staff here are second to none and even though not all the food was to my taste, would come back for the vibes and try some more dishes and drinks.

I've been to this restaurant for Restaurant Week before, but I wanted to try out more of the menu so I decided to have my graduation dinner here! We reserved a table for 6 at 8:15 PM. The staff was nice enough to allow us to use a private back room for dinner and I couldn't have been happier. The servers were very attentive and kept the drinks flowing. We ordered a variety of items:

Maker Mine: Delicious and refreshing cocktail with pineapple and Maker's Mark. Had 2 of these because of how good they are!
Dozen Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh, tasty, and reasonably priced.
Rocketman Sushi Roll: Highlight of my night! Easily one of the best sushi rolls I've ever had. The truffle miso sauce really adds a delicious umami flavor. Would come back again just for this.
Alaskan Black Cod: This was a beautifully present dish but it came up short in flavor. I found it was really missing something in the dashi. Overall, just very bland but could just be me.
Lobster Mac & Cheese: Pretty good! Cripsy top with a nice cheese pull and decent amount of lobster throughout.
Strawberry Cheesecake: Nice portion of yummy cheesecake. Was really surprised by the blueberry sorbet. Didn't think I would enjoy it but it was the perfect compliment.

This was a perfect night! Almost all of the dishes we had were great and the service was impeccable. Will 100% be back. Rating: 5/5.

NYC high quality meal.

Make sure you have the fresh sushi.

Open kitchen. Incredible service.

A little loud in there but it was a Saturday night in the big apple.

Food was good; service was not.  We were seated at an end table that seemed not to have a waitperson assigned to it.  Had to call staff over to get a menu, take a drink order, take our order.  At the end of the meal, I waited for a coffee until I asked for the bill and told the waiter to ignore the coffee - he stated he thought I did't want it.  The bus staff refilled my water glass many times and were very attentive.
When the food came, it was very good - no issue at all.

Came here for restaurant week 2022 which included appetizer, main course, and dessert for $60. Food was delicious and the restaurant decor was modern but cozy. The waiters were on point with water refills and when my friend asked about two different cocktails, they were able to give some detailed explanations to help him make his choice.

The seafood appetizers and main course were delicious. Sushi roll was super fresh and I didn't even need the soy sauce. The Rigatoni Nero with shrimp, mussels, calamari, and confit tomato *chefs kiss*. I can eat this all day!  The braised short rib was okay. I would stick with the seafood next time as this was a little dry. The desserts weren't sweet which is perfect for me since I don't like sweets and while the cocktails were good, they are pretty pricey (ranging from $18-20 each).

This is a good choice for a group or small dinner. Well located and great ambiance, with service to match
Our group was about 10 people. We ordered a bottle of wine, and the sommelier came to answer questions, which was nice
We tried the oysters, tuna tartare, and ceviche as appetizers.
Entrees included salmon, black cod, and steak, all seemed happy with it!
We ordered the molten chocolate cake and the doughnuts to share, both were big and delicious.
Overall a good place!

Stopped in for a drink while waiting for friends. Surprised to find the best bathroom in the world. The toilet was advanced and operated by a touch screen. There were cloth towels. The restrooms were spacious and gender neutral.

Extensive list of whiskeys though it was pricey. A lot of the pours were priced at 50-100% of the retail cost of a full bottle. Frankly, I think it's well worth the premium for the opportunity to use their restroom.

They had some creative cocktails too so I ended up having a mezcal based one that had cinnamon. Reminded me a bit of a Manhattan. Very well orchestrated cocktail. Service at the bar was phenomenal. Greeted promptly. Order was ready quick. Super professional.

A good friend brought me here for a celebratory dinner - first, our server was knowledgeable, well versed on the menu and specials, and was just a whole ass vibe (in the best way possible). Next the food... AMAZING. We had east coast oysters & the tuna tartare with caviar for apps. For mains we had grilled whole fish and the langoustine special of the day. And finished it off with the homemade donuts. I will be back!

Honestly , this place is over rated . We though all of our food and appetizers were okay. Nothing special at all. The crab cake had no flavor . The Cesar salad had way too much dressing . Our steak came undercooked , not how we requested , so they took it back and brought it back out when we were almost done eating. Our Sea Bass lacked flavor . Service was okay. Lobster was good. We won't be back.

Perfection! Loved everything we ordered, the vibe, the service, the cocktail, it was really special and my family and I enjoyed every aspect immensely!

Our server was nice, knowledgeable and on top of everything! He made some excellent suggestions which I took, from the crab special app, to the languistine sleicos entree to the ginger martini ( Movie Star?) to the molten chocolate cake for dessert!

We had the salmon, the lobster roll, the pomme purée, the brussel sprouts , the asparagus, the sorbet, the doughnuts, various coffees..

The doughnuts were a bit sweet apparently but the cake was a hit.. the portions were great and the langoustine was really amazing! Better than the lobster I had last that was supposedly from Maine elsewhere ..

We were celebrating but happy to come back anytime!

Highly recommend..

Edit- was really looking forward to enjoying my delicious leftovers but sadly they somehow forgot to include the potatoes ... :(

Came here on Saturday night with a party of 2.  Amazing ambiance and bar area.  The food was good, not spectacular and it was way over priced.  I've been wanting to come here since it opened and I was so disappointed.  We got the tuna tartare and edamame to start and the branzino, steak and brussels sprouts.  It was just a really expensive average American restaurant with an elevated atmosphere.  I'll probably only come back here for drinks at the bar.

Some of the best food I ever ate in my life , the service was excellent, drinks were perfect, the whole place is worth experiencing, , the charred octopus was to die for , the mushroom soup was good , the lobster roll was tasty too,
Very fresh seafood offered in many ways: raw tower, sashimi or sushi, and baked. The shortrib steak and crab cake were also excellent.

I'm not sure what the hype is about. The place is average. Only stand out fish was the whole red snapper sashimi. We ordered majority of the appetizers they offered and small plates and had the dover sole to share. Was hoping for a lot more. Didn't even take pictures of everything since it was so lackluster.

Came for restaurant week. Beautiful restaurant. Superb service. But was very underwhelmed by the food. It was a forgettable meal. Felt like everything was a little under seasoned. Looked prettier than it tasted. I do wonder tho if the non restaurant week food tastes better or different.
Also the hostess made a weird comment to the party in front of us about how it was restaurant week... but said it in a way like she couldn't wait for restaurant week to be over. Like she was looking down at those customers. It was a weird vibe.

This is an excellent restaurant.  On this second occasion we tried the mushroom soup, market salad, chicken, lobster, haddock, sashimi and black bass.  All were excellent.  Imagine excellent chicken?  Seldom ever happens.  Also good were the desserts: the donuts, carrot cake and banana trifle.

Is good !

My Friend and I came to this Restaurant during Restaurant week, we did reservations through Restaurant week web page.  Weird thing they were advertised in Restaurant week but they only participated just one week, weird huh. This restaurant is very pricey and the fun is to try many restaurant during this week or month to to take advantage of the specials. I guess maybe next year I will try to come during the week they are participating, is good is they highlight which week it is.

The Ambiance is fantastic, very charming a cute decoration. The service was fast and very amicable.  Everything was fresh and very good quality.

We ordered 2 drinks and 2 Shushi plates.  

Sushi was fresh and succulent , is a sushi bar so this is not surprising LOL.

Drinks well made, excellent combination of rums. I ordered EIFFEL , was sweet but no so strong, very good.

Only 4 stars because their participation in restaurant week was a little bit shady.

Came here for lunch and it was great. Reserving via Open Table was a breeze and we got seated right away. The menu included omakase lunch, nigiri, normal rolls, and many other seafood options. You can't go wrong with anything tbh - everything we got tasted perfect and was done fairly quickly. Our server was attentive and answered all the questions we had - highly recommend this restaurant!
Perfect spot for a nice dinner - the martinis are great and the sushi is fresh (get the rocketman roll)!
Saw Tyler Perry dining here it was really cute. The food was delicious. Expensive but worth it.
I've come here so many times and it's amazing EVERY TIME. Sushi is to fucking die for!!! Everything is always fresh and the expresso martinis top notch. My favorite place

Taking a picture of my food was the last thing on my mind when eating Oche A Tu Gusto last week.

I wanted a nice selection of mofonguitos to try from this legendary Dominican fast food spot. I went with the pollo, chicharron, and camarones mofonguitos.

While they were all delicious, the chicharron won my heart. The crispiness of the pork and softness of the plantains were a match made in heaven.

We first ate them while they were fresh. Then we put the leftovers in the fridge to reheat and finish later. Bruh, they  taste 10 times better after being reheated!! Something about the proteins of the food breaking down and releasing glutamates occurs when food is left to sit for awhile (fun fact of the day).

TLDR: bring cash and order mofonguitos!!!!

For someone who isn't Dominican and not familiar with the fast food they eat this is certainly a good place to start if you're in Washington Heights. The staff are so nice and helpful, they're patient and I really felt like they took their time to explain what everything was. The food was good and was not greasy (which I was really excited about). I 100% recommend it, but not if you're a vegetarian lol.

What a spectacular find. I love the vibe. Every single thing was fantastic and tasty. Everybody at the Oche A Tu Gusto was so pleasant and accommodating. Would certainly recommend Oche A Tu Gusto to everyone.
They have the best chimichuries sandwiches ever and there monfonguitos are just mouth watering deff going to keep on ordering from here

They made the best Dominican fast food that I ever tasted...
My favorite plate is the camarofongo in the white sauce; OMG! The best Mofongo in my whole life.
The only thing they need is a better delivery service to get known throughout New York.
All I am going to say is, churrasco con tostones! Steak and fried plantains! oh and the pizza empanadas are out of sight!, price is decent but major kudos to the chef, very satisfying!

I love the mofonguitos of chicharron from this place, since is near my house I usually call for delivery, the mofonguitos are very tasty and it brings a lot of cheese on top. the downside is that they don't accept cards and most of the ATMs around the area ask for a fee which at the end you ended up paying more than you usually pay... overall, good place for their fast food

I just had the Shrimp Mofongo
In White Sauce is Absolutely the Best in The Tri-State area. You must try it.  Kelvin Crucey
The best Dominican food ever! The best mofongo with longaniza and the shrimp mofonguito. The service is the best and they cook super fast can't wait to go back!!!

I had the mofongito...first time I've had that. I felt like it was a little too hard for my liking, however, it did taste very good. In addition, we had the pizza pastelillos...the kids loved. all in all I bought 6 mofongitos, 2 pastellilos, Gatorade and snapple for $16.

I was in the mood for chimichangas and decided to give this a try. The inside is tiny, but I knew right away the food was gonna be good. It was DELICIOUS! They have a sweet sauce (almost tasted like Russian dressing) drizzled on top and then smothered with cheese. If you're in the area, give this place a chance

I have to say I had the best mofongo I ever had this is a little place but it's big in flavors the food taste very very good I love this place, I come here a lot and it's always good, I tried mofongo churrasco and it's the best I ever had I highly recommend this place. If you like Spanish food this is the place.
the food was trash!!! do not ever order from here.. I order the chicken and waffle sandwiches and the chopped cheese and waffle sandwich and they send us two plates of rice and burgers on a stick..

the food is fucking old. they refried they chicken over and over. they coleslaw is old. don't can't nothing from there cuz shit old as fuck. waste of fucking money. it's a shame how they serve us old fucking food. don't even waste ya time here.

This place is tucked between 1st Ave and York, and so nice to walk into. 4 chandeliers line the ceiling. The place is comfortable, but good for dressing up, too.
We had 3 appetizers, but we ate most before I remembered to take pics. Beet salad, salad trio (spinach, leeks, eggplant). They looked like olives. Very nice presentation. Of course we had the amazing cheesy bread.
2 entrees, chicken kebabs and Cornish game hen. Flavors were unique and yummy!

So great! I was part of a party of three that ate dinner here on the recommendation of a local friend. The ambiance was lovely -- the decor is beautiful and gracious, the place settings were equally charming. And the food . . . wow! Great cocktails, great (Georgian!) wine, great non-alcoholic options. If you are a fan of passion fruit, go for their passion fruit lemonade. It was a perfect summer thirst quencher.

My dining companions each enjoyed soups: one, the best borscht she had ever had, and the other a yogurt-based soup that was served with sides of bread and cucumbers. Each of us went for the Georgian salad with walnuts, which is terrific. I selected the game hen with blackberry sauce as a main, and was thrilled with the flavors. Full disclosure: the sauce makes it difficult to see where the meat ended and the bones began, so I recommend eating with care. The bread selections are amazing and merit the promotion they get from the staff. Service was impeccable, warm, friendly, and knowledgeable.

I have enjoyed many great meals in Manhattan, and this rates up there with the best. Highly recommended.

Take a voyage into a rich European heritage right in the heart of your city at Oda House - a spot that combines an excellent atmosphere and equally exciting culinary delights.

Atmosphere: (4/5)

Oda House is a charmer with its splendid atmosphere.  Picture a classic European house, bursting with heritage and vibrancy.  You'd be easily taken by the thoughtful decorations adorning the wall, adding character to the entire setup.

Food & Drinks: (5/5)

The Georgian red wine here is an absolute delight - full-bodied and richly flavored.  We were two sharing, and we savored every sip.  Our main was the Luba Chicken Shwarma, accompanied by a side of mashed potatoes.  The chicken was herbaceous, delightful, and honestly, one of the best shawarmas I've ever indulged in.  The mashed potatoes served as an excellent companion to the dish.

Service: (3/5)

Service at Oda House was satisfactory, although there's some room for improvement, particularly with the QR code system for their menu.  Nonetheless, it does give you a plethora of options to choose from.

Overall

To sum it up, the experience was memorable and utterly satisfying.  From the wine selection to the main course, Oda House impressed on multiple fronts, making it a worthwhile visit!

We had lunch yesterday.   A big appetizer sampler and a walnut salad.   Everything was very good.   Portions were large.   It was enough for 4 people,  but we were 2, so lots to take home!  Nice atmosphere, and the service was great.  We'll be back!

Oda House on the Upper East Side is a Georgian restaurant featuring authentic dishes. For dinner we ordered the beef and pork Khinkali, Tolma (beef & pork wrapped in grape leaves) and a mandatory Adjaruli (cheese boat) which was sinfully cheesy. For mains we had the Mtsvad (skewer grilled chicken shish-kebab) and Chanakhi (seared organic, lamb baked in clay pot with grilled vegetables). For dessert we settled on the Shok - Manje, a cognac infused chocolate pudding, and my personal favorite, the Ideali, a honey-walnut cake iced with condensed milk cream. Oda House is our favorite Georgian restaurant in NYC and highly recommend it for those looking to try the rich flavors of Georgian cuisine and wine

Great for date night!

Really nice space, with a dark ambiance. They have a mint water option, which was really refreshing on a hot night. The staff was friendly and made good suggestions.

We had:

- Small Adjaruli - delicious cheesy egg and bread appetizer

- Beef Dumplings - good but a bit too doughy for me.

- Georgian Salad with Walnuts - this had to be one of the best salads we ever had. Fresh tomatoes and cucumbers with an amazing dressing. I want one now!!

- Lamb Clay Pot - a lamb stew - the hubby loved but a bit too gamey for me.

We will definitely come back, there are a few other items we would like to try.

What a lovely surprise, on a cold rainy evening, to find a delicious hearty meal of Georgian roots. I had only once in my life tried one dish (the cheese bread); and tonight's dinner experience really opened my taste buds to new combinations of ingredients and new flavors

What we tried and highly recommend:

Khinkali
Oversized hand-rolled dumplings filled with seasoned organic beef, pork, and herbs- plump and juicy

Adjaruli
Homemade sulguni & Imeruli cheeses baked in yeast dough, served with poached organic egg and butter mixed in

Mtsvadi
Skewer grilled Georgian shish-kebab made from organic pork, served with grilled vegetables

Chakapuli
Organic grass-fed lamb slow cooked with tarragon, mint, scallions, parsley, cilantro & white wine, served with Georgian bread.

Lobio Rachuli
Pinto beans cooked with homemade smoked pork belly, onions, fresh herbs & Georgian spices, served with mchadi (corn bread) & Georgian salad

For desserts we had

Mariami - Oda special
Wine dipped prunes & walnuts in shortcrust pastry, iced with sourcream & topped with chocolate

Napoleoni
Puff pastry with homemade Bavarian cream

My ultimate favorites that I could easily finish on my own were the cheese bread and shish kebabs. We did love everything though and even ordered repeats to go (take out for home!)
Fantastic food selection! Make sure to get the cheese bread boat, it was the highlight of our meal for sure.

The food here is tasty and has mild aromas. Definitely try a khachapuri (cheesey bread dish with an egg in the center) and the Khinkali (dumplings) which are staples in Georgian cuisine. The main dishes we tried were also good. We tried the Lobio (pinto beans plus corn bread) and Mitzvadi (meat skewers).

We tried the Georgian house wine (amber colored) and it tasted like a watered down red wine so I do not recommend that, but otherwise, the food was great.

The space is large and well decorated. It is hard to appreciate with the low lighting but my friends and I enjoyed our visit there. All the staff were kind and attentive.

I preferred the appetizers here over the main course items. I came with a larger group, so we shared multiple appetizers between us. We got the chicken khinkali, oda special zulien khinkali, adjaruli, and appetizer plate sampler. The khinkali was interesting and the adjaruli was a cool experience. The sampler was a good amount to share among us and I enjoyed the assorted salads that were in the sampler.

For the main course, I chose the lamb lula kebab seeing that it was a pretty popular choice online. The mashed potatoes on the side was really good and buttery, but I found the kebab to be overwhelmingly salty and I couldn't finish the meat in the end. My friend, who ordered the same dish, also agreed that the dish was quite salty. It's a shame, but next time I would want to try the chanakhi or another dish on the dinner menu.
Amazing food! Super unique stuff, great service and ambiance. The cheese bread is phenomenal

I've never had Georgian food but wow I'm pleasantly surprised! It's also very vegetarian friendly so that's a huge plus, but you have to be a fan of cheese and mushrooms to enjoy the vegetarian food. The cheeses in each dish are unbelievably yummy, I'd definitely suggest the megruli just to get a taste of the cheese it by itself.It's kind of like a cheesy garlic bread but 10x better. The phkhali trio was probably the most unique thing we had, the flavors were immaculate.
The oda special dumplibg were average, one was full of mushrooms which was yummy and one only stuffed with sour cream which wasn't that great (mostly because I don't like sour cream in that much quantity). The mushroom and potato dish was a little bland & was mostly just a lot of dill so I wouldn't get it again.

I'd really love to go here again and try out the different items on the menu.

Oda House resides in the space that was once home to Malaga restaurant, a homey Spanish restaurant that I was very fond of that served enormous portions of delicious seafood dishes (although honesty compels me to say 1) I had not visited in some years and 2) I have heard the quality declined towards the end).  

Because of my sentimental and nostalgic fondness for Malaga, Oda House had some big shoes to fill.  And fill them it did.  Where the location once served delicious, homey Spanish food, now it serves delicious, homey Georgian food.

During a recent dinner, we started with kubdari (sort of a big, round, tasty Georgian empanada), kinkhali (a meat-filled dumpling that resembles a Chinese soup dumpling in appearance, if not taste), and a Georgian salad.  All very tasty.  We chased this very hardy portion of starters with Mtsvadi, a dish of skewer-grilled meat - simple, but perfectly seasoned, and very satisfying.

The wait staff was solicitous and friendly, though perhaps a tad disorganized seeming.  

Prices were reasonable.

If you're going to Oda House in hopes of getting some high-end chef's re-interpretation of Georgian classics, you're in the wrong place.  But if you're going for a meal that seems like your Georgian grandmother's best dishes served in her home, you'll come away very satisfied and very pleased. And it feels like a family place.

A good, solid 4 star restaurant.

Georgian food! Hooray for ethnic options in the UES

KHINKALI
These soup dumplings were so so fragrant, the herbs and spices really come through in a background of light, savory broth and meat flavor. How to eat? Hold it by the handle, bite off on the side and make sure the soup doesn't spill out!

ADJAPURI
Cheese boat w egg. Sounds simple, but DELICIOUS. Fresh and warm bread house a pool of stretchy chewy bouncy cheese mixed with egg (our waiter mixed it for us to demonstrate) until it is one consistency. The egg makes it hearty and even more satisfying. Rip off pieces of the bread w the cheese. Yum.

Lovely evening out with a friend! We tried Oda House for the first time and it was a gem of a find! The restaurant has a cozy welcoming ambiance with beautiful china and a large bar area. We had the phkali trio which was great I do think the best offering on the trio was the badrijnis - eggplant wrapped appetizers and they do have an appetizer of just these as well. We also of course had to try the Adjaruli and i now know why everyone raves about it. Amazingly cheesy, eggy, and savory - dangerous for the diet, spectacular for the taste buds. We also had the chanakhi which is not pictured because I was too far into the meal's goodness at the point it came out and forgot to photograph it but it is seared lamb in a thick stew of tomato, eggplant, potatoes, and bell peppers cooked in a clay pot. Again a really lovely dish. This is great food for a cold day and was just a very special unique experience. The service was also very prompt and efficient which we really appreciated! This was a great experience where I got to try a bunch of new food and loved all of them! We will most definitely be back to try some more!

Fantastic, delicious, authentic (I presume as I'm no expert), and service was honestly just A++. It was my wife's and my first time eating Georgian food and we were definitely confused looking at the menu. The waiter was very patient with us and gave us recommendations. And they were all amazing!! We also ordered a bottle of Georgian red wine that I loved.
I honestly forgot the names of what we ordered, but you have to get their bread with butter+eggs, which is the typical Georgian dish to get. Decor was darker wood vibes which we enjoyed for dinner. I would highly recommend this place.
Absolutely lovely food here. All the dishes were fantastic, but the Khachapuri was the standout dish for sure. On the pricier side, but I'd definitely say it was worth it!

Georgian food is having a moment and I'm here for it!! Chama Mama seems to get all the attention but very happy to have found this place too.

KHINKALI (chicken) - warm and flavorful and yummy! Coming from a background growing up with Chinese XLB, these are definitely similar but the thicker skin caught me off guard the first time I tried it.

BORSCHT: my friend is from Russia and this was her main request off the menu. I am definitely Not from Russia but also enjoyed this - I can see myself craving this in the winter lol.

PKHALI TRIO: ok these are so cute ?!!?? These are my favs: the three diff kinds were eggplant, spinach, and leek and tbh I wasn't sure which one was which but at the end of the day I liked them all so I guess it doesn't matter?!

TSITSILA RACHULAD: Cornish hen with blackberry+cilantro+garlic sauce. We got this because it sounded interesting. It was pretty much exactly as described but for some reason I was not expecting it the Cornish hen to be chopped up so small - it felt like every single piece was 80% bone, 10% sauce, 10% meat. It was a very high-effort endeavor to eat this and at the end of the meal I just had a plate piled high with bones and chicken parts that I couldn't fully disentangle (and I feel like every piece I got was a drumstick? .... does that mean I ate like 5 hens ?!?). The sauce had an interesting, rich flavor but couldn't quite taste the blackberry.

Next time, I could see myself ordering the Pkhali Trio, maybe the Khinkali and the Borscht again, but probably not the Tsitsila Rachulad. There were so many other things on the menu that looked interesting, but we were limited by the size of our stomachs. Will have to come back to try more!

The water within the flip-top, large glass bottle was refreshingly cold, as it should be (though this isn't always the scenario in restaurants), and a sprig of fresh mint danced gracefully inside.This promptly delivered bottle spared us the customary ordeal of being pitched still water (potentially polluted by microplastics) or sparkling water (how wonderful it is to be able to proactively order sparkling water, free from any sense of pressure). This initial gesture of generosity set the tone - the portions at this charmingly adorned Gruzian restaurant were consistently generous.

Despite my dislike of QR code menus (an unfounded bias, admittedly), the one presented here led to the restaurant's website and showcased a visually enticing menu. Each dish, described in words and captured in images, sparked anticipation. Giorgi (aka George), the restaurant manager, promptly approached our table, extending assistance. Engaging in conversation with him, we gleaned insights into the chef's dedication to authentic Gruzian cuisine.

We indulged on appetizers galore, all were excellent. Our selection included borscht, a fresh tomato salad with delicious green Ajika sauce (ground walnuts, fresh herbs, Gruzian spices), eggplant, mushroom dumplings (Oda Special Zhulien Khinkali), homemade sulguni & Imeruli cheeses melted within yogurt dough, and some other delectable choices.

Georgi's periodic check-ins further elevated the already attentive service of our delightful waitress.

The abundance of appetizers, with their hearty portions, regrettably left little room for entrées. We left with the anticipation of exploring more dishes on our future visits.

Was in the mood for Georgian food so we found this place nearby but it wasn't the best. The portion size of the khachapuri was tiny compared to the real thing you get in Georgia or even in the other Georgian restaurant here, and this was the large!
