But then I realized, if you want cheap drinks, having to breathe through your mouth in the restroom, often loud, over served customers, frequent fights and obvious drug infestation, you might as well hit up Rudy's on 9th ave. At least they respect old patrons and comes with free hot dogs. It was time for me to grow up and  find another more mature place to hang my hat.

Been coming here for the longest time and first to order their food. I don't recall how great their food were back then cause I'm usually stumbling drunk but this passed weekend we had an order of wings and it was so freaking good! The cheese sauce was amazing. Not sure if it's the new cook in the back but I'll def come back for the food again!
Ole' faithful! I was there when it first opened up. Always a good spot to start or end the night! A little young crowd for me now but had some great times. A must when in the Village.
Went there during happy hour. The price is very affordable comparing to bars in nearby area and the bartender is super friendly.

This is your typical sports college / bro / loud top 100 hits --- bar.  
There is an upstairs and downstairs, lots of room to have a large group drink. The staff was nice. The beer selection was mediocre and the mixed drinks were standard. They play a lot of football/sports games on the TV so a good spot if thats what you want, but too loud to watch.

Also the bouncer was v annoying on the way out; just kept telling us to "move" as we were on the sidewalk waiting for an uber, legit made us stand 30 feet away before he stopped bothering us. (Empty outside and not a ton of foot traffic)

Long story short; if you want to drink with the bros of NYU, here is the spot. Not necessarily a bad spot, but just know what you're walking into.
Warning you're not allowed to wear shades at the bar. Dumbest thing I've ever heard in my life.

Eric, Eddie, and Ryan are very down-to-earth, friendly bartenders who made my friends and me feel very welcome. Thank you for taking special care of us and our entire cohort, especially among such a large crowd.

Things to know before coming here - there are no outlets, but there's a pay-to-use charging station. It's a super college atmosphere, so it's very loud, crowded, and uncomfortable. Most people are wasted and enjoying their new privilege of drinking and being away from their parents. It's not uncommon to find girls throwing up in the bathroom or outside. There are plenty of TVs, so it's great to watch a game. There's beer bong on both floors. Stools are available, but limited, so catch them while you can. There's several coat hooks throughout the place. And finally, for a sports bar, the food is actually pretty good!

As most dining/beverage establishments, Off The Wagon is still reeling from restrictions placed because of COVID-19. But I must say this place still has a the feel of the bustling chatter and laughter it had before March in NYC.

Little Backstory: About two years ago I used to frequent The Step (13th) after work hours to get familiar with the nightlife in the city. I soon found out there were other bars related to The Step- which is how I made my way to OTW. Very proud to say I've had some of my best memories here with people of all walks of life, sharing a drink or three somewhat often. Not to mention OTW has a solid/equipped staff. I hope things can get back to normal to be able to visit this Village staple once more like old times. Pay them a visit and support the local watering hole  (they now do outdoor dining)
If PJ isn't there go ahead and walk out he is the best/worst ever be prepared for some sarcasm
I went here for my 23rd birthday a few years back and me and all my friends had a great time! It was so much fun and the drinks were great, and I loved the atmosphere too. Part sports bar part club.
THe bartenders here have a nasty attitude. Made fun of me infront of my face for telling them thank you... just a nasty, mean group of girls working bar

Okay let's be real - you go here for the atmosphere, not the food. The three stars are for the service and consistency that you can expect from the visit. Go with your college buddies to watch a game, grab a couple of drinks and maybe a few appetizers. Don't come here expecting a Michelin star experience. Come for a good time and leave happy!

Good drink. Loved my rose cider.
Terrible chicken wings. All burned and super dry.
Good fried jalapeños and Mac n cheese. Fried pickles were okay.
Liked their second floor.

Good music! Great bartender!

We were here for less than an hour but had a great time. Beer pong games happen in the back downstairs and upstairs. We got a round of vodka sodas and shots. It was early on a Friday and still relatively crowded.

You can't go wrong trying here - there are a lot of places around here if this doesn't end up working out. We for sure will be coming back!

We were racially profiled here. We steered off at artichoke pizza and I ( like a fool in retrospect) was drawn by the music at off the WAgon. We entered because no one was outside. But as soon as we entered the BOUNCER called on us to the front of the club/bar to ask us for verification which we gladly did. As soon as me and my husband  went to the front the bouncer asked us if we spoke English ?! . This was terrible and insulting to us both.  The subsequent bouncer came outside and asked us to move aside and asked the guy to go inside . The guy outside said "ma'am please step aside" and didn't even allow us to to talk or explain anything. We seriously didn't want to enter the place that eagerly or anything but we definitely felt racially profiled as Indians !!!!!

Racist & Misogynist Bouncers at the door! Think if its really worth to get a drink at this place, for the cost of being racially abused. Afro-American bouncer, with no disregard of feelings and man-handling women - SHOULD BE FIRED. Look for other reviews for this guy. Avoid the place, west village is full of bars where patrons are treated well, and not trashed.
Great place to watch an nfl game! Want code Monday night football and even though Daniel jones disappointed, the watch was good. The bartender also saved my headphones I left in anger. Thanks y'all !

Love the place, love the vibe, drinks are amazing, prices are very affordable. The one star is for the "we're a REAL bar we'll not make you a virgin mojito" answer that the white bartender lady had to say. Racist much ?

I actually prefer the vibe of HOTD better ( their sister bar). This one was nice, but I feel like I have to strain my neck to see the TV from the bar.

The service here was great, I must add. Our bartender was nice, personable and made sure our drinks were always filled.

Note that they have Truly on Tap now, a nice bonus!

It's still a solid choice in this area and you can't beat the cheap drinks.

4/5

Saw an employee sexually assault/harass a poor girl here. Short, overweight man that was cleaning tables off the upstairs (my guess is that he is a busser of some sort). His face was on one of the bartender's t shirts so I guess he's a staple of this bar. Would be funny and cute if I didn't witness him force himself on a woman half his age and size. Disgusting and brazen.

Great that this bar is able to remain open during covid! This is more of a beer place and our party ordered wells. Our drinks were average but our food items better- would recommend the fried pickle spears!! The grilled cheese is $2 unbeatable price in NYC.

What can I say? If you want a casual but fun place to hang out this is the spot. Bartenders to security are all helpful, professional and friendly. Want a true neighborly bar with good food and excellent drinks this is the place to go.
Amazing place! Love it here so much fun and great food and perfect for group dinner spot.

I can't say enough great things about this place !!
The drinks were soo delicious and they have happy hour everyday from 4-7 which is great.
The food is plated soo beautifully and everything is incredibly vibrant which made for great photos.
The waiter was sooo friendly and explained every dish and gave us amazing recommendations. The fish was phenomenal as recommended by the waiter definitely will be back.

Stopped by here for a Saturday early afternoon brunch. Absolutely no one is inside or in their outdoor seating area. Chose a table in the shade and was given some water to start.

To begin, ordered a Jalapeno Margarita ($13) and the Guacamole ($14). Drink had a nice kick, while not being as strong as I'd hoped. Guacamole is chunky and ready to eat with the tortilla chips. For the entree, got the Huevos Divorciados ($18) - a layering of tortilla shell, eggs, and avocado swimming in a mole/salsa combo. Good flavors overall, especially in the sauces - wish I added chorizo for some more substance. Also tried the Chilaquiles ($16) which weren't as well made.

Service is solid as the items came out quickly. Expensive for brunch, as there are no deals, so probably better for dinner.

We were starving at 4 o'clock and came in here because it was one of the few restaurants opened. I started with a cold beer and my husband had a margarita & we shared a guacamole.  I ordered shrimp tacos with six large shrimp, a slice of avocado and some salsa. My husband had a steak enchilada with some speckles of beef.  Our meal was tasty and the staff were accommodating.

There  was a small round table near an outlet, we were told since we were two people we couldn't sit there.  We sat at a table for two, but plugged our phones in at the corner table. We were here for an hour, and nobody else sat inside. While we were there a huge bug ran past us.  Upon seeing the bug we realized that the floor was pretty filthy and we were pretty grossed out.  Staff tried to tell us that it was from the subway.  Then another huge bug ran past us. Funny, when we were leaving, they offered us a shot of tequila. When we said we were driving, we were basically called liars.  I left walking uptown to our car. I read reviews and see that Ofredo has a bug problem or a cleanliness problem. But there was an  "A" rating in the window.

I may not have been upset except for the large cockroach. Attentive service, decent food but...  Funny they offered us a shot of tequila on the house. We said we were driving and a staff person  said no you didn't. WARNING : You may not want to eat here. BEWARE: Despite the response from their GM, there have been other Yelp reviews alluding to a cockroach problem.  Check other 1 star reviews. I wish we were aware of this before we came here  I  also believe I saw a review or 2 on TripAdvisor alluding to it as well.
The drinks are very strong and the tacos are amazing. Very small restaurant with outdoor seating.

6/5 for happy hour, which is 4-7 daily!

The margs are divine.

And the food menu is one of the best I've ever seen at a happy hour, with tons of $10 bites.

Plenty of outdoor tables in addition to a quaint inside. And a staff member helped seat us without a reservation.

Will come back for dinner sometime.

I visited with a couple friends on a Sunday evening. They were incredibly busy, and business seem harried and poorly managed, with staff rushing and not having enough hands for the volume of customers.

The manager asked if I had a reservation, and I said I didn't. I asked for a table, and he said the soonest would be 6 PM (an hour later), so I said sure, 6 PM for 4 people. I asked if he needed a name and he said no.

I waited at the bar until 6 PM to check in on our table. The bartender was friendly and competent but did not really have the luxury to engage with us besides to serve our drinks and take our payment.  

I double-checked with my friend, who confirmed that he paid separately for his one drink, but his beverage was still included on my bill, which I didn't scrutinize until I got back to my hotel.

At 6 PM, I checked with the manager, and he said that there was some miscommunication and he didn't have a table for us. I had a hunch he didn't when he didn't notate it in their system or ask for my name or number. He then said that he would accommodate us anyway and assigned us a table and said that we could stay for only an hour. He made sure of that, rushing us for drink and food orders. I felt unwelcome.

The food is overpriced and unappetizing but experience tells us not to drink excessively with an empty stomach, so we ate what we were given. The margaritas the bartender prepared for both me and my friend were incredibly tart to the point of them being undrinkable. Maybe a bad batch, a poor pour, or a new employee, but overall disappointing.

I spent more than $100 and don't feel the value matched the price paid. I tipped 20% as the right thing to do, but I'd probably not come back.

I've only visited Ofrenda for a Happy Hour, but it left me wanting more! We ordered the Queso dip and margaritas for a quick snack before moving on for the night. The margaritas were deliciously fresh (and $8!) and the Queso was FANTASTIC! Next time I'm in the city, I'll definitely be back here for dinner.

The servers are friendly and the vibe is cozy and cool - I'd definitely recommend making reservations, because this spot fills up fast!

Definitely make a reservation. This restaurant is really small and gets really busy. Inside it was extremely loud and crowded. It would have been nice but all the body heat made it feel and smell like a crowded club on a Friday night. Luckily I sat outside on the street and took in the smells of New York.

Passion Fruit Margarita: 9/10

Delicious! I got a passion fruit margarita and it was so good. It was strong but you couldn't taste the alcohol, the best combination. The passion fruit didn't taste artificial at all. I would love to come back for happy hour and get a pitcher of this! I tried the mango too, which was also great. Not artificial and great taste.

Quesadilla with chicken: 8.5/10

As far as quesadillas go, this one was very good. The top was nice and crispy, although the bottom got a bit soggy. The chicken was shredded and extremely moist. It was perfectly spread throughout and made the dish more of a meal. I wished the chicken had had a bit more seasoning or flavor to it. It was very plain. The quesadilla was loaded with cheese, and it was perfectly melted and gooey. I loved the flavor and it wasn't over the top. The green salsa  added a good amount of flavor but w didn't have as much of a punch as I would have liked. There was a little something missing overall with the spices and flavor. I would still recommend it though and would definitely get it again.

Overall, this place to me would be a great stop for a happy hour. They have a good deal, great discounted small bites and margs. For dinner, I think it was too chaotic and too expensive for a tortilla with cheese. The other items look good if you want a fancy Mexican dinner.

Absolutely delicious margaritas and food! My friend and I stopped by for happy hour. Along with a few margaritas each, we got an order of chicken quesadillas, fish tacos, guacamole, and elote. Everything was fantastic - I especially loved the mango margarita with a tajin rim. The thing to note is that there does appear to be a 1 hour and 30 minute time limit. But it was not restrictive at all, and allowed us time to enjoy the food and drinks.

The happy hour here is amazing because:
1. It is every day, including weekends!
2. It includes a selection of beer, wine and margaritas!
3. It also includes food! You can fill up on discounted nachos, tacos and quesadillas.

Not only is the happy hour great, but the food is also delicious (you can't always have both). After hh nachos (not they are not your typical nachos, they reminded me of empanadas with nacho toppings) and a cheese quesadilla, we had the octopus, shishito peppers and chicken enchiladas. All tasty, good portion sizes, and reasonably priced.

The inside is a little dark, but it was a nice day so we sat at their sidewalk seating and people watched.

Walked in around 8p on a Wednesday night and got seated within half an hour for a table of 3. Reservations are pretty available online though, so I'd just snag one of those if you can.

Apps -

- queso fundido: 5/5, wow! Definitely a must-have off the apps section
- ofrenda guacamole (chips and guac): this was ok? 3.5/5 I thought the chips were way too oily for me, but my friends loved the guac
- elote: 4/5, elote is always great, I've had better though. Probably could've had more flavor / spices

Mains -

- pescado tacos (fish): 4/5, lots of flavor, but not amazing
- Gobernador (shrimp) tacos: 5/5 definitely the highlight for me. Shrimp is cooked to perfection.

Overall a nice experience! It's a little on the pricey side, imo $17 for two tacos is a bit much, but hey they were pretty good, and also not that small either

Great service, I got there at 4:45 and it was empty.. by 5:30 every seat was taken.. after work crowd. I strongly recommend reservations. Chicken tacos a 10, shrimp tostadas a 10, guac and chips a 6. Happy hour 4-7pm.

TLDR: A great spot for outdoor summer dining!

Started off with the passionfruit cocktail that was light refreshing and yet somehow pretty strong. The tacos were nicely presented, rich in flavor, and well seasoned.

The restaurant was pretty packed for a sunday evening so I would highly recommend getting a reservation well in advance.

Came here for happy hour on a Friday after work. The allure of cheap margaritas and tacos is very hard to pass up, for anyone. Called earlier in the day and was unable to make a reservation for any point in the evening, they were short some seats due to the rain that evening. Ended up having to show up and hope for the best.

I'm just a big fan of Mexican food in general so I went in very open minded. Ofrenda came across as much more of a casual spot than say La Lotería. Seeing the happy hour prices where they were I sat there thinking wow this meal is going to blow my socks off if this is the price point for the happy hour version. Wrong. Ultimately very forgettable food and a cramped environment made it a not too great experience. The guac was ok. Fish tacos were mediocre. Will say that the queso fundido was pretty good.

As far as the drinks I started with the Smokey Jalapeño Margarita and was turned off by it. It was too sweet which was overpowering the Smokey and jalapeño flavors. The regular margarita was better.

Overall you're better off going to La Lotería if you want to stay in the area. For price point and good just head up to los tacos numero 1. Crowded and not all that good I can't say i will be back.

Terrible. Was here for a birthday with a reservation: they kept us outside for 30 minutes in the cold. They told us they would give us a round to compensate for us waiting outside 30 minutes for a reservation and we got the bill and they didn't take anything off of it. Management was terribly rude to us, made for a terrible experience. Would not come here for a group or a party. Stay away, there sneaky and dishonest especially the manager who was fighting my friend over the bill.

Would rate this place 4.5 stars. Great for happy hr! My friend and I came here after a barre class and it was already popping. We had made a reservation at 645 to catch the end of happy hour at 7. We got seated right away and was able to place an order in before it was over. The tapas and drinks came out immediately. Overall, food is pretty solid and will be back!

Btw, the seats are fine if you don't mind overhearing other people's conversations, but a bit crammed otherwise.

the food is decent, but the prices are ridiculous. $17 for two shrimp tacos? and no taco tuesday deal? just absurd. i've had better mexican food for a much better price in nyc. service is also subpar, very nonchalant people who don't really engage with you much. ambiance is loud and decorated nicely, which i like, but again, just pick somewhere else bc the food quality & quantity doesn't justify the price.

Not my first time here but my first time reviewing this old school New York haunt. After all these years, it is still a great place to start your night off. The food and Margs are legit. For what it's worth, I'm not saying it's the greatest meal you will ever have in New York. It's a great place for small to medium sized groups of friends to catch up, have a decent meal and take your party elsewhere. It is conveniently located in the west village where there is no dearth of bars.

The tacos and spicy jalapeño margaritas are delish. Each taco is two bites sized and if you are a dainty woman, maybe 3 or 4 bites per taco. If you are a group 3 and above, get the pitcher. The guacamole is as good as it gets.

As other reviewers have mentioned, you absolutely need a reservation and your entire party needs to be there in order for them to seat you. If you miss that, it will be a 30 minute wait. The wait staff is very nice and treated us kindly.

Solid Mexican spot in west village. It does the job! Not like five star quality but you will walk out of here satisfied. I tried the guacamole, shishito peppers, gobernador and pescado tacos. The guacamole was nothing special. The shishito peppers were good!
The gobernador tacos were pretty good, the shrimp was cookies nicely. The pescado taco was pretty good too!
The service was nice, quick and friendly.
Overall, I'm happy with my experience here.

Ofrenda has really great Margaritas. If you like Margaritas you should definitely head over to Ofrenda to sample their Smokey Jalapeño or their classic. The chips are good too at Ofrenda. Beyond that the food is just ok. So go for the Margaritas, your choice if you stay for dinner.

Stopped in for Happy Hour with a friend after work. Such a great spot! I'm surprised I've never been here before but I will definitely be back.

Started with prickly pear margaritas with sugar on the rim. These were sweet, tasty and I could probably drink 12. Such a good Margarita. My friend stuck with wine, thought the HH wine options were a bit limited but I thought they had some good options.

We ordered a Queso Fondido with chorizo to snack on, loved that it came out in a cast iron skillet pan, kept the cheese warmer and melted for longer. The fresh and warm tortillas were the perfect touch.

Will be coming back to get actual dinner!

The food here tastes bad, lacks flavor, and is way overpriced for how low quality it is. The inside of the restaurant smells like mold and the silverware / plates weren't very clean. Do not recommend, although service was very good, constant refills of water.
Nice place to spend amazing time the  food it going to make me crazy the best food I recommend

Been here a few times w friends and can't complain thus far. Food is quite good especially the sweet plain takes w the green sauce and cheese on top  but the service could be a bit better. Place becomes quite busy and loud from Thursdays-Saturdays (based on experience) but it's def enjoyable. Was told the cucumber drink (margarita) is very refreshing and delicious; worth a try!

Personally, I loved this place. We went for Taco Tuesday's and the food was amazing. The service and vibes were incredible. The food was goood but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there for another dinner or taco Tuesday, but if I happened to pass it I definitely would. I really did like the queso but the quesadilla was okay!

y'all this place was so bombmy friend and i really wanted to check out a happy hour and luckily stumbled upon this spot!

it was 90+ degrees outside but we didn't have a reservation so we sat outside lol. despite the hot weather, the waiters were very attentive to ensure that our waters were always filled and that our orders were always taken

the happy hour is every day from 4-7pm everyday and the menu includes a variety of yummy cocktails, beers, wines, and mexican classics with beautiful plating such as tacos, elote, and nachos! overall, i highly recommend this spot for its yummy bites and great cocktails, but definitely make a reservation beforehand!
-- -- --
pictured:
" nachos ($10.00) // i didn't expect it but the nachos came in four huge corn tortilla chips instead of the smaller triangular chips i was used to, but they tasted amazing! almost like a tostada, the chip was topped with a hefty amount of cheese, avocado, beans, crema, and pico de gallo!

" tacos de hongo ($10.00) // coming with 2 tacos, i was thoroughly impressed by these mushroom tacosthe mushrooms were tender and nicely seasoned, topped with epazote, pico de gallo, and quest fresco!

" quesadilla ($10.00) // very solid quesadilla that you can't really go wrong with

" margaritas ($9 each for flavored ones) // we tried the mango, prickly pear, and passion fruit margaritas and all of them were delicious with a good amount of tequila! my favorite was definitely the prickly pear, for the pink color was so beautiful and the sweetness of the pear reminded me of a candy!
Well done food, fast service, and a killer location. We had the fish tacos and they hit the spot perfectly - with amazing beans and rice. Definitely a nice one for lunch or a light dinner.
Ofrenda is a go-to for happy hour! Their margaritas are amazing, their guacamole is fresh, and the service is top notch. This is my favorite happy hour place and should be yours too!
Food is always amazing, especially the fish tacos. Cocktails are yummy. Ambiance is casually romantic. Service is also quick and attentive.
This place is so relaxing. Staffs are so friendly special mention to Arturo! Arturo is the best! He know's what you like. Foods are so delicious. I will definitely come back and always will go here.

Classic Mexican spot on in the West Village that still offers HH everyday!

Smoky Jalapeno Margarita was very good. I quite love that instead of salt rim they used sugar and pepper (?) Sweet and spicy.

Prickly Pear Margarita was pink color and too sweet, both visual and taste were meh.

Tostada Shrimp was very delicious as well as the Elote.

Fish tacos  3/5 the flavor was great. The table favorite dish goes to the Eloté! It is off the charts and you must come here if you are looking for a good eloté. You just order the spicy sauce on the side (they'll know) and it pairs well with most of their dishes (quesadilla, tacos, etc) for any spice lover!

Mango guacamole 5/5! They crushed it with the mango on top of the fresh avacados, so delish and refreshing - a must!

Honestly don't get how this place has such high reviews. The enchiladas were not good at all and served cold, margaritas tasted pre mixed. I asked for hot sauce and was charged for it even though I saw a bottle of valentina hot sauce (would've tasted better than what I was given). Was rushed out of the restaurant after 40 min by the girl grabbing every single drink off of the table when we were thinking about ordering more, very weird we all know what you're doing when you do that and we got the memo and just left. Genuinely we were there 40 minutes. The guac was super good probably the highlight of the dinner.

A decent Mexican spot in the village! Our table ordered guacamole and shishito peppers as our appetizers. The peppers were tasty! I ordered the mushroom tacos as an entree and they were filling and flavorful. I really enjoyed the habanero and verde salsa they definitely added more heat to the tacos. The passion fruit margarita was delicious as well.

Spicy margs we're on POINT. Had the beef fajitas which were super pretty and even tastier! I hate to say I don't remember our servers name but he was an absolute gem! Bartender was also super helpful and came and helped bus our table while our server was helping other tables

Solid Mexican spot in West Village. Food, drinks, and service are all good. I got the jalapeño infused margarita to start, which was delicious. For dinner, I split the shrimp and fish tacos. Both were good.

Cute and crowded place in the west village
There's indoor and outdoor seating
Reservations are recommended
Drinks are flavorful and fresh
Food is tasty and well presented
Churros are delicious
Service is why I am giving them 3 stars instead of 5
They are too much to soon. It's like they don't give you an opportunity to eat and enjoy your time there. They're constantly pouring water and retrieving dishes out of the way without notice.
There is a time limit on your table which doesn't let you enjoy your time out. Not a fan!!!'
Also to get change of a $20 bill was annoying, I was confused why because it's a bar..

Stopped by for happy hour and enjoyed the spicy margarita!  At first, I thought the drinks weren't very strong, but I realized they're just well-mixed so you can't taste the liquor haha.  The first margarita wasn't spicy enough for me, so I asked for my second marg to be extra spicy! It was perfection!  

Service was great. My water was always filled, which I really appreciated on a hot and humid day.  The waiter also came around frequently to check in on us and make sure we got our last round of drinks in before happy hour ended. Paying for our bill was also a very quick process.  

The only annoying thing was that they required the whole party to be there, before seating you. Kinda annoying during happy hour, because I would have gladly drank an extra marg or two while waiting for the last person in our party. I will definitely be coming back for more margaritas, and hopefully will try the food next time!

The place is cute and super chill! The drinks are bomb and always made perfectly. My friends and I love visiting Roy who is the best bartender! The establishment is great for happy hour after work, birthdays or date night. This place never disappoints and the food is absolutely delicious. Good for groups or just a drink at the bar. I always recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a great margarita and some authentic Mexican food.

The food here is decent and the restaurant is cute! However, even with a reservation we waited 30 mins for our table. The place is super busy, so waiting to get seated can be frustrating. We got guacamole, pescado tacos, al pastor tacos, and Tostada de Ceviche. My personal favorite is the Tostada de Ceviche!! It is so tasty, but just a bit messy to eat. I feel the pescado tacos are average and not as good as everything else. The rest of food we got were good. The service was great! They always refill our water very timely.
Animated! Great service! Delicious Mexican food! Happy hour 4-7pm... do yourself a favor and get yourself a pitcher of the smoked margarita.

The happy hour here is amazing! I love working not far from here so I can surely make another return.

Loves:
+ $8/9 for margaritas
+ Strong drinks
+ $10 for food plates (ie. nachos, two tacos, etc).
+ Nice staff and good service

I would highly recommend having a reservation so you can take advantage of the indoor seating, especially as NYC shifts into colder winter weather.

Overall experience solid 4! Food wise it's a 3 BUT happy hour was awesome. So they get an extra star, it's everyday from 4-7pm and has drinks/apps etc. we got there just in time Friday with a 6:45pm resi! Our waiter was a gem and let us quickly order a bunch of HH items! We each got margs, queso fundido, tostada de ceviche (just ok), and nachos. The nachos were the best thing we ordered to be honest- so good! We then ordered tacos, alambre (steak), Pescado (fish) and Pancita al pastor (pork belly -very fatty) and sadly we weren't impressed with the tacos. 2 come per order and they are good to share but they were just OK. I also felt everything was soggy but that's because of the tortilla they use- although it did taste authentic and home made. Would hit up the happy hour again but that's likely it...

This establishment has an incredible ambience - serves for a great date night or intimate time with friends. Great music!

They offer really cool food selections and good selections for vegetarians and vegans. The chips and guacamole are a MUST! Those chips were magical. They also add on pineapple to their guac which adds a unique twist that was very well received by my party and I.

The margaritas are STRONG and great tasting! Two things I'm looking for in a great cocktail! And the drink prices are reasonable.

My criticisms would be I did not care for the sliced almonds on my enchiladas. They seemed misplaced and didn't add much to the dish. I could've done without them. I also would pass on the rice and beans - the beans were overly salted and seemed a bit odd in taste.

Overall great experience! Very fun for a night out on the town!

Great place to eat. Just had a small brunch while touring the city. The staff was super friendly and the place very clean. We had the guacamole and chips and avocado toast. Both were pretty good, but nothing distinct. The friendly staff and clean place is what sold us.
You've gotta get the guacamole. Very flavorful and it comes with other yummy sauces. The sangria is great -- not too sweet and has a nice orange flavor.

Ugh such mixed feelings. I come here for happy hour a lot as they have great deals and usually flexible last minute availability. They have like $8 margs and good deals on beer etc. The food is pretty average but not terrible if you're just looking for something to munch on while getting a few drinks. It's also extremely close to my apt which gives it an extra point in my book. I would NOT go out of my way for this place.

Would have given it 4 stars except for my last experience this weekend, when I had a Friday 6:15 reservation and was seated at maybe 6:25. Not the end of the world, but the server didn't come over to me to take my order until 6:40, and the michelada I ordered didn't get to me until 6:55. Now, all of that would have been understandable given the crowd there but I think an apology would have been nice (or even better, a comped side of chips or something). Instead, I was moved to a shitty table about 5 minutes after my drink was brought over because "a couple that was dining wanted a table that overlooked the sidewalk".

Based on that experience, I would not return despite the good drink specials. I think ofrenda is getting a little too big for its britches

I came here with some friends for HH and am glad we stopped by! Their margaritas are all super yummy, but my favorite was actually the prickly pear which was fun and unique. We got the Queso Fundido to share for the table and added chorizo. It was delicious and super cheesy. Service was great and they let us sit at the bar/order there before our whole party came.
Delicious, fresh, pretty speedy service for a party of 6! Definitely recommend if you're in the area or live near by for fresh delicious sushi!

I came to Ogawa with a friend from school last week and ordered the Philadelphia roll, a piece of tomago sushi, a salmon roll, and a spicy tuna roll. The food was delicious and I enjoyed every bite. I even loved the wasabi and almost finished it which I almost never do. I also appreciated the fact that they had outdoor seating and provided a shot of sake on the house.

The food was amazing, and I loved the dining experience. The food came quickly and the waiter was awesome. I loved how accommodating they were. This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the NYU Washington Square park area. I am beyond happy.

Favorite sushi in NYC. I crave it all the time. It's also BYOB which some people might dislike but I love it because we just bring our favorite bottle of wine and the bill isn't full of overpriced mediocre wine! The crispy rice is incredible and every single sushi roll I've had is A+. I literally go once a week. They are the sweetest people too and host private parties inside a lot!!

Couldn't say better things and have never waited for a table once!

- this has been my staple take out sushi place for the past several years (considering it's only a block away I can't justify getting delivery anyway so no updates on that front)
- owned by a perfectly lovely couple who always remembers (sometimes rewards regulars with new menu items; beta testers/guinea pigs I suppose lol)
- recommend: spicy tuna roll; (maine; the only kind they offer) uni sushi and scallop sushi (which are usually only items I get from omakase)
- they raised prices in the past couple of years but I feel like the quality of fish has gone up to offset the cost so I don't mind
- friendly, intimate and casual
- they've since addressed the air situation and installed a proper air conditioning system

Small neighborhood gem for great sushi!!  This well run, family business consistently sources great seafood, while supporting its community.  The warm service and consistent quality are always on point, and Chef is always happy to make special creations upon request - he may even offer you a taste of one of his latest ideas!  Though we no longer live around the corner, they always remember us - no matter how long it's been since our last visit.

On our way back home after 9pm on Friday night, my daughter got super hungry, and we were just passing by this sushi restaurant. There were several restaurants nearby, besides we normally check Yelp to confirm open availabilities for us but we didn't. We just felt we should try them so we just walked in without doubting.
It was a very small (about 4 tables) but has so cozy atmosphere.
We ordered a spider roll and one more for takeout.
The lady who took order was super nice and sweet!!!
We waited outside the restaurant and the order become ready in 5 mins or so. So quick!
I already decided to come back again, and their sushi made it so definite: spider roll was so yum & renkon or lotus root chips on it....I want them more.
We spent only 25 bucks or so and very satisfactory overall!

I had two perfect little sushi lunches here in the past three weeks so I'm surprised to see Ogawa's present standing on Yelp.
I got the ($13.50) sushi lunch special the first time I came, and it was fantastic. The colorful array of fish was extremely fresh and flavorful and the portion was on the large side. It came with miso soup, and everything was delivered with lightening speed, which I really appreciated as this was a lunch break meal. The restaurant is small, but usually a few people away from empty on weekdays at lunch. You'll experience understated ambiance with comforting casual vibes.
I returned during another lunch break and had the ($11) two roll special for which I selected an avocado roll and spicy tuna roll. More perfection.
Highly recommended!

By far my new favorite Japanese restaurant. The food was delicious and sushi chef was incredible and the service was wonderful. Fried rice is the best fried rice ever. And I know fried rice.

Chef's choice is also the way to go. We let Jin pick and his choices were delicious.

Family owned too, so I feel great about finding a new neighborhood spot to support. I can't believe I haven't been here before!

This place is basically at the right price point with nice people running it.   My rule of thumb for a Japanese place is, usually, do they have natto rolls?  If so, it is likely a joint that is closer to authentic.

They are around the corner from my office, I'm not super picky or a foodie, and they are fast.  I have been happy with everything I have gotten from this place so I recommend it if you need to be fed and don't want to cringe while you eat.

I really love this place! The food is really good and everyone that works there is very nice! It is a small restaurant so don't expect to come here with 15 friends. It is perfect for an affordable, delicious Japanese meal with a few friends or family (or takeout/delivery). Not always easy to find in NYC!

Lunch specials are very good value! The chicken katsu is my favorite--it is really a treat! The miso soup is also to die for! Really everything I have tried so far has been too notch... check it out!

Nice Restaraunt. The staff is always friendly. There is a $15 minimum for credit cards. I just wish it was next door to my home!  I'd never leave!

It's small am cozy, right off the beaten path so you don't get that crazy lunch rush folks.

Eat24 email: "We called the restaurant to confirm your order, and they told us they had to close early today and won't be able to complete your order." No reaching out by the restaurant to apologize/explain.

23. One Roll Box (Lunch)  1 + 10.00 Delete
Choice of Roll: Yellowtail
Choice of Rice: Brown ($0.50 Extra)
The lunch bento is a great deal and the owners are super nice. The amount of food for the price point is great and the quality is decent.

Love this place! Great sushi, chicken katsu, and best miso soup I've had. Lunch bento is a great deal. Owners are super nice. I'm moving and will really miss living above this place, but will surely come back to visit!

Oh man the server was super friendly, the sushi (rolls) were tasty and reasonably priced, and the sake was hot. All four big bottles of it.

What a great little place to chill with yer budz and celebrate a good good life

Walking by on a Saturday afternoon looking for some sushi that was open, it was amazing for the price and location for NYC. Asked the chef to serve what was the best. 3 pieces of sushi, flawless. Hand roll was good. I'm a stickler for the perfect crunch on my nori though. All around perfect for what we were looking for. Thank you!!!!

Have never actually eaten in the restaurant, but have had home delivery loads of times. The quality and freshness of the sushi and rolls is top notch! The delivery is super fast, the price is reasonable.

Highly recommended!
The green salad was super fresh. The sushi was really delish. Great little place off Cooper Square.

Decent, fresh sushi at very good prices.
Their lunch specials are a great deal, but keep in mind that their rolls are a bit smaller than usual.
Both delivery and pick up are always speedy and the staff here is friendly and efficient.
Great veggie sushi, udon & ramen! Ordered takeout twice. This place is so cute and delicious. Will be back!

We were walking and being picky to find a place that we like when we came across this little cosy restaurant. I loved it so much. they were very humble and kind. the food was very good. and the prices were unbelievably low!

I'm you won't die from eating their fish but it's definitely not fresh.

The rice is even stale... or mushy. Gross. Nota bene, they charge extra for rice substitutions.

If you're really hungry this place isn't bad for American sushi such as eel and California. It's a step up from getting sushi at  grocery market but it's a step down from restaurant grade Japanese finger food.

I created a Yelp account just to write this review for Ogawa.  My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this tiny sushi restaurant.  The Sushi is very good, especially for the incredibly affordable prices.  What I love about Ogawa is their service.  They are some of the nicest restaurant employees/owners I have ever had the pleasure of giving business to.

My girlfriend has Celiac disease and they are incredibly accommodating (sashimi is all she can eat at most non-elite sushi restaurants but Ogawa can make every roll gluten free).

I really have never written a Yelp review before but I've never experienced service like I have at Ogawa and felt compelled to share.  Highly recommend

Lunch today for the office came from Ogawa. We've ordered from here plenty of times and in fact it is our go to place for the sushi cravings. Not to mention they have killer lunch deals that will leave you not just full, but stuffed.

For $8.65 you can get their Lunch Box which comes with a choice of 13 different items and a side of rice, miso soup, a side salad, 3 pieces of fried shumai and 4 pieces of california rolls. A careful look at the 13 choices and you realize you actually have 32 choices because option #13 is actually choose a sushi roll from a previous section that contains 20 different selections. If the Lunch Box is too much food for you, you can always downgrade to a Lunch Plate for $6.50 that comes with the same 32 choices and rice, 2 pieces gyoza, and a side salad.

I usually go for the Lunch Box and choose either a Yellow Tail Roll, Spicy White Tuna Roll, Tuna Avocado Roll, Beef Negimaki, or Chicken Katsu. The rolls come out very fresh and never "fishy" tasting. They're never chewy which is good. I like the sauce on the Beef Negimaki. As far as the Chicken Katsu is concerned, it's good but not great. At times the chicken comes out a bit dry. I guess it depends on the chef for the day.

A note for anybody that orders take out and has a coworker that orders tempura. The tempura sauce comes in a little container and is not soy sauce. I've poured this little container of sauce on my rolls numerous times thinking it was soy sauce and have received the glare of death more times that I can probably count on one hand. Take this knowledge and use it well. I'll remember it now but just watch me doing it again the next time we have sushi for lunch.

I've yet to eat in at Ogawa although I'm not sure if I'd want to. The seating area is very small and with the tables and chairs put together, there really is only one tiny narrow path left for people to walk in and maneuver around. People almost seem to be sitting on top of each other. I think I much prefer to bring the food back to the office and enjoy it in the comfort of our cozy leather couch.

I find this place very charming. The staff is very nice and the sushi is cheap but very fresh and well made. The place is a bit on the small side, but if you go midday you won't have to deal with many people. Try to stick to dates or parties of no more than 4.

I often order delivery from here as well and the first thing I noticed was that they package the food really well so that nothing gets smashed or leaks. Also very prompt delivery.

It's a very standard Japanese restaurant that knows exactly what it's doing.

Probably the best oyako don I've ever had.  I don't know how they do it (steam, maybe?), but they manage to make the egg oh-so soft and silky, like my thighs.

I don't know how any of the other food is here, because I've only had the oyako don.

Tiny place, so definitely no good for groups.  And they take credit cards, but only with a $15 minimum, so you're out of luck if you're just trying to get lunch on the run with a quick swipe.

This is a solid little sushi place that knows how to cut fish.  It's well prepared, fresh and inexpensive.  I order delivery from them often, and when we stopped in the other day after rejecting B Bar as a wedding location, the lunch specials filled the bill.  Peter had the sashimi lunch for $10.95 which came with miso soup, and he also ordered a spicy scallop hand roll and an eel roll, both with cucumber instead of rice since he's a diabetic.  They didn't bat an eyelash.  

I ordered the veggie/shrimp tempura lunch box ($7.25) which came with miso soup (excellent, by the way), 3 shrimp shumai (average), a salad (excellent), rice, and shrimp, yam, taro root, something I am forgetting, and onion (I asked for no broccoli).  The shrimp were a hair greasy, but the rest of the vegetables were excellent.  It was a ton of food.

The place is really tiny.  There was a father with a little kid, under a year old, with a stroller, at the first table when you come in, and you really couldn't get past him.  It was cute watching him feed the kid sushi, though.  The kid loved it.  Hated the stroller, dug the kid.

I feel like I just wanna say whatevaahhhh to all the bad reviews. For me, this place is amazing. Thirty seconds from my job, perfect for lunch, affordable, great ambiance, delicious, great service and really warm and comfortable. The lunch deals are fantastic and are just the right amount of food. No one bothers you and its a good place to eat alone. Also, Oyako don (chicken, egg & rice) is maybe not terribly authentic but its delish, cheap and filling.

p.s. $15 minimum for credit card so bring cash if you wanna be cheap

Somethings fishy here and it aint the sushi. I can't believe so many people don't know the difference between good sushi and terrible sushi. Just because it didn't make you sick doesn't mean it's fresh. The chicken curry donburi was just yellow curry shaken over a plate of stir-fried chicken with rice. The tonkatsu was a dry, flat, piece of ambiguous meat. A McDonald's chicken tender tastes better. I'm not saying no one should go to ogawa cafe, but don't expect anything close to what their yelp rating might portray.
it was very cozy and all the employees were extremley kind, enjoyed my time here! Would recommend going here. Great Enviroment!!!

I am rating only based on 5 Don Buri meals I had.

Avoid their Don Buri meals.
Almost no substance just rice and eggs.

Taste was subpar and amount of vegetable, beef or chicken is just too little...

If they lower the price by 25%, it'd be worth it.

It's a solid tiny little sushi place.  I love the decor and the exposed brick wall, and that the staff will eat their dinners at the tables next to you (I kind of always want to try theirs, too!).  

The sushi is definitely good, and one night my dining partner and I decided to order a bunch of rolls and split them.  They were all pretty tasty and while not the most inventive of the bunch, pretty creative for such a small joint.  Reasonable prices, as well.

I've walked by this place so many times and always wanted to try it out.  I grabbed a menu last time and saw that they deliver to a pretty wide area so I figured I'd try it today for dinner instead of my usual place japanese place that I order delivery from, just to change things up.

My sister and girlfriend came over.  We ended up getting the boxes to try some things.  we had a salmon teriyaki, a chicken katsu and a chicken teriyaki.  My sister also ordered an eel avocado roll.

I don't think I've ever had such BAD japanese food.  Everything was over cooked - dry and hard.  And for the most part, tasteless.

the eel avocado roll was good but I am not sure if it was actually good or if the rest of the food was SO bad that it made this "better".   I would say that its just average but some of the other reviews here say that the sushi is good.

in any event, I threw away the menu and will never eat here or order from here again.  I thought about calling them to tell them how badly cooked everything was but it was SOOO far beyond help that it was pointless.

If one dish was bad or if it was just a little over done because it was delivered, I could consider giving them another try, but you can't cook -- sorry, you can't OVER cook something THAT badly and fail to season everything and have any redeeming excuse.

Nice little place serving sushi and other dishes.  I was looking for a simple lunch, having walked over from 5th, but didn't want a slice/dog/falafel or anything fancier/formal from the places I passed.  This place appeared on a food-desolate block and did the trick.

For $7.50 I got a nice bento box with salad, rice, potstickers and a decent piece of Teriyaki salmon and veggies.   For an extra buck you get soup and some other things.  It might not be super authentically Japanese, but I got a nice, healthy lunch for under $10.

Note:  It's pretty tiny... 5 tables, 3 of which are 2 tops - and the sushi bar might have two seats/stools.

I order from Ogawa a lot because it is fast, good, and relatively cheap. I usually get their spicy tuna and the mind eraser rolls. Occasionally, I order the tuna tartar and the uni sushi (the latter is not always available). I also like their miso soup very much, especially in a cold night! The shrimp in the tempura roll is usually cold, but I don't mind that too much. Their lunch special is particularly well-priced. I would never eat lunch or dinner there, though. It is small, and kind of sad. Not a place where I would enjoy a meal, but perfect to order a delivery.

Ogawa is a tiny place. It's comfortable, quiet, and conveniently located just off Cooper Square. The service was attentive and the prices are reasonable. My lunch companion ordered a bento box, I ordered the lunch-sized sushi platter. The food was fine but not exceptional in any respect. The best of the bento was the shumai (maybe get an order of shumai for your party if you go). But other than for convenience, there are better Japanese places within a ten-minute walk.

Ogawa is a good local. I wouldn't call it great, or an insult to sushi, but a decent find. I've never had takeout there - the restaurant is small and the service expedient. It's the kind of sushi place that I would only order basics from - classic rolls or simple sushi and sashimi. I would be anxious ordering anything more advanced.

It is, as everyone has mentioned, affordable, which does count for a lot, particularly in "NoHo." (who calls it that?) I certainly go as a repeat customer when I don't want to go anywhere pricier, but it's not the most interesting or exciting experience. Still, when I need sushi...

A couple of blocks from work so this is my go-to for sushi lunch. It's decent and affordable - I usually get the 2 roll lunch combo with soup or salad and they give you a decent list of rolls to choose from. (not exactly their "special" rolls but not just a tuna or salmon roll either.)

The place is really small and always packed so I usually take it go - they make it quick so a good choice for lunch in the hood.

It is often said that a Japanese restaurant's miso soup is the standard upon which to pass judgment. Ogawa's is a smoky, full-bodied soup, with a raspy voice and a penchant for half truths and white lies.  It's the kind of thing you plunge into, like a lake at midnight after the water has turned ink black and you can no longer see the bottom.  It is that enveloping.

This is a friendly, tiny place on the edge of main NYU campus that I've been passing for 20 years and finally ordered takeout today. The raw fish on a Monday (closed Sunday) was exceedingly fresh.  Portions of sashimi are not generous but more than adequate, especially for the price. The eel and avocado sushi was very good, drizzled very lightly with sauce and not sodden. I will be ordering from here again, will probably try the very affordable lunch special within the next week. Person on the phone was very nice, delivery was speedy (20 min) and although the delivery guy was surly, he had just climbed 4 flights of stairs. Next time I will ask for extra ginger as you get very little.  

One minor quibble:  why was my sashimi served on a bed of parsley? Ugh. I actually like and eat the shredded daikon and carrot.

A totally serviceable sushi place. Nothing was especially great but everything was good. Ordered a chirashi and it was the cheapest version of chirashi possible (some filler stuff like radish and egg but no nicer stuff like squid or roe). Fast service. All in all, totally fine but not a standout.

This is an insult to sushi. Not only will you be very disappointed in the spicy tuna, but halfway you'll begin to have reservation of whether it's safe to continue to eat the rest...yes, it's pretty gross.

I also tried the mango shrimp sushi - I asked SPECIFICALLY what else was in it..."Only shrimp and mango"..."that's it?"..."yes"...but sadly the chef proceeds to drench it in this sauce, and I ask him to not add any more and he tells me, "Its not spicy and I already put it on" , slamming the knife on the counter....Rude rude rude, and unfortunately very overpriced.  I had $14 order and give her my card and she looks at me like I made a $2 purchase...You've got to be kidding me...
Top fucking notch. Jin is a wonderful host (and I assume Yoyo is as well but she was off the day I visited).

I don't get all the bad reviews. This place offers cheap sushi that is of good quality is a great go-to spot for sushi takeout. Yeah, you get what you pay for so it's not going to be phenomenal but the prices are really good as is the service. It's a lot better than many other places I've tried in the city that have similar price points.

Portions are big and the lunch specials are a really good deal...a ton of food.

Their salmon teriyaki is good as are their rolls. Definitely my go-to for lunch (work in the neighborhood).

P.S. $15 credit card min

I've had delivery from here a couple of times.  It is a good, solid sushi/roll meal.  The lunch special is a good deal at $6.95 for 2 rolls, and 9.25 for three rolls.  It comes with a miso soup or salad.  

A couple of nights ago, we ordered the sushi platter for 2 at 28.50, which was good!  3 of each for salmon, tuna, hamachi, and red snapper; 2 of each for unagi, mackerel, and cooked shrimp, and it also included a California roll and a tuna roll. Now that's a good deal if you ask me!  The hamachi and mackerel were particularly good.  It also came with two side salads.  It was more than we could eat!  We also ordered the spider roll and the salmon skin roll.  The spider role was only 4 pcs - kind of small if you ask me, but it was still good.  Everything was good.  The fish was well-cut.  

A great budget-friendly sushi place, and decent quality.

Get lunch here 2-3 times a week and the sushi is always fresh and on-point. Their eel is really good (not fishy at all), the avocado is always perfect, and the miso is really, really tasty. The house salad (which I usually get at Japanese places) is skippable - the carrot ginger dressing is meh.  

Lunch special - 3 rolls + soup/salad for $10??? Amazing. Also, everything fried here is awesome. Their brown rice is awesome. The rolls wrapped in cucumber instead of rice are awesome. And the service? You guessed it, awesome.  

I work across the street, so I always order to pick up, and even if they are busy it's ready in 10 minutes or less. Awesome!!!!

made a delivery order for the very 1st time tonight and it arrived very timely and the sushi was definitely good for the price.
If you're looking for cheap sushi that tastes decent & won't kill you & won't cost you a fortune, this is definitely a place to hit  up.

ordered the chirashi & california roll.
california roll can't go wrong and it didn't
chirashi had salmon/tuna/white fish/makeral/imitation crab meat/octopus/toro/shrimp and came with salad/soup.  

I am satisfied.

It was average. I ordered the lunch specials from here a couple of times and they were always busy for a restaurant this small. It's a hole in the wall.

Now- even though the food is average- it is superior to most of the other places around the area. The food is fresh. I think. I had the beef terriyaki and the salmon terriyaki. Nothing to brag about. The price matches the food because it is very affordable.

They give you a lot of food for a great price. Their sushi is probably above average but not one of the best I've had in a while.

I'd go back- just not more than once a month.

5/5 For Service
3/5 for food
4/5 for price
3/5 Atmosphere (It feels dingy).
Ehh. Nothing to rave about or even come back to. Tried multiple rolls... All dry, uninspiring.

My friend said this was his favorite place for sushi so I tried it out. Philly roll for $4.60! In Brooklyn, I can get that for $2.50! I know Noho is not Brooklyn but still I find that pricey. I only got 2 rolls, but the salmon in them tasted rubbery and the rice was a little dry. Also the rolls were mediocre size for the cost.

This is a really tiny place so a no-no for big groups, maybe a date if you want to chat in a small space and hit the sweet bar next door after. Literally it can only seat like 10 people. No bathroom either, which is not a problem unless you have a small bladder like me (but was fortunately saved by the bar).

I like to get what I pay for so I won't be returning. On an up note, the waitress was very friendly, so I tipped well.
Awesome sushi and cooked dishes! Lovely people working there.  A neighborhood treasure!!
